Also,the service was very slow. Upon arrival we asked for extra decaf coffee. Two hours later it was still not brought up. Asked for ice twice until we finally got it. The mattress was firm. The air quality was not good in the room. The air in the room was dry!

Watch out. When you shorten your stay at the Hyatt they raise the nightly room rates by 30%. Booked 2 night at $319 per night. Needed to shorten the stay by one night and the room rate went up to $425. So much for a 24 hour cancellation policy.

My husband and I stayed here for weekend while getting out and about in NYC. Excellent location. Lovely room. Friendly staff. Only negative was the restaurant was closed and there was building work going on...which we only found out about when we got there. But it was a great place to stay and would definitely go back!

Beware ! Some of the rooms are obviously what is pictured but my high floor city view king room was SMALL, DARK and DIRTY!The floors are some fake wood something that had not been washed in a very long time!! The lobby is under construction which they failed to tell me when I made my reservations- ever hear of email Hyatt? Or do you just want to make sure you take my money. Room service messed up my order every time I used it (& wanted to charge me $5 for a cup of tea. I understand NYC prices but really??)The location was perfect for what I needed but I could have stayed at several other locations. Chose Hyatt bc of its reputation but this one is a pass

Overall - The hotel general presentation was nice. The stay was merely unpleasant due to the 'ADA Room' not being wheelchair friendly (possibly due to age of hotel, but these were upgraded rooms at some point). It's clear they haven't taken a wheelchair into the room and used the facilities as one might normally. Won't stay at this particular Hyatt again.

Check your timings before you stay here, the hotel was under renovation on a recent visit--visible construction happening in the lobby/restaurant area, temporary dining in the basement, you'll be told the quiet rooms away from construction overlook the back courtyard of the hotel where there is no sunlight to be had. When I told the front desk during checkin that I used to be a Platinum status years ago, they actually laughed and then told me to "start over" in World of Hyatt. Arrogant, weird service attitude. The room was small but nicely appointed. I never thought I would miss The Standard.

The hotel staff were accommodating, but not overly friendly. Rooms were nice and clean small for more than one person. For the price I paid for this room I wouldn't expect to have construction going on and would expect top notch restaurant and bars but there was not because they were under construction. They offered a 10% discount, doesn't seem like much for all the noise and lack of amenities.

We were there to visit our niece who attends NYU and this location was great! We were walking distance to just about everything we wanted to see and only a quick subway ride to Central Park. Great restaurants, bars and coffee shops were all moments away.

The rooms were not huge, but were very nice. But since you shouldn't be staying in your room much while in NYC it was fine. The lobby restaurant and bar were under renovation and that was unattractive, but it should be done soon. From Time Sq to the WTC, from the Intrepid to Little Italy, it was centrally located. I like to walk and this was a great location to walk from. While is was over $300, nothing is cheap in Manhattan.

Having spent 4 very pleasant days in New York city staying in Hyatt Union Square I was shocked to learn on my return home that there was an overcharge of $500 on a $2500 hotel bill. After a 45 min telephone conversation ( at my cost) I was told that the deposit of $400 was added to the bill, that this is normal and that it will be returned to me in 10 to 12 days. To add insult to injury there was an overcharge of $100 for food posted to my account after check out. On checking out I was handed my bill to check the details. I agreed with the overall amount of $2517. Yet I had charges of in excess of $3000 deducted from my account. This just does not make any sense.

The hotel will be fabulous once the renovations are done (late April 2017). In the meantime, expect lots of noise. The location is excellent. The staff are exceptionally good at their jobs and customer focused. Can't wait to stay again--after May 2017.

Location is great but rooms can be noisy at night due to fire station nearby and construction on street. Make sure to stay on a higher floor.The staff is very nice and helpful. Walking distance to lots of cafes and shops.

This hotel was great. Good location, very nice and professional staff, updated rooms and clean. Room service food was the only disappointment. Other than that we had a great stay. We even arrived early and the staff was so nice and got in into our room right away.

I want to thank Francois for all his assistance during my planning process. He was attentive, professional, and extremely courteous. This was my first time planning a staycation and I was pleased with all the help from the additional staff. The room attendant saw my girlfriend and I and told her Happy Birthday. that was really nice.

The restaurant, lounge, bar, and lobby were unusable. Never communicated prior to arrival by email or on their website. They set up a make shift restaurant in the basement and the. Gave you suggestions where you could go eat and have a drink. Lack of prior notice is inexcusable.

Great rooms. Excellent location. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The bar and restaurant were under construction so they did a nice job of accommodating this. I'd stay again. The only downside for me was the bed was a bit too firm for me.

Nice hotel in a great location. Subway just around the corner. Walking distance to a lot of places. Rooms a bit on the smaller size. Clean, friendly staff. Our room was facing to the back side of the hotel which was not a hit.

Well, it's a little over the top in terms of modern decor, but otherwise really nice. Room is fairly small (like most Manhattan hotels), not much closet space or surfaces to put things (furniture arrangement could be better), but this is a great place to stay for a few days in Manhattan. Quiet, comfortable bed, good bathroom (very important!). You can't beat the neighborhood - Union Square market, restaurants, shopping, walking to Greenwich Village, SoHo and Flat Iron; near all kinds of transportation. You really feel like you're in a New York neighborhood.

No prior warning of construction noise inside and outside hotel. Noise is so excessive that Hyatt front desk hands out ear plugs to guests from a basket!!! We left after one night and moved to Marriott Marquis for the remaining 3 nights...peaceful and quiet! We were told that the General Manager would contact us..have not heard a word in a week. Pitiful!

Very nice hotel. Room was clean, staff was friendly. The restaurant was under construction at the hotel, which we weren't made aware of before checking in. And we didn't get a call that our room was ready until 5pm.

The location was great, close to restaurants and the subway. The hotel restaurant was under renovations and there was road construction outside. We were a little disappointed that we weren't told before we arrived. The road construction activity was all night long. But we were offered a discount on room service and a slightly lower room charge.

Stayed here one night on a college tour with my wife and daughter. We got in late and ordered room service that arrived quickly (less than 20 minutes). Food was great. Rooms are trying to be somewhat hip, but are fairly small. We had two queen beds a desk and two cabinets on each side of the bed but very little room to move around otherwise. That being said it was very comfortable and perfect for our situation.The Wifi worked great, and all are staff interactions were positive. Location is good right near the New School and parts of NYU, along with lots of shops and restaurants.

Awesome staff at this hotel. The rooms are up to date and comfortable. The staff assured me a quiet room (yes, even in NYC) and a lovely view. Bellman was exceptional! I felt like a totally welcomed guest in a clean and lovely room.

I just had a 10 day visit to New York and stayed at the Hyatt Union Square because it was close to my daughter's apartment. I've stayed at a gamut of other NY hotels - from the Carlisle to the Standard to Crosby Street. While the Hyatt understandably doesn't have the over-the-top glamor / amenities of these other places, it offers great value and had unexpectedly terrific food. Buratta club sandwich is unbelievably great, as is their salmon with poppyseed dressing. Coffee is strong and flavorful. Rooms are clean, cool and quiet - you can't ask for anything more. The lobby, bar and restaurant are currently undergoing major changes - which to this 60'ish traveler will be welcomed. The current vibe is dark and art-edgy. Art-edgy but lighter and cozier would be my preference. It sounds like the bar is heading this way - a "library of spirits". Because of the renovation, the hotel kindly didn't charge for a couple of breakfasts - one because a band saw started to buzz just outside the (currently) underground dining room while we were still seated at breakfast. This personal touch and attention made a great impression, and I look forward to returning to the Hyatt Union Square.

Perfect location for our visit. We arrived at Penn Station and were able to walk to the hotel. Our plan was to see a play at the Public Theater, so again we were able to walk. We also went to Chelsea Market easily from here. The room was average size for NY. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and nicely appointed. Enjoyed our stay. They are currently undergoing renovations in the lobby, so I can't speak to that space or the dining room.

Spent the weekend at the Union Square Hyatt. Great location, whether you want to spend the weekend downtown or uptown. Great staff. Couldn't be more helpful or pleasant. Great rooms. Couldn't be happier. Highly highly recommend.

Very nice property. Excellent location near Union Square. Staff friendly and helpful. Good service. Nice amenities. Would definitely return for another visit. If price is much higher that would be a consideration. I enjoyed the visit and the Hyatt.

Excellent location in the Union Square area. All the Staff we encountered provided excellent customer service and very good dining choices when asked outside the hotel; as well as directions. Hotel rooms are on the small side but very modern/upgraded and clean. Plenty of outlets. We will return to this property.

We had a great stay as the staff were very helpful with all our needs, the room was well equipped for our needs and the location was perfect. This is our fourth time staying here and I have nothing but great things to say about the staff and service.

We had something either stolen or thrown away worth hundreds of dollars. We spoke to 2 managers neither of whom were interested in helping get to the bottom of what happened. They also have charged our card for something that they can't even tell us what it was.

Clearly poor management. Scattered staff, rude and more interested hanging out at the front and socializing. Linens and robe in room dirty. Front entrance closed and horrible path through alternative entrance

The Hyatt Union Square is my go to hotel in New York. The location is fantastic for both business and fun with easy access to east/west and north/south subway lines.The rooms are very comfortable and nicely furnished, the hotel bar and restaurant are good and for those who like to explore there are countless more within a short distance.Most of all, the hotel staff is one of the nicest I've ever met.

I recently stayed here while visiting my daughter and her family, and was very pleased with the hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful, the room was smallish but well thought out, and it was located a short walk from my daughter's apartment. Close by is Union Square and its subway station, so you can travel anywhere in the city. I'll definitely stay here again.

This Hilton offers the best accommodations in lower Manhattan in close proximity to the Strand Bookstore, NYU and numerous government buildings. If you are researching New York genealogy or just in for a business or academic trip. This is the perfect place to walk to anything.

About the room/facilities: * I found it to be spacious and comfortable. * The bed was comfortable and to my taste. The pillows were OK too. * The work desk and chair were comfortable as well. * There are plenty of power connections for my electronic devices both at the desk and near the bed, and those were easy to reach. * The TV was good and the channel selection met my needs. * The closet was small but well designed. My only suggestion would be to have the safe in the bottom drawer, rather than the top one. * The night stands were OK. * They definitely made the right call with the high ceilings. They improve the overall experience. * The mini-bar was OK, but I would much rather have it empty, so I could use it to store some sandwiches and milk. * The washroom was well designed and functional. I especially enjoyed the shower height - in most hotels where I stay, it is too low and I keep hitting my head on it (I'm 6'1 - tall but not a giant). That did not happen here. About the staff: * The staff at the front desk/concierge recognized me and greeted me every time I walked by. It was the most consistent experience in hotels in years and it hasn't gone unnoticed. Well done! * The concierge was attentive to my needs and took the time to answer my questions thoroughly and also make suggestions regarding the use of the hotel's car service. * I needed a shoe horn and a sewing kit, and the front desk staff sent that to my room right away. Overall, the balance of my stay was positive. Both the room/facilities and the staff were excellent, and the problems I experienced were very minor and promptly addressed. If I come to this area again, I will likely stay at the Hyatt Union Square again.

Hyatt at Union Square has an excellent location with good access to all of Manhattan, with welcoming staff. The hotel is looking and feeling a little tired, lacking the freshness of other top ranked hotels. More could be done with the restaurant and bar area. Rooms are clean but are in need of an update.

Everything about this hotel was great. They were friendly, will hold your luggage before and after check in so you can explore the city. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Would stay again without hesitation.

We stayed at the Hyatt Union Square in early March - from the photos we thought the room would be much bigger - it is small and compact but cleverly designed and the bed is very comfortable.The location in Union Square is excellent and we also walked to the East Village, Gramercy, Midtown, etc. The staff is very friendly. All in all, a good choice.

First time at the Hyatt Union Square. The room was great and enjoyed breakfast. The trip was for fun. Went on a short trip to visit my daughter and see a play. It was a great trip and the hotel was just great. Will make this my new hotel in NYC.

We stayed at the Hyatt Union Square in order to visit family nearby. The hotel is comfortable and clean, and certainly meets Hyatt standards. The rooms are small but functional, well equipped and nicely designed. Service was friendly and helpful, The location, a block south of Union Square and adjacent to Greenwich Village and the East Village, is very convenient (at least for our purposes.) Being just a block away from the Union Square subway station, a major cross roads, access to Midtown and downtown, as well as Brooklyn and Queens and the Bronx, is good. I stayed here once before and enjoyed it and anticipate coming back.

The employees made the experience here the best. From the front desk, to the doorman, to the bartenders, all were top notch. The rooms, while on the small side, were comfortable and clean. Get the Urban Sky room the floor to ceiling windows make the room seem much larger. Came to the city on business on a Friday and stayed the whole weekend for fun.

At best it was OK. No hot water on day one. Very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The bathroom is a study in space efficiency. Bring your own soap since the tiny piece they give you is silly. The location is convenient to Union Square.

This hotel is in a great location, easy to walk to multiple restaurants and shops. The room was very spacious and neat we had a desk and a separate bathroom (9th floor). The staff is excellent, very friendly and professional. We recommend this hotel.

I stayed at this location as it is within walking distance of my office and was visiting for business. Upon arrival with another executive, we were told that at 11:45 PM (the bar was already closed). That was disappointing but but tolerable. We braved the cold night and found drinks and food elsewhere. Upon entering my room, I was surprised at how SMALL the room is. My bathroom at home is bigger. Since, I am only staying for 3 nights -- I figured no big deal. Linens and pillows had the distinct smell of OLD, SWEATY BODY ODOR, so much so that I had to spray perfume on them nightly and sleep on one of my clean shirts so as to not have to smell or have my face touch the pillow directly. Even that, I tolerated b/c as a seasoned traveler I have learned that if a hotel has smelly linens in the room -- the ones they will replace won't be much better. All these small things don't amount to much individually but all together is annoying and irritating BUT STILL I tolerated it and did not say anything to hotel staff. HOWEVER, if there should be one redeeming factor let it be the hotel staff service and room service. And there too hotel staff failed miserably. After a very long day, I ordered a $16 burger (after service fee, tip etc. total was more like $32 -- seriously.) only to have it come ALL wrong. After advising hotel staff they told me they were "willing" to comp me a new burger. Shouldn't they be apologetic and I be the one "willing" to accept it? When I asked if they could duplicate my order and asked her to read it back to me (it must have been initially written down, right?) I was put on eternal hold. I went out crossed the street and bought a burrito faster than they were able to figure out if they wrote it down or not, still don't know -- pretty sure not) Room service shouldn't be this hard, listen and write it down. Also don't tell me you are "willing" to do anything after you have messed up. Apologize profusely and ask if I'd be willing to accept the comped meal (I wouldn't have anyway). Mediocre at best and overpriced to boot.

Unhappy with charges I wasn't aware about. Should have been told before checking in that my card was being charged even though I told the front desk in was paying cash at check out. I should have been told prior to my arriving.

Staff, location, room--- everything made for a wonderful stay. My room was small, but cleverly set-up to take advantage of the space there, great bathroom. Staff was helpful and friendly, and breakfast in the lobby restaurant was lovely. Will return!

Have stayed previously in this hotel and whilst loving the location we had a small room which for an international traveller was restrictive. This time we booked a larger corner room. It was worth the extra. Had nice views and much more spacious. Only downside was the proximity to the fire house and there seemed to be quite allot of fires whilst we were sleeping. This is not a fault of the Hyatt and would try a higher room next time. The staff were pleasant without being smothering .The proximity of the subway and the quick times to shopping and shows makes this a favourite neighbourhood.

Very satisfied with our stay. Location is FANTASTIC (though not for everyone). Make sure you ask for a high floor, as traffic noise is a problem. Will definitely stay here again (but will specify a higher floor!)

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel on several different occasions..... and have had a wonderful experience each time. But this time we experienced truly great customer service - which grew out of the inability of the hotel to honor a reserved suite upgrade. This inability was certainly beyond the control of any of the hotel staff - but the professional, compassionate and courteous manner in which this was handled was far beyond our expectations. During the process, the Front Office team - led by Lucia - was honest and proactive, keeping us informed along the way. Their efforts to make it all right were generous and genuine. It is certainly much more challenging when circumstances arise during a hotel stay which require a significant change in plans - and much more impressive when the hotel staff acts and behaves like they are on my side.

I loved the Hyatt Union Square! What an ideal location for those of us that want to be far away from the annoying tourists of Time Square but close to everything! Situated a block from the Union Square Subway, you can go to all the important places in the city without switching trains. We were in Battery Park (Statue of Liberty) and the Freedom Tower in minutes. Another stop was close to Central Park and the Broadway area. Forget the subway as several wonderful areas are within walking distance of the hotel. This was truly an ideal location for me. Stay in Times Square if you must but I was so happy to be far away from it.Check-in was fantastic and Kenza was a delight throughout the trip. She was friendly, enthusiastic, and had some great food recommendations. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and accommodating. We stayed in an ADA accessible room which overlooked the street. I believe this was an upgrade over the courtyard view I booked. It was spacious and the ADA accessible items were not intrusive with the exception of the shower which resulted in a wet floor everytime someone took a shower. The room is thoroughly modern, stylish, upscale, comfortable, and had awesome touches such as a Bluetooth enabled clock and plenty of plugs in the room. My only complaints were the lack of a fridge (which could have fit in the room) along with a vanity mirror with a broken light (it was hard to see in the mirrors). Otherwise, I loved the room! There were some elevator issues in the hotel a couple of times but they were not overly annoying.I would be sad if I didn't stay here on my next trip to New York. If you want to be near the cool stuff, stay here and enjoy yourself!

I had experienced one of those very difficult travel days like you see in a cheesy movie. But when I finally arrived at the hotel (24 hours late!) I was greeted with compassion, kindness, and care. My stay was absolutely wonderful in every way.

Love the location and the intimate hotel. Staff are helpful and the rooms are well conceived. The only too is for couples to request a "closed" bathroom. This has the area separated by a pocket door so illumination does not disturb your partner's.

Great location for getting to west village and Williamsburg! The staff is amazing eagerly ready and willing to help. Rooms are nice size for NYC. Grocery and Walgreens in close proximity. Beds are very comfortable

Room was just too tight and no privacy for restroom. Was disappointed by restaurant for breakfast. Overall a great location but disappointing property. Next time in this neighborhood we will stay at the w

I love this hotel. It's one of my favorite hotels in the city and I have been traveling to NYC for over 20 years. The location is superb and there are plenty of food and drink options around. Powells Bookstore is a short walk away as is a large movie complex, and there's a terrific wine store across the street. But the hotel itself is tremendous value and very very comfortable. Some of the rooms on the 2nd floor even have private balconies which as a Hyatt Platinum member I will occasionally get upgraded to. Staff are super friendly and there's a top notch restaurant "Fourth" in the property. Overall it's a 5 star hotel.

No hot water in shower, engineer came 3 hours later, worked for a half hour and then left saying he would return. Never did. Front desk initially said they couldn't move my room, then did after I objected in the most strenuous terms. They did give me a discount from my stay for the trouble.

A return visit to the Hyatt Union Square rewarded us with an enjoyable 6 night stay. We booked the Urbane Sky Room instead of the Courtyard Studio of a prior visit. The additional $40/night was worth the extra space and views. Like before the staff was helpful and friendly, the rooms clean and functional. The location is perfect and accessibility to the subway convenient. Be sure to check out Everyman Espresso a block away for your morning wake-up call.

Check in was exceptionally quick. I arrived just after a snow storm. Their walkways were clear and the bellhop handled my multiple pieces of luggage, business gear, and displays quite handily. I will mention that service for breakfast in the attached restaurant the next day was both slow and snippy. Also, the oatmeal - not so good. But that was not the hotel's fault.

I love Hyatt. They are super friendly. The rooms are quiet, updated, fairly spacious for NYC. They are very accommodating and treat me like I am a 5 star guest! They don't have a mini fridge for leftovers or water but it is New York, so they have to conserve space.

The Hyatt Union Square is a smart, beautifully looked after hotel on a quiet street off Union Square. The rooms are well appointed and the one we had at the rear of the hotel was quiet. The staff were excellent, couldn't do enough for you and the location is perfect being close to the subways at Union Square and an easy place to get to and from. Highly recommended....

Hotel is in a great location. It is not a big hotel which makes it feel more intimate. Staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful including making restaurant reservations for us. The Fourth restaurant serves a good breakfast.

I enjoy this hotel immensely. The location is perfect and is close to everything. The Hyatt is modern with a bit of a European flair. Rooms are very modern but a little small. I have always enjoyed the staff. Once again they were friendly and efficient. I will be back again in April.

Modern hotel, small room but fine if you're not spending much time in e room. The heat/air condiitioning cycles very loudly, so much so that I turned off the system in order to sleep. Doorman staff very helpful.

This is a really lovely little hotel. Doesn't feel like a Hyatt. Rooms are small but stylish and functional, coffee and breakfast in the fourth restaurant great. Location is close to subway at union square. Walking distance to soho and the village. A really good spot for the rate. Great cafe over the road called think. Best coffee we had in New York.

Location could not be better. The staff were great and made me feel welcome. Bed and room amenities were comfortable and clean but a leep quality was an issue due to a beeping noise that would not stop.

Loved my first experience at the Hyatt Union Square. The staff were lovely and always attentive, the food was delicious and presented beautifully and the bed was super comfortable. I can't wait to come back next time my work brings me to New York.

Beautiful well-designed room.The cleanliness of hardwood floors really makes me happy in a hotel room.Nice beds, well-designed bathrooms. Reasonable rates.Awesome location. Truly the best in the city - central to EVERYTHING.Coffee pot in room. Super impressed.

I can accept some noise. Specially in NYC. But what is not acceptable is to have room repairs on floor at 2am of the morning. I had to step out and ask the maintenance guy to please stop. Colleague of mine at other flor was hearing a beep the entire night. So. good hotel, but not for a good sleep.

I don't think we stayed in such a small room. The good part was that it was clean comfortable and compact. And it made us uncomfortable when the view out of the window was of other buildings. There wasn't even a single green or open view from the window. I felt really claustrophobic. The staff really went out of their way to be welcoming. However management should review policies that ensures that certain housekeeping, dining and other amenities are provided on a consistent basis.

I spent 5 days at the end of January. Nothing was as supposed to be, starting with a ridicoulosly small rome deceptively called "suite". No way to heat the room, despite a noisy aircon. Nothing for free, bottle of water 6 $ (actually, there is one and very valuable free service on demand, which includes toothpaste, razor, etc.). No food after midnight, etc. Cleaning and refurbishing minimal. Breakfast non included, daily rate, including taxes, above $ 350. Restaurant serves mediocre food, lounge is rather fancy but service is slow and options limited. I had in the past mixed experiences at Hyatt, this has been the last one.

Great Union Square location and modern room and decor but the staff is what made our stay excellent. Everyone was friendly and helpful, offering advice or directions or recommending a place to find gluten free pizza. The only negative things: receiving an 8am call from room service regarding our order, even though we hadn't placed one, and the early morning noise in the hallway from housekeeping and other guests. Otherwise the room was quiet and well maintained. We had an urbane studio room which provided absolutely no view, but no noticeable street noises.

Chose this hotel due to proximity to my business & I hit the jackpot. It was upscale, very comfortable and quiet (in NYC!!). Staff was super friendly and helpful. It was a little pricey, but would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is very conveniently located in the Village proximity, lots of places to eat around. Despite being located in a busy area, it's very quiet inside the hotel. Staff were helpful during our stay, the bedding of high quality. Wifi worked well.

After the disaster at the W midtown, where we checked out an hour after checking in, due to bad service and poor rooms, we had to find something quickly. It was Christmas time in NYC and the Hyatt was super convenient. If you're looking for a boutique hotel in a great location then you can't go wrong with this place. The rooms are a bit on the small side but the location makes up for it. It has a couple of good restaurants and the bar Singl is where I'd go even if I weren't a hotel guest (good bartender). Front desk was quite helpful and follow-up was super fast. They actually gave us a choice of rooms and showed us a few since we didn't want one with a terrace in winter. They were extremely polite and always greeted us upon entering and leaving. The housekeeping service was a bit slow, it may be due to the holiday rush. A few times we came back at 5pm and saw our room hadn't been made up yet. That's all the critique I have for this establishment. I recommend it.

We had a great time at this Hyatt! Great location and tons of restaurants and fun things to do in the area. We had a problem with the A/C and they fixed it right away. The room was small, but cozy and plenty of room. The bathroom was very efficient with a great shower! Enjoyed our stay and we will be back.

The hotel is 1 mins walk from Union Square station - very convenient to metro and union square shopping district. Closed to NYU and East Village too. The room is a bit small but I guess it's just cause it's in Manhattan. Otherwise, got everything I need and hotel front desks seem very nice! Oh the gym is well equipped and maintained!

Excellent location.Rooms small. All necessary basic amenities present.Quiet area at night.Easy access to subway.Front desk people were amazing and extremely helpful-especially Kathy, Francois & Steven. They helpedfind the restaurants

Beautiful hotel, nice room and large for NYC standards. Our only complaint was in the three days we stayed there was no hot water in the shower, luke warm was the best even after running the shower for 15 minutes. The sink water was hot. The Hyatt was a little pricey but the location was perfect.

Very professional staff, Jen,Chris,Steven just to name a few were very friendly and helpful and courteous. Very cozy and cost effective place to stay around Union Square where everything is walking distance. I will be coming back next time I'm in New York.

I've been a Gold Passport member longer than much of the staff here. The front desk staff were nice and professional. They assigned us a high floor view room which I appreciated. Then we discovered the facilities/maintenance manager is doing such a POOOOOOR job. The first room had a bathroom ceiling that vibrated so loud from the HVAC unit. It was like being near a helicopter and was louder than any super 8 hotel! I could have never slept! We asked to move rooms and were told someone would come up to help us move. A guy came by, fairly quickly, and gave me a key yet had no luggage cart and clearly didn't want to help us. We managed.We moved to the 2nd room, which had a terrace. Nice! Yet the terrace door didn't lock- the lock wouldn't turn. That gives our neighbors fairly easy access to my room. The HVAC unit in this room was loud too, even though nothing like the 1st room. We slept in a cold room the 1st night due to the noise, and I actually heard the unit in the room next door. It got worse: The toilet was in its own room which flooded from the shower above us. It was easy to see the water damage in the ceiling and down the wet walls. Also the sink barely drained leaving a pool of yuk. I used the business center which turned out to be a single computer w/no chair in an employee hallway. It was uncomfortable and freezing (winter) being near a service corridor w/the door opened exposing trash and related.The TV worked when pulled away from the wall yet often lost signal when it was pushed back in- bad connections. Finally the billfold with a writing pad had no paper in it so why bother to have one?I've stayed in a A LOT of Hyatt hotels over the past 30 years. Compared to other Hyatts, the maintenance here stinks. Between the small rooms and all the problems, I'd rate this as a 3 star hotel- certainly not 4 stars.

Stayed here for just one night, but it was enough to acknowledge the excellent level of business provided by the Hyatt. Hotel seems quite new, cozy, somehow chic: very comfortable room with hardwood floors, beautiful bathroom, all for a reasonable price. Professional and swift service by the people at reception. Recommended.

Nice boutique hotel. Rooms are nice although a bit small (welcome to NYC). Staff is friendly and helpful. Great location - easy access to restaurants and the subway to get any where in NYC. The bar closed early, which is a bit frustrating.

Had a great experience checking in and dealing with the staff. I love the neighborhood. One of my favorite hotels in NYC. The rooms are fully equipped with alll essentials. The bed is firm and comfortable, soft sheets and towels Will always come back.

This is now my favorite hotel in NYC. Excellent but not huge rooms (hardwood floors, great beds), very good fitness center, excellent food in the hotel restaurant. Good location - at Union Square, it is near everything I need to get to, and walkable to everywhere else. For Diamond Gold Passport Members, there are many perks (e.g., free internet, free breakfast) that make it particularly nice. I'll stay there whenever I can get a good rate!

Hotel is in a great position, is charming and well renovated. Rooms are very comfy and have a great barhroom and complimentary soaps. Best is to take the room with a view. Bar dowstairs very relaxing and never too busy. Good drinks

This is probably one of the best locations in town. A five minute walk from both the east and west village and maybe 10 minutes down to SOHO. If you want to head uptown, it's a 15 minute walk to Herald Square. The is a quiet, residential area for the most part - loads of old school New York pizza shops, bars, and smaller unique eateries (that don't cost a small fortune) conveniently located nearby. And the streets aren't packed so you don't feel like a tourist. The rooms are on the smaller side but this is to be expected in NY. Having said this, the standard room is quite comfy for two people, and the beds are probably the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in, in any hotel, anywhere.Staff is incredibly friendly and goes out of their way to help if you need any. Would definitely stay there again.

This is our first time visiting New York. We had no clue about what location would be a good place for us to stay so we just happened to choose this spot on a whim. We liked the price and the photos provided online. What makes this place great is the customer service! They are absolutely remarkable! Not only that, the hotel is nice and it is in probably one of the best locations you could imagine! We are close to everything! It has truly been an unforgettable experience at this hotel. I can't thank them enough!

Stayed here last Thanksgiving for about a week and again after Christmas 2017. We're former New Yorkers, looking for a base to reconnect with friends and the city. Staff is appropriately hip for the area, but still friendly and helpful; manager went out of their way to help us find a solution to the fact that the rooms are pretty small with no room for rollaway beds.So, yes, the rooms are a bit small, no wet bar, our room didn't have a tub, but the bed was great, service excellent, location is in walking distance to almost anything you'd want to do downtown.I'm a Hyatt fan, their high end properties are great -- Park Hyatt Seoul and Tokyo were two of my favorite properties in the world. We'll stay there again when we come back to NYC.

I was a business traveler to NYC for 4 months straight and pretty much stayed at all the Hyatts in Manhattan except the Park Hyatt. This one is my absolute favorite. It's modern, sleek, beautiful with exceptional staff that remember your name and seem happy to work there.The Fourth restaurant is delicious with the best French toast I've ever had. It is a bit overpriced with rather small portions but very tasty. The location is also very good for both personal and business travelers because it's close to lots of shopping, a major subway hub, a whole food and a Walgreens across the street. I live in NY now and sometimes still stop by for a drink in the bar area.As a business traveler I found this Hyatt and Hyatt Herald Square occasionally around the same rates. Pick this one if they're similar or pay a little more for it, the breakfast is better and the location and feel are much more upscale than the midtown/k-town location of Herald Square.

Stayed at the Hyatt a few years ago and was blown away with the place. It's proximity to the subway was so convenient and the room was large by NY standards. Liked the Hyatt experience so much that I didn't give a second thought to booking for a week in an Urbane Sky room after the holidays. I'll be sure to post a new review with my experience this time around after my stay. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year everyone!

I would like to stay at this hotel again. It was central to all my needs. I had to commute back and forth to Brooklyn everyday to see my daughter so it was soon convienient to the subway and or a great place to get Uber or a cab. I was close to Whole Foods and wonderful coffee houses and places to eat breakfast.

The Hyatt, Union Square is centrally located. Easy access to subways, the Village is walk-able, close to Eataly & the Union Square Market, restaurants, etc. The hotel is friendly & the staff is very accommodating.

Stayed here for a couple nights during my business trip.Very beautiful, nice and cozy hotelClean room with a large and comfortable bed.Friendly staff with excellent service.Superb location, Quiet and safe environment.Just a few minutes walk to subway, Best buy and Walgreens.

I've stayed at the Hyatt Union Square several times and have always come back because the rooms are impeccably clean and well laid out, with extremely comfortable bed and outstanding bathroom. The rain shower is awesome, the linens first rate, and the CO Bigelow bath supplies excellent. Free wifi, great desk area with plenty of outlets. Starbucks coffee in room. Service is always excellent. Really, you can't go wrong staying here. Convenient to Union Square, East Village, Village, NYU, etc.

This was the second time we stayed in this property when in New York in Dec. We liked its convenient location in Union Square, close to subway, which we used everyday to go to shows, concerts and museums. Staffs were very friendly and helpful. Room was not big but decent for 2 people in city. Since we didn't spend much time in room other than to sleep, we didn't mind. The only issue we had was bed, which was a bit too soft for our liking. We come to NYC yearly, and this property has become our go-to hotel.

Very noisy, party next door, the hotel didn't do anything about it, I had to pack and move out at 430 am because it was so loud and Rediculous. The front desk was rude and non apologetic. Aren't there supposed to be 1 or 2 people per room? Not 20 with loud music and a party??

We travelled as a family visiting NYC from the UK and we found that the Hyatt Union Square were very accommodating to us, even organising our transport to/from the airport. Special thanks to Victor for that. The location of the hotel was great, as walking around was easy and there were plenty of restaurants nearby to go and eat. My only criticism for the food & beverage, was that there was no American breakfast available, the first for us in NYC hotel. No waffles or pancakes? Us Brits come to America to indulge in this type of breakfast :) However, the staff were accommodating, efficient and polite. The rooms although small, were comfortable. The beds were really comfy! On the whole I can recommend this 4* hotel as a great place to explore NYC. Thanks.

My Mom, sister, daughter and I stayed here for a girls family weekend. The hotel was in a great location, was well decorated, had courteous staff and had everything you would want from such a hotel. I would have given this hotel a 5 rating until we checked out. That said, I must tell you to be VERY aware of their billing tactics. We had reserved one room with two queen beds but upon checking in, the front desk person informed us they no longer had a room with two queen beds available but, "for the same price, we will give you two king rooms that adjoin." I thought, "PERFECT." We enjoyed our stay and after check out I realized they charged us for both rooms (my mom checked us out and didn't thoroughly review the bill. Admittedly, she is not a seasoned traveler so she trusted their billing, signed the bill and left). Once I realized the mistake (four hours later), I called and asked them to remove one room as that was not the agreed upon plan. They said, "no problem! It is all taken care of." So I followed up by asking how much we owed. The price they gave me took a couple hundred bucks off the bill. Ummm, no...I need a whole room charge removed, not less than half a night. So, had I not asked, they would have gotten away with charging me more...again. They tried to pass it off by saying, "we only agreed to giving you the same rate for one night." I said, "WHAT?!??" I can assure you, that was NOT the case. I responded that I was only going to pay for one room. They proceeded to do some interesting math and started using industry phrases that I am sure they were using to try and confuse me and told me I owed more than the one room total. I am not sure how that even made sense considering I had two bills, one for the first room, and one for the second. It a seems to me, I should only pay for one of those rooms. At one point they said, "that room charge was a mistake on our part, we should have charged you more." CHARGED US MORE?!?? You charged me for two rooms when you told me you would only charge me for one and almost got away with it, and then tried to charge me more AGAIN and hang up the phone before I could question it. I finally gave in and agreed to pay the higher price for the one room (I was at the airport dealing with a flight cancellation and was about to be helped after waiting a long time in line to speak with an airline customer service agent...I had no choice but to give in) and THEN the manager started to add our "incidentals," on from the other room which were a few food items and drinks from the mini bar. I stopped him and asked him why after messing up our bill and me finally agreeing to pay the higher price for the one room (and losing 30 minutes of my life dealing with this situation) that he would even bother. The manager Stephen did agree to remove the mini bar charges. That was the only positive that came out of our conversation, but let's not forget they still got more money out of me than they should have and would have gotten a lot more had I not reviewed the bill or followed up with their first, "all taken care of." So, stay here for a good and reliable branded hotel with a good location, but be aware that they will take advantage of you and use any tactic they can to charge you extra. I should add, one elevator was broken so it took us about 20 minutes to get up or down every time we needed it. That was quite annoying but not a deal breaker. Their tactics and willingness to over bill you were most alarming and, to me, a deal breaker.

Had to make a very last minute reservation aftet getting to our hotel and finding it not open for business yet. Another property of that chain was in horrible location. We've stayed at Hyatt Union Square twice already this year, so I called them and found them helpful and accommodating. Their rates are higher than the one not open, but worth every penny!!! Don't try for too inexpensive in NYC. You'll get burned!!!

The Hyatt Union Square could be a great hotel. It has a great location. But it is not being maintained well. The repairs needed when we stayed there last May were still not repaired in December. The elevator was horrible--one of two shut down most of our visit. They are repairing but doing so in the busiest holiday season. The staff was great except for the management. They are not responsive. Very disappointing.

I never review places, but based on the excruciating ringing noise coming from the service elevator next to my room (#414), paper thin, walls, super loud rooms, and lack of a working elevators has moved me to warn others. Stay away!!!

I reserved a terrace room and upon check-in was told it was not available. I was moved down a room grade and placed close to the elevator. I would have chosen a different hotel had the hotel communicated that the terrace room was not available.

Do not stay at this hotel! The room was tiny, and noisy with the constant sound of the elevator shaft going up and down. The water in the shower came out in spurts and bursts. The cost was high and the quality low

Room was comfortable & we chose Hyatt because we know that the beds are comfortable & we would be able to get a decent night's rest. The location worked well for us. Plenty of great restaurants & markets nearby. Union Square was decorated for Christmas & looked lovely. One elevator was being refurbished; fortunately, we never had to wait very long for the one working elevator. Rate was high for a weekday.

The room, which I was told was an "upgrade", was contemporary and had wood floors, but the bathroom was worn looking - particularly in the shower. I was unable to figure out how to turn off one of the lights even though there was a master light switch. I had to call the desk to inquire. I could hear street noise even on a high floor and, having one of the two elevators out of service made for a long wait in the morning. If the rate had been reasonable, I would have rated it higher, but there is no way this hotel was worth $600+ for one night. I feel like I was ripped off to pay that much for a very ordinary hotel. I know it's Manhattan, but there are much better options for less money.

staff was very friendly and accommodating great room with view. will go back only complaint is the bar located on the 1st floor. the bartenders were not that good and seemed pre occupied. the cleaning was slow but the staff took good care of it

Elevators under repair, hideous bright white lights fixed on the hotel at night blaze in room window of a noisy, smallish room major detractors in otherwise decent stay really close to Union Square, neighborhoods all around.

The staff doesn't know the city, didn't help us with directions, restaurant selection, did not even get us a taxi upon a request. Didn't advise us that only one elevator in the whole building worked...bad choice

Sad to say the only thing keeping this rating from a 4 star is only one elevator was working which apparently is the norm. Waiting for it to access your room takes way to long and checking out you have to wait for several elevators until you can find one that is not full of people. Other than that the staff and rooms are excellent.

I frequently visit NYC for work, and I always stay at the Hyatt Union Square. It is in an excellent location, the staff is outstanding, and the the hotel and facilities are top notch. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in NYC.

This is my 5th stay at this property, and it was wonderful as always. The location is perfect, close to the village, downtown, and the Lower East Side. It's near major subway stops, and is walking distance to just about everywhere you'd want to go from midtown and below. The staff here are just wonderful, and as accomodating as can be. They are currently in the process of upgrading their elevators, so I can't wait to see what that improvement will be like on my next visit. The rooms are pretty spacios for NYC hotels, and the beds are just the most comfortable things ever. I always sleep well at this hotel. Lots of room overlook the city, if that's what you'd like. Or go for a courtyard room if you want things a little more quiet. Enjoy!

I appreciated this hotel and staff. The cleanliness was a 10 all around. I was in town to visit with my son who resides in a Brooklyn as a college student. Couldn't have felt better about my hotel selection.

The hotel has some rooms available with outdoor patios, rare find in NYC. The hotel is in a great location for food and shopping , perfect spot.The hotel has a nice fitness center , bar area and attached restaurant and plenty of places nearby to eat , drink and shop

Loved staying at the Hyatt Union Square. The service was amazing from top to bottom. Also really liked the restaurant, the Fourth. Ate quite a few meals there. I am a frequent business traveler, but this was a family trip. I definitely would come back again with my family.

Often when in NYC I have stayed mid-town and wanted a change - glad I did - this is a really good hotel in a great location. Being so close to Union Square means you 2 mins from the subway and easy access to the rest of the city. It is a lively area - plenty of shops and restaurants. Some great places nearby to explore. The hotel itself is very good - I had room on the 11th floor - it was a little small but fine for me on my own. Had a night cap after dinner in the downstairs bar - was a bit surprised to hear 'last drinks' at 11:30pm on a Saturday night - but not complaining - I had been walking all day and was ready for sleep.All in all - I'll be back!

This Hyatt was fabulous! Great location, close to everything and easy to get around as close to subways. Very nice and attentive staf. It was quite spacious by NYC standards. I will definitely return.

Ultra modern, clean quiet room with windows that open!!But the best part was the service...within minutes the front desk staff, including the concierge and door men, knew us by name!! Every request (shower cap, corkscrew, fridge for the room) was taken care of with not a trace of attitude and in a very timely fashion. We have stayed at a number of boutique hotels in NYC and this ranks high, if not highest, on our list!Thanks for all the smiles, nods, small talk and great service that truly enhanced our stay....

We stay in NY a lot, mostly priceline a 4 -5 star hotel for a night or two, usually disappointed...but because we were staying in NY for a week I wanted to hand pick a hotel. Last month I was briefly in the city and spent a few really fun hours looking at many rooms in hotels, around union square and in SOHO. Without hesitancy I choose the Hyatt Union Square, specifically the Alcove Loft junior suite. Because it's a wrap around shaped room it feels so spacious and the bathroom has a separate door for the toilet, and a fantastic large shower. The bed is exceptional. Details are thought of in this simply designed room! I love that you can open a window for fresh air, and the room has three massive windows, so light! I also wanted a hotel where we could walk in and out without traversing a mammoth lobby to get to elevators, the Hyatt is exactly that- large lobby, but designed not to make the hotel guest walk through the whole thing! Bonus is the elevator is always available. Whole Foods around the corner, Liquiteria across the street, subway stop a block or two away. I might be done pricelining NY hotels and will just pay a little more for the hyatt union square.

I'm a Hyatt loyalist, so I stay at Hyatt hotels a good deal. This was my second stay at this hotel, and I enjoyed it, but it came in a bit below my expectations.Location: It's located in a fantastic part of NYC - The Village. I've stayed in Times Square (super tourist area), Grand Central, and Mid-Town, and this is my favorite area by far. So many great places within walking distance.Rooms: Yes, they are a bit tight. But my wife and I had enough space for a an extended weekend, but any longer than that with two and it would have been rough. Otherwise, the room was comfy, wi-fi worked well, and I felt the rooms were surprisingly quiet for a city hotel - street noise didn't seem that bad.Service: The front desk was friendly, and room service was good. The only issue I had was some of the front staff had no clue about the local area. I asked about a local happy hour and the first person passed me to the next, who directed me to the hotel bar (pretty sure I could find that myself), and the bartender informed us there was no HH. Ugh. BTW, we found a good one a block over on 3rd Ave (Linen Hall), I will stay that George stood in stark contrast to the early team. He was super friendly and knew the area, etc. Would I stay here again? Sure. I'd just temper my service expectations.

Great location. The front desk staff was very nice. But, they really nickel and dimed in the restaurant. I got charged for a refill on my coffee at breakfast. That's never happened to me. I guess a first for everything. I just think a hotel charging these rates should be less concerned about every incremental penny. Decent stay but that left a bad taste.

Customer service is a serious issue. The rooms are tiny. Not fit for more than one person. Remodel was done cheaply. Issues with cleanliness. This hotel is 3 star on its best day. The staff (GM included) are apathetic and do not cater towards loyalty members.

Finding this Hyatt was accidental and serendipitous. Since this was election night I wanted to avoid the midtown crowds. This Union Square location turned out to be perfect. The hotel property somewhat reminds me of my former long gone favorite Hyatt property, The Stanhope Hotel (long ago turned into condos ). Hyatt Union Square is a small modern updated property with the wonderful flavor of home.

We live on Long Island but stayed in NYC to watch our son run the NYC Marathon. Hotel has a great location and was immaculate. Staff was friendly. Room was comfortable though I am over the open bathroom concept, it didn't interfere with our stay.

Great location. Very friendly helpful staff. Rooms are small but nice. Comfortable bed. Would stay there again. Some rooms have open concept bathrooms. Nice lobby and bar for meeting people. Close to subway with 24 hour Walgreens accross the street.

This Hotel is a true gem. We stayed here because it was one block away from NYU. It is a small and intimate hotel. The rooms are first class and updated with modern amenities. We enjoyed our stay and were very comfortable.

Good stay for a night. Clean room and friendly staff. Can hear people and noises from the hall in the early am hours. Overall good location for plenty of sights, restaurants and bars. Would stay again

This new Hyatt is right near union square and very close to key subways which makes it very easy to get around. Just a short walk to Greenwich Village and Soho for excellent shopping and restaurants. Has a cool bar and excellent restaurant on premises too. Some rooms are small but very functional.

Great hotel located right next door to Union Square, close to all of the Village and Chelsea sites. The hotel is fairly small for New York, but very luxurious and well appointed. My only complaint is that the bed wasn't the most comfortable I have ever experienced.

This hotel is great for the business travel and visitor to NYC. Rooms have a great layout, perfect starting point to walk to so many attractions. Nice bar on property and also surrounded by many neighborhood gems. Shopping and dining options numerous. I do not think I would recommend for families with children but you should at least check their website if you are interested. The hotel staff is super helpful.

This Hyatt comes close to Radisson hotels I have stayed in as the hotel is modern and the interior is dark, but the room and bathroom are smaller at the Hyatt. If you're staying in the middle of NYC, you're not going to be in a quiet place so I didn't expect it and I wasn't surprised when I could hear muffled noise from the street.

This was my 2nd time staying here. I received an upgraded both times. Both times the rooms were very clean and comfortable. This hotel is in a good location if you have business in and around the Union Square area. Only minor complaint would be that the elevator is a bit slow. Otherwise, no complaints.

I booked this hotel on the same day I needed a room in NY (my existing hotel in NY was a joke, so I checked out right away). The Hyatt Union Square provided a warm welcome, upgraded room due to my status with Hyatt and a 'reasonable for NY' price. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. The location is very convenient, since you can easily take a subway nearby. I recommend this hotel when considering a visit to the Big Apple.

My room was set up on a company M/C. They asked for a card for incidentals. I have a Visa. Because they were different they would not check me in. So I had to put all on my Visa now have to go through a 4 week reimbursement process.. get with it!! 1/2 roll of TP in the room with no back up is UNACCEPTABLE! Cold shower at 6:30 AM. Get bigger water heaters. Nice hotel but many breakdowns.

Excellent bed, wonderful shower. excellent products. Fun wine and glasses by the door. Free internet, self lighting closet. Really a lovely room in a great part of lower manhattan. Convenient to NYU and the wonderful restaurants of the east village. Warm, helpful staff.

If you are visiting a child at NYU, this location is excellent. All the comforts of an upscale hotel and easy walking distance to NYU and the whole downtown area. Even if you're not but want to be in the middle of things downtown, this is a great full-service location. The staff is pro and the rooms are clean and functional - albeit on the small side as are a lot of NYC rooms.

Hotel is in a great spot in Union Square.Bar & Restaurant area so nice.We were in room with only I little wardrobe(only could hang up 6 peices of clothing) should be told because we stayed for 12 days with large suitcases and had no intention of living out of our suitcases when staying and paying at a Hyatt Hotel!

This is a decent room and pretty centrally located (they do charge you for that). However, light sleepers will probably be woken up or disturbed many times due to the nearby fire station and constant blaring of horns. Wifi was terribly slow even during off-hours. I can't believe they don't put a router in each room and/or get better connectivity.

Everything was great. I came in on a red eye with my young daughter and they let me check in early. So wonderful! Only issue is that you can hear doors open and close constantly. High floor is recommended.

The staff were all helpful, kind and professional. Special thanks to Kathy and Fernando at the front desk. The gym is one of the best. The hotel is conveniently located by New York University and some great restaurants.

While staying in NY, the Hyatt Union Square was a great choice. Service was great including front desk, door man, restaraunt, etc. convenient to Union Square and Fashion District. Room was very clean, accomodates professionals. Refigerator or ice bucket would have been nice.

While my first room had a weird high pitched noise which evidently came from a piece of fire detection equipment in the ceiling, I ultimately had a great stay. Very convenient to Union Square and close to the local Avis rent a car.

This is the perfect hotel for visiting NYU!!! Walking distance from all NYU buildings. Surrounded by fun shops and restaurants. One block away from subway hub. The hotel staff is friendly and can help you with any aspect of your visit.

Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location.....This is the third time my wife and i have stayed at the hotel. It has a "Boutique" feel and the rooms were well accented. Best part is still the location which is steps away from Union Square all the great restaurants in East Village.

Right off of Union Square, the hotel is close to the East Village and the NYC area. Well appointed hotel. Rooms are a nice size for NYC. Love the wood floors vs carpet in the room. Excellent service. Good breakfast options.

very convenient, comfortable, and clean. great location too! Have stayed here multiple times, and this was better - definite improvement. they do need to have a better restaurant. that is not up to par given the surroundings.also need bar with more normal seating and better bar food.

Union Square is an excellent base for visiting Manhattan. Easy to get most places from here by foot, car or subway. Good places to eat nearby, beautiful walks, good shopping and easy trip to area museums and galleries.

I was in New York City recently to visit family and stayed at the Hyatt Union Square hotel located next to Union Square, NYC. This is a vibrant, exciting location close to many attractions, and offers a visitor a wide array of options for dining, sight seeing, people watching, entertainment and the opportunity to experience life in one of the premier cities in the world. The hotel is relatively new with attractive décor and architecture, clean, well designed rooms with all the amenities necessary for a restful and pleasant stay. The health club offers contemporary equipment that provides the visitor options to exercise as one wishes. The hotel is located close to subway stations that enable a visitor to travel throughout the city. There are several parks within walking distance such as Union Square and Madison Park should one wish to spend time in a park setting. The area is one of the cross roads in the city offering a mix of population groups and cultures. There are attractive food stores offering various items, should a visitor wish to purchase food items rather than go to a restaurant. There are also entertainment venues close to the hotel. In summary, Hyatt Union Square is an upscale hotel offering comfortable and attractive rooms in an area of New York that offers a visitor a positive and memorable experience.

We stay at this Hyatt every time we come visit our daughter who is attending NYU. We are always very pleased with every aspect of the hotel, from the friendliness of the staff since you arrive, to the cleanliness of the room, to the location of the hotel. We strongly recommend it!

We had another wonderful stay at the Hyatt Union Square this past weekend. The location less than a block away from Union Square is great, plus one of our favorite coffee places (Everyman Coffee) is a two minute walk away. But one of the best aspects of the hotel is the employees; from the housekeepers to the front desk personnel, every interaction was a pleasure. I wish I remembered all of their names, but I have special thanks for Victor (front desk) who made checking in on Friday a great experience. One other note: the windows open a few inches, which is really nice when the weather is cool, but when you close them, the room becomes silent with no traffic noise whatsoever.

Modern decor in rooms. Everything clean and looking new. Room was quiet - or else everyone was tired because there were no disturbances all night. Very helpful staff. Rooms not large but typical for NYC.

The Hyatt USQ is a nice boutique hotel that is welcoming. The overall decor is nice, but minimal. I am staying at the hotel for a total of 6 nights. The room is VERY small with open bathroom/sink concept. I think it is over priced compared to other hotels in the USQ/Soho area.

For a total cost approaching $500 for a single night, the value received was terrible. Room too small, location not great, reception area tiny and cheap-feeling. Not a good experience over all. The room views on the photos were not representative of the actual rooms. The property did not give the "Hyatt" feeling, but rather a cheap hotel for quick stays
user_location: Washington Dc, District Of Columbia, Usa

review_body: We were very happy with our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The staff was friendly and very customer focused. The location is near lots of great restaurants in the city. Our room was clean, and we also had a small outside terrace! We will certainly stay here again when we travel back to New York City.

We were only there for one night but everything was clean, working and nice. The staff was very friendly. Will definitely stay there again. We had a courtyard room which just faces the backs of buildings but it was great because you don't get all the street noise - which can be loud in NYC

Your service is beyond expectations. Can you turn up some of the important lights? I had no idea I had issues with lighting until I visited and tried to navigate the stairs to the bathroom from the restaurant.

When we selected this hotel for an extended stay, our choice was based on location and the reputation of the Hyatt chain. What we got was a wonderful surprise. This hotel was a gem due primarily to the exceptional friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel staff. As new comers to NYC, we were like babes in the woods as far as negotiating day tips, directions, using subways, etc. When each question arose the staff was there to point us in the right direction and offering suggestions of places to go and things to do. Special Kudos to Francois and Sabeli, both of whom took a fair amount of time in helping us book tours and tickets for a Broadway play at an exceptional price.Our room was comfortable and well cleaned and prepared every morning and evening.The breakfast bar had a nice selection of choices at a reasonable price.The hotel is located in midtown and we felt very comfortable walking the neighborhood streets during the day and evening. Some nice restaurants and attractions are close by and many of the major downtown and uptown attractions were within a short subway ride.While not the cheapest place to stay in NYC, looking back, we felt the cost was of great value for the treatment and service we received. We would definitely stay there again on our next trip to NYC.

Conveniently located but if you blink you may pass right by it. This hotel blends so well with the neighborhood. Within walking distance, apart from Union Square, the hotel provided easy access to the 4, 5, 6, L, N, Q, and R subway lines two short blocks away as well as a Walgreens, Best Buy, Duane Reade and an assortment of little shops and places to eat inclusive of Starbucks and Panera Bread. The room, for a New York hotel room was quite spacious and well appointed. The furniture was very interesting, the location of the refrigerator was very clever and I really liked that the light inside of the closet came on when the closet door opened. It rained while we were there and a nice touch in the room was the presence of an umbrella, rather than having to ask to borrow an umbrella or go out and buy one in the rain. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud and I wanted to take the pillows home with me. I absolutely loved the room layout and the huge picture window which encouraged staying in. All in all a wonderfully surprising gem of a hotel.

My fiance and I stayed at this hotel on a short trip to NYC. We stayed from a Sunday through Wednesday. We easily took public transportation from JFK airport to the hotel. It is extremely close to a subway stop. We were able to walk pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. There was a lot of shopping and restaurants just outside our door. The staff at the front desk were always extremely friendly and helpful. They mentioned we could always stop in the gym and pick up a bottle of water on our way in or out of the hotel, which was great! The rooms were even a little bigger than we expected for a NYC hotel. They were modern and very clean. The staff did a great job. I would definitely stay at this hotel again on a future trip. The only thing it was missing was a pool! :)

Very nice hotel. Staff was very helpful during our two day stay. The hotel is in a good location close to good restaurants and shopping. Rooms are not large but very nice. The room was clean and tidy.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Hyatt Union Square, New York! Check-in was fast and friendly. Franciose was sweet, kind and professional. My room, 1 king bed, was spotless, spacious and very comfortable with plenty of towels. I love all the hard flooring, especially from a cleanliness point of view. The bar and lobby were gorgeous and the morning coffee in the bar area was delicious and served with a smile. I was sad to only stay 1 night! I will definitely stay here again. Top notch.

Great location and hotel staff was very friendly with a smile on their faces. Service was outstanding. Have stayed at all Hyatt hotels in NYC as well as Andaz and this beats them all. This location in union square is close to great food and the subway is about a block away. I cannot stay enough positive things about this hotel.

Very nice quaint Hyatt, small rooms but larger are available you have to ask!we loved our stay first class treatment and first and for most it was clean and I felt safe. I would stay here again next time I want the City experience!

Our hotel was located near Union Square area on the East side. Easy access to public transportation, taxi service & walkable to just about everywhere. Terraced room which provided a cozy outdoor space to enjoy morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening.

Very clean and comfortable but a bit expensive. I guess it's New York you get what u pay for Location is great close to everything . I loved the stuff everybody is so nice and professional it was the icing on the cake

This is the fourth time I've stayed at the Hyatt Union Square and I've always had a pleasant experience. It is perfectly located in the city, the rooms feel comfortable and spacious and I've always been treated very nicely by the staff. I have no complaints and look forward to many more stays. Given that I travel to New York 3-4 times a year for work, I like that I've found a hotel that can be a "second home" of sorts.

We have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square New York several times. We keep going back as the location is superb, the hotel is very nice and the staff is very supportive. Close to subway, Times Square, Broadway... Safe area with lots of places to eat nearby. Highly recommended!

Not my usual place to stay but so glad I discovered just how nice this hotel is. The room design and functionality is fantastic - one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in. Loved the lighting controls and the thought that obviously went into every aspect of the room design. Great central location. Looking froward to returning.

This is a great hotel! The staff is very friendly, the food from the restaurant is very good, and the location is very convenient. I will be back in New York in a couple of weeks and will stay at the hotel again. By New York standards, the rooms are sizable, but first-time travelers to Manhattan should bear "By New York standards" in mind.

I cannot explain or rave properly enough in order to give the whole staff the kudos they deserve. I stay at this Hyatt often and stay at all the Hyatt properties in NYC and across the country, including the Andaz and Hyatt Centric properties. They are all great! However, this stay takes the cake. They gave an upgrade to us above my usual upgrade and gave us a bottle of champagne, strawberries, and a wonderful note congratulating us on our Engagement the day before. I did call to let them know that I was proposing in Central Park on a bike ride and boy did they come through! Thank you so much. Give the whole staff a raise! Best wishes and hope to see you soon! Matt Christiansen and Jodi Laramy

Great customer service - staff go above and beyond to please travelers. Nice fitness center; small rooms but well designed and very functional. Great latte in the morning at restaurant with very friendly barista. Highly recommend this hotel!

We loved our stay in the Union Square area. The shower was a highlight of the room, it was perfect! And the room darkening curtains were AMAZING. I woke up at 9 AM one morning and it looked like the middle of the night. I have not slept that late in years. The room was small, but expected this in NYC. There is lots of shopping and food in the area.

Staff was accommodating and friendly. The room were clean but on the small side. The hotel was conveniently located. We will be staying there again in the next two weeks. Amenities were nice. Wi-fi, robes etc.

had a great time, the staff was wonderful..location is great, the bed was nice..the rooms are small like all nyc hotels..check is was easy and I got a late stay.. all and all great trip! been to many nyc hotels and this is one of the better ones..location is right in the middle of the city..

This was the third time i stayed at this hotel for a business trip. Love the small size and boutique feeling. Front desk is always super friendly and greet me on my way out and upon returning. The rooms are a great size and are efficiently arranged. Great area-super close to Union Square and walkable to East and West Village. Great management-will gladly return!

Wonderful overnight stay. The staff was efficient and helpful. They couldn't have been nicer. The rooms are comfortable and spacious for NY. The location was great and the valet parking worked out well.

I thought I would try to return to this hotel to give it a second chance,the first was no good.Starting out ,poor doorman,wouldn't help with luggage.We where given a very small room on 10th floor,asked to be changed,a very slightly bigger room was available.On second day,stuck in elevator.Need ice,call room service,good luck?Does your room need a light bulb replaced?Good luck,call housekeeping.Lots of street noise in middle of night,did you sleep well? Good luck!

Good vibe. Cathy was great at front desk. Nice energy in the bar. Location is perfect. Starbucks a stones throw away. Wifi was spotty but they upgraded to premium as I had work to do. Nice couples retreat

I went with the upgraded room with an outdoor space. Unfortunately it was directly across from the closet that contained towels, cleaning supplies, etc. for the entire building and it was very noisy in the morning. Other than that the room was good.

The hotel was well situated for our visit to see an off-Broadway play and visit family. Staff was friendly and helpful; the rooms are well-designed and very clean. Many restaurants and shops are a convenient walking distance.

Had room facing street and you hear all the construction and transit noise. Couldn't sleep. Hotel is average and certainly not worth the $509/night I paid. They couldn't give me another room citing hotel was full.

We spent one night in NYC for my son's birthday here. I only wish we could've spent more nights. This hotel is beautiful and modern with a sharp lobby, wonderful bell staff, and front desk personnel couldn't have been more pleasant. The room was just the right size for what we needed. The bed/shower/hot beverage center were all impeccable. Our only issue was that the housekeeping staff repeatedly knocked on our door beginning at 8:00 am the next morning: every hour on the hour. We tried to sleep in, but the noise in the hallway was terribly loud. We neglected to put the "do not disturb" sign on the door, and regretted it. Don't forget to put the sign on your door before you go down for the night! You'll be glad you did! Other than the early morning disturbances, this was a very lovely hotel.

The staff is outstanding in their service. Very professional and welcoming. This goes a long way when you are in the hassle and bustle of NYC and when you are traveling away from home. The food at the restaurant is excellent and the service at the bar and restaurant is impressive. The rooms are a bit small and the hotel can be a bit noisy at times since its right above the police station but the location is good because its close to all the Jazz clubs and great restaurants.

nice hotel, convenient location. very cooperative and helpful staff. Good experience. Room was clean. Breakfast was well prepared. Hotel price is high, but I guess that's NYC. I would definitely come back another time.

We stayed a week. Great location on lower east side of Manhattan. The staff was very helpful and prompt to help, e.g. bring more hangers. The faucet was so close to the sink bottom that I could not put my hands together beneath it to wash them; so the staff moved us to a room with a higher faucet but of course that took time to pack some. Room was small but adequate. The air condition and/or heater had some odor that gave my wife a headache, she has allergies. The floor was not cleaned daily. The room was quiet but load neighbors could clearly be heard late into the evening. The head of the front desk did give us extra points for our troubles.

My cousin and I visited my daughter and we needed a room with 2 beds. This turns out to be a difficult thing to find in NYC. The Hyatt Union Square was in the right area for and had a few rooms with 2 beds. Had no idea what a great location it was. Turns out Union Square is a big transfer station for many of the subway lines. Our room was attractive, well-lit, clean- and we appreciated the two small closets. They were on one side of each bed, so we had our own closet with hanging space and nice big drawers. The staff couldn't have been more welcoming and solicitous.
