Loved this upscale room with comfortable bed and great amenities! Chic decorations and modern design. Located just around the corner from my son's new NYU Dorm made this a perfect location. Easy to walk to anything you may want. Restaurants and shopping galore!

The Hyatt at Union Square is a splendid hotel in a wonderful part of the city filled with friendly staff in every position. It's very easy to get to from Penn Station by going up a stop on the Red/Blue lines to Times Square and then down on the Yellow line to Union Square.

Location is the only thing this Hotel has going for them. The rooms are very small and not very up to date with it's décor. It was ok but for the price we paid - it was very disappointing. Definitely not a 4 star hotel. 1 of the elevators was always down and their stairs led you outside - it was pouring out 2 out of the 3 days of our visit - therefore everytime we used the stairs - we had to run around the corner to get to back into the hotel (after getting soaked) Staff was not very friendly and seemed to be non-chalant about everything. We intentionally asked on our day of check out, of check out time - knowing that there was only 1 elevator working so that we wouldn't have to run back down to get our keycard reactivated since we were having brunch (in the Hotel restaurant) with friends that we would not be finished until after 11am - the front desk told us that it was 12pm. Let it be known - our keys did not work at 11:05pm when we arrived back to our room to pick up our things. We had to run down & wait for the elevator to go back up to our room!! Will definitely not come back here... too many other better boutique hotels with better prices and amenities in the City

Great services, great hotel!Especially Jennifer at Front Desk Assistant Manager, very considerate and helpful, best experience in NYC ever.Being diamond member, we got treated very well. Great breakfast and 4pm late check out.

I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square in New York as it was within a mile of my daughter's apartment. If you want to get out of mid-town Manhattan, the Hyatt Union Square is a great location. Within walking distance of many great restaurants and shopping. (I highly recommend tours of the East Village, West Village, Chelsea, SoHo, Wall Street, the 9/11 Memorial.) Rooms are small, as is typical in NY, but nicely furnished. A fitness center is available 24/7. I ate at the restaurant one evening. It was late so only the bar was open. I ordered an appetizer which was ok - not nearly as good as the in which restaurants I'd been dining. Staff was friendly and helpful.

This hotel was recommended to us by a family member who once lived in New York. So glad we took her advice! The hotel was perfect! The location was great as it is close to everything. The hotel restaurant was great as well.

I often travel for work, and, when I travel to NYC, I often am staying at the Hyatt Union Square. I love the location in Union Square - tons of restaurants from fancy to hole-in-the-wall finds are walking distance away, a main subway hub right nearby, and good leisure activities around (if you have the time - movie theater, mall, etc.). The hotel itself is very new (I think it opened in 2013?), so the rooms and conditions of the whole facility are still in that brand-new stage - i.e. perfect! It has a very modern feel and look to it, which I prefer. For the foodies - there are three different restaurants (well one's more a bar) as part of the hotel too!Last but not least, the staff here has been nothing less than perfect - always friendly, always smiling, always welcoming. They dress pretty well too - I appreciate the added touch of the tailored uniforms with just the right style and colors to match the rest of the hotel's feel.Happy to recommend this to anyone I know, especially Hyatt-goes in NYC!

The rooms have been very good. Clean and well maintained. The service has been excellent both times that we have been there! Not worth staying at a larger property closer to the park when the service is so good here.

The service here is outstanding. I requested a fragrance-free room, and that's what I got - none of the usual Hyatt nonsense about "it's good enough". They also remembered that I like extra feather pillows; I didn't even have to ask. I only ordered room service once, but it was plentiful and yummy, as well as arriving promptly. Oh, and the shower . . . that was amazing. What an awesome shower, with tons of water pressure so that the "rainfall" shower head felt like standing under a waterfall (rather than the "standing in the drizzle" effect that many such showers actually produce)! Comfortable and clean surroundings, great service, and good food - what's not to like?

We loved the Hyatt Union Square; the service, bar, restaurant were all exceptional. It's close to everything, very walkable, a subway station a short block away, the Union Square Farmers Market. My husband is in a wheelchair; the accessible rooms are perfect, roomier than most hotels in Manhattan. The housekeeping staff could not be more accommodating. A young woman at the front desk booked a town car for us to go back to the airport, and accompanied us to the car to make sure we were able to reach it safely and comfortably. We had a perfect NYC holiday, thanks to the staff at the Hyatt Union Square.

I was in Manhattan for business . The hotel's facilities allowed me to prepare and comfortably rest for work engagements. The staff was nice. The room was clean and well kept. The hotel is situated in a great location with easy subway access yet still gives a sense of privacy and allows quiet in the middle of a busy city.

Just enjoyed three days and nights at the Hyatt Union Square- super friendly and helpful staff, nice rooms, great beds, perfect location to everywhere. Just beware of the breakfast restaurant $$$$$. Starbucks and Panera are a block away. Would gladly stay there again.

Hotel was very nice. Room was well appointed. Bathroom was large by NYC standards. Beds were comfortable. Valet service was excellent. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Free wifi was very much appreciated. This was our second time there and I would stay there again.

My stay was perfect. Quick check-in; friendly staff who kindly allowed me to enter the room quite early.The room was very clean, Ammeniites of good quality and cozy bed. Only detail is that wardrobe is tiny, so problems if in a longer stay.

My go to hotel ANY time I'm in NYC. U cannot beat the location. Close to Soho The Village.. all of downtown and a fast cab or subway ride to the shopping on fifth. I elected to use the subway almost my entire stay instead of waiting for a cab or uber ans deal with the traffic. The rooms are a tad small but modern in design. I use to always stay at the W down the street until I found this gem of a hotel. The staff are always so courteous and try to make your stay as,enjoyable as possible. Great place to stay ans won't break the bank!!!! Looking forward,to my next stay. Thank you to all at The Hyatt Union Sq.!!!

This is our second stay here . Both times we had a great experience . World class service and large comfortable rooms with an outstanding location . Our only issue happened when we were trying to take a mid afternoon nap, the housekeepers were quite noisy in the hall opening and closing doors . Maybe they should be reminded to be more thoughtful .

The sitting area in the lobby was pleasant, but my room was much smaller than the photograph of the room I thought I booked. While the room faced the interior and was quiet, it had an unpleasant smell upon entry. It probably originated from the bathroom, as the shower tiles were stained from mildew. The hotel management did sent someone up immediately after my complaint, which I appreciated. Sadly, the quality of the room and the experience did not warrant the price tag.

Comfortable, good size rooms. I love location, close to everything. Turn down service needs some improvement. First night they left one chocolate square on a pillow for 2 of us. The following nights they left 2 chocolates at the random place. Our bed was not turned down.

My child is enrolled at NYU tisch school of the arts. I have stayed here multiple times in the last years. The hotel is very close to the dorms and classrooms. Breakfast buffet is delicious and convenient. Walking distance to many delicious restaurants.

Friendly attentive staff at desk.Service in restaurant and lounge was not up to your usual standards. Wrong orders delivered in both, no service in lounge until summoned as we sat in the very visible corner at the front of the lounge.Our in room patio furniture was in need of surface cleaning every day.You supply of toiletries in the room of poor quality.But, in spite of these issues, the stay was enjoyable

My husband and I were pleased with this hotel. The rooms may be small, but ours was well laid out, attractive, and very clean. Front desk and housekeeping staff were cordial and very responsive. The hotel is one block from the Union Square subway entrance, which makes it an extremely convenient location. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. I hope to stay here again.

Everybody is devoted to you, high level of human skills in the service! very good room! food delicious! one of the best hotels i have been in NYC. I will try to elect this hotel for my next visit in New York!

Let me start off by saying we paid almost $600 per night for our double room. With this fare I expect to be fed chocolate covered strawberries. Unfortunately, our experience was quite the opposite of that. When we first got to New York, we were exhausted so we wanted to lay down. However our room was not ready until 2:30. This was three hours after we arrived and 30 minutes after check-in time. By that time, they should have made that night free. And for half of our 7 day trip, one of the two elevators was not working so it took 10 minutes to catch one. This was a pain and completely inconvenient. Also, the room was TINY!! There was nowhere to put our luggage because the beds did not have space underneath them. Then once we had unpacked there was barely any closet or drawer space to put our clothes. Now mind you it was me and my mother (two women) so we brought A LOT of clothes especially since we were staying there for 7 nights!Oh and another thing was the fact that you could hear someone talking in the lobby all the way up to the 10th floor. This was unpleasant to hear while we were sleeping (or at least trying to sleep). And because the hotel is on 4th avenue the noises of cars honking was endless even into the wee hours of the night. I wish we had found a hotel that was on a more quiet street and that had bigger rooms.

Enjoyed every moment, from check in to check out. Wonderfully friendly staff and very efficient. We requested an ADA room room for my parents which was absolutely perfect. Drinks in the bar was comfortable and made a great meeting spot for family members to gather.. Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious and comfortable. Union Square is super fun----and super noisy and congested. We will take the good with the bad snd stay in your hotel again!

great location, helpful and friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms, good restaurants in hotel, rooms are quiet when on upper floors with courtyard views. Very close to subway stations, shopping, fine eateries and Union Square park and Washington Square Park.very slow elevators ;(

Nice updated rooms even though they were kind of small. Front desk was extremely helpful and nice. I would stay here again. Bathroom and room are attached without a door. There is only a door to the toilet.

I recently came into the city for work and picked the Hyatt in Union Square for the location. The rooms are standard size for NYC hotels but you can't beat the location. Step outside for coffee shops and restaurants, The Strand bookstore, all the shops of union sq, lower fifth, greenwich village and SoHo. Service was also lovely. Will definitely return for work and pleasure.

It is in a perfect location for visiting NYU students. Nice friendly staff. Clean & modern rooms. Nice bathroom. Stayed in the courtyard facing room and it was quiet! Would definitely stay here again.

Great service - the front desk, concierge and valet were extremely helpful. The rooms were spacious and very quite. The location was easy to get to and close to business and dining options.. Overall a great value proposition.

I'm no stranger to NYC having lived here 20 years ago and making annual visits since then. I recently tend to stay in the Flatiron district or below. This is my first time staying at the Hyatt Union Square and it was a delightful surprise. We upgraded to a corner loft room. The room was layed out well and I loved the fact that there were no carpets. The bathroom is small but with good counter space for all the stuff you need to put out. I loved the extra touch of putting a small ledge in the shower to shave my legs- thoughtful!The staff was pleasant, the location is great, the price reasonable. I would definitely stay here again.The only downsides I could find, and they aren't criticisms by any means, are the elevators are a bit slow at peak times and the street noise is a bit loud. Both issues typical of almost any city stay.

Great location near New School and NYU. The staff is very courteous and consistently friendly. We chose a courtyard room which was remarkably quiet for NYC - but no view. Warning: Valet parking is $75 per night and is not in/out!

I have to admit I booked a night when almost all other hotels were full. The location was convenient to my needs. Staff was very courteous. Room small. Typical for NYC. Iron in my room didn't work. Hot water took several minutes to get up and when it did was scalding hot. Asked another guest in the hotel and they had the same experience. One of 2 elevators was down for maintenance.

I always stay at the Hyatt Union Square when I visit NYU. The staff is warm, friendly and welcoming. The rooms are modern and spacious by New York City standards. The hotel is within walking distance to great restaurants and the Union Square subway station. The hotel is one block away from the open air market at Union Square open Saturday. It is convenient to campus bookstores and dorms .

We traveled to New York for business. We enjoyed the hotel amenities. The décor was modern and inviting. The location was great. The staff was very accommodating and professional. I would return and stay at this location in the future.

Modern, clean facility with decent gym and great location walking distance to wonderful cafe's, entertainment, etc. Very helpful staff, with great local recommendations. Sunday Brunch was ok, but expensive. Fantastic baked goods! Disappointment with no balcony or rooftop dining. Small, but nicely laid out room.

The Hotel staff were courteous and pleasant, the room was nice and slightly larger than most I have been in in NY, and the location was perfect for attendance at a play at Tisch and the Farmer's Market at Union Square Saturday morning..

Nicely updated rooms and a very friendly staff. A pleasurable 5 nights!Our welcomed stay for the first time in many years was a grand experience. The staff was very helpful with eating recommendations and in helping with transportation.

Great location, steps from Union Sq and the subway. Rooms will on the small size but it's expected in downtown NY. Though the Hyatt is a worldwide hotel group, staying at the Hyatt Union Square felt like i was staying at a boutique hotel.

Stayed three nights on business in NYC. Reasonably close to Union Square subway stop, unsure of taxi frequency as I never took one. The Union Square Wines shop across the street is pretty good. Wines in the hotel room were just okay but the prices were reasonable. They need to provide some kind of refrigeration for the white wines, though (I understand some rooms have a fridge, mine did not.) Workout room was sufficient and well stocked with necessities. The Fourth cafe/restaurant has a good menu and good service but closes the bar too early. No pool or hot tub is a big downer for me - enough to have me looking for another hotel next time, but not absolutely a show-stopper. Room noise (from inside the hotel) was more than I expected, but not keeping me up at night. Sirens and honking are just NYC but outside noise never kept me awake or woke me. Nice décor, bed was pretty comfortable. Pillows were good. Shower was cool but a bit impractical because it wets most of the bathroom floor. I'd stay there again, but only after ruling out other options.

No complaints about the rooms at all, which is a definite plus. Would absolutely stay here again as well. But... Would be nice if either of the restaurants/bars stayed open past 11. And if you didn't get stuck in the elevators. Haven't been to the fitness center, so I can't speak to that.

The room was very nice and in good condition. The staff was great! I asked for an ice bucket to be delivered to the room as there were no ice machines, and it was delivered promptly & cheerfully. I wish the complimentary morning coffee were available a little longer (like 5:00 - 7:30/8:00am vs 5:00-7:00am), and I wish there were a little more variety in the available tv stations. Seems it was all news /sports /paid promotions & kids channels. At least they had USA Network & HBO.I'd definitely stay there again.

This trip was a quick business trip. Victor at the Front Desk was amazing in getting me checked in early so that I could make an afternoon meeting, but the magic stopped there.And it was the little stuff... really little and unnecessarily aggravating.Champagne and locally sourced chocolate were promised as part of the package and not delivered. A telephone call on day 2 yielded a cheap bottle of Prosecco and a Moo Chocolate moved out of the "for sale" basket in the room. Really?My rez had a provision for late checkout ,if available, but I was told by the clerk that he "might" charge me an additional $300 for a couple of hours. It was left that he would "try", but no solid commitment, so I was left dangling until I actually got my bill at checkout as to whether this unjustified extortion would occur or not.The simple answer would have been, "yes, we would be delighted to arrange that for you".The hotel is pleasant, the rooms nice and, if you can get to Victor, the service is A+. Sadly, it declines rapidly when left in the hands of the less committed and less well trainedWould I stay there again? Likely not. There are others who do all of this far better for the same robust price.

Clean rooms with nice decor. Staff is very pleasant and friendly. Lovely hotel would recommend and stay again. Quite neighborhood so if you are looking for clubs or night life check further, not here.

I was treated very well by the staff. I was delighted when the dropped off a plate of fruit to my room mid afternoon on Saturday. I was working when my girlfriend, who is on crutches arrived and team at the Hyatt Union square helped her get comfortably settled. I would definitely stay at this hotel in the future.

Excellent location! Nice, modern yet simple hotel! Everyone friendly and professional! The lobby is a hit for its simplicity but all your needs are efficiently met. I wish I could use staircase to access my requested low floor! Non available.

Great service, nice sized rooms, newer property, nice location. I only wish room service was open later especially for those of us still on west coast time. I've stayed at this property for the past 3 years and have yet to be disappointed.

Everything about this hotel is great!Location is amazing- walking distance to Chelsea, SoHo, Greenwich Village, Gramacy Park & one block from Union Square subway & park. Rooms are very clean, quiet, comfortable. Staff is super friendly, courteous. Hotel is dog-friendly, too. The fitness centeris fantastic. Great restaurant & room service available (though the food is expensive). This hotel is a great place to come "home" to. Highly recommend it.

I have always had great service at Hyatt properties and the Hyatt Union Square was not different. Location was fantastic. Coming from Virginia, the hotel is not that far once you come out of the Holland tunnel. There were plenty of parking options at the hotel, garages nearby and even on the street. The people working at the front desk were extremely helpful. The room was set up well. There was a group of 4 of us sharing a room with 2 queen size beds. The room had small closets on each side of the beds so that the two people sharing a bed had their own closet and drawers. The room is set up so that you are not on top of each other. The room is not large but it is designed well. Beds were super comfortable. The hotel was so quiet. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

The hotel is nice and everything was clean.I visited as a getaway from kids with a friend. Unfortunately, when we arrived they couldn't give us two queen beds and only had a room with a king (first bit of awkwardness). Once we got into the room, we realized that the bathroom has no door and shower is visible from the room. Moreover, you have to undress in the room. Sink also mid-room. As a couple, all of this would be very nice, but as two friends traveling, it was really awkward.

The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and modern...totally impressed! The staff surprised us with a cheese tray and bottle of wine for our 40th anniversary. We will definitely stay here again!

A fairly decent hotel, the rooms were small but customer service was excellent. The location was perfect for my business trip, there were lots of nice restaurants and other venues close by.I wouldn't mind staying there again on my next trip!

Great Rooms, Great Service! Very accommodating any request i have is met. I stay here anytime i am in New York. Its convenient and always a great room. Thanks to the front desk for helping me out. I'll be back...

1) WORST Bathrobe had FECES stains inside robe 2) Shower repaired 3) No extra toilet paper - not even a new roll to begin with 4) no full kleenex 3) Breakfast food tray not removed from room, but computer person in PM removed it for me. Told to put out door =not strong enough to open door and carry tray More, but can't remember - Hotel location perfect for me and stayed in Hyatt SF many times. Felt like I was in a third world country. POOR management

17 series are the best rooms more spacious . Staff is very friendly and helpful . Ideal location for Union Square and NYU dorms . Lil expensive but worth it if u get good rooms . Area is safe n all good restaurants next to hotel

Overall the hotel was great. I found the room to be very small. This is the first time I had an opportunity to stay at a Hyatt where the sink, shower and toilet were in different rooms. I was very displeased with the transportation service to the hotel. I asked before I agreed to have an uber limo driver bring me to the hotel how much the rate would be. He assured me that he would give me a good price. When I arrived at the hotel he charged me $160. I was advised by my girl friend who had arrived earlier that I should not have paid more than $55. Needless-to-say, . I will be blogging via Social Media advising anyone coming New York not to use their cab service.

Good prices and very nice location. Bed is super comfortable!!Definitely recommend. Quiet area but not far from all the cool stuff in NY.Breakfast was really good as well. The union square right by it can be a fun place to hang out at night.

We've stayed at this hotel for our trips to NYC due to its convenient location. We've had an excellent experience during both of our stays at this hotel. In particular, our experience with the front desk personnel has been exemplary. They've been very helpful with checking our bags, getting us into our room early, arranging taxis, etc. Very friendly staff.

The employees went out of their way to make sure that I was comfortable. The door man assisted me in ensuring that my luggage got to my room on time. The accommodations were excellent as well. I look forward to my next stay at your wonderful hotel

They hotel is very nice! Rooms are very small (200 sq ft), but you kind of expect that in NYC. The rooms are very modern and beds are comfortable. Rooms are consistently very clean...My 4th stay this year. Very convenient location to Soho and Greenwich Village. It is away from the tourist trap of Times Square. If you are looking for hip/laid back NYC. This is the place to stay.

Nice, contemporary, stylish, great location.Top service. All the niceties including bed and bedding of Hyatt at its bestOne thing: for elite members $25 credit is not enough to cover breakfast.Recommend.

I admit I had higher expectations from a Hyatt hotel. I was using my Hyatt points for a one night stay at this hotel. I was given the worst room with inside brick wall view and was told that it is what one gets when spending 25,000 Hyatt points.The shower was almost unusable, it couldn't be regulated and would attach with spurts of hot water.The precious almost non existing space in the King room is used with displays of snacks and beverages one would not want, including a $6 water with a large price label to not mistake it for a free water, god-forbid!The bed was clean and comfortable. The floor had not been washed in a long time.At 9 am there was loud banging on my door: it was the cleaning staff that wouldn't stop knocking on the door until I opened it. They wanted to know when I was checking out.It is an awfully overpriced hotel, aside from its location it only has few redeeming features. I am gladly switching to a cheaper and better hotel tonight.

The front desk staff was amazing, and they easily get 5 stars from me. The room itself was beautiful, though I was surprised that the bathroom was part of the room, with no separate door. The shower itself had an ugly stain, which I imagine would have been easy to clean given that it was tile (bleach anyone?). The restaurant on the main floor was excellent, though the menu limited. The wait staff gets mixed reviews - our original waiter clearly did not want to take care of us, and was a rather dour man. A second waiter came to the rescue, and it was a better experience. All in all, I will stay here again.

Excellent location, very stylish and comfortable interior, room was perfect, but above all: the personal efforts the staff at the front desk showed was outstanding, thank you for that, they handle every tricky situation at the most convenient, friendly and efficient way. my hotel of choice in Manhattan, Congrats on your choice of personell

This is our fourth stay at The Hyatt Union Square! The location is perfect and the rooms are perfectly appointed. All of the employees you encounter couldn't be more hospitable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Manhattan or Williamsburg- very convenient to the L train to Brooklyn.

Great location, outstanding service, beautiful property. Was exactly what we needed for our stay to tour The New School and NYU. Neighborhood has lots of great coffee shops, bookstores and restaurants.

Our base level King room was very attractive but small. There was very little space for clothing - a couple small drawers, a very short hanging rod partially blocked by an iron and ironing board. The high tech thermostat w/ motion detector would not keep cool air blowing through the night.

This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel while in Manhattan. Both stays have been for business. Location is perfect. The rooms are very modern and large for Manhattan. The beds are extremely comfortable. The hotel is very quiet and very well serviced by the staff. The breakfast is excellent downstairs but not included. It is very expensive so if you are not there for breakfast, Think Coffee across the street is very good as well. I would return for business but for personal, the prices are a bit expensive...that is the only reason I did not give this hotel 5 stars.

Clients and I loved staying at the Hyatt Union Square for a two day biz trip. It was my second stay and it continued to please. Comfortable, trendy, fresh and convenient to mtgs and restaurants.Switched gears on Friday for a friend get-away in the city and loved basing from the Hyatt. So walkable to everywhere we wanted to go and loved coming home to the Fourth, Singl and Botequim - the restaurants and bar. Great food (try the ribs and the tuna!) The front desk guys are the best, always friendly and with great recommendations. While we did not use them this time, the free bikes for rent are a nice touch. Great vibe all around! Looking forward to my next stay.

I usually stay on the upper west side, but needed a lower east side location. Lovely hotel with intimate lobby and good, friendly service. Walking distance to Wash Sq Park, the Bowery, and subways. Room very European, i.e. small, classy, and chic. Nice bathroom. No dresser and only 2 small drawers in armoire.

The hotel is clean, new and in the heart of everything. I had a small incident when checking out. Although the amount of my stay had been taken out from my credit card this did not show in the front desk accounts. My credit card was an overseas one and I had to call my bank to get the credit code and tell it to the front desk. They were very helpful at the front desk and obviously cleared it with they accounting department. I should add that the staff at the front desk is wonderful.

The room was very small so it was fine for one person but with more than one person you will find the space quite tight. Very small closet so pack light. The room had a tile floor which was clod to walk on so bring socks or slippers for comfort.

This hotel is very close to NYU campus and dorm buildings which was really handy when meeting up with our grandson. The hotel rooms are adequate but with only one chair and a bed, there wasn't much choice for sitting. The hallways are very narrow and there are no ice machines so you have to call the desk to have ice delivered. Nice lounge area by lobby. We did not eat at their restaurant, The Fourth.

I love staying at the Hyatt Union Square, it is a great and comfortable hotel, and the local area is great for eating out and shopping. The Singl bar makes incredible cocktails (a must when visiting NY)

The stay was comfortable. It is a great location. I do believe all other guest would say it is worth the money, time and effort to be there. I am glad to be a gold pass member and share my view today.

The hotel itself was beautiful with a great view. Lots of great places to eat near the hotel and easy access to transportation. The front desk people were very helpful and friendly, and made The one downside to this place is that housekeeping was very pushy, and it brought down my view of the hotel a little. Their housekeeping staff could use to be trained a little more on proper etiquette when talking to guests because I was made to feel like I had to get out of my room two hours before checkout. I felt rushed to checkout on the morning of my departure because their staff wanted to clean my room early, and argued with me that they needed to "plan" their cleaning that day. I also didn't like how they would come in a second time for turn-down in the late afternoon, often without knocking properly before entering.

Nice location in the city without the hustle and bustle of midtown.Don't pay extra for a city view room as you might need binoculars to see the streetOnly a one person show at check in or check out so be prepared to wait if you don't use on-line check in or out

We were more than pleased with the location, service and attitude, especially by receptionists George Pena and Joanna; and the young man who helped us check in Saturday and check out Monday. The only reason it gets 4 stars is the price per night; and that it has no mini refrigerator nor coffee in the lobby nor paper.

This hotel is very modern and considering it's location was very quiet. The room was modern and well designed although for our 8 night stay and being international travellers a bit small. I have found out subsequently there were larger rooms which may have suited better, The housekeeping staff were very good and any requests were handled very well. The front of house staff in the main were a little stand offish and seemed more at ease with a younger cliental. The afternoon doorman was very good and friendly but some of the others not so much. The location was perfect very close to the subway and only a few stops from most mid town activities .Breakfast options were quite plentiful as well.

Love the location as I could walk everywhere. 40 min walk to Times Square. Many restaurants and shops close by. Whole Foods around the corner. Great energy in this neighborhood adjacent to Union Square. I loved my room. It was designed well, with everything I needed at my fingertips. Very active lobby bar, unlike many hotels that seem to have an under utilized bar for for web photos only. The price point is reasonable for NYC. Hardly heard street noise on 6th floor, but I am a sound sleeper. I would definitely stay again.

We've stayed here many many times and always felt that the staff were friendly and helpful. This time we were troubled by the constant credit charges --- we'd charge $50 of drinks in the bar and Hyatt would charge my card $150! $50 for the charge and $100 as an additional "hold". We stopped buying anything at the hotel. It became that annoying (we get cc messages for each charge)

Upon check in at this trendy hotel, I think the front desk help was as excited as we were for our visit to NYU accepted student orientation! How refreshing to feel so welcomed in the big city! While our room was small, it was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was situated to provide plenty of privacy for this mother-daughter duo. I believe there are only King rooms in this hotel, so if you don't want to sleep with your roommate be sure to ask before you make your reservation! Elevators were quick and the room maintained a comfortable temperature on a very warm April weekend. We always got great advice from the front desk regarding subway, bus and other transportation arrangements as well as restaurant recommendations!

Smaller new Hyatt property, excellent location a few mins from Subway in Union Square Park can get you to all NYC easily. Quiet property for NYC location--excellent staff and service. Very good food in restaurants, decent fitness center.

Excellent service, clean rooms, great location. Staff was very friendly. I felt comfortable here. Amenities were wonderful and the hotel itself was beautiful. Wish my stay was longer so I could've enjoyed the various restaurants/bars available as well. I would definitely stay here again!!

we loved our visit as usual. The Hyatt Union Square is the hotel of choice when I visit my son. Love the location and the staff. Very couteous staff and clean hotel. It is a little pricey but we love staying there.

I am fond of Hyatt Hotels. So unless some bizarre offense should occur I have nothing negative to say. This was our first time at the Hyatt Union Square and for a NYC hotel and the guest room was larger than many, very comfortable, totally equipped electronically, and full mini bar (we did not use, EXPENSIVE). The hotel's bar off the lobby was very nice with a great selection of beverages and good friendly service.

Despite being a Hyatt, the hotel feels like a boutique and is. The restaurant, Red, is excellent. The rooms are very well organized and appointed if small. The neighborhood is great and there are a lot of restaurants, and Union Square is terrific.

Our trip seemed doomed when we left a bag in the taxi from LaGuardia airport and neglected to get the medallion number. Staff at Union Square Hyatt were most helpful and very sympathetic. When the bag was later returned by our taxi driver and brought to us, I believe the desk staff was as happy as we were. Everyone at this hotel is welcoming, kind without being intrusive. The room is thoughtfully designed with a compact but perfectly designed floorplan. Shower is amazing, all was immaculate. Not the first stay here, and we will be back.

The hotel was very nice and the staff were very attentive. However, my partner likes to take a bath before going to bed and she was bitterly disappointed that there was not one single room in the hotel with a bathtub!

This hotel was within walking distance of my office, was clean, the staff was super helpful - so high marks everywhere. The bathroom was very clean and the room as well. We have breakfast in the restaurant there and it was fantastic!

Had a great stay due to friendly and welcoming front desk staff and prompt service when called down for something. Rooms not huge, but it's NYC. They were functional, loved the robes in the room and the fact the shower head was on opposite wall than the handle!

I have usually stated in mid-town with all the other tourists.This last trip, I was delighted to find an elegant, quiet, and boutique-sized Hyatt near Union Square. It will definitely become my first choice for future visits to Manhattan. My room was contemporary, clean and well appointed, and faced an inner courtyard, so I heard NO street noise. The restaurant on the main level had delicious food.

We spent a weekend at the Hyatt Union Square. Enjoyed our entire experience. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the room was comfortable if a little cramped, the location was terrific.We were offered an upgrade but preferred to keep our original reservation on a high floor, facing the "courtyard" and far from the elevators. We knew that facing the busy streets could be noisy even with well sealed windows. We liked the fitness center. We appreciated the free wifi.This is a very conveniently located hotel near very easy subway and bus transportation as well as many good restaurants and Whole Foods and Trader Joe's.

We stayed here for two nights in April and had a great experience. The rooms were clean and very nice. The hotel is very nicely laid out, has a number of nice restaurants and excellent gym facilities. The hotel is also centrally located, right near Union Square, with lots of things to do and different transportation options if you want to go elsewhere in the city. The staff was also terrific. We had several different groups of people staying in the hotel and the staff was incredibly helpful whenever we asked them questions or needed help coordinating between rooms. There were only two, pretty minor, issues. The rooms were somewhat small, though that's to be expected in New York City and the rooms certainly had everything you needed to be comfortable. The other annoyance was that the elevators were pretty slow. In the greater scheme of things, these were both very minor, and the pros far outweigh the cons.

I've stayed here several times and always had a great experience. The service is first rate and the rooms are beautifully designed and very comfortable. It's not the biggest space, but what New York hotel is? Still, the rooms are very comfortable. Bonus points for an absolutely dreamy shower!

Hyatt has become my first go-to place because it combines luxury accommodations and treatment without the forehead-smacking prices. Its loyalty program flips the concept -- as a platinum member, I feel Hyatt's loyalty has far surpassed mine.

The location is situated in a very convenient location near Union Square, which made it easy to catch the subway to almost any part of Manhattan or Brooklyn. We had a large (by NYC standards) corner room with a sitting area. Having the separate sitting area made a huge difference in our stay here compared to other hotels in the area. The hotel staff was unfailingly polite and helpful, both in standard-course interactions and when we requested assistance (e.g., requesting a extra clothes hangers). This will be at or near the top of hotels we consider when we come back to NYC to visit our family.

Rooms were comparatively small, but one cannot complain as this is new york city. Bathrooms were nice and big. Bathroom accessories were top notch. Breakfast was awesome . The best part of this hotel is the staff. They do everything to make you feel comfortable. And did I mention the location. Its Union Square !

Very good hotel with great location and friendly staff. Overall a great experience that I highly recommend. The room was very comfortable with great amenities from Bigelow in the bathroom.My only negative comment is that the quality level of the restaurant FOURTH is not the same of the rest of the hotel. I hope to come back soon in my next trip to New York.

I stayed in this hotel over 25 nights in 2015. They have an exceptional staff who does remember you, expedient check in process, nice gym, and if your are sleep challenged asked for a courtyard room. They are super quiet to the point you would not know you are in NYC. Bathrooms great. Rooms small but functional, modern and very clean. Its NYC after all, real estate is at a premium. : )

I stayed one night on a quick NYC layover. The location is fantastic - perhaps the finest in New York if you want to be downtown, but not too far from midtown. Many great restaurant choices and activities nearby.Rooms are nice but very small. I had a room on the top floor, with floor to ceiling windows that opened. The furnishings are cool and the rooms are efficiently designed which helps to make up for the relatively minimal square footage.The lobby is also nice, with a variety of seating areas. For business travelers, note that business services are virtually nonexistent. I had breakfast in the restaurant. It was disappointing in terms of both menu options and preparation.Staff was ultra friendly and helpful, but there are some real problems with competence and responsiveness. I had a billing issue (improper backcharge to my credit card) which was never properly resolved, despite multiple follow up efforts on my part. So beware (and watch your credit card for unauthorized charges post-checkout).

Stayed here for a couple days while on a business trip. Hotel is in a great location. Multiple places to eat within walking distance. Staff was very professional and provided excellent service. Don't know when the rooms were made up but I never saw the cleaning carts in the hallways. I like that. Though my room was small it was very nice and in reality provided all the space I needed. Shower was awesome as were the blackout curtains. I would say the only downfall is that the sink in the bathroom is so large, it leaves very little counter-space for cosmetics, etc. Will definitely stay here again on my next business trip to the area.

Second stay at stay at this hotel, and I hope there is a 3rd stay in my future. The hotel is in a wonderful location, near washington square park, and the east village, which lends itself more towards a neighborhood-y vibe, rather than a touristy one. It's close to various subway stops,but also walking distance to tons of areas. I love to walk, so it's a about a 20 minute walk to the highline, 30 minute walk to Penn Station, etc...The hotel itself is great. Comfortable, clean rooms. And the staff are WONDERFUL. Everyone I have ever encountered there are nothing but the best of people. I used the fitness center 3 times, so I would recommend that as well.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

American airline unprofessional service staffs made me missed my flight on Saturday night to France, so I was stuck in JFK. After I found the Hyatt Union Square in Manhattan, I called and tried my little lucky for request a room with a decent price at the last minute on Saturday night. The staffs were really helpful and professional. I've a great experience despite of the unfortunate circumstance. I'll sure to choice to stay in this hotel again in my next NY trip.

Great location, steps to union square and subway. Staff are very friendly and gave me extended check out time till 2pm, which is very helpful. The room is very modern and lit perfectly, almost like in a actual apartment.

We had a fabulous 2-day stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The room was beautiful—sleek, modern decor. Friendly, attentive staff. Location could not have been better. Across the street from shops, coffee, and markets. Easy walk to subway.

I find this hotel one of the best in the area. Rooms are quiet and the staff is excellent. Many amenities in the area and close to transportation and business. I would highly recommend this hotel when traveling to NY.

Stayed here with the wife on a 3 day vacation using points acquired from Hyatt. Really liked the Union Square location as it was easy to get to/from wherever we were going. Hotel room was pretty small compared to other rooms I've stayed in (outside of NYC), but I think that's common in NYC. Bed was very comfortable and the shower was hot and had sufficient water pressure which were both important things after exploring the city each day. I would stay there again.Only cons was the Hyatt Passport rewards benefits don't go very far here (free wi-fi and late check-out only...not even a complimentary water which we typically get at other Hyatts). Rooms also had thin walls (could hear the people in the hallway clearly and the woman next to us coughing all night). Not enough drawer space for our things/luggage so we had to be creative as well with the tight space. Also, no view outside the window (we looked into a tiny courtyard and back of another building).

Ideal location-- all subway lines 1/2 block; drug stores; basic, trendy, and iconic restaurants easy walk; plus gun outdoor market on Saturdays at Union Square. I almost only stay at this Hyatt when in NYC.

The Hyatt Union Square hotel was very nice. The room had great views and good amenities. The location is perfect for getting around NYC. The only issue was the check-in process. They would not let my husband check-in because we don't have the same last name. I emailed them in advance to say that he would be checking in (he arrived first to NYC) and they completely missed my email and made him wait for half hour.

Cool boutique-y Hyatt property steps from Union Square. Guest room had a wooden floor, which I'm not usually a fan of in hotels (noise), but our room on the 7th floor was very quiet. Bathroom is funky, with a all-in-one shower/toilet room; open sink and vanity. If you're traveling as a couple and have privacy issues, or if one of you has to get up early but the other doesn't, this isn't a good set-up. Good property for folks traveling solo.

Very clean, love the bed,the housekeeper was awesome. We love staying here alway on the 8fl very good.l love this hotel because the people are always helpful. We will come back again. Trains,and lots of store to shop.

Nice hotel and location. Room is cozy and feels different. Though its a kind of studio room minus kitchen but still it feels good. I definitely like the bed and pillows. I generally like the front road facing room as it feels lively. Front desk is courteous and helpful.

I love staying at this Hyatt when I am visiting clients or doing business meetings on the east side of NYC. It's easy to get to, has a great vibe, and I love the C.O. Bigelow products :-) The Fourth is a spot next door that has great wine as well and also a nice, easy vibe.

Stayed a weekend with my wife and 7 year old. We had a king bed and made up the couch for our daughter to sleep on. When our daughter gets older this won't be an option but for now it was perfect. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Work out room was great as were the restaurants. The location is ideal for getting uptown and downtown but there is plenty to do in the neighborhood as well - walking distance to east village, SoHo, west village, etc.

This Hyatt location is perfect for NYC activities around Union Square or almost anywhere in the city because it's so close to the subway station. Shopping, amazing restaurants and NYC fun is all just a walk, Uber or subway ride away.The property is new so it's always nice to have clean and up to date hotel features. It's your typical NYC hotel though - smaller than normal rooms and you can hear street noise. I've stayed at the W nearby and both hotels are pretty comparable to one another. Would recommed booking whichever has the best weekend rate.Try to skip the car if you can, parking and the daily in and out rate was crazy expensive. The hotel restaurant and bar were not great althought out of convenience, I think we went daily at some point. I'd get breakfast at one of the cute coffee shops directly across the street and dine at Blue Water Grill in the square or head over to ABC Kitchen. There are too many options that are so much better than their sort of average hotel food and atmosphere.

From the second my Uber pulled up to the front door, I felt like the employees rolled out the red carpet for me. The door man was so nice and helpful the entire week of my stay and Dan, one of the front desk managers made my stay an absolute pleasure. He was extremely sweet and made some great recommendations, including where to get a great cup of coffee nearby. I ate at both The Fourth restaurant and Botequim, the Brazilian tapas restaurant and both were great! I would definitely stay here again.

From the moment I arrived, I was stunned at the level of service and professionalism here. I am a Diamond member and often stay in midtown, and all Hyatts have been very good, but this one is in a different class as it's much more of an Andaz feel, and every interaction I had was surprisingly excellent. From the maids, to the front desk, to the guys who took shoes for complimentary shines, every employee either loves working here, or they have been incredibly well trained. I upgraded to an Alcove Suite, which was a superb suite. The bed was excellent, the shower outstanding, and the layout was very cool as I had multiple street views. Great Nespresso in the room (dangerous for them as they give you small cups, so if you pick the wrong size it could overflow). Very good closet design, safe; excellent, clean work out facility, very cool lobby, even nice elevators. Staff was uniformly superb. My only complaint would be that Diamonds, who usually get free breakfasts, were given a $25 credit instead, and you know what that buys you in NYC...A fantastic hotel, located in a great area with access to subways that take you pretty much anywhere. Several great restaurants are within 5-10 minute walk, and I found more good pizza around Union Square than I ever could in midtown. Highest recommendation....

Very close to Union Square and its metro hub, this hotel is still new and rooms are surprisingly large and very well insulated against both external and internal noise, even on the third floor where we were staying. Rooms are well equipped flat screen, minibar, wine bar, umbrella,... The bed is good, king size and the bathroom is small but like in many NY hotels and with a nice shower. The only negative points are the elevator, which you wait quite a lot during rush hours and the restaurant where the menu is poor and quality of meals is average (we only had lunch there). What we ordered was either tasteless or too salty. In a nutshell, very nice hotel to stay but eat somewhere else.

Nice stay. Good restaurant with friendly staff overall. Excellent location for Mid town walk or TriBeCa shopping. Subway and Uber access close by as well as the active park scene and restaurant choices.

Lovely rooms, though small. Perfect for business travelers or couples. Nice restaurant (the Fourth) for breakfast (love the orange-infused oatmeal. The hotel staff are very attentive and welcoming. Location is close to many restaurants and shops.

Great food at the Hyatt. Great service, amazing 5 star waiters and a little gem that you don't expect to find in a Hyatt in New York City. Breakfast especially was really good, try the oatmeal and fruit.

We chose this hotel because of it's location, price and the Hyatt reputation. I've stayed at many hotels around Manhattan at this price point and beyond and our stay was as good as I've experienced anywhere. I requested a quiet room away from the elevator on a high floor and was accommodated. The room was on the small side as are many NYC hotel rooms, but it was very modern, clean and cozy. The HVAC system worked well and wasn't obtrusive. The room had a stowed coffee maker, minibar and snacks. The lighting was innovative and everything in the room worked as it should. The bathroom was small but very functional and again very contemporary. The personnel at the front desk were very friendly. The hotel is well situated so that a short walk will take you to either the east or west village, Chelsea and of course, Union Square. We couldn't have been more satisfied.

Great hotel if you are planning to visit NYC. Great location very close to the subway station. Very polite and friendly staff. Rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. We had a great experience the staff was very helpful and nice.

This hotel is in a great location, is modern but pretty and has great service. The room was small but functional, very comfortable bed and room lighting controlled by convenient little buttons. I stayed over a weekend and expected the street noise to keep me up but it was not as bad as I thought (the hotel is around the corner from Webster Hall). I dined at Fourth restaurant which was delicious but predictably pricey ($20 for a bagel & lox!).

The Hyatt at Union Square is as wonderful as you would expect from the Hyatt. The rooms were clean, the staff was wonderful, and very helpful if needed. The only thing that became bothersome was every time I used the key I had to get one remade which may have been user error on my end. The front desk staff was wonderful though meeting me on my floor for the inconvenience. The room service tenants were also wonderful and very generous. I wish I could remember her name, but I'd like to thank her for making two trips for our dinner. I'd highly recommend the Hyatt in general and had a very pleasant experience.

We generally were happy with our stay. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only drawback was that some of us could not check in until 4:00-4:30 pm because the rooms were not ready. I suppose this is a housekeeping concern.

We come here a lot...full disclosure, our granddaughter is nearby. Having said that, we choose over and over to stay here. Staff always helpful, rooms clean, showers are really good. Restaurant is good, and bar quite chic. Rooms bigger than other local hotels we've tried and not returned to. They're not on our speed dial, but almost.

I had requested a double room when I booked because I was staying with my brother. We had tickets to a concert. The request was never confirmed by the hotel and when we changed in the hotel was unable to grant my room request. The rooms weren't big enough for a pull out couch or a roll away bed. We ended up changing our plans so my brother could catch a train home.

My only reluctance in writing this review is the fear that with so many good reviews my favorite NYC hotel will be full when I try to get a room. They are across the board an excellent hotel. Great checkin/receptions staff, lovely rooms and excellent restaurant.

Showing your credit card once is not sufficient, unless you show it daily you will be locked out of your room until you go back to the desk and show it once again. This occurred three times for us within a one night stay. We were charged $1408 pending for a $369 tab, this charge lasted twenty four hours. At thirty-six hours we still have pending charges for incidentals of which we used nothing. That pending charge is $100. Does this seem like a friendly place?

Great stay here - very clean and updated rooms, staff was friendly. Loved the CO Bigelow amenities (it's the small things!) and it was a central location close to lots of restaurants. Stayed here for a business trip and would stay again.

While the service was excellent (very friendly desk staff and luggage handlers), rooms are nice considering the small size, the rooms are extremely noisy. We could hear everything in the hallway with slamming doors, and many times people talking outside our room sounded as though they were in our room, that's how noisy the rooms can be.

Rooms were small. Courtyard view was a joke especially from the 11th floor. Water pressure was very poor and the thermastat was difficult to adjust. It was a very underwhelming stay. I rather doubt i will stay there again

Room was very modern but the main are and toilet area was quite small. Huge shower, though Room was very clean . Staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was very convenient, close to Union square and shopping.

My daughter and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for 3 nights recently. The hotel was very nice, the staff members were both helpful and friendly and the location was great. I normally stay in midtown when I visit, but chose a different location and I'm so glad I did. We had a "courtyard" room which doesn't provide much of a view, but it was amazingly quiet. The room was somewhat on the small size, but the layout/space planning was great. Bathroom was very nice and the shower was excellent. The location is wonderful. Great choice of subway stations, shopping, restaurants and more. I'll definitely stay there again!

great stay atvhyatt union square snug but comfy clean rooms. however requested items for rooms on initial day of stay and didnt recieve them until calling cocierge back the following day.. other than that no complaints

Special attention was just right. Excellent service from staff! Had delfious meals each day at the 4th- wish the hotel had a swimming pool - at least a small lap pool with a separate jacuzzi - my go to hotel while staying in NYC

Very ok hotel..including service. One of the two elevators would skip floors when the buttons were lighted. Also, I requested a wake up call the day of my departure, and never received it! Luckily, I had set the alarm on my phone so I didn't miss my 8:30 am flight!

Excellent location, great hotel with convient access to union square and subway. King Room is great for couple. Staff was very helpful. Local area farm market on Friday and Saturday. Enjoyed walking the neighborhood and Strand book store

Have now stayed here twice on business. Good hotel, clean and quiet for NYC. Great shower pressure and nice CO Bigelow soaps. Hotel bar - good selection of beer and whiskey. Booked another stay in a few weeks.

Room is small with odd layout that doesn't afford much privacy when there's more than one person staying in the room, but that's not unusual for NYC. AI enjoyed my stay and felt the staff was particularly kind, friendly, and helpful.

People couldnt be nicer. Rooms were and bed was good with excellent tv service. Bathroom was good except I like a totally separate bathroom. Location great, many restaurants and shops witthin 8 minute walk. Good gym.

I've stayed here several times now. The beds are comfortable and the staff always helpful. Good breakfast either in the restaurant or room service. Great location. Great smoothies across the road from the hotel.

We booked a group, as we were holding an event in Botequim, and the hotel was a great escape after busy work days. I have rarely stayed in a hotel that was so quiet and calming! The front desk staff was super friendly and helpful. Great location with plenty of nearby restaurants, breakfast spots and public transportation. Would absolutely recommend !

Close to Union square for the subway & bus's & there is a 24 hour Walmart across the street for just about anything you may need.I had a skyview room, not much of a view of any iconic stuff but OK & high enough off the street for noise. The free WiFi was good I didn't need the paid one. Not much storage for stuff but didn't overly worry meBreakfast was just OK but I generally went elsewhere as a bit pricey as hotel breakfasts are.Liked the vibe of a smaller hotel with a bit if a retro lobby & lifts

I have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square several times, and each time I have been very pleased. I am sure that I will stay again. It is a good value for the money by NYC standards. Small but good use of space, comfortable. Like the restaurant and lounge. Great location.

With the exception of two subpar experiences with the staff, this was a great stay. The beds are very comfortable, and the room was surprisingly quiet, especially considering the busy location and proximity to the traffic. The shower is a large enclosed area with lots of attention to detail -- the large showerhead is situated on the wall (not on the ceiling thankfully) with the shower handle on the opposite side to the showerhead, so you don't get wet turning on the water (I wish more showers were setup this way). Really nicely designed room, though normal sized for NYC, which means a little smaller than average. We only ate breakfast at the restaurant, The Fourth, but it was quite good, though the espresso is better across the street at the Think Coffee. We had cocktails at both the hotel lounge, Singl (pleasant), and the restaurant bar, The Fourth (surly to indifferent - the bartender seemed to be want to be somewhere else). The lobby staff was excellent, with the exception of the doorman at departure. Despite the fact that there were ample taxis when we left, he was pushing his private car service (which was a minivan haha) for $35! When I said that I wanted a taxi, he rolled his eyes and continued to push for the private car. It felt like a typical NYC tourist shakedown. Instead, we just grabbed a taxi and saved $20.

Great location in Union Square. Rooms just large enough. Very comfortable bed, nice view.Attractive lobby, great restaurant. 1 block from the subway. Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend!

Front desk staff was warm and friendly. Rooms were clean and decor was very nice. We loved the Union Square location and had no problem getting to and from all of our destinations. Also, this hotel is one of the few we could find in the city with 2 queen beds in one room. That is a good find!

Very nice typical NY room at a reasonable price and you cannot beat the location. 2 minute walk to the subway and then an easy 10 minute ride to the theater district. Great restaurants within a short walk, but stay at the hotel for a great breakfast. If the weather permits, eating outside and people watching is fun. Always a lot to do around Union Sq. with great shopping and many weekend events there.

Beautiful hotel very clean. Room was amazing. King size bed and very comfy. Enough clean towels for days. Fully stocked mini bar with food as well. Asked for later check out no a problem very Helpful. Look forward to going back soon

Chic quarters in a perfect location for access to the East Village, Union Square, Noho and beyond. Convenient to transportation, entertainment and a range of dining options. Perfect home base for anyone wanting to spend time downtown with easy access to other areas.

Stayed at the Union Square Hyatt for 5 days in beginning of March. Hotel is in an excellent location being only about 2 blocks from Union Square. The nice thing about this hotel is that it close to everything without being too overrun. There aren't alot of touristy destinations close but you can easily walk to them or take the subway. It is a very central location.Hotel itself is very nice and seems relatively new inside, trendy style, very clean. Compact entry lobby with restaurant and bar. I didn't use them but they look nice and were fairly crowded. Room is compact but nice with desk, king bed and long entry corridor. The king room shower is a little odd as it is open to the toilet area but it works. Great waterpressure, reasonably comfortable bed, honor bar, OK view. Again very trendy with wood floors, modern sinks. nice decor. Best thing I liked was that it was very quiet. I was never woken up by trucks or service, etc.Overall very happy, good service, nice hotel, good location

The #1 thing that stuck out to me at this hotel was the staff. I only stayed one night, but during my short stay, I was delighted at how friendly and helpful all the staff were. The room was also very nice and the hotel is located in a great spot. I would pick this hotel again!

Loved this property. Small and quaint with lovely guest services personnel. The restaurant that anchors this hotel (The Fourth) is wonderful-great atmosphere and delicious food, especially the breakfast. Hotel is updated with top modern amenities and has two great bars for happy hours. Location cannot get better than this in the Village! I will definitely be back again on the multiple trips I take to NYC each year. The complimentary afternoon hot chocolate in the lobby is probably the best I have ever tasted too!

The Hyatt Union Square hotel was great, from the room, the work out facility and the staff. Everything exceeded my expectations and the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, my stay in New York was enhanced by my choice of hotel and I will stay here again during my next trip.

Its a nice trendy and modern hotel with a great bar and friendly staff. Hotel is well located, seconds from Union Square with its farmers market, and a short walk from the lovely West Village. For the money, even considering Manhattan sizes, our room was small and underwhelming. Overall, above average.

Location: Great for frequent travelers to NYC. I know other reviewers complained about the distance from this hotel to some of the major NYC sites but this is one of the reasons we liked this hotel. We don't live too far away so are frequent NYC visitors so Union Square, SoHo, Chelsea etc. tend to be the quiet locations we seek when coming into the city.Room: We reserved the smallest room (Studio). It is essentially a King-sized bed, narrow desk, small closet and not much room for much else. That said, it is clean, tastefully decorated, and the bed was standard Hyatt (although not Westin!) comfortable. For the price, I wouldn't expect more.Food: We actually drank at the bar and ate at the restaurant within the hotel. Bartenders were nice and drinks were well-made. Food as well. All at the hotel premium (though probably not unexpected).Staff: The staff was friendly and helpful from start to finish. The front desk was especially friendly!

From the doorman to the receptionist to the bartender to the breakfast wait person all are the best!I love Singl bar, the neighborhood and my daughter goes to the New School which is convenient. I love the beds, the courtyard rooms and the cool snacks.

Booked two rooms and only one was ready at check-in time. We had to wait an hour before our room was available. The front desk did not offer an apology. Rooms were clean, modern, and somewhat small. We probably won't stay at this hotel again.

Quite Overpriced - few amenities. Room is quite small.The location is off the beaten track. Better to stay uptown. Although, near the subway lines.The room is well furnished but quite tight for two people. The only amenity is a small gym. The staff is friendly. No concierge provided.

Hospitality is like incredible,I will make a return visit to this hotel just because! Walked in and right away I was greeted with the most warming welcome there is! Love the British accent from one of the receptionist, mangement and room service.. Let's put it this way in all my traveling history I have never had the experience like I did in the Hyatt.

Very well appointed room. Small, but had everything you needed. Comfortable bed and pillows. Great bar and good restaurant. Very affordable for New York. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

We had great service and enjoyed the comfort of this hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived, including the gentleman who helped us with our bags, our check in person and even the bar tender at the scotch bar. We will stay there again!

I'm a little biased to the location but since our son lives one block away this was the perfect place to try. The room I booked was a corner loft, room 411, and it was spacious enough for a weekend's worth of clothes and had big windows and great views. I liked that the room had a Nespresso machine--I like my first cup of coffee to be the minute I wake up and the second cup was a cappuccino downstairs. it was yummy. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't speak to that but it was a lively place day and night. The good thing was that even though the lobby and restaurant were noisy, we did not hear a peep from our room. We would definitely stay here again.

I am never disappointed with the Hyatt Union Square. The service/staff are amazing as well as the location. The rooms are small but very efficient. Nice bathrooms. Usually our go to hotel ...when in NYC.

Being a part of Hyatt group, this would be inbetween traditional hyatt and Andaz hotels.Located at the junction of 4th Avenue and 13 St, it was within walking distance to Union Square and nearest subway station as well as different supermarkets and convenience stores/pharmacies.Reception desk was similar to Andaz.Lobby design was interesting especially The Fourth restaurant.Room was relatively small compared with the previous hotels we stayed before, yet good enough for its price.The main issue was the design of the shower control. There was simply no sign for hot or cold water nor "power". It took a while to have hot water which eventually became too hot.It was not easy to explain but those who used before would understand the frustration.Staff was not consistent, while one was very friendly but not the rest.Luggage was not sent to room after waiting for 10 hours. And no assistance was offered upon return.Understand the staff tried his effort to upsell hotel limo, and he somehow exaggerated the taxi fare and journey time. He claimed it took more than an hour or even longer from hotel to Newark airport which we eventually arrived within 30 min.Feedback was shared with the staff but was treated as their lesson to learn but no follow up was taken sadly.

The location is great, right at the heart of Union Sq with subways lines steps away. The staff is really great at this hotel, everyone was sooo nice and super helpful. The beds are super comfy, amenities in the room are awesome, it pretty much has everything you would need/want in a hotel. I think my only issue was the size of the room, i booked an Urbane Studio and it was smaller than i thought it would be then again this is NYC, so maybe i shouldnt have expected much in regards to the size of the room. Another point was that there was no breakfast buffet, just ala carte, and the prices were on the higher side. Again, i used to live in NYC, so i know that this is an expensive city, but it would have been nice to have a buffet instead of paying 18 bucks for eggs. BUT the service was IMPECCABLE. So i highly recommend this hotel.

Great location with a boutique hotel feel, modern style, helpful, attentive staff. Only problem is that one of the elevators was out of service briefly. Would definitely recommend (already have) and will return. Thank you.

Recently stayed here. 3 of us in a double room. We never had enough towels, toiletries or coffee. Had to call housekeeping many times during our stay. Upon check-out I was charged twice. Would think twice about staying here again.

Clean and comfortable. This newer hotel provided a clean and comfortable room. A little small but done very well. Great eating spot and separate bar area and very well outfitted fitness center. Great location near Union Square and SOHO so if that's where you want to be ( we did), definitely one to consider. Great level of service.

The staff at the hotel are nice and helpful. The rooms are very small and would be a pain if you had more than one person using the room in my view. I had a large suitcase and the only place in the room I could open it was right by the bed. I tried to go to the restaurant in the middle of the afternoon on Sunday to have a cup of tea and work at one of the tables. The bartender was friendly and served me the tea, but I was not allowed to stay in the restaurant to drink it, even though it was more than 50% empty. I had to take it to the lounge. This was a pain because I had wanted to work on my computer. I ended up taking the tea to my room.

This mini-Hyatt is true find in Manhattan. The rooms are modern, clean, and designed well-for one person. This is a hotel for the business traveler. More than one person and it's very tight. But I would still stay here as I did with my wife, for the location, and great customer service. The staff were friendly, helpful, and trained in hospitality.

I have now stayed at this hotel twice and it was excellent both times. In January I stayed in a King room while traveling on business and the bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. I just returned with my 17 year old daughter who is looking at colleges and we had the double room with two queens. Beds are amazing and the room was verty quiet. They stock the room with CO Bigelow products which are lovely and each room has robes and slippers. Overall, this hotel is just very, very comfortable.There is a nice bar called Singl as well as a great restaurant for breakfast with super friendly staff and great food. I am a Platinum HPG member so I am always happy with the way I am greeted, but on this last visit, the hotel greeted my daughter and I with superb hospitality, allowed us early check in and late check out and they were just overall exceptional. And the location is amazing in Greenwich village/Union Square. Great restaurants and everything is walking distance. I will definitely make this my NYC hotel of choice moving forward.

Great food great service clean room everything was spectacular and I will stay there more in the future. Perfect view and great food all around near by the bathrooms and showers and brand new and comforting

This hotel is located in the Union Square area of Manhattan which makes it the perfect location to see everything. The hotel itself was immaculate and the staff so friendly and helpful. This was our best weekend in New York so far!

We stayed at Hyatt Union Square while visiting our daughter at NYU. The hotel is very nice and the staff was friendly and attentive. We were, however, somewhat disappointed with our Courtyard Studio room. In particular, the "open concept" bathroom just doesn't work for us--I generally get up earlier than my wife and it was impossible for me to do anything in the bathroom without waking her. The extreme lack of storage space was also problematic--no place to hang a coat or unpack a suitcase. Although the room was small (as is to be expected in NYC), it seemed that there was plenty of space for a larger wardrobe and a dresser and perhaps some coat hooks. The room was also rather dark and the placement of mirrors relative to light fixtures and electrical outlets was poorly thought out.Our breakfast in The Fourth restaurant was quite good.We might consider staying here again if my wife or I travel alone to visit our daughter--otherwise, we're likely to look elsewhere when in New York.

the hotel has a great location just off union square. It was a very nice hotel and offered very good value for money.The view from the room was of an internal yard even though it was supposed to be e city view.the staff was friendly and accomodating.The elevators were slow though.

- lack of executive lounge- breakfast starts to late- gym is basic and without daylight- slow elevator, quite frequent only 1 out of 2 was working+ clean new rooms+ attractive design+ Location+ connection to public transport

The Hyatt Union Square is centrally located with great access to the subway (4, 5, 6, Q, N, R, L). The rooms are small and the elevators are old, but the service was great and the hotel bar is awesome. The hotel is also nearby Ippudo which is the most famous Ramen spot in NYC.

This was our second stay at the Hyatt Union Square, and once again we were very happy with our choice. We requested a "quiet" room and it was exactly that! Nice room darkening drapes also added to the excellent night's sleep. The room was very clean, though not huge, was fine for our needs. Great location near Union Square and many restaurants and activities. We will be back!

The stay is good, but I checked in online before getting there. I saw no benefit at all except for you. I thought I was suppose to get a free water, but I drank the wrong one. (that created an issue at checkout). The staff are very nice, always helpful, so no complaints on that side. Am I suppose to get a newspaper in the morning at my door, I thought that was part of it. You have Preferred member check in, but not always followed. A non Platinum member got the penthouse, but it was never offered to me. Also aren't I suppose to be on the highest floors, yet, I never get above 7. Basically its a bunch of little stuff, that makes me want to change companies. Its consistently, inconsistent. Basically its a bunch of little stuff adding up to this potential decision. By the way this is my first review of any type like this.

The hotel is intimate which I live in a big city. Everyone knew me and said hello every time I walked in it out of the building and always asked if I needed anything. It doesn't sound like much but after staying in various 5 star hotels around Manhattan over the last 10 years where staff barely acknowledge you it was so nice. I'll be back here again and again!

This is the 2nd time that we've stayed at the Hyatt Union Square New York. The staff remembered us and welcomed us back. Excellent service; Inviting hotel with Clean rooms and a comfortable bed. Wonderful location... especially if you are visiting NYU. Great restaurants nearby... we will definitely stay at Hyatt Union Square again.

The Hyatt Union Square in New York City has a great location with a very caring and accommodating staff. The AAA diamond rating is well deserved. We booked an Alcove Loft Suite and had a great time. The hotel is near the Strand Bookstore and lots of great restaurants.

My wife and I really enjoyed our stay, and breakfast at the restaurant next to the Hyatt was excellent. Service at the hotel was very good, and staff was very pleasant despite the incredible cold weather!

Hyatt maintains great quality and value and the Union Square location is no exception. Rooms are clean and while compact are efficiently arranged to give you separation of sleeping, working and bath space. Beds were very comfortable. A major plus is the proximity to the restaurant downstairs, The Fourth which offers reasonably priced meals (NYC pricing). You're two km from the West Side Drive for runners and window shopping in Union Square can occupy spare time. Our only recommendation to management would be the value of a table for room service set up as the desk space is sparse and otherwise you're obliged to use the bed.

This hotel was fantastic. Very clean & updated look. Perfect location with SO many restaurants and stores near by! "The Fourth" restaurant inside of the hotel itself had such a delicious brunch!! We will definitely be going back to this spot!
