If you are planning a visit to NY and want a great place to stay the Hyatt Union Square is the place. My wife and I spent the weekend for Valentines Day and it was amazing. The staff was top notch and bent over backwards to make sure our stay was memorable . Rooms are beautiful and they even had my favorite candies from my childhood ( Mary Janes and Charleston Chews) on the counter. I would recommend this place to all my friends.Ed CKings Park, NY

Had a great time with the wife. The hotel was in excellent condition and the staff was very friendly. Perfect location, near several subway stations and great shopping. Close to very good restaurants. Showed up early and staff made sure to put a rush on my room and was able to get me in within 15 minutes of arriving. Also allowed for a late check out to accommodate some morning shopping.

My husband and I spent an extended weekend in NYC. We are native New Yorkers now living on Long Island but love the diversity that the city has to offer. And, in our opinion, there is no better place to stay than the Hyatt Union Square. The location is just perfect. The warmth and friendliness of the staff made this a home away from home. They were very courteous and attentive to our needs. The bed was super comfortable and the rooms were extremely clean, bright and cheery. If you are into working out, they have a great fitness center, as well. We had several meals and drinks at the bar and restaurants inside the Hyatt and again the staff was wonderful and the food delicious. We have had the opportunity to stay in many hotels in NYC but this is by far our favorite!!

Usually stay closer to Times Square but friends in NY assured me Union Square is where New Yorkers go, and recommended the Hyatt.Location is great, plenty of shopping restaurants - near the Village and Grammercy Park - busy but less touristy. added bonus of cinemas right next door.Hotel recently refurbished, well appointed rooms, on the small side and maybe short on storage but very comfortable - staying at the rear has benefits with very little noise and the blackout curtains are killer!Some rooms have Nespresso machines others the US style coffee machine.Gym is good and well fitted out.Hotel has two excellent restaurants, a Brazilian in basement and The Fourth an American brasserie at street level both worthy of a visit.Service is very good, friendly and attentive.Think this just became my new home base in NY!

Great rate & excellent service! Near Barnes & Noble, Subway station, NYU , movie theater, nice restaurants New facilities, fast access, secure and quiet roomsI've stayed several times during last 2 years

There was one morning I asked for a service and it took the hotel close to 1 hr for them to get to my room. And despite telling them there is a faulty power socket, the complaint went unheard throughout my stay.

Staff was courteous, effetiant and professional . Room was well organized and clean. Housekeeping did a great job. Front desk was most helpful in restaurant recommendations and obtaining cab service. Hotel is in a wonderful location.

I often visit NYC, specifically the NYU area this being my first stay at the Hyatt Unions Square. A major blizzard covered the area that weekend requiring changing of reservations several times. The hotel could not have bee more accommodating. Our ultimate stay allowed the staff to demonstrate their hospitality skills starting at the front door; amazing customer service. I have already booked my stay there for net month. The only reason for the 4 stars rather than 5, is that our room was a bit noisy. The front desk was apologetic and noted that for my next stay.

The best thing is the location but the hotel itself is a smallish boutique hotel under the auspice of an excellent chain. Nice staff. We were only there one night but all was as hoped for. The bed was comfortable. Union Square is a block away.

Love this location and chose this as our hotel of choice when visiting our daughter. Only reason I rated a 4 was because housekeeping in this stay was not up to the past experience. Staff was very accommodating when brought to their attention. We will be returning soon!

No complaints. Room was clean and tidy. Staff was friendly and attentive. I would stay here again. No problems. Easy to catch a cab too. Good restaurant as well and a good bar too. Close to Union Square and plenty of restaurants.

Great location but mostly very small rooms. Their suites (except for two specialty ones) are not really suites but simply slightly larger corner rooms that they call Alcove Lofts. So perhaps disappointing if you are planning on using suite upgrades. Nice staff though.

The Hyatt Union Square never disappoints! Staff is exceptional and the accommodations superb. Both restaurants that are adjacent to the property are delicious. I highly recommend this place--love it! Brunch on Sunday am is top notch.

We love this hotel! The staff was always friendly and helpful.The room was beautiful, clean and has a terrific view of Manhattan. The beds were comfy and the location was great for walking to Tribecca, High Line, Meat Packing district, The Village.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Union Square New York. The decoration of the entire hotel is great, and the room furnishings are perfect considering that standard rooms/studios in non-luxury properties in NY need to be smallish for obvious reasons. The bed was very comfortable too. The food offering at the Fourth restaurant was very good and quite sophisticated. I wish I had had time to try the other bars and restaurants. Big kudos to the staff. Everyone was very helpful and friendly at all times. Since I had to tend to some business in the Greenwich Village, the location was formidable. I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel next time.

Professional and friendly customer service. All needs were met quickly. I will definitely be back again and I recommend it. It was just what my BF and I needed to have a mini vacation away from home!!

Had a great one night stay. Stayed in a suite which was perfect. 10th floor lovely view. Front desk staff terrific especially Dan who was extremely helpful and energetic. Very close to Union Square and multiple subway lines.

The hotel is in an amazing location - right at Union Square. Things are a bit crunched inside, but as far as hotels in Manhattan go it was pretty good. Hotel is decorated really nicely, with the room feeling really urban and chic. The mini bar was fully stocked. It had a really nice walk in shower. The staff was a bit snarky about my booking - we were looking to change rooms and they made it a big deal.

This place is quickly becoming my goto Hyatt for business travel in NYC. Nice rooms - had a corner room on this last stay with a little extra space, well appointed. Very quiet - did NOT hear another guest. Great service - every member of the staff worked hard to make sure I had a good stay, and there was great recognition of my status with special touches. Great food - The Fourth restaurant on premise nailed breakfasts and a dinner. Cool bar - right around from reception, for a nightcap. Nice workout area - spacious, and a choice of machines. Great location - drug store across the street to grab essentials, shopping close to get other items I forgot to pack and of course central to tons of things to do. I will be back!

Great location near Union Square means a quick trip to Soho, the West Village or Midtown. Friendly caring staff makes you feel at home Alcove Loft (spacious corner room) is finished beautifully with hardwood floors, Italian cabinetry and a small but lovely bathroom with wonderful shower. Nice breakfast in the Fourth cafe and a lively bar make for a nice energy day or night. Well equipped gym is also a plus. Reasonably priced for NYC too. A great choice if you want to be close to the action but enjoy a small, peaceful retreat to return to at the end of the day.

Great location!! Near my NYU student and there is SOOOO much to do in the area. So many fun restaurants and shops. Could explore the East Village streets for days and days. The Hotel is excellent in every way with helpful, informed staff to help guild your adventures.

My daughter and I were due to arrive on the Saturday of the recent blizzard that blanketed NYC, I called the hotel and asked if they had availability for Friday so we could arrive earlier than expected so that we could avoid driving in the blizzard. The staff was so accommodating and friendly. The staff at The Fourth was just as friendly. Would definitely stay at this hotel in the future.

We so enjoyed our trip to NYC for snowpocalypse 2016, The hotel was beautiful, and the staff rolled with the epic snowstorm with grace, They also rolled with our epic celebration at SingL, which we all appreciated. Thanks, folks. The Hogans

Needed a hotel with a central location and Hyatt Union Square was the perfect spot. It was reasonably priced, clean, very comfortable and provided all the necessary amenities. The hotel brasserie was a great place for afternoon tea and a light snack. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. We would definitely stay again.

All of the staff were extremely nice and helpful; extremely attentive desk help and doormen; room wasn't huge but was hip and clean; fantastic location near shopping, food, subway; nice options for cocktails/drinks at the restaurant inside; rooftop is not yet open, but should be a really nice addition when it's ready; will look at this Hotel first when returning to NYC.

Room clean, sufficient space, excellent connections for internet and electricity, bathroom and toilets clean and easy to use. Personnel helpful and nice people.The large room downstairs too cold during the dayBreakfast good and easy with good service.

Clean, great location, courteous & professional service, we ❤️ NYHyatt Union Sq is a gem. I'd recommend to any traveler. Room is modern, but small. Our Urbane room was on 10th floor. Very quiet with nice view of city

The hotel was very cool and modern looking in the lobby and the bar was a beautiful space to have drinks and relax in. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful.The room was on the small side and I would not want to have an extended stay in that space, but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean and nicely furnished. I would definitely stay there again. Great location near Union Sq proper and convenient to subways and restaurants.

Greeted at door. Arrived to a well organized and responsive team. Requested item was sent to our room immediately. Smart room design with pleasant view from inter side area with rock garden and green trim. Nice quiet room on the inside area of the building.

We liked the hotel, restaurant and location. The room was clean with contemporary design which was cool. We had breakfast at 4th and it was delicious. The staff was very polite and accommodating! We would recommend

everyone was wonderful and so nice, from the door man to the front desk. wonderful little boutique hotel that I would highly recommend. the room was a nice sized, especially by NY standards, and the bathroom was nicely thought out, with a separate area for the toilet.

This jotel is topnotch, not only because of its superb location but also because of its unique support. Wanns feel like in heaven? Try the magic suite. The gym and restaurant on the ground floor are also noteworthy!

We've stayed in 4 different locations in New York, and this was by far the best of the bunch. Previous trips included stays at a hotel on the Upper East Side, a private apartment on the Upper East Side, Grand Central, and now at the Hyatt Union Square. The other locations were good, but for those who have visited New York before this location is terrific, the room was very nice. Good shopping and dining close by and the subway was very convenient. They even secured ticket for Hamilton for us.

This property is located in the heart of Union Square, so was pleasantly surprised with the Euro-boutique feel of this Hyatt. Hannah greeted me with warm professionalism and made the special effort to ensure my room was feather-free allergen-free room as I requested. She asked me t wait in the lovely lounge area and came to me with my room key when she confirmed my room status. Her colleague recommended an excellent restaurant a few blocks away that was perfect for our needs. While I was waiting for the refill of homemade hot chocolate in the lobby, with real melted chocolate the old fashioned way, Chris S acknowledged me again and said he would bring a cup of hot chocolate to my room. While I said I could come back, he politely knocked on my door a while later with a hot cup of chocolate drink, finishing with "if you need anything, please feel free to call me and my name is Chris."The checkout was efficient and friendly, with the receipt emailed to me promptly. I would certainly enjoy my next visit to NYC by staying at this specific Hyatt. Well done in service and room cleanliness.

By far the greatest staff! So friendly and accommodating . The room was pretty good. The bed wasn't the most comfortable and the floors were wood and I just couldn't quite get used to it lol. But would certainly stay again and recommend!
Overall I really enjoy my stay at the Hyatt Union every time I am in NYC.Heading back again tomorrow!Perfect location, rooms are great, dining is amazing, staff rocks..Highly recommend staying there.

A Hyatt you say? Yep, this a not a huge hotel like the name suggests. Eleven floors of rooms – two elevators, so not too many rooms on each floor. While the second floor rooms have balconies, they face Fourth Avenue so the sounds of the city and a nearby fire house are evident. Our room was an upper floor ‘courtyard’ one, small but well appointed with clean lines and a nice modern feel. Bathrooms and beds are the key to a good hotel room and our were very good.What makes this property truly outstanding is the staff and excellent restaurants and bars. And the location is convenient even if you do have meetings way downtown or midtown. Remember this is a relatively small boutique-like hotel but the two bars and three restaurants are truly outstanding and memorable. One important thing to know if you are planning a theater night, getting there couldn’t be easier. Walk one block to the 14th Street-Union Square subway entrance and take the Q train to Times Square-42nd Street. It’s a direct no-stop service, same is true after the show – no in between stops – express service.

Love this hotel! Stayed here for work. Very reasonably priced for a weekday. Its design is very modern, looks brand new. Its beyond clean, I didn't see any mold, missing caulk, scratches, anything. Rooms are spacious and functional. Hardwood floors, tons of plugs and usb outlets, water closet bathroom, and energy efficient light controls in rooms. I was so impressed with this hotel all around. Wifi was fast and reliable.

Just stayed here for five days. Wow, a really nice place to stay in the heart of the city. Very beautiful hotel all around. From the lobby to the rooms, they've put some effort into making the place look nice and not just some boring hotel. You can't beat the location- great access to trains, restaurants, everything NYC has to offer is right there. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. Even the stuff in the mini-bar wasn't overpriced. Room was actually spacious, I got one with a sitting area. I'd be very curious to try the ones with outdoor space when the weather is nicer.

Great service, cleanliness, and luxury quality with a good gym. Fantastic hotel, I stay here regularly.Rooms have high quality furnishings, the Brazilian restaurant is underrated, the cocktails in Singl could use some improvement.

Modern, nice room, and surprisingly large for NYC. Staff was friendly and while I was in meetings 90% of my time in NYC this trip and just crashed here, it was very comfortable and pleasant stay. They even helped me snag a cab in the snowy streets to get back to airport, which is no easy feat.Didn't get to check out the attached restaurant but it looked lively. I noted the room service was way too overpriced ($18 for a yogurt plus delivery fees) so I avoided having breakfast delivered and just opted to eat at airport the morning I left. Overall would stay here again.

A great hotel! My room was quiet, clean, and comfortably modern. The hotel feels like a boutique hotel even though it's a Hyatt. Shower, bathroom in general was spacious and lovely. Location is primo for NYU, Greenwich Village, getting a subway, etc. Had 2 nights with my son and 2 solo -- we received a complimentary upgrade to a double queen. Brightness, ambience, and staff in cafe were all excellent too.

Our room was not ready when we arrives @ 2pm. so we had a lite lunch in the adjoining rest. Then our room had a maitenance issue. I had asked for a corner loft..so were offered other rooms..At least I got to see most all the room types, because that is what makes the hotel interesting is that they have different types of rooms. Ended up with a terrace room. It was wonderful and had a great engagement party for our son in the bar downstairs SINGL. The staff was wonderful and thoughtful.

Great staff helpful, decently clean and the service is great. Great location, close to subway and downtown. Rooms are very comfortable, breakfast without many options but tastes great. Recommended for any visitor for a short stay in NYC.

The hotelWas in a great location. I Stayed with a group of girls. We all agreed that this was definitely one of the nicest hotels we had ever been in. Beautifully decorated and kept. Staff was amazing, friendly and hospitable.

Thank you for your generous upgrade to the supreme corner loft like apartment, and for your personal and thoughtful care for our most recent visit with our father. The helpful assistance of desk attendants Victor and Victor was invaluable! We appreciated your thoughtful kindest in helping us provide a great hotel experience for him during what was most certainly one of the nicest visits of his life. This hotel is magnificent!

All the advantages of a large hotel chain, but with more personalized boutique-style approach to guest services. Easy access to Eastside, Westside and crosstown subway lines in Union Square makes this an ideal location for business and tourism alike. I love this hotel and it is my second home, when I am not at home in LA, CA.

I wish I could give this a 3.5 but rounding down as there really are so many good places to stay in NYC.I picked this hotel for it's location. Right in the heart of Union Square with great bars and restaurants a short walk to the subway. The hotel lobby and rooms are modern and sleek and I love the bar/restaurant area. However, I stayed for a good amount of time - 5 nights - and noticed a number of seemingly trivial things start to add up.The PROS:- Modern vibe- Great shower- Room service was prompt and accommodating- Front desk staff were all pleasant- Fitness center - LOCATIONThe CONS:- In-room coffee never refilled- Lobby coffee was continually empty - Toiletries were missed when we checked in (later added)- Toilet broke and then re-broke- Key cards randomly de-activated in the middle of our stay- Continuous noise (possibly the subway? Possibly the roll doors in other rooms?) made it hard to fall asleep- Small blue lights shine from each of the light switches (3 on each side of the bed) which kept us awake until we found a way to cover them

Hotel is conveniently located for both uptown and downtown attractions. Union square is a good connection point for the subway.The hotel is clean and warm and adequate. Restaurant and bar are expensive

I booked a "studio" room. It was larger than I expected. The design of the rooms is impressive. Everything is there, refrigerator, closet etc, but cleverly built so you don't even notice at first. My two favorite design features were: control panel for all of the lights at the bedside, plus a night light option for the bathroom. And ladies - they have a little foot shelf in the shower for shaving! The staff were all pleasant and helpful.

I loved it. The Fourth which is the restaurant in the hotel was awesome. Best spaghetti I have had. Home made spaghetti and the sauce with cherry tomatoes are unbelievable. I had a coworker with me who feels the same about the hotel

This location turned out to be extremely convenient for me. However, unless you have a particular reason to be in this area it's not an area a tourist would be drawn to. One good thing about it is that it's not very hard to find parking on the street if you go a few blocks east, at least on the weekend. The hotel is very nice like most Hyatts. The room was large enough but the closet space was inadequate even for a one-night stay. In the middle of the night I woke with a severe sneezing fit. I don't know what it was, there must be something in the air because the room was clean and did not seem dusty.

This is a nice, modern, centrally located hotel. It had the feel of a boutique hotel. I had an urban studio room which gave me a view of the city but I didn't notice any traffic noise. I would stay here again

The staff at the front desk was friendly and efficient (they even let me check in early)! Room was clean, modern, and well apportioned. Excellent breakfast fare at the restaurant downstairs. What a delight!

Good location & great breakfast at the Forth Restaurant. Room 903 given is the worst type. Smaller & the door facing the other room & a big noise like my own door when the other shut the door. Sink design is Too shadow & too close to the faucet. Concierge didnt notify me the arrival of my mail order, & one was returned because they cannot find my name. Wrote to the Director of Room & no reply till now, almost a week. The service staff are friendly but the operation system & mamagement seemed not function & care about guests.

I travel a lot for work. I try to stay here whenever you can, but honestly the price limit. However when it meets at lemon I book it every time. I'm in the city about 25 times a year. This is by far my preferred hotel.It's amazing how quiet it is the only steps away from the hustle and bustle of union square

This hotel is in a great location near union square / east village. So if you want a hotel where you can literally walk to anything, this is it.I've stayed here a few times and each time the staff is only okay. I actually was stuck in the elevator for almost 10 minutes on my last stay and luckily I was able to text my friend to get her to ask someone for help. Eventually they helped, but when I reemerged from the lower level no one really seemed too concerned. I will note, the servers that work at Botequim downstairs showed a ton of concern and gave me a glass of wine which I thought was very accommodating and nice. The people at the front desk just kind of looked at me and smiled. I have been contacted since and the manager gave me some Hyatt points for my trouble so that was great of her to do.The guest rooms are somewhat small, but the layout is nice and the design is very contemporary so it's easy to get over. The beds are very comfortable and I like their bath products. There is a bit of noise from the road, but I get used to that.The gym is great. I love the cold towels and water. It's nice and spacious, even though its in the lower level it doesn't feel cramped. They do a good job keeping it cool.The restaurants are great as well.I may be back if I'm in East Village or Union Square again. Hopefully the elevator is fixed!

Overall, the hotel is situated in a great location. Close to metro stops and nearby area is lively and lots of restaurants and coffee shops within walking distance. The room was clean and the hotel had a really nice bar area as well. All hotel employees were very nice as well, especially the front desk staff.

I stayed at the Union Square Hyatt in early January. The location can't be beat, with access to anything and and everything one could wish for with stunning views of the Empire State Building and great design with chic and luxurious furnishings. However, what really impressed me was the level of service, the attitude of the staff and the seamless attention to detail. With a new trendy hotel opening every 5 minutes there are many options for travelers yet from my experience the boutique hotel never delivers the way Hyatt does. Luckily there is a Hyatt in virtually all the top global travel destinations (have personally stayed in the Park Hyatt Buenos Aires and at the Park Hyatt Paris as well, I can happily report that superior service is the norm) there's no reason to stay anywhere else!

Great service from the moment my wife and I arrived, when we drove up to the hotel and the doorman asked how long we'd be staying. We told him just overnight, so he moved his car at the curb to allow us to park in his spot thus saving us $65! Never had that happen before...especially in NYC. Arrived at 11am and received early check in. The staff was super friendly. Really nice room accommodations. Excellent breakfast in The Fourth. A very pleasant stay all around. Will definitely return to this property again!

The staff at Hyatt Union Square was very nice. Room are kept well and comfortable. The bathroom we had was small but well equipped. I would stay at this hotel again. There is an excellent restaurant downstairs. We enjoyed our meal. The only down side was the heavy scent from candles in the lounge. I couldn't go into the lounge because of the scent.

Wife and I stayed here when running the NYC marathon and found the location served us well. The rooms were spacious and clean. We stayed near the hallway's end and thus, it was quiet. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

This is a lovely property. It is modern and clean. The problem is with the elevators. I have now stayed there three times in inside courtyard and outside facing rooms. I hear the elevators all night long. They are noisy and the rooms have no sound protection. The staff is very friendly and housekeeping is great.

I have stayed at this property before and this time came with my two children 10 and 15, and so needed a room with two beds. It was NYC so of course it was small for my purposes. No ice bucket provided and I did not want to call room service for ice. Unnecessary tip would have resulted.In addition, the phone in the room did not work, so when I did call room service and ordered three orders of ice cream (60 dollars with a tip) I had to call using my cell phone. The phone was out for two days.Then when checking out, my 10 yr old needed to use the bathroom, locking the door. He could not unlock as it was broken. After trying myself for 10 minutes I called and asked for an engineer. He could not get my child out, so a second engineer showed up and finally unlocked the door. I asked for some compensation for the problem and got 5000 extra Hyatt points which was ridiculous, but had no time to argue as my relaxing afternoon became rushed to get to LaGuardia to get out of town. I guess these things happen, but more responsibility needed to be taken. The hotel is a nice one and LOVE the location, but there are other choices in the area. Price was also reasonable for NYC.

Travelled for Birthday treat as my wife and I are both 50 within a few weeks and our daughters 21 and 18 so seemed like a plan for a family long haul bash. Hotel well situated with very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms not huge but modern clean and we were allocated adjoining rooms by the front desk staff which was useful . Slight issue with the bill at the end but superbly handled by Jennifer. Would definitely recommend.

Got to stay here while visiting a friend & I must say the rooms where well updated & clean which is always a plus. Love the decor in the property, it's always something I look at when staying at a hotel. The staff was helpful on getting my darn boarding pass printed.

I'm staying at this hotel for a second time. My first trip was amazing which is why I cam back. However, this time the room they have me in (814) is so incredibly noisy that it's impossible to sleep. It seems to abut both the elevator and the house keeping facilities room, so there is a constant sound of elevator mechanics, doors opening for house keeping to get items, etc. It's infuriating. Last night was a sleepless one and I'm expecting the next two nights to be too. Not what one expects for this price.

So this is not necessarily for a stay, but rather the experience of booking a room.It was Christmas Eve and our flight was cancelled. We need a room for the next two night in NY. So we looked up what Hyatts had a room with two beds. Union Square Hyatt showed availability. I even called the Passport 800 number and they also confirmed this. One room left. I then called the Union Square front desk and they confirmed this and said come on down and we will book you in it. Terrific.So we take a cab to the hotel and when we get there I start the booking process with the desk. For some reason they said there was a problem and then the front desk rep had to go to the back and bring his manager which took about 10 minutes. The manager says he has to call Passport and General and takes another 10 minutes only to come out to us and say that sorry that was an error we have no rooms with two beds. Good luck.Ok great. Christmas Eve. They tricked us. That wasn't funny. It would have been one thing to say that sure we don't have any rooms BUT let me try to accommodate you at another property. But nope all they said was that was an error and we can't do anything more for you. To be honest as loyal Hyatt customer I expected better. So for the next two hours we were on the couch by the lobby looking for another hotel to get us in on the holiday weekend. Not once did the manager or the rep come to ask us if everything was OK. Not great customer service or hospitality for the matter.

I checked in early and waited 1hr and abit to get a room.staff was friendly and helpful and close to what I needed to shop (Mac,Sephora,forever 21 and etc) good customer services the time I was there. And whatever I needed, they were quick and helpful.

My stay at Union square was everything I hoped for and then some. The staff to the room set up was excellent. They set the bar high for the competition. The location of hotel makes traveling to any where in the city very easy. Union square itself is the best attraction one can visit.

Staff is excellent! From the front desk, to the bell hop to the restaurant staff, everyone was very attentive and pleasant. Room we stayed in which was room 418 had a musty smell every time you first walk in the room.

Great location. Room was clean and updated. Good price and staff was friendly. Got an early check-in, so that helped! Close to subway and cabs parked outside. Shopping close by, quiet room and very comfortable bed!

I was very happy with my stay. The room decor blew my expectations and the staff was very friendly. I couldn't complain about anything. Very relaxing hotel and perfect for business. I'll be back again.

The hotel is in a great location, very clean and staffed with a Team very eager to help in any way they can. We didn't try the bar, but the on-site restaurant has an excellent breakfast with a variety of choices and some great pastries.

From Dan at the front desk to the waitstaff at Fourth the terrific restaurant, this hotel is terrific. Minimalist and on the small side, but appropriately New York, I would recommend Hyatt Union Square to anyone.

From the first moment walking in the door to the last minute picking up my bags on way to the airport I met the most amazing staff on the planet. Hannah is unbelievable and I would like to marry her. Victor was great as well as Caroline, Dan, and others I don't remember. I felt safe, secure and any problems were expertly and quickly resolved. I can't say enough how well I was treated. I will be back very soon

Stayed at this property for one night for business. The hotel offers everything you need. The rooms are a good size and the bathroom area is arranged very nicely. The bar in the hotel is a little pricey if you want a drink. I would recommend walking a couple blocks to a local spot. The hotel staff are very professional and accommodating.

I have lived in the city area for about 5 years now and now I am in Long Island. I planned to spend 31st night in the city with my family. To me, the hotel is ideally situated. All the great live music places and great restaurants on both the East and West villages are at a walking distance. The hotel is neat, very functional, the rooms are comfortable and have updated decor. The staff are very helpful, as they are in most Hyatt hotels and the breakfast at the Fourth can be delicious. If plan to return to the city for a vacation and pick a Hyatt hotel for a stay, I'll pick this one in a heartbeat.

great location , nice room and great staff helped make the hotel very enjoyable for the evening. The rooms are a little small but its normal for Manhattan. Easy street parking in the area. There are great restaurants and shopping walking distance from the hotel. The restaurant served a great breakfast as well

I would recommend you drop everything and get the next available room. You will be greeted and taken care of by amazing people such as Caroline, Victor, Dan, Hannah, and others. I felt safe and secure. They absolutely went the extra mile taking care of me and my friends. It was a trip that legends are made from

When checking in for an over night stay, we called the desk and asked to change rooms because it smelled as if someone had spilled perfume in the room. The front desk responded that a spray is used by the cleaners on every room. We opened the window ( a lucky break in a NYC hotel) and went out for the evening. All products contain lavender, soaps etc.The facility was well appointed but the housekeeping aWas careless. Ask for additional pillow and brought without pillowcase. Item left by prior occupants scattered in drawers.Achooo!

I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square last weekend for the second time. This is a great hotel. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Check in was very smooth and I was able to get into my room early even though it was New Years Day. Location is great. This is the first hotel I check for availability when I travel to NYC. I have family that live nearby that I visit so I will be returning.

The Hyatt Union Square provide a comfortable stay close to some of the more interesting places in Manhattan. The rooms are quite comfortable, if a bit small (typical of many NYC hotels), and service was great. There is a well equipped fitness center as well. My only small grip is that the only bright lighting in the bathroom is an overhead spotlight. While it dramatically lights the sink, it does nothing to help you see you face in the mirror to shave, etc.

We stayed here over Xmas / New Year . We couldn't fault the hotel in any way , the staff were great really helpful and friendly . The room was lovely really clean , large comfy bed and fab shower. The location was perfect we got a cab from the airport and apart from that walked everywhere covering quite a distance , we only took one subway journey and that was back from Brooklyn . We are not sure that we would go back to New York but if we do we would stay here again . Thank you Hyatt Union xx

Very nice hotel. Reasonably priced for New York City and for its location.Very nicely updated rooms and although they are small the space is well utilized.The staff were very helpful and friendly and the bar downstairs is a nice place to meets with friends and family.We really enjoyed it and will stay there again soon.

Union Square destination over the holidays was enhanced by our stay at the Hystt. Lovely smaller hotel with inviting lobby, most accommodating staff, nice sized rooms, upscale linens and , did I mention, hot chocolate for our pleasure. Look forward to returning.

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was greeted each time I entered the lobby and upon checking in was given an overview of the amenities available to us. I would definitely recommend anyone traveling to NYC stay at this hotel.

the Hyatt union square was fantastic..room was very nice, hardwood floors and a nice bathroom all the employees were great...great location close to a lot of night life and restaurants as well as the parkwould definitely stay here again

Everything you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. Great staff, free rental of travel adapters & allsorts with the option to buy any of the bits you need.Tea & coffee facilities left a bit to be desired (we're British!), but there's a mini mart across the road where you can get everything cheap (including alcohol). 2 minute walk to the nearest subway (14th st/5th ave) and many attractions walkable distance. Room service was great, tasty food & quickly delivered.Remember to add your tip (15-20%) on the bill before you sign- a requirement we struggled to get used to, but very much a requirement in the US!

Hotel is in a great location if you want to explore the excellent restaurant scene near Union Square. Walking distance to Gramercy Tavern, Union Square Café, Il Mulino and many other great places. Easy subway access. Also walking distance to NYU.

I was just in NYC on 12/19 and stayed at the Hyatt Union Square - room was perfect. Street view, really quite. (2 blocks from my daughter's NYU Dorm) I definitely recommend to other NYU parents, proximity, amenities all worth it. My only negative - I thought parking was a bit exorbitant, even for NYC standards.

Front desk staff very charming and helpful. Room the largest I have ever had in NYC. Every possibly amenity. Shockingly spacious and well equipped gym. The Fourth restaurant was the perfect brunch spot - very chic.

Great service, friendly, not overwhelming and we were allowed to check in early and to check out late as Hyatt rewards customers. 1/2 block to subway very convenient for all of our New York City needs

Staff were attentive and professional, room was nice and clean. Was amazed and thrilled to have a balcony to sit outside and enjoy the warm December air. I got a very good rate through work, so perhaps it was the price to value ratio that was so great. Breakfast was terrific - I've never raved about yogurt and fruit before, but it was superb (but quite expensive).

My wife and I recently stayed at the hotel on New Year's Eve. The service was friendly and prompt. Rooms were clean and modern with a number of ammenities, Overall, we had a nice time and would certainly return to this property in the future,

We stay at this Hyatt because of its location, but we would go out of our way to choose it even if it was not near our destination. The front desk staff is amazing, the rooms are clean and quiet, and the rates are very competitive. One of the best properties we have stayed at, and we've stayed at hundreds.

I have been staying at this hotel on and off for last two years. I like the room, bar, food etc. But one item I am not happy about is that right at noon the day of the check out the key stops working. It was our wedding anniversary and we came back from lunch at 1215 and we could not get in. We had to go back to the counter to get a new key. All hotels have a grace period on the day of the check out. Shutting key access felt cheap.

Clean, stylisch and Large room with Nice views, very friendly and helpfull staff, good quality bath amenities, Perfect Location for Manhatten Sightseeing, many Cafés and Restaurants in the neighbourhood

My daughter and I stayed here after Christmas for 4 nights to celebrate her 21st birthday. The staff were so welcoming and friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel itself turned out to be in a fabulous location situated just behind union square so it was quiet but you could just walk round the corner and be in the square with shops, restaurants, cinema all on your door step. It is also a 10 minute walk from all the big shops on Broadway which were busy but nowhere near the crowds that we found closer to the central park area. I didn't use the gym but my daughter did and she loved it, our room was really nice and was cleaned and tidied twice a day. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Firstly I'm not a fan of the mass globalised chain style hotels trying to be high end and luxurious, smaller privately owned hotels can be just as good or better. The Hyatt had to do, given we needed to be in the location of Union Square, and the times we travelled being between xmas and nye. The hotel put us in the wrong room the first night, they actually downgraded us, we bought this to their attention 3 times before being moved and weren't offered a refund, instead told breakfast would be complimentary at the restaurant attached to the lobby, we also had included in our booking free breakfast for 1 person, on checkout there was no record of the complimentary breakfast and they tried to charge the full amount for 2 breakfasts each morning, highly annoying. On a positive not, the rooms were clean & decent size for NYC standards, the staff were all friendly given the confusion previously mentioned. The stay did nothing to make me want to book into another larger same as always large hotel chain..... Go the smaller independent hotels and b&b's, put food on the tables of those people running a small business...don't line the pockets of those that already have way too much.

Room was fantastic, staff were equally as good! Brilliant location, subway was not even 100 metres away ! Shops close by! Everything within a stones through !!Unbelievable experience!Hopefully we will be back sooner rather than later!

We booked a room for new years day (NOT new years eve) with a 5am departure for the airport. The guests one room over were quite loud, yelling and slamming doors. By 11 security knocked on their door to ask them to be quiet. The quests were even louder saying they would "settle down". They did not but fortunately left 5 minutes later. They were clearly "jolly drunks" at this point. At 2:45 am they arrived en masse (how many people do they allow in one room?!) They must have passed the front desk yelling and fighting and arrived on our floor screaming, crying and swearing at each other. They were now "angry drunks". We waited for them to pass out but they just kept fighting and crying. There were at least a half dozen of them. We called security and they were asked to quiet down. They did not. Ten minutes later, we called again. We were told security would give their "last warning" and would be told the police were next. Last warning after a night of shenanigans? How about monitoring the situation? and at 3am the first warning should have been the ONLY warning!!! Not wanting to deal with the police (we would never get any sleep then!) we listened to them wind down for another 10 minutes But by then it was too late to go back to sleep. This is supposed to be a nice hotel. Thanks for the 3hours of sleep for which I paid $200. What the heck?

A great location and perfect. The hotel is located right beside union sq. accommodation was very good, and there was a nice restaurant and bar. We used behind reception for a business meeting at one of the large tables. The staff very pleasant. A great spot for trips to Manhattan. I certainly stay here again.

I tend to like Hyatt properties because of the overall consistency and quality -- but this is a relatively small property, so you never know if you'll get the features of the well-managed chain or something else.... This one did not disappoint. The staff was universally friendly and and overall helpful. There was a bit of a 'failure to communicate' between the management and some of the staff a couple of times (for example, bringing me an electric kettle that had a foreign plug? why would they even have that? I just wanted to make hot water, and i hadn't yet discovered the actual coffee maker hidden in the furniture), but it was all worked out and absolutely no 'attitude'--- other than a good one. The rooms appear to have been redone recently---clean, modern, and I love the Euro-trend to wood floors (as opposed to grungy carpet). Someone thought about what one needs to do in a hotel room--eg, where/how you need to control the lights. Not so sure about the trend to having a bathroom sort of in the middle of the room as opposed to a room itself, but the shower made up for everything. i don't usually get excited about hotel showers but i LOVED this one. Big, with great tile (just pleasant to be in). Well-placed shower head, with just the right flow and pressure. And a little foot shelf! I didn't want to get out. A great bed. Windows that open --- my favorite for controlling the climate, which is never well done by a hotel thermostat. The construction was sustainable and eco-friendly (a bonus when you can find it). Walls were a tad thin but in all there were no noise issues where we were. Perfect location. I've been in lots of NY hotels-- most of which i wouldn't go back to, but i'd stay here again in a second.

Stayed here on business for three days. The location made it easy to get to meetings in both midtown and downtown, plus it's near lots of good restaurants which makes for an easy meal at the end of the day. The rooms were small but well appointed and quiet, especially by NYC standards. I lived in NYC for years so am not a tourist or foreign business traveler so I know the city better than many and definitely think this location is perfect for any visitor. I can't comment on whether the staff is helpful when it comes to giving directions or making reservations as I didn't utilize that service.

The Hyatt Union Square is in an ideal location for someone looking to explore Manhattan. It's right around the corner from the Union Square subway station -- making it easy to go to any part of the city. It's also close to SoHo, St. Mark's Square, and the village as well. You don't have to go far to immerse yourself in a true NY environment. The service is reliable and friendly. Rooms are comfortable and clean with great amenities. It was less of a big corporate hotel feel and more on the boutique hotel side. I enjoyed the two meals I had there -- breakfast and happy hour. Happy hour is pretty well priced for a hotel in NY.

Negative reviews are actually harder to write; especially when one discovers to his surprise that comments about an establishment are quite positive and that you are going to be an exception. You definitely don't want to sound unreasonable or idiotic...With that said, here are the problems I had with this hotel1) The Noise. I had what was described as a "quiet" room on the reservation slip. However, it was anything but. Where your mileage may vary is the appreciation of the AC/Heater blower which I found incredibly noisy so turned it off. Once you turn that off you realize that it covered the noise of the pipes, I woke up to the sound of people taking a shower, flushing etc. I am happy to accept that maybe I am too noise sensitive on that point.Where it's not really up to debate is the paper thin walls and the severe lack of luck we had with our neighbors. Day 1: Teenagers on the phone and laughing all the time. Day #2 party people coming home yelling in the corridor at 330am and then 530m. Day #3: a dog yapping...So yes, not "quiet" by any stretch of the imagination. Had to go buy earplugs.2) Service is not great. Reactions ranged to the very nice "we never had any complaints" to the better yet equally uneffective "even if i could switch you to another room it would be street view and even noisier". In addition -I guess it's the New York style- but, while you walk in front (like less than one meter) from the desk every time you go in and out the hotel, you don't get a hello 50% of the time... (I thought us Parisians were supposed to be bad...)3) The corridors don't get vaccuumed, at least for the 5 days we were there. This piece of plastic in front of my room greeted us day 1 and stayed until the end. Also, Room cleaning was just skipped one day and when we asked around 4pm to do it, it was done very poorly.What is good about this hotel is location: Union Square is a great place to use a base for NYC. Also, the rooms is quite nice, the internet works well, the bed comfortable and the amenities Hyatt level. But, as you can see from the above, there is no way I can recommend this property and there is no way I will go back. PS: I am Hyatt Platinum member and that didn't change a thing, nor did they seem to care.

I don't know the rate we were paying because it was part of a 4 day package with BA to visit our daughter in NYC over the Christmas holiday. Overall the experience was good compared with stays in other parts of Manhattan. It is a virtually new Hotel in a pleasant and relatively quiet part of town; off the tourist trail and nicer to stroll around than Mid-town but with the trendy Union Square round the corner and excellent transport connections for all parts of the City.Positives were:-As a new hotel, nearly everything was fresh, clean and working (apart from the sink drain!)The staff are unusually friendly, welcoming and with more time for you than anywhere I have experienced in New York before.The design is interesting and innovative to maximise the spacious feel of a quite small building with quite small rooms.For a "boutique" hotel, the range of food and drink outlets is excellent with three bars and two restaurants each with a contrasting vibe. Something for everyone there. The negatives: The small rooms were given a more spacious feel by the clever expedient of removing the walls of the bathroom so that is was an integral part of the room. Clever design but not to our taste. Although there was room for an easy chair or two, the only piece of furniture apart from the (very comfortable) bed were a fitted work desk and a desk chair. Fine for a business person stopping overnight but not for leisure visitors staying a number of days.The food and drink prices were so high that we felt compelled to look for cheaper options elsewhere, which we don't usually do. But I guess this is more a reflection of New York and the $/£ exchange rate.So, on balance, pleased with our choice but more a young business person's hotel.

No fridge in room. Every day had to call down for coffee, for the coffee maker. Had to ask for more tissues. Did not clean our room floor,every day . We usually stay in less pricey hotels,with better service. Wen they finally brought up the requested items,you were expected to tip. For a room amenity. Good location. Pretty. Loud.

Great hotel for a great price. Our room was small, but comfortable. Super-modern and chic. Hardwood floors feel cleaner to me than carpets. Nice amenities offered en suite and upon request. The bed was very comfortable, the shower reminded me of a spa, the lighting system was very cool -- modern and user-friendly. We stayed on a high floor on the "Courtyard" side so it was very quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I loved this hotel. At first, we thought that it was going to feel like one more big chain (Hyatt) hotel but it actually feels like a boutique hotel. We staying in the 4th floor facing the street. The room was recently remodeled, contemporary, and quiet. Location is perfect. You are going to be in the middle of all NYC attractions with access to the subway within a block. This is a small hotel so amenities are limited but better than expected (wifi, gym, lounge, restaurant, etc). And the service is exceptional. All people in the front desk were really friendly and helpful. Bottom line, totally recommended.

Everyone who works at this hotel goes out of their way to help. A special shout out to Dinelle. The rooms themselves are clean, well designed and functional. They are small, which I suppose it standard in Manhattan. I stayed in the Courtyard facing room as I wanted no street noise and I got none. It was very peaceful

Great boutique hotel located in an excellent location downtown that is walkable to many areas. The staff provides excellent service. The Fourth Restaurant has great breakfast selections. We will definitely return again.

Eventhough the room is not big but the room is clean. The location is good and the staffs are friendly. The surrounding area outside the hotel sometimes a bit noisy, can hear frm the room. Some standard amenities are not provided. You have to ask.

A very comfortable and easy place to stay in the east village. Close to union square and the subway and good coffee over the road at Think. Great staff and I loved the black curtains - no issues with jet lag

The bad: I was already somewhat miffed at the Hyatt Union Square when I arrived. I had booked three nights at a reasonable (for New York) rate but there had been an illness in the family and I had to cancel one of the nights. What did they do – priced the two remaining nights based on the current rate, nearly 50% higher! I felt disrespected, wanted to bail out, go somewhere else; however, since the business meetings were already scheduled, I stayed but wasn’t a happy guest. I would disagree with the hotel’s claim of being a “Modern Luxury Hotel.” Modern it is, luxury it is not (although it does sport THE best blackout drapes ever!). Leaving the elevator on your room floor you encounter a decidedly narrow institutional hallway. Where’s the luxury? The walls are thin – all night long I heard doors opening and closing. Oh, yes, and by the way, I got stuck in the elevator between floors. Not a single button could make the thing go. Talk about scary. I finally pushed the “help” button and a distant voice asked me what the problem was; in what seemed like ages (could have been minutes given my state of mind), the car was moving again. After talking to the manager, I received a meaningful accommodation for which I am appreciative. The shower was great but the shower stall was not well ventilated so even new it has started to smell moldy. The room is “overdesigned hip” and seems to be furnished from Ikea. C’mon, at these prices... OK, the good: great location, lots of small eateries in the neighborhood, Union Square a block away, the Strand bookstore around the corner. It was cold out and I was there on business so I didn’t do much wandering. The absolute best part of the hotel was the front desk staff – they were really pleasant, really accommodating, all really, really delightful and well-trained young people. Would I return to the Hyatt on Union Square? Probably not...

This was my first time staying at the Hyatt Union Square, and I absolutely loved it. Perfect location, very posh and functional rooms, and a fitness center that has everything I need for my morning workout. Just starting a new job where I travel to NYC often, and I will stay here every time. Highly recommend it.

Would love a magnifying mirror in the bathroom, other than that, loved my room! Very well appointed and designed to maximize every inch of space, well done!!!Great place to get to many areas of interest; also, loved the restaurant in the lobby. Great breakfast!

Nice location, NYU right nearby. Hotel staff courteous and friendly at every level. Housekeeping could have been a bit better, they left some towels in the shower, empty pizza box left behind, etc., but not a big deal. Overall very pleasant stay.

The GOOD: very very friendly and helpful staff, always with a smile, great location, also just north of Soho, lots of shops and many inexpensive healthy eating options around. There are two on site restaurants, and snacks are also served in bar area. Food is OK to good, but very expensive ( easily $200 for two with minimal drinks). The bar and the basement tapas restaurant are not open on week end nights. Main restaurant on first floor serves very good breakfast, cappuccinos and coffee. The rooms are not too small for New York City. Breakfast is "very" nice; croissants are like in Paris, the real thing. Valet parking is available ( at $65/ day). Good WiFi in the rooms (free for platinum members). Nice selection of newspapers.The BAD parts were not really a surprise as most of it had been extensively described in prior reviews ( very poor design of the shower and bathroom, very " hard" feeling mattresses, complicated light switches, no mini fridge, dark elevators, ..). The strange thing here is: the mattress looks expensive, has a nice soft pad on top of it, and nevertheless...feels (sometimes) horrible to sleep on, although I was told that other customers feel it is too soft, or just right.Overall: a great hotel, just be careful how you sleep (protect your back), be careful when you shower ( or water will spill all over), and become really proficient at handling the tricky light switches ( unless you want to wake up your partner in the middle of the night if you have to get up). Luckily none of these might be that big a deal for most people.I still would recommend a stay in this hotel. Do not miss their cappuccino and croissants in the morning.

Stayed here recently for one night. Great location right off of trains that go directly to Grand Central Station and Penn Station. If you are staying here for a few days there is Whole Foods, Traders Joes within a 3 minute walk,wine store across the street, and a Walgreen also directly across the street, The room itself was quite small especially considering that their is no separate bathroom. The sink and shower are right smack in the room and their is a pocket door which separates the toilet. I don't mind this at all but some might. Great black out curtains. Staff was friendly,professional. Our room and common areas where clean. My one complaint: if you're going to have heavy large glass front doors, always staff a door man or keep them open!

Have used this hotel in several occasions for business trips. Staff are all very friendly and efficient but not at all fussy. Rooms are small (to be expected in New York) but smart, modern and clean. Room service good quality. Good location for getting around Manhattan.

I have stayed in Hyatt Union Square many times multiple nights in a row., last checkout being yesterday after 4 nights.I love how nicely it is decorated. Due to my business I started to visit it very often as my choice of a hotel to stay in NYC now. All the employees I have encountered with so far are very cordial and accommodating. The only minuses I have for this hotel, are ; not having the Nepresso machine Park Hyatt has, or any coffee machines, super slow elevators, and annoying sound of the heater if you bring it above 72F. Needless to say, I love this hotel and it's location, despite a few negative issues, I will continue staying there. I am a Hyatt fan now and look at my choices for Hyatt anywhere I go. Andaz in Wall Street also is very nice but don't like the area as much. Park Hyatt is very nice but honestly, I prefer Union sq better. I love the fact that they lock the doors although there is someone at the desk 24hours after midnight.

The original room we reserved wasn't what we've expected at all. So we had to pay extra 200 dollors for upgrading the room. Rather take other hotel. Very different from other Hyatts we've stayed in other cities. Bit disappointed.

We were looking for a nice place to spend the night in Union Square. The Hyatt fit the bill perfectly with a great location and cozy place to rest our heads (and tired feet). The hotel is pricey but it comes with an amazingly friendly staff who go out of their way to please. The rooms are clean and well kept and the hotel has every ammenity you could need (dining, bars, a gym, etc). We had one hiccup during our stay and management quickly made it up to us. We will definitely be back next time we are in Union Square!

Clean, sleek room. Very quiet. Close to my daughter's apartment so we'll be coming back. Friendly greeting at the front door. Easy check-in/out. Comfortable. I recommend this hotel. There is coffee in the lobby during the week (also can make it in the room).

One of the better Hyatt staff I have interacted with! Very friendly and efficient check-in, nice rooms, good location, a little noisy but bearable, great breakfast at The Four. Good location with nearby restaurants. A little pricier property than others in Manhattan, but worth it!

The Union Square location was right in the center of Manhattan which was perfect for exploring all parts of the island. The rooms appeared to have been recently renovated with modern features and stylish finish levels. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. In addition to having close proximity to a variety of bars/restaurants, the hotel itself features dining/drink options on the first floor. Would highly recommend the Hyatt Union Square and we would definitely stay here again during our next visit.

From the time we checked in to the very end everything was pleasant and welcoming. The hole staff was helpful friendly and professional. The Location was outstanding and most convenient, 2 mins from the train station, however if you like to walk everything is accessible on foot. The union square park right across was romantic for me and my wife. We bought art, food, unique gifts ext... The Restaurants and bars in the hotel we're Deco and fancy but reasonable in price. The front desk and door men staff were very helpful plus always attentive, ready to open the door every time we came in or arrived with a welcoming smile. Coddles to Housekeeping for there impeccable service. The management kept following up with us at all times making sure we we're comfortable and happy. All in all I have to say 5 star hotel and we would definitely highly recommend and stay again.

. Hotel has small resturant and a Tapas place. Also has a singles bar. Nice gym open 24 hours. Staff was very helpful. Hotel is new. Rooms are nice although a little small. Plan to return. Great location for shopping and resturants. Easy acess to cabs, buses or subways.

I stayed here four separate times between May and Nov of this year. All excellent stays. Modern rooms with nice interiors. Small hotel so not super crowded. The staff is excellent. Very friendly and always eager to help. The restaurant attached is very good too, which makes it convenient when on business and in a rush. Would not hesitate to stay here.

Of course you would only stay here if Union Square or downtown is the center of your activities. The hotel is relatively new, clean and staff is nice. The rooms are tight. Had a series of nitpicking issues that were responded to fast but annoying- the toilet did not work well,. Have you ever had a sink overflow-amazingly I did. The drain was so slow that before I knew it water was everywhere.

Each detail of my stay at the Hyatt Union Square has hugely exceeded my expectations. Every single member of staff I encountered was unfailingly kind, helpful and really made an effort to accommodate me and make me feel welcome and comfortable. The room was extremely clean and all fixtures and fittings in perfect condition. The services are fantastic - from the vintage candy in the rooms to the extensive list of complimentary toiletries available on demand. The location is extremely convenient and nearby greenwich village is a fantastic neighborhood for shopping and eating. If I could make any small suggestion to make this fantastic hotel even better than it already is, i could only suggest that they add some more vegetarian options to the room service menu, but that's it. And its worth saying that the (limited) vegetarian options they do have on their room service menu are delicious!

This hotel is very trendy, and feels much more like a boutique hotel, then a Hyatt. It's very modern, and still totally comfortable. The rooms are very nice, as are the bathrooms. We got a room with a terrace, and it had a spacious seating area with planters. Very nice!The bed was very comfortable, and this is very important to me. The service was excellent! From check in to check out. Excellent house keeping too!If I had one bit of advice, I'd avoid the rooms by the elevator. As we were able to clearly heard peoples conversations outside our door. Otherwise, this hotel impressed me from start to finish.

The hotel is centrally located in a great neighborhood, plenty fo things to do while not working.the front desk staff were very helpful and when asked questions they were always willing to help out as much as possible.

Pleasant staff and great atmosphere! Can't wait to go back! Did not have the opportunity to eat in the hotel restaurant, but it looked fabulous. This hotel is located near a park. Good to walk through.

Stayed here for a night...leisure. Really liked the hotel. Very much a boutique feel and certainly trendy. Lots of attractive people walking in and out!Rooms are definitely on the small side, but we had a king room with a nice comfortable bed and a great view...could see the Empire State building.Shower area was tight, especially if one person is getting ready at sink and somebody is showering. Shower is very nice, nice bathroom amenities, but we found it actually hard to get the temp right. Toilet was in it's own little water closet room so that is always nice.Decent little hotel bar on site, the restaurant looked great but we didn't eat there.Location is right by Union Park and an easy walk through NYU, to West Village, or to Greenwich Village.

We wanted to have a fun night wandering the holiday booths at Union Square, and the Hyatt's location was ideal. It is right in between Union Square and the East Village, and our room was on a high floor and had a great city view out of huge, clear windows. All we really needed was a king-sized bed and a quiet room, which can be a tall order in a place as loud and space-constrained as NYC, but we got both. We didn't order anything but coffee, but the breakfast menu was varied and appealing. Would definitely patronize this hotel again.

Hyatt is a top quality hotel and it's location in Union Square is ideally located for using NYC transportation to go uptown, walk downtown and go crosstown. The reception was fast, very professional, knowledgeable of "how to" get around, on entering the hotel the doorman not the best. The online checkout is perfect. The concierge for leaving luggage very quick. Room very comfortable and very clean , for a weekend stay very quiet at night, and finally we would stay there again

I was disappointed with the service and have no plans on staying there again. I emailed the manager and heard nothing back. Customer service is/was very poor. I like Hyatts but will need to find another hotel when staying in Union Square.

Being in the center of Union Square always makes for fun. Always a lot to do, especially when the markets are set up for the holiday. It was particularly good this year, thanks in part to the helpful and courteous manner in the way Danelle greeted me at check-in.

Nice room, pricey breakfast, two muffins and tea for two, twenty plus bucks. Good location, about thirty minutes to LGA. Great restaurants around the hotel with a large variety of foods. All in all I would stay there again.

Perfectly located, staff is super helpful, bar was very comfortable and had great drinks. There were two private events in the bar during my three night stay, so I wish I could have spent more time there. The only constructive criticism I could have is that room service came around a bit too often. I slept in until 10am one morning and room service had come by 3 times knocking on the door. I realize I should have put the do not disturb sign out, but it just became a bit annoying getting woken up multiple times in a morning.

My stay with the hotel has been wonderful! The staff was probably the friendliest I've seen in a very long time (and trust me, I travel a lot for work). I like how fast things were sent to my room when I requested it. The front desk and doormen were so pleasant when greeting me whenever I walked in or out of the hotel. The hotel is very clean too. I didn't have time to check out the bar, but it seemed pretty popular. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city. It is right around the corner from Union Square and other stores to go shopping. Places to eat are nearby as well.

Great location and tidy room however overall facility is tiny as well as the size of the room. Over priced but it is in Manhattan what can you say. I will try other hotel around next time when I visit NYU.

I have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square several times now and it has never disappointed. The location by Union Square is convenient to the subway and an untold number of restaurants. The rooms aren't large but they are very comfortable--during my most recent stay I was right by the elevator and still the room was quiet. The little coffee shop/restaurant is more than adequate, and the staff has been exceptionally accommodating every time I have stayed there.

My wife, son and I spent a lovely night at the Hyatt Union Square over the Thanksgiving weekend. We usually stay closer to Times Sq but decided this time to try a different location. The locale was great. Much quieter than bustling 42nd street. A lovely place to walk around enjoying Washington Square and the open air holiday market at Union Square. The hotel has a small footprint compared to most Hyatts and the rooms are somewhat small. But the modern layout of the rooms and the clever built-ins make up for this. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our only negative concerned the restaurant, the Forth, which just did not appeal to us.

Definitely not a hotel for family. One businessman/woman would do fine here if only for sleeping. Room is quite small, lighting is poor, no closet space and certainly not a very practical bathroom sink.

The room was nice but we continually had issues with the toilet. It had to be snaked and dealt with three times during our stay. Also, when we asked for extra pillows they brought us one! Other than that the room is clean and comfortable and the staff was nice.

excellent accomodation and courteous staff members. Danielle was again excellent and she recognized me and my wife as soon as we entered the lobby.. The men who opened the door for the guests were true gentlemenDanielle is gregarious and courteous and she clearly deserves a pay raise. She made our visit to NYC very satisfying, pleasant and enjoyable.

Overall a very nice boutique hotel. Most staff friendly and helpful. We chose this hotel to stay away from the touristy areas, and to be located in an area that provided a nice assortment of neighborhood pubs and restaurants. Down side, the rooms are quite small.

Very nice double room with good space, very compfy bed, nice lightning. Well equipped bathroom with separate restroom and shower. I really love the space dedicated to the gym center open 24/7 with appples, fresh water always available

Just checked out after a 3 night visit for Thanksgiving week and could not be happier with my hotel choice. Originally, I had reservations at the W but changed my plans when I learned there was a Hyatt in the area as I am a Platinum member in their Hyatt Passport program.Hotel is modern (only 2 years old) with nice wooden floors and an updated bathroom with rain shower. Sure, the rooms are on the small side but this is NYC ladies and gentlemen and the layout was more than ample and roomy enough for my needs. The concept at this hotel is very similar to the Hyatt Centric brand--clean and contemporary.The staff was young and vibrant and catered to all my needs. Location wise, this place is tough to beat. Close to the subway at Union Square Park and walking distance to The Village, SoHo, NoLita, Flatiron, Little Italy and Chinatown...I even walked to the Brooklyn Bridge and Freedom Tower....I had an issue with a noisy guest in the room across from me on the first night but the front desk addressed the matter promptly by moving me to a corner, Urbane Studio the following morning.The gym at the hotel was better than many others I have stayed at. Some great restaurants, coffee shops, etc within 2 minutes - 15 minutes. Good sports bar across the street. Nice little touches here such as chocolate squares at bed turndown and free apple cider (winter).Will go out of my way to stay here again!!

Good quality accommodation in a great location. Staff are very friendly and attentive. the bar on the corner of the property needs something - has no sense of welcome or warmth and no real presence. Other bar where Breakfast is served in the mornings is pretty good - bar staff very good and bar menu not bad. The Speck and Cheese biscuit on the breakfast menu is pathetic, first one turned up with no speck and four cut down slices of packet cheese and that was it. Apart from that have used the hotel prior and will do so again.

My husband and I stayed here this past week for three days. It is definitely a chic boutique hotel in the middle of Union Square. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly by the staff and given an early check in. Although the rooms are small, they are very functional, exceptionally appointed and immaculate!The beds are so comfortable. We had room service for breakfast and throughly enjoyed it! We would definitely come back and stay here again!

I am always on the hunt for new places to stay in NYC. I was pleasantly surprised by this property, which I understand from a friend is new. The room, while small (this is NYC after all) were clean, well-appointed, and comfortable. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The Union Square location is perfect if you would like to be down in the East Village/Nolita. To provide some context, I usually stay at the Standard East Village when I'm in the city. That being said, I would definitely come back to this Hyatt assuming the price was more or less the same (on this trip, this ended up being slightly less expensive than the Standard). But in terms of quality this hotel and the Standard are comparable.

Friendly staff and nice hotel with various places to eat and socialise. Would like to see a bit more variety and healthy options on dinner and breakfast menus. Rooms are a little small and flooring rather basic.

Every time I go to NYC I will stay at Hyatt Union Square. Very good location and easy to find restaurants. They will try to let me check in earlier if you arrive earlier. Rooms are small but what you can expect in NYC.

Hotel pumps perfume into their air system. Very concentrated and hotel was unresponsive in correcting the problem. Will not return unless and until this situation is corrected. We had stayed at this hotel a number of times previously and never encountered this problem before.

I stayed last week at the Hyatt Union Square for the first time. I stay at Hyatts frequently, and generally have good experiences. To me, this Hyatt is a work in progress. I was attracted by the location, which gave me a chance to see more of Manhattan, outside of Midtown and Times Square. The neighborhood amenities and transportation access are great. The hotel is thoughtfully decorated and has that boutique vibe they are going for. The problem is in the service which reminded me of indifferent staff at some boutique hotels. Everything was just a bit off from the front desk to room service to housecleaning. They need to up their game. I will give the hotel another chance in the future.

Customer service at the Hyatt Union Square is exceptional. Everyone was so friendly and accomodating. Will definitely be back again. Highly recommend the property. Great value and location, central to everything!

Although the rooms are pretty small and the prices are high, it's my second time at this hotel. I like this neighbourhood, close to Soho beautiful streets full of nice stores and restaurants. Easy tovreach all the city by subway. And the staff is really amazing.

Room was large for New York standards. Hotel has daily promotion where they pick guests at random to receive a comped breakfast. We won and the breakfast and service were outstanding. We were also upgraded to a room with a private terrace. Very cool!

Second time staying here. Great location. Fantastic shower pressure. Efficient room layout. Staff is very accommodating and friendly. My only suggestion is to get some decent lighting in the rooms. Impossible to put on makeup in either the bathroom or room because of insufficient lighting. An easy fix would be to put makeup mirrors that have lights that come off the bathroom wall over the sink. Or install better overhead lighting in bathroom. Very frustrating. Plus room has a lot of dark spots. Such a shame because so many other plusses including great full length mirror (if only I could see myself in it).

Hyatt typically delivers an expected product for business travelers in the U.S. It's usually reliably good, but rarely special or unusual. I found the Hyatt Union Square to be a pleasant surprise -- an older building 1 block from Union Square (North of the Village) that had undergone a modern and inviting makeover by interior designer Paul Vega. The rooms are small but very functional and nicely put together. The public spaces are also spare, but the restaurant and bar must be inviting to a younger crowd, as they were crowded both nights I stayed there. Another guest and I were well treated well at The Fourth, the brasserie-style main restaurant there, when we went in for coffee. There's also a Brazilian steakhouse on the floor below,, but I didn't sample it.

We visited the hotel just before Thanksgiving and found the place fantastic. The hotel itself was very attractive and easy to find. The only down side was that it was a 1 hour cab ride from JFK. However, once we arrived, the staff was very nice, helpful and professional. We had called ahead to inform them of changes in our flight and they allowed us to check in early. The bar and restaurant were outstanding. Our bartender made some of the best mojitos. We had a little sticker shock at the prices at first, but in reality the prices were comparable to other places we visited in New York. The only hiccup that keeps me from calling this hotel perfect is that our breakfasts left a little to be desired. The staff and facility are excellent and I would recommend the Hyatt to anyone that is looking for a relaxing few days in New York City.

I have stayed at this property several times and all the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are always very clean and well appointed. A great place to stay when in NYC. If you have a child going to NYU like I do this is close to the school (short walk) and close to dorms. You can't go wrong at the Hyatt Union Square.

The rooms were newly renovated with high end fixtures. They were perfectly decorated. They made great use of a relatively small space. The staff is very friendly. Cool bar and nice restaurant. I will stay there again!

The rooms are average size for NY (not large) but the room was well arranged and appointed. I really liked the hard wood floors with area rugs -- it made it feel more like home and most importantly it is better than the questionable cleanliness of most hotel carpets. The floors were clean and the overall room and bath were very clean. The shower was large. In terms of food, I was not impressed with the ground floor restaurant - not very interesting menu, average food quality and pushy service.
