The singl bar was good - small but friendly and interesting. The hotel staff (front desk and business center area) were helpful and friendly. I am not a fan of the area but needed to be nearby for a meeting. If you need to be in the area it's a great choice.

The room should have been ready by 3:00. We arrived at 4:30 and it was not. All the receptionist offered was "you can leave your bags here and come back." Room felt cramped. Bathroom door wouldn't stay closed. Bathroom lacked enough hooks or bars to hang things. Shower was fine.Gym was no great shakes - the sort designed by someone, who didn't use gyms. It would have been much better to give passes to the Crunch Fitness across the street.

The hotel is in a superb location and offers all the traveler needs for a great NYC experience. Great staff in the restaurant, very clean, front desk kind and helpful. Room was comfortable and again the location is prime. I recommend highly.

This property has the feel of a boutique hotel. It is intimate and well appointed, creating a vibe that made us feel welcome and special. The lobby is small but functions well as a place to meet or linger for a few minutes. The room was clean, in great condition and laid out with the thought (and design) necessary to maximize the use of the space. The fitness center was similarly spic and span and very well-equipped for the limited space. We were only there one night but would have loved to stay longer. We'll be back.

This wonderful hotel hidden in Union Square is wonderful! The room, though small, was perfectly appointed and just what we needed. The staff was so helpful and friendly. What a great find in this wonderful hotel!

Really liked this hotel. Very convenient to my daughter at NYU and close to Union Square. This is a Hyatt but more of a boutique as compared to the other NYC Hyatt's. Comfortable rooms, 2 good restaurants and decent bar. I'll be back.

I stayed here with my daughter who was visiting NYU. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a terrace room on a lower level. The room was clean and well appointed, and the terrace space made the room feel more spacious. The location was great -very convenient and close to a lot of nice restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay here the next time we visit New York.

Overall a nice hotel, but the room lighting was extremely dim and I was there on business. The check out staff remarked they frequently get lighting complaints. I almost bought some brighter bulbs. Rooms were small but comfortable.

This hotel was perfect for us. We were in NYC for our son's show at Webster Hall, and this hotel is only a 2 block walk from there, which is why we picked it. We couldn't have been happier. We had a courtyard room on the 2nd floor, but could not hear any street noise at all. The room was small, but that's to be expected in Manhattan. In my opinion, size didn't matter. The room and bathroom were spotless, the king size bed and bedding was super comfy, my husband even said that the bed had that fresh, clean smell. Loved the shower too! We will most definitely stay here again! I wish we could have stayed another night this time.

We will definitely stay at this Hyatt again. We loved the decor and found the room very modern, clean and quiet. This location was ideal for visiting our daughters and there were plenty of great places to eat within walking distance. We never hailed a cab and walked everywhere. Highly recommend it!

My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights in October. Great location by Union Square. Shower handle fell off, sink didn't drain, but room clean and quiet and comfortable with nice position. The repairs were done quickly. Excellent black-out curtains. Breakfast in lobby restaurant was delicious. Waiter was charming with next table's small children. My daughter used gym every day and was very happy with it!

We stayed for 10 days and the hotel was very good. We had chosen the more expensive room, an Alcove Loft room and it was worth it. We were on a family visit to NYC so it was important to be able to have family to visit with us, and the seating and table area in the room made that possible. The linens, furnishings, bed and so forth were all to a very high standard. The housekeeping service was good (and when they made a mistake with an order we were given a nice gift to compensate) We also ate in the hotel on quite a few occcasions, both from In Room Dining (good) and The Fourth Restaurant (Very Good). Of course the downside of Union Sq (and the nearby fire station) is that it is darn noisy, especially on Hallowe'en, but hey that particular 'festival' is always noisy! The hotel is well located for shops, cafes, restaurants and all sorts of facilities, all within a walk. And the subway is very close too. On most mornings we bought breakfast in a local deli and brought it back to our room, and that was good and economical too. Union Square itself is a busy place, with (dare I say it) a 'hippy' rather than 'hipster' vibe, but it is good to look around the Square itself, if only to see that side of NYC upclose. The Square also has a huge Barnes & Noble bookstore; reason enough to stay nearby, not to mention the iconic Strand Books, also close. We will definitely stay at the Hyatt Union Square again next time.

Three of us were coming to NYC and wanted to be near Cooper Union/NYU. and walking distance to the Whitney and High Line (1mile). After some searching, i found the Hyatt. Feels like a boutique hotel not a chain, and is either new or recently updates. Like all rooms in the city, room 1015 is snug but well designed, and a nice view (big windows) of nearby buildings. One of the best showers ever - spacious and tons of water from a waterfall showerhead. (Even a footrest in the shower for soaping your legs and feet) Location was super convenient. Highly recommend.

Decent hotel, great location, restaurant food was really good, the room was modern, clean but very small, and we got a room that was staring at a wall - worst view ever. They told us the benefit was that we were far from the elevator but one could still hear noise from the hallway, but it wasn't that bad. The hotel is fairly pricey, but that's NY - you pay more than in other places. Anyway, if you do not plan to stay in your room all day, then you're fine.

My stay was excellent in every way. Everyone was extremely courteous and helpful, the room was nicely appointed, clean, and quiet. Good fitness center. Great location with access to public transport. Specially liked the online check in and check out and being notified when my room was ready by email. My new favorite hotel in NYC.

very nice hotel, kind people at reception ready to help the guests, nice rate very very good service. we booked a double room king size bed. the location was not very central but anyway was ok. breakfast good

The hotel is located very very closed to Union Square, where you can easily take The subway to ho everywere. It is a design hotel, very cool. The Service is perfect, we stayed in a king room with The view of the city. The room is confortable and large, but there isn't a guardrobe at The entrance where you can leave your coats and there is no fridge. But the hotel has two bikes that you can take even for the whole day for free. The hotel is in The university area therefore is plenty of pubs, restaurants and shops.

Was pleasantly surprised with our stay. Very competitive price and a nicely updated interior. No complaints. Rooms are a little tight but the bathrooms are well designed and contemporary. Great find in a very desireable area of the city.

My hubs and I stayed here for our 9 year anniversary and had a blast. The place is beautiful and every single person was nice and helpful. The rooms are the size you would expect for the location but they are VERY modern and have various technology throughout the room. The room was super clean and beautiful and the roomservice was very yummy. Will absolutly think about this place next time we need a 'staycation' in NYC.

Arrived very late for a one night stay and was warmly greeted by front desk. Gave me the rundown of all the hotel has to offer, even though all I really wanted to do was get to my room since it was already 3AM and I had an 8AM meeting. Room was nice... but small for the price. Bathroom was larger and well appointed. Overall, customer service was great, but didn't spend enough time there to fully appreciate all the hotel had to offer. Would most likely stay there for convenience rather than amenities.

We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and had no issues. The bed was so comfortable and the perfect place to collapse after our days of walking all over the city. The shower was wonderful and the Bigelow amenities made me very happy. We had a very small room but since it was just 2 of us, it worked. I would have liked a dresser but honestly, it did not interfere with my enjoyment. The Internet was dependable and easy to connect to. The hotel employees are so friendly and helpful, they always had a smile and greeted us with genuine warmth. The breakfast at the hotel was delicious and the coffee was perfect. we will absolutely be back.

Great location in Union Square. We upgraded to a studio, plenty of room, amenities, and most important a great bed. Staff was friendly and quickly took care of our auto and answered questions. Kudos the gentlemen at the front desk when we checked in on Thursday - <Dan?> I do have to check on the a couple of cocktails that we had at the bar - they showed up on the folio at $29 and $34 - Definitely will stay again when in the area.

Being New Yorkers we have been in a few NYC hotel rooms over the years, though haven't actually stayed in many. Getting a weekend away to celebrate with friends was a special treat and our experience at the Union Square Hyatt only helped make a great weekend even better. We only stayed for one night but we really enjoyed the little time we were actually in the hotel and our room. The staff was excellent, knowledgeable, very friendly and professional. The service was relatively quick and all interactions with the staff from the front desk to the cleaning staff were very pleasant and professional.The room was very clean and for a NY hotel felt big at the standard size room price point. We had a standard room with a pretty good northern view on a mid-level floor. The bed was really comfortable, there was plenty of space to move around, a great shower and semi-open bathroom, good TV, in room fridge, desk, seating and closet space, and overall very comfortable. We ate in one of the restaurants as part of the next morning wedding brunch and the food was delicious. Union Square is a great location in the city with access to many subway lines, restaurants, bars and shopping, so we would highly recommend this area and this hotel. If the opportunity arises again we will be sure to book a room here.

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for one night in October while some work was being done in our apartment nearby. We had our small dog with us as well. This was a last-minute reservation, and I needed to vacate the apartment with the dog around 9 am, so I called the hotel to ask about early check in. They were friendly and accommodating, and they gave me a lower neighborhood rate as well, very nice! In the end I was able to check in at 11 am. Without the dog I could have checked in when I first arrived around 9:30 am, but apparently dogs are only allowed on the two lowest floors of the hotel. The only glitch was that I'd paid for the second-lowest room category, with a street view, and initially they put me into a courtyard view room, the lowest category. I called as soon as I saw the dark courtyard view and they put me in a different room immediately, a much brighter and slightly larger room with a view out to Fourth Avenue.The room overall was still quite small - and the bathroom even smaller - but it was modern, clean, and functional. Not a luxury hotel but nice enough. I found there was a fair bit of noise coming in from the hallway, even though we were at the end of the hall. Any time someone spoke in the hall, you heard them loud and clear. I didn't have a problem with street noise, however.What really made this hotel 4 stars for me was the staff. They were friendly, welcoming, professional, and responsive. One example - when we had food delivered for dinner, the desk called up to confirm and then accompanied the delivery guy to our door. Very nice - I expected them to ask us go down to the lobby to get it.And I am very grateful that they allowed me and the dog early check in, so that we could hang out in the room on a chilly day!

My wife and I were lucky enough to get a room upgrade for an extra $20 per night. Great location... close to many restaurants and also close to a number of subway lines.Expensive wine but otherwise great!Good gym (in the basement)

This place was perfect for us - right around the corner from the Strand bookstore and 1 block to union square and subway stops. Our room was spotless and silent. When my kid knocked over and broke a glass container of yogurt smoothie, I called the front desk and the first thing they asked was if we were all okay. It was cleaned up immaculately when we returned from our ventures.

Great location...Friendly staff...clean & comfortable roomsWas close to get to Brooklyn, shop in soho, walk the high lineas well as heading to other points of interest. Was our 5th trip & probably our favourite hotel!

We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt. The staff was exceptional and the rooms were excellent. The hotel is in a great location, next to Union Square, within walking distance of NYU (where our daughter goes to school) and a quick subway ride to anyplace in the city.

It was a very pleasant stay. Upon leaving I left an item in my bedroom. I went back the following day asking for it. After the first search they said they couldn't find it. But later the same day they called me to inform me that it was found. I really appreciate that, especially since the same incident happened in another hotel (won't mention here the name) and the item was never retrieved.

We stayed at the Hyatt Union Square to visit our daughter for NYU's Parent Weekend. We liked everything about the hotel, the rooms were very nice, the staff super helpful and the bar downstairs was a nice place to meet and talk. We look forward to staying there again.

I have stayed with Hyatt many times at this location and every time is a great experience! The staff is friendly all modern rooms. Centrally located in the best areas to walk!! Will recommended this to everyone!

I only stay at this hotel when I come to Manhattan. It is the very best! Best room, best service, best breakfast and close to everything I need to do. I definitely recommend this hotel. To mention a few, hotel staff is courtious, responsive, and outstanding! I arrived early in the morning and staff found a room immediately available. I received immediate assistance to help me gain access to the internet to print my airline ticket.

The stay was very good and the rooms very clean. The service was very good and people very kind. WiFi service was available for free with good connection. The position close to Union Square and easy to go to Times Square.

Victor was an amazing doorman, he should be the concierge!!! He sent us to the best places in town from the places that had best champgne and wine to the best breakfast in the city! I can't tell you enough about this guy! His attitude toward the guest, always smiling and willing to give you the best places to see. He should be the concierge!! Hi 10 for victor!! He is the man!!

I stayed here for three nights at the end of October. First, the hotel is gorgeous and there are numerous amenities that make the stay more enjoyable. The restaurants affixed to the property are great, although East Village doesn't lack for food options. What impressed me most was the customer service of the staff; it just might be the finest I've experience at any hotel.An added bonus is the proximity to Union Square Station, which is about a block away and can whisk you almost anywhere in the city.

Hotel is recently renovated and rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated.Friendly hotel staff, great restaurant on site, and a bar.My only complaint, and it is a small one, are the towels could be a better quality.Bed linens were awesome and the bed and pillows very comfortable.

The hotel was very nice and close to everything. It was clean and modern and the staff was very helpful, especially Dan at check-in. We did not have time to experience all of the facilities in the hotel, but those that we did were excellent.

1 day trip, staff was excellent, room and amenities were great. Location is great, near shopping, transportation and most importantly the Strand Bookstore is just around the corner from the hotel which makes it very convenient for bibliophiles.

I turned up after a 9 hour flight to hear that my room was cancelled because the had difficulty with my credit card. They sent me an emails saying- "your room has been canceled" no help when a) i was in flight and b) the hotel was now fully booked. spooky thing is my card worked at the airport, the cab and the next hotel. maybe this is the over booking policy- blame the cars

Despite the room being small as is par for the course in NYC, everything speaks of quality and thoughtful design about the property. And to boot, the hotel staff has to be some of the most friendly people you can meet in the city. I should glorify them any more; else, you will compete with me in my next trip to NY.

What a great spot to rest after touring NYU and the surrounding city. We were able to walk to SOHO and back and even walked back from the Ground Zero Memorial. Hotel staff was outstanding. Room was beautiful, clean, quiet with a big comfy bed. Lots of great restaurants close by, concert in Union Square, friendly New Yorkers on the street helping us navigate their town....

Good location where you would expect a lot because of the Hyatt name. Rooms are noisy with other doors to rooms slamming and street noise. No drawer space. You do not feel safe with personal items disappearing and fire alarms going off.

Pleasant, professional and helpful staff. New, clean building. A convenient location for NYU and Greenwich village area. Modern rooms with excellent use space within th small room footprint. Did not try the in house resturaunts, but they looked interesting.

I have been traveling frequently to NYC - as my daughter just started at NYU. This is the best of the last 4 hotels I have stayed at in the past year. The staff was amazingly accommodating. The room was clean, extraordinarily quiet and the bed was comfy with crisp, white cotton bedding. I will return.

check in time was 3pm. i had reserved 2 rooms. my room was not ready until after 5:30pm....after several complaints and talking to the manager. the manager said they had premium guests who they could not kick out! i said i paid for a room that had a 3 pm check in...not 5:30pm. first he offered me points for my next stay! i said i would never stay there again. finally he did give me half off one of the rooms.

From the ease of check-in to the high quality service, my stay at Union Square was perfect. Valet parking was relatively easy as well (there is a garage across corner as well). The room was well appointed and breakfast nextdoor was ideal. All in all, the stay easily exceeded expectations and look forward to next stay.

The staff, accommodations and service are always top notch and this trip was no exception. The staff remembered my preferences and ensured that the room was ready when I arrived. The check in was efficient allowing me to drop off my bags and start enjoying the City.

Hotel is nice and small - rooms very small but have nice amenities - not worth the high prices charged for the stay and from early in the morning the elevators were not working properly and there was no note on each floor about accessing the stairs or how long the elevator would be out. Bad communication

Visiting our son for NYU parents weekend. Hotel was excellent. Perfect location. Lots of places to eat nearby. Very clean. The elevators took for ever. Almost a 5-10 min wait every time. That was the only negative.

Had never stayed here before. Had a nice stay. A little rocky on check-in with only one staff member present in lobby and with heavy techno music pulsing in background -- found it unsettling for a late Sunday evening. But everything else was very solid. Larger rooms by NYC standards. And GREAT modern shower, full height with great hot water pressure. Room design similar to W rooms but brighter, fresher and more recently updated. Great location, neighborhood feel on surrounding streets and close to attractions, public transport and business centers of City. Will recommend and stay again if need to stay below midtown. Manager responded sincerely and quickly when I mentioned check-in experience on my survey. Very good vaue on this stay, rates super competitive for other similar options in area.

The Hyatt Union Square NYC is a great hotel. The location is excellent, if you want to be near Union Square you really can't do any better, it's a short block south of the square and close to the subway, restaurants, etc.The hotel itself is very new which is a rare find in NYC. As a result, everything feels clean and fresh. The rooms feature wood floors which is a really nice touch, it's a lot cleaner feeling than carpet and is cozy. The rooms are contemporary furnished with beds, good desk space, a small closet, and a minibar. The rooms have the latest in technology including outsets and light switches on the wall by both sides of the bed, connected TV equipment and good wifi.The bathroom has a nice dark tile floor and stand-up shower with a glass door (much nicer than a tub-shower). Toiletries are high quality even though the bar soap is very small. There's a large list of toiletry items available by request as well.As is very common in NYC the room is small, but it's better designed that most rooms and certainly wasn't too small for a short stay.The hotel staff is very friendly and willing to help. There are a couple restaurants in the hotel although I didn't try them, but they looked good.I think this is a great addition to NYC and it's a very good value. If you want a clean, fresh hotel in this part of town I think you'll be very happy.

They Hyatt at Union Square surpassed my expectations! I was traveling for work; location was a highly desirable. Hotel atmosphere from lobby to room was upscale, rich and modern,yet comfortable and inviting. Staff were charming and helpful. Great first experience to this property - will be back!

From the moment I entered to the moment I left the hotel, after 4 days, I had the best customer service everywhere in the hotel. It was not only friendly, but clean and perfectly located for my visit.

Room is comfortable, clean and quiet. Staff is engaging and helpful in every way. We needed help with dinner reservations and the staff recommended a perfect spot. We had stayed at this hotel about two months earlier. Upon arrival the reception desk immediately remembered us and that we were visiting our daughter.

I was in town for business and stayed at this location. Very clean and modern. Beautiful decor. Being in NYC they had to be efficient with space. For those who have never been to NYC, the room will be smaller than a standard hotel room, but it is well arranged. I LOVED the room. The bed was extremely comfortable. I like the shower head so much that I had the front desk get me the manufacturer.The location is perfect. It a short block away from an express R subway line that will get you to Times Square quickly (without having to deal with the crowds at your hotel!).If/when I come back, I plan on staying here.

Love this hotel! Room was clean and spacious. Front desk and restaurant staff exceptional. Bartenders not so much. More closet space and toiletries/amenities would be welcome. Great neighborhood vibe. Overall, a winner!

Location was very good for me.Simple room, ok design, not great view, no frig.Blanket was too hot and sheets alone were too cold....The bed was...too soft.and my back hurt in the morning.I didn't like that each night there was a knock at my door at 9pm for turndown service.

We stayed here over a long weekend while we visited our daughter at NYU Law School. The hotel was an easy 10/15 minute walk to the law school apartments. The staff was extremely friendly and proficient. The room was very clean and modern. We loved the walk-in shower. Our room didn't have a tub. The size of the room was perfect for the two of us.

Great hotel, I had an Urbane Studio Room. The room was spotless and the amenities were very good, slippers, umbrella, nice soaps, lots of towels. The room was also very quiet. Overall the hotel and staff were excellent and the hallways, lobby, restaurant and other common areas were also spotless. The hotel is in a good location, easy access to the subway and it was not a problem to get a cab. Great experience overall.

First time I stayed at Unions Square. It is so convenient with the nearby subway hub. It makes it so easy and fast to get around in the city. It will be my new location. The hotel has a friendly and efficient staff. The design is modern and cozy. The rooms are small, but OK. Some noise from the passage.

I had taken my daughters into the city to celebrate my oldest 13th bday. It was our second time staying at the hotel and the service was just as accommodating and rooms just as clean and stylish as the first time I had stayed. They even had a nice bday surprise for my daughter. The area has everything you need , we never left the union square area, went to farmers market, movie, street fair and shopped at the many retail shops in a 4 block radius. We had a great experience .

The staff was courteous and professional. Our room was very clean and the bed was comfortable.Interior design was unique and original. We drove into the city and the parking was off premises but was taken care of by the hotel staff. We parked at the curb steps from the front door and received our car the next day, steps from the door. We had an excellent stay.

The perfect location to stay and visit my son at NYU! The staff was very attentive and the Hotel was clean and cozy with a choice of restaurants/bars inside the hotel. I had the studio room and though the drawer space was limited the room was a good size and the king bed was very comfortable!

I stayed at hyatt for 4 nights for business trip. Bed is comfortable and room is pretty spacious and clean. The location of hotel is also great since it's right next to union square and whole foods market.

Arrived early & front desk held luggage until room available. When we arrived back, our luggage was waiting for us in our room. Overall Good service & location . Room a little small, but had everything we needed. Enjoyed the fourth restaurant for brunch. Near by to other good restaurants. Also enjoyed walking around the farmers market at union square.

We went to NYC for my friends birthday and typically stay in the union square area. We wanted to try the Hyatt because we heard good things about it. The costs were high but we figured it would be worth it because of the location and the great ratings. When we landed my friend learned that her dog passed away and was very upset. On check-in, we knew the room was not likely ready as it was about noon. The staff was helpful and courteous so they gave us a room that was available so my friend could freshen up. The room's layout was problematic for us. The room was extremely small and although the toilet had a door, the shower and sink area did not. There was absolutely no privacy. When we asked to switch rooms we were told all of their rooms were designed that way as it is a "boutique" hotel and that they were fully committed for the entire weekend. They also advised that it would be an upgrade to relocate to a room with a door to the bathroom! After continuing to complain they agreed the next day to upgrade us to a room with a door to the bathroom. The next night the room was fine - exactly the same with a door to the bathroom. The problem was we were put all day and when returning in the evening it was freezing in the room because the thermostat was broken. We just turned the air off and went to bed. I would not recommend this hotel because nobody explained to us when booking that you would have to pay more money for a room that had a door to the bathroom. We were already paying over $500 for the room! I also did not appreciate how management handled the situation. They saw how upset we were and other than switching our room the next day, there was nothing done to make us feel better other than apologize and explain that is the room we purchased and they are fully committed. One last comment, you can hear every door in the hallway slam shut and it kept us awake all night.

This was 3rd or 4th time staying at this hotel for business .... I am only a platinum member and they upgrade they gave me was amazing. A corner suite on the 2nd floor that had a balcony that wrapped around the corner and could easily host 50 people. I was dissappointed that i was only staying 1 evening would have loved to stay longer just to enjoy the room. Service at the hotel is excellent, everything is ALWAYS top notch.

I always enjoy staying here when I'm in NY- super comfy beds and great location! Subways to everywhere less than 1 block away, wonderful farmers mkt in Union sq. excellent restaurants and shopping nearby too!

We stayed at the Union Square Hyatt for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is great and the staff are extremely nice. However, the room was very small, there was not enough room to unpack our bags, the bathroom had no place to place our toilettries. The room in general was very uncomfortable.

We stayed here for 4 nights and our review is mixed. The location is good if you want to be in the middle of the east and west village. Lots of places you can walk too. However, it is a bit noisy being so close to Union Square and there is also a fire station very close. We were on the 10th floor and heard sirens all the time. I had to use ear plugs to sleep. I had booked a courtyard side room to try to get away from that, but they put us facing 4th. I'm sure this was considered an upgrade for a better view, but the noise was pretty bad. The rooms are small, even for NYC, but nice. It is a bit different to have your vanity and shower in your room without a door. Personal preference on if that would bother you or not. The toiletries given are much nicer than many hotels we've been too. Like I said, small but usable and updated.They also seemed to be having elevator issues while we were there. We got stuck in an elevator. Not a great experience. And the next day they were working on the elevators again. I will say that one of the staff members took some money off our total bill because of the incident. The staff was very attentive the entire time we were there. Always welcoming you back and offering assistance. We are not sure how to rate this hotel. Sirens are a part of NYC and Hyatt can't do anything about that. But maybe honor a request for a courtyard room. Elevators have issues, it happens. Just not fun when it happens to you. So, will we stay here again? We are undecided. The noise level, while probably less than say Times Sq, is still more than we are used to from other hotels in the city. But the rooms and staff were nice. The cost was a bit more than I think that hotel should be, but it is NYC. Nothing over the top, but a nice hotel with a good location. I think it all depends on where you want to be and what you are looking for.

we are here frequently. they persist in not following instructions made on reservation to have no feather pillows, etc. in room and to put refrigerator in room. Very annoying. No communication between reservation line and hotel. the hotel is beginning to look seedy with dirty elevators, etc. the lighting in the room is too low.asked for a lit vanity mirror- first one delivered did not work- had to get a second one and demand that they tried it out first. Only pus is the location. also overpriced.the floor we were on smelled like someone was smoking- I suspect an employee since we were close to service room.

I was in NYC recently and stayed at the Hyatt Union Square in midtown. This is a nice upscale hotel with spacious rooms, an attractive work out area, nice restaurants, and a convenient location. The staff is responsive and friendly. Check in and check out was fast, efficient, and professional with all employees courteous and helpful. I recommend this hotel.

Highly recommended for a Union Square stay. Rooms are sleek, clean and efficient and lobby is inviting. Good restaurant. Very convenient location. Only thing I was not crazy about was the chair which is easy to tip over if you lean back.

I stayed for 2 nights and found the location to be the highlight - it is walking distance from key attractions, next to the ever-buzzing Union Square but also a great retreat when you need to rest. I found the room quite small but still very comfortable. The wifi is great and the staff very helpful.

Loved this Hyatt hotel and will definitely stay again. The cost is terrific. The staff are friendly and "on it" professionals committed to customer service. The lobby/public areas are clean, fun, well decorated, and comfortable. The room was a good size (as was the spacious bathroom) comfortable, and quiet. We had a king room on the top floor with a window that opened for some fresh air. The bathing products were a generous size and smelled wonderful, making the rain head, walk in shower feel like a spa. The location of the hotel is also good for exploring NYC. There is a subway station a block away, but so many wonderful things in walking distance: Ina's for gorgeous designer consignment, ABC Kitchen for an outstanding menu (best to make a reservation) and a mile stroll to the High Line - were all easy and safe to get to. Also nice is a Whole Foods and Trader Jo's super close for quick travel treats. The only things that may bother you: no mini frig, very limited drawer space. If you are super finicky about these things, well, don't be. Let it go! And enjoy a wonderful stay at this Hyatt.

This was probably the cleanest, fanciest hotel I ever stayed at.The staff was friendly and helpful. I ran into the cleaning lady and she asked where I was from and we had a good conversation while I was waiting for the elevator.The front desk was really great. There was a line of people checking in. Staff members popped out and took each of us individually instead of having us wait.The bar was excellent! The poor bar tender was doing the drinks, busing, waiting. The wine he suggested was nice.The shower was amazing.The view was meh but still interesting because it looked into offices and residential units.

Stayed two nights here! It was an amazing stay. I called beforehand for an early check-in (like 8 a.m. early) and a room was ready for us when we arrived groggy and tired from our red-eye flight. The staff was so friendly (even by non-NYC standards)! We were greeted by multiple staff members (doormen, check-in people, etc), each time we entered the hotel. The cleaning scheduling was amazing. Our room was always ready and clean by the time we left and returned from our day's activities. They even offered us service on our first day since we had gotten in so early. The room looked brand new with modern/sexy furnishings. The bathroom (rainfall showerhead!) was great and I loved the toiletries they had. It is perfectly located. Walking distance to soooo many things and you have a major subway station a block away that has three lines. Would DEFINITELY stay here again.

We had a very nice stay Hyatt Union Square. Rooms were surprisingly spacious for New York. Liked the style and layout of the rooms. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Hotel is in a very convenient location. Extremely close to subway lines; easy to get around.

If you want to be in the heart of the New York City magic, but not in Times Square, then this is your perfect location. It is close to SoHo, Greenwich and even Times Square if need be. The hotel is more like a boutique with a cool funk about it. Rooms are not large, but sufficient for a couple. We stayed both in a King Standard and a King Jr. Suite. The Jr. was a little bigger, but nothing major. The gym was perfect, bfast at The Fourth was very good and we even used the hotel bikes.The staff there was super friendly and very helpful in every way. They were great with immediate requests and even anticipated our needs.To experience New York like a New Yorker, then this is your hotel.

This is a great location off Union Square for business or pleasure. Staff is always very polite and extremely helpful. The rooms are a decent size and very comfortable. Wide selection of dining nearby as well as hotel food service if you don't want to go out.I'll be back again.

The hotel is very well located and has an elegant, hip vibe without being too much so. Service was not spectacular, but it was friendly. Examples: waited 10 minutes in bar for table service until I finally just got up and went to the bar to order (saw two others have to do the same)...asked the desk clerk to print out my boarding pass (where he stood with two other employees chatting) and he politely led me to the business center and left. Little things like this make the difference between a very good and an excellent experience in my book. The hotel rooms are pretty...The bed was comfortable...Shower was nice, and all was quiet in courtyard facing room. Would definitely recommend!

Just as the title says, great location and a great newly built hotel. I didn't see a doorman during our stay so be ready to fetch your own cabs. The valet service was a weird setup (meaning they leave your car on the street until someone from a nearby garage comes to pick it up) so I parked myself around the block and saved myself the hassle/wait of dealing with that situation. Subway is a block away, grocery stores are plentiful nearby, as is Uniom Square. Will definitely return.

The best Manhattan has to offer is 20 blocks in any direction. The hotel rooms are very well designed and exceptionally comfortable. The staff were across the board excellent. You would be hard pressed to find a better place to stay.

Wonderful hotel and delightful staff! Love the location and cleanliness of the rooms. The staff is efficient and courteous and willing to assist you with anything. Lightning in the bathrooms is very dim. Pack a makeup mirror.

Wonderful boutique hotel. Great service, rooms, people, food and atmosphere. Good location. Each time I returned from business meetings, I felt welcome and at home. That's important for a woman traveling alone.

I love the location. I was visiting with our family friend, It was so easy to walk around the down town area without spending any money to see New York city most famous places. Everyone enjoy staying at Hyatt Union Square.

Hyatt Union Square is our "go-to" for a stay in the city due to its location and accessibility. Staff are friendly, amenities are good.Beds and pillows were comfortable. My only complaint is the noise from the hallway that comes in the door - no way to stop other thoughtless guests from loud conversations. Running the a/c unit helps!

Not having had to much experience staying in NYC i am a Hyatt platinum member so I chose this hotel. I stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is small and the rooms are very small. The property is very modernized and that was nice. Our room was clean and the staff was very friendly. Also our room was in the middle of the hotel and the elevator shaft was behind our room, so we could here it moving sometimes at night. They don't have a conceige desk, but i guess its part of that modern styling. The restaurant called the Fourth which is located in the hotel was vey good, a little pricey but the ny strip was cooked to perfection. They also have a nicely appointed lounge in the hotel that looks pretty nice. I give this hotel 3 stars because it was a little far away from everything that we were doing. I reccormend staying here if you dont mind being a little far from times square or central park.

Our room was clean and attractive but extremely small even by NYC standards. It was noisy at night with sounds and talking in hallways and adjoining rooms.We found it unusual that we had to tug at manual heavy exterior front doors ourselves instead of an automatic opener or an attentive doorman.Even with the good location, at nearly $600 per night this was not a value.

This Hyatt in Union Square is outstanding. It's right in the heart of the action of trendy Union Square. The room is very modern; the bathroom is large. I also loved the raindrop shower design! The subway stop is also only a block away. I will definitely be back at this hotel during my next stay in NYC.

Second time staying in this hotel. Friendly staff, great service. Nice room, not much of a view but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. Great location. Reasonable rate for a decent NYC hotel.

Really happy about our 2-night stay at the Hyatt Union Square this weekend. Great room (great design, bed, shower, etc), great sound insulation (we could not hear anything from the street noise), great heat/air conditioning (very quiet and responsive). We did not eat in the restaurant, but everything else really exceeded our expectations!

Flawless hotel. When in NY I always stay at here. Staff is extremely friendly and professional. Rooms are large, clean and well appointed. Easy to get in / out of hotel due to size. Restaurant is delicious.

Tucked just off of Union Square, the Hyatt Union Square offers clean and trendy but sparse accommodations. Following the new urban trend, guest rooms are small, do not offer guests any drawers for storage and are best suited for a business traveler or individual who is traveling alone. Hallways are extremely dark, and even in the guest room, the lighting is limited. That said, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom elegant (but again dark and difficult for shaving or make-up). If you are looking for a traditional luxury hotel room, this is not it but for a trendy and clean place to stay in the city, it is just great.

Excellent customer service, prime location, clean and modern rooms - a very nice stay. I world definitely return to this hotel. The staff remembered my name and was more than accommodating-!Thank you!

Loved staying here. Well-decorated, cute, clean room. Stellar location and staff was really helpful and welcoming. Was in NY on business and stayed here for 4 nights---was a great home away from home for a few days. Would definitely stay here again.

I hosted an event at our office nearby and needed rooms for 20 people. I worked with Jodi, a sales manager for the Hyatt and was treated very well. It was a crazy busy week for events in NY and Jodi and team remained patient with me even though I had many last minute changes. The rooms were expensive the week we stayed due to the heavy demand on hotels in NY.

On arrival I checked into my room which had already been occupied, the bed was used. This was rectified and I was given a different room, not sure it was a king room as I had booked. The air con was extremely noisy so I coped without it for 3 days. I can't believe for $500 per night you don't even get a complimentary bottle of water, instead there is a $7 bottle of warm Evian for you to purchase. Although I enjoyed the complimentary coffee it was not topped up on the second day and I had to leave a note for extra supplies for the 3rd day.On checkout I was asked to settle my bill by credit card. Despite me showing all paperwork from my agent to say it was supposed to go on account they said they would look into it after checkout. To my horror the charged my card anyway for just over $1500 without informing me! After many emails this is finally being sorted out.My company uses this hotel regularly (100s of room nights a year) and we are all shocked when at check in they ask 'have you stayed here before'. Surely the simplist of reservation systems could inform the staff that we are reglar customers?I and many of my colleagues are dissatisfied with the service and slipping standards at this hotel.

I had a very good stay here – superb service at the reception desk/bar/concierge (not so at the restaurant on the street though) and very stylish interiors. However the room was small, with a view towards the wall of the opposing high rise. I did enjoy the Union Square neighbourhood, it's a nice area both for walking around and very accessible using public transportation.

As my son is a student in NYC I look for places to stay next to him whemI come to town. This time prices were very high for a very tiny room. Although the staff was very friendly end we spent a nice week. This location is very close to subway and Soho and Chelsea nice restaurants.

I selected this hotel because of location but that's the best that can be said of it. The room was very small - probably the highest cost per sq. ft. in the city. There are many choices in NYC and this won't be mine in the future.

Modern rooms but very small. Several maintenance problems had to be addressed during our stay. The front desk staff is disinterested in providing a high level of service. I only stay here because of the location, right in the middle of Greenwich Village and near NYU. I also like the restaurant,The Fourth. The hotel as a whole is mediocre and yet they charge top prices.

You can't beat the location of this property - which is ideal for visiting NYU parents who are comfortable with the Hyatt brand but open to local color. On the plus side, the hotel has made a real effort to assimilate with the neighborhood (special shout out for the Bigelow bath products), and the restaurant food is well above average. On the downside, WiFi is extra, which keeps a community from building in the lobby (like The Ludow). I also didn't care for the open plan bathroom, which puts your dop kit uncomfortably close to your bed in smaller rooms. That bothered me enough that I switched to a larger room - but the management couldn't have been nicer about it.

We chose the Hyatt for its reputation and location - which was great. Arrived Saturday afternoon and started with delicious happy hour cocktails in the lobby bar. The concierge was quite helpful in planning our evening out including dinner reservations. We loved our room and the staff couldn't be nicer! We'll be back!

Will stay at this hotel next time in NYC. Great location and very cool bar scene. Stopped in on the way to China town.. Great location....Friendly bartenders and nice vibe, good bar menu and excellent service.

Highly recommend to the Parents of NYU students, excellent hotel to stay in. It's all about location location. Dropped my daughter off for her second year and decided to try the Hyatt Union Square. Excellent choice, easy access to all our needs - this is in the center of all - NYU. Service exceptional. Worth every dollar spent.

Very contemporary design in a very good Manhattan location. Very friendly staff at the front desk. Appears quite new in the common areas - at least newly re done. Room was small but nicely appointed and had a very modern décor. While the restaurant is attached and I supposedly had a credit, when we went there for breakfast it was a disaster. No plates out, nobody eating, one guy running around and had no clue as to the "credit" from the hotel - "that is from them, we are us". Got up and left. The hotel itself was very nice but stay away from the restaurant you can tell it is poorly run. Would certainly stay in the hotel again. Just find a manager for the restaurant.

Lacking a congierge lounge, their benefits for Hyatt Elite members are lacking. Staff is very accommodating. Terrific location. Skip the adjoining restaurant. Too expensive for limited menu, even for NY. Lots of better options within short walking distance.

I stayed at the Hyatt at Union Square for 3 nights while visiting my adult children. I could not believe how much money it was going to cost but thought it would be a great location and high end hotel. This is unfortunately a hotel run by young people for young people. Very little service. Decent small room but a disappointment. A couple specific things that went wrong and for which the hotel never apologized were 1)on day of check in, they said they'd call me when my room was ready as I arrived earlier than the scheduled check in time. They said a room would be available soon. I never received a call. 2)one day I came back to my room at 5 PM and the room had not been made up. I asked housekeeping and asked the front desk as well; both were very casual and nonchalant about getting this done; 3)it felt like a college dorm with people talking out in the hallways way into the early morning hours. All in all, a lot of money for very little service. Stay if it's convenient for you but be aware that you'll pay top price for a tiny room with the sink and bathroom right in the middle of the bedroom.

In the heart of Union Square, this Hyatt is chic, charming and upscale, feeling like a larger boutique hotel. The only complaint was the room size and layout with the sink area not privately positioned in the room and very little storage space. The decor was beautiful though and appointments were uoscale and high tech. The service was incredible Several restaurants on the main floor felt not at all like a hotel atmosphere and the food was excellent.

Have been staying at the Hyatt Union Square few times since they open. But this time we were NOT happy with them. We booked for four nights. On my second night I called guest service for one extra towel & was connected another person. He told me that I am allow to have ten towels per room & per night. I told him that we only have eight towels, 3 baths, 2 hand, 2 wash & 1 floor mat. I told him I never heard such a rule that I can only have limited towels & beside I asked for ONE more. The Courtyard Studio facing 4th Ave is very small with very small closet for one person & you can hear the traffic. Also they give very limited toiletry per day even though you pay for another day. Expect us to use the tiny soap for my four night stay over & over again. Have to call & request for it. Not good house keeping. Even though I'm a LOYAL HYATT Passport card holder for years. Have to keep them happy!

Only 4 stars because our soft drinks were out of date but they changed them out right be our check out and we still got charged for them unfortunately other then that the hotel is amazing. Very nice, clean, and professional staff.

Union Square Hyatt is a fabulous location, with terrific rooms, views, cleanliness, quiet and super friendly staff. The design is very accommodating and current, and the fitness center is the best I have ever encountered, with terrific machines in great condition, water, towels, weights and all you would want. The location is a block from a fabulous outdoor green market most mornings at Union Square and uptown cabs outside the door. Also, the area if flush with great restaurants to walk to, any subway you want, and excellent groceries and other shopping. I cannot think of any downsides, except that they do not have a low price breakfast venue, nor ice machines on the floor. However, you can get ice if you ask for it delivered, and the shops across the street are great for cheap and good local coffee/breakfast. We love this place and someday will splurge to get a terrace room--yes your own terrace! And did I mention how great the shower heads are---??? I really recommend this hotel, but it is not a super great value. It is just a great spot and you do get what you pay for! Enjoy! You're in a great city and you have to pay for that! Oh, and if you are sensitive to sirens, beware because there is a fire station just a block away. Never bothers me, but just so you know...

Super clean hotel, friendly staff, excellent location and easy to get to/from lots of places because it's so close to the Metro line. We didn't try out the hotel bar or restaurant but will definitely do so next time we are there.The rooms are a tad on the small side but I'm told that most NY hotel rooms are like that. There was a man who chose to sing opera in the early morning hours above us, but I can't quite blame the hotel for that. :)

I recently spent four nights at the Hyatt Union Square and I could not be more pleased. The hotel itself, the room, the people and amenities were amazing. The location was also very convenient to so much of Manhattan. Would absolutely stay there again. I have been to NYC many times and stayed many places - FYI

We have visited this Hyatt several times. The service is impeccable. Many of the employees have been there for quite some time and remember us on check in(like Victor!). Everyone is friendly and professional. The patio rooms on the second floor are perfect for a puppy play area. Our dog appreciated having a place to enjoy the sun off lead. The restaurant's street side seating is perfect with your puppy companion, as well. My son is returning this next weekend to visit his sister and staying here. Great location. Near a ton of restaurants without being in the mad house of Times Square. If you are going to a show, the subway is around the corner.

Two of us were having a fun weekend in NYC, touristing around to lower Manhattan sites - Flower district, Union Sq Farmer's market, Tenement Museum, etc. The Hyatt has a great location for lower Manhattan. The room was really great - very up to date, clean, well served, Our only wish was more light near the sink. My wife ended up sitting by the window (nice view) during the day to get enough light to put on her makeup. I suppose young eyes would have no problem. The staff were cheerful and friendly and helpful. We enjoyed staying there and will come back again.

Convenient to Union Square subway station. great launching point for travel in any direction and many walkable sites. The Fourth bistro has a great breakfast, a nice place to sit outdoors for an afternoon beverage and people watching. Street noise was minimal. local pubs are a moment away. Front desk was very helpful with storing bags, hailing cabs and recommendations for local restaurants and directions thereto. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

I found the Hyatt Union Square to be great for both business or leisure. The location is ideal with easy subway access and lots to do within walking distance. My room was outfitted exceptionally well with easy access outlets, work space, comfy bed and pillows, and was completely clean. Love absence of carpet!

2-yr old hotel, cool design, very conveniently located. windows are smallish for a modern hotel, but still provided sufficient natural light into the room. love the wood floor!I was stuck in the elevator for 10 minutes one day - it went up a couple of floors and stopped moving, doors wouldn't open either. I called for help, they said engineering will fix it and it will move shortly. there were no signs posted or staff around warning guests not to use the elevator. not quite what one would expect at a reputable hotel.

Open about two years now, this boutique hotel in a very desirable part of town is still not getting the details right. There’s a lot to like, with a stylish foyer and quite the intimate feel throughout. My room had delightful hardwood floors, and the décor is a combination of white plasterboard walls, black trim, and mirrors. The bathroom is well appointed, not huge but with strong water pressure. But, the staff are overlooking some pretty basic details.My alcove loft (which is a corner room) really wasn’t big enough to entertain guests. There’s nowhere to put drinks and food, except for the work desk. There was a food stain on the sofa, and only one working power outlet at the desk (the other was covered with tape). While I requested a high floor, I received a room on the third floor. Admittedly, this is New York, but the traffic and sounds from the street were a constant accompaniment night and day. My room temperature was set at 74 degrees when I arrived, which was enough for me to continue sweating until I noticed the thermostat. The water dispenser in the foyer is a nice touch, but it was left empty for most of the night. Since the foyer is quite small, when family groups or lots of people wait in line to check-in it is hard to enter the hotel and reach the elevators. It isn’t clear if there are stairs as an alternative.

I stayed here only one night. The hotel was pleasant and in a good location. I found my room to be a little small, especially the bathroom. I didn't have the greatest view (my room overlooked the patio below me as well as a Walgreens). The bed was comfortable. What I didn't like about this hotel was the noise. I should have asked for a room a higher floor- the noise from outside continued late into the night. I asked the front desk several times for directions to various places in the city - every time, they were friendly and helpful.

Great place to stay. Friendly staff and very convenent location. Lots of restaurants and pleasant neighborhood. Good gym. The bar and restaurant have a great atmosphere. Don't forget to visit Think Coffee across the street!

I loved my stay in New York , it was even better to be in this hotel. well located , easy access to all points of interest , close to Subway and good shops. Charlie attendant welcomed us very well. I am waiting for my next visit to stay in the same hotel.

I was really pleased with the hotel. The lobby is cool, the room was comfortable and chic. Great location too. The roof area was closed or I would have gone up to hang out. All in all it was a great stay! Friendly staff at check in..... I will return. This is a great hotel if you want to stay downtown and great location if you plan to do anything on the mid-lower east side/chinatown, soho etc.

I loved it here. It was the perfect location, the subway entrance was only a few feet away. The staff was amazing, always professional, always helpful. The restaurant next door was lovely. The room was clean. The bed was THE best! I would wake up feeling like I had slept in all day and really I had only slept for 6 hours. I really can't say enough good things about my experience here. When I come back to NY I will definitely be staying here!

This was our second time at this hotel and we thought there was nothing they could do to improve our previous outstanding hotel experience. They did! This a five star experience in a relaxed, friendly atmosphere.

This is a relatively small hotel (for a big hotel chain), and it has the feel of a boutique hotel. I loved that I could check in and out on line. By checking in online, the hotel will text you when your room is ready. That was very convenient. My room looked out onto 13th St. and had a pleasing city view, but no disturbing street noise. The room decor was pretty and calming (slightly Japonaise); the room was quite large for Manhattan. The location is ideal: a 2 minute walk from Union Sq subway, 20 minutes to the Highline; 10 minutes to NYU and Greenwich Village. The staff was friendly, efficient,and helpful. The only tiny reservation I have is that I did hear a little noise from a neighboring room (through the locked communicating door), but this was minor and brief.

It is a nice hotel. Our room seemed to be newly remodeled and it was very comfortable and clean. It was also quiet for sleeping at night as our room didn't face the street. It is also a short walk to the subway station.

We stayed 3 nights when visiting for a wedding. Very friendly staff. Large room for nyc standards. Gym in basement and basic. Relatively quiet for big city. There is much to do in area and would be good location if going to visit nyu.

although the rooms weren't large, they weren't small either. that's just NYC. otherwise, the place was top notch without moving up into the suites at some place with prices up in the stratosphere. while not cheap, you get what you pay for, and the room and especially the service, left very little to be desired. the service was what really topped it off for me. i'm not overly ticky, but it was outstanding. the location, basically right next to Union square, meant that for cabs or subway, access to other parts of the city was quick and simple, what with union square being a major subway junction. shopping, food and the rest, including a large, major chain 24/7 drugstore with food also right across the street. not sure exactly when, but i certainly will be staying there again.

Very modern hotel with great location. Clean, modern and spacious rooms. Nice amenities and good location. Staff is very friendly and you have to check out the bar with it's amazing scotch selection! This is my new "NYC" hotel from now on...

Stayed for 6 nights ( business) The reception reps were friendly and very helpful from my arrival (very early check in ) room comfortable ,clean and pleasant .this boutique style Hyatt offers a city chic atmosphere at the door of a centric location , subway located within 2 min walking .plenty of good food options minutes away .will be back for sure

Room was very clean. Great location for public transportation and activities. I would gladly stay here again. The staff upon arrival was extremely helpful and professional. I enjoyed their greeting and attention.

This was very convenient for visiting my daughter who moved into the east village. The hotel was in union square, near NYU also. Great hotel, all modern. The dark curtains made for a great sleep. A nice peaceful rock garden out the window in the middle of the hotel. A cute bar/speakeasy & cool decorations. The staff was very helpful. I will def stay there again.

The Hyatt once again was a great hotel for my visit to the US Open. If you aren't staying in Queens then you may as well stay in Manhattan and be able to walk to everything. The hotel staff very courteous and accommodating. The room very nice; clean; equipped. The bar is noisy and expensive. $17 for a glass of wine! Come on. But overall all, excellent experience.

first time I have stayed at this property and in this area of NYC. As always, the hyatt staff was great, the room was very comfortable. Loved the location, very close to subway, made it easy to get to Yankees game and US open tennis!

We stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for 4 nights whilst in town to attend a wedding. Great location, quirky modern rooms, plenty of amenities and everything you'd expect from a decent high end hotel. No complaints at all. Most staff were friendly and accommodating. I managed to get my suit dry cleaned in record time! We ate breakfast twice in hotel restaurant and a great selection and some really inventive brunch options. The hotel is ideal for exploring the area and it's an easy walk to the lower east side, Soho, Greenwich etc... Will definitely be staying here again when next in New York.

Had an Urbane Studio. It's a nice little room with sharp modern decor. The layout is very open, so check pictures on the web site before you book this style room if you have trouble with the bathroom area being open to the rest of the room. (The toilet and shower themselves are private, of course.) The only bottled water in the room was for sale, but NYC has excellent tap water, so that wasn't an issue for me. The hotel is well-located. The staff are energetic and attentive. When a colleague had trouble booking a room at our corporate rate, they were happy to make adjustments to keep our party together.

I had originally booked 48 Lex on expedia but for some reason I was relocated at Hyatt Union Square. I had a good stay nonetheless. I would appreciate having a light complimentary continental breakfast as it is the case at 48 Lex.

After spending nine nights here, I can heartily recommend this hotel for its comfort, location and readiness to serve its clients as helpfully and undemonstratively as possible. None of the pleasant front-of-house staff seems to be over 30, and they worked hard towards making sure our stay was a comfortable one, and our requests were met with quickly and cheerfully, and with no hassle by any of the staff re our asking for an extended check-out time, for example. Our quiet room was located on a 5th floor corner overlooking 4th Avenue, and was bright, clean and functionally contemporary. The only design changes I would like to see would be for a larger refrigerator, a less shallow bathroom sink (it was only a few inches deep), and a gentler outer door that didn't inevitably bang shut noisily. Perhaps the highlight of the room was the extremely comfortable double bed, which made getting up in the mornings such a chore. The front desk in the lobby was as minimalist as I have ever seen in a hotel, which worked fine, but overall the lobby could have done with improved lighting, gentler music, and some more amenities like the sale of postcards and maps. Getting about the city from Union Square couldn't have been simpler, with the Subway just a few hundred yards away and a variety of passing and nearby city buses moving in all directions; and Greenwich Village was within easy walking distance. For book-lovers, the great delight in this New York University neighbourhood would also be the existence of the superb and venerable Strand Books store barely one block away. So we were happy with our stay and would certainly want to return to this pleasant hotel.

Great location near Union Square with plenty of nice restaurants within walking distance. Hyatt's "The Fourth" restaurant is also very good in its own right. After just a couple of visits the staff welcome you back and always go out of their way to ensure a nice stay. Rooms are pretty spacious and always clean and bright. A real pleasure.

Nice place, great location, fabulous staff, the place is simple, neat and clean, location is close to several option for moving along NY and the staff is always ready to give you a nice smile and resolve any request you might have.

We have been here twice, and both times we really enjoyed our stay. The staff was super friendly. It was a hot day when we arrived, and the free flavored water in the lobby. They could improve by having more drink options in the bar.

We had an excellent experience with very helpful hotel staff to ease dropping off our son for college. The location of the hotel was second to none. Absolutely beautiful hotel and contemporary styled rooms. Very clean and good size room.

The staff was extremely professional and helpful; the scenario was madness on move-in day, but they made it look (relatively) normal and easy. Everyone worked tirelessly with our boxes and enormous amount of luggage. We were actually able to walk many things around the corner to the dorm.

My stay at the Union Square Hyatt Hotel started off great , the longer I stayed the worse my experience became. I didn't get new sheets each night. I came back the house keeper left music blasting. I didn't get the 15% off stated on the Hyatt site . I was accused of stealing Reese's from the mini bar that was never supplied to begin with. I would say if you ever stay here, double check everything !!! Shady business!

A terrific hotel in a perfect location. Close to subway and restaurants. Very comfortable. The front desk staff were helpful. On site restaurant was delish too. The shower was an added plus. You will not be disappointed.

I booked this hotel through NYU since my daughter was going to be starting college there. Turned out the hotel was a two minute walk from my daughter's dorm. I had no idea, just got lucky. A lot of people staying at the hotel the weekend we were there were moving their kids into their dorms. The hotel staff was so helpful and maintained patience on a very busy, crazy day. The reception staff and bell staff were always so nice. The tables out front were a perfect place to have a drink. We will be staying there again in Oct. and I can't wait. The room was a little small but super comfortable and the rainhead shower was fabulous!

I wanted to be close to my NYU daughter's dorm and this was a block away. Wonderful staff helped us make drop off weekend smooth and easy between helping us with all our dorm items and happily greeting me each time I returned alone. GREAT place and will stay there again every time I am in town

This relatively new Hyatt hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of much of Manhattan. The room decor is modern and attractive. The staff is excellent. The rooms are small, as you would expect, but well appointed. Internet and TV work fine. Shower is fantastic. Soundproofing and curtains deliver an incredibly good environment for sleep. Unfortunately, the bed and pillow combination are among the poorest that I've experienced in my last 100 hotel stays across Europe, North America, and Asia. Air conditioning is not annoyingly loud, but cycles much too often. I enjoyed the location, but didn't get a full night of sleep in 3 nights at this hotel.

This hotel was recommended by a very close friend that lives in NY. Excellent location, attentive and polite staff, plenty of amenities, and a wonderful aroma throughout the lobby! Our room was the perfect size and had nice/modern décor.

We were in NY for family event. This is a very comfortable hotel very close to Union Square near NYU, shopping, and walkable to Washington Square. Rooms have wood floors, modern look with walk in showers, comfortable bed, coffee maker and hair dryer. Service is excellent. Rooms are serviced twice daily and lobby personal are great. Our room had excellent view of 4th avenue but was noisy so maybe courtyard room may be quieter. They offer free basic wifi and charge for upgrade speed. There is a Walgreene's and wine shop next door. Highly recommended.

Service was excellent. Hotel staff very promptly attended to everyone of our requests. Very friendly at all times greeting us pleasantly at all times. The room was a bit small but the service more than made up for it.

Really enjoyed our stay. I chose this hotel because it was so close to the L train and we could be Williamsburg Brooklyn in 10 min or so which is where our son lives. Also took the subway to grand central to catch the 7 train to Flushing and the U.S. Open tennisTo summarize:Pros:-Staff so friendly and helpful from the front door all the way to check out-close to subway-room was not huge but perfect size-lighting could be control from so many places-the restaurant, The Fourth, served one of the best breakfasts we ate during our trip-close to Union Square Park which is "interesting ". Nice farmers market there-great rain showerCons:-Lighting bath room could've brighter-always wish NYC hotel were less expensive Would stay there again!

Beautiful hotel Love the new concept of no wall to wall carpeting. Would love a complementary coffee bar in In the lobby in the morning The hotel room coffee makers aren't very good All in all a lovely place

Recently had to be in Union Square-Village area to drop son off at NYU. We stayed 2 weeks at the Hyatt Union Square in an amazing 2nd floor room with a deck. The staff are super friendly and attentive. The location is close to restaurants, major subway stations and tourist attractions. Rates for New York are very reasonable. Rooms are kept super clean. I cannot imagine going to NYC and staying anywhere else.

Best location for NYU dorms and lively surrounding . Everything is close by and very convenient . Staff is very nice and friendly and go out of the way to make u feel comfortable . Special mention of Charlie who took very good care of us . Union square is few minutes walk . Great experience and will surely come back soon

This is a really great location for NYU, I've stayed here before and am happy to say the people here are still really really nice. the rooms are clean & comfy. The Hyatt was great in getting this reservation last minute for me. Steps from Union Square, shopping, restaurants and of course NYU!

The light is kept so low in the lobby I cannot read a map, the registration form or even one of the books kept in the lobby end table. This is carrying energy conservation too far, and is inconsistent with the wasted energy in the rooms, which are kept at a bone-chilling 65 degrees. Every time we enter the room we change it to 72, and every day the maids change it again to 65. So I have

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for one night because it's very convenient to NYU. The hotel staff was nice, the room was very clean with a great bathroom. Room was small by non-NYC standards but roomier than other hotels we've stayed at in NYC. We arrived by car and it was difficult to access the hotel because there was a truck blocking the front of the hotel (frustrating when you're trying to negotiate busy NYC traffic). Hotel staff apologized but no compensation offered. Ouch! - was hit with a $65 valet parking fee for one night, which under the circumstances was an affront. Good location by Union Square with plenty of dining options. Overall recommended, especially if you're not driving a car.

Staff welcoming and helpful. Hotel property stylish, comfortable, and conveniently located. Dinner in hotel restaurant was absolutely delicious and a pleasant surprise. Definitely recommend staying here.

My husband and I stayed here for one night and have only good things to say about our experience. We arrived well before check in and our room was ready for us. The room was clean and modern and was a decent size for a NYC hotel. The hallways were also clean which is something I always notice when staying at a hotel. The staff in the lobby were friendly and helpful and overall the hotel was very quiet. The best part about this hotel is the location. You just can't beat it. You have access to almost every subway line and you can walk down to the village or uptown on a nice day. I will definitely be back.

We stayed 5 nights at the Hyatt Union Square-moving our daughter into NYU dorm. The service at this property could not have been better. The employees were friendly and went out of their way to be very helpful. We have already booked our next stay at this property.

This is the most stylish Hyatt that I have seen. It has a small, boutique feel with contemporary upgrades and high-end amenities and offers traditional Passport benefits.It also has the price tag to match. At over $500 per night, it was a splurge yet an enjoyable one.My room was on the smallish size, although certainly in line with other NYC hotel rooms and spacious enough to not feel cramped. What was especially great was the fantastic use of those small spaces - the mini fridge hidden in the coffee table, sleek shower stall, and built-in closet.The location is convenient to most areas of Manhattan and is within walking distance of the subway, many restaurants, the famous farmer's market, and a Trader Joe's. Beware of the line at TJ's however - it wrapped around most of the store at close to 10pm.I had a drink at the lobby bar which is also trendy and loungey-cool.All of the staff at I encountered were friendly, helpful, and professional. They all seemed quite happy to be working there.I would definitely consider a future stay at this Hyatt location, especially if I could find a deal.

The location is great - lots of good restaurants and shops nearby. We stayed here because it was close to our son's dorm at NYU, but even if he lives somewhere else next year, we would stay here again. The staff is very welcoming and helpful, and the rooms are modern and comfortable. It was also great to have choices of wifi - the hotel offered free wifi for checking email or regular web surfing; you could pay if you wanted to stream videos on Netflix. It was refreshing to have these options. The blackout curtains were also first rate. This is essential when you are traveling from the west coast.

Hotel was fantastic! Staff very friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay here again. Front desk kept extra bags for us and helped us with a late checkout for our 5 pm flight. Great room and amenities. Perfect location!!

I have travelled extensively for my businesses over the past 30 years but I haver encountered better service anywhere than we did at the Hyatt Union Square. We had two carts loaded with suitcases, boxes and bags that we were trying to get to Founders Dormitory, 2 blocks away. Victor and Jorge not only loaded the carts, they pushed them all the way to the Dorm! Unbelievable! Afterwards, Charlie helped us switch our rooms so that our daughter could leave a day early, which saved us one night on her room. Our stay and the service at the Hyatt Union Square was by far the best we have ever encountered.

A lovely boutique style hotel with lots of warmth and a great atmosphere ......... the product of a great design and a fantastic team.The patio garden was a lovely touch with the sun out.Great value for money

It is an average hotel with a good restaurant and good location. Rooms were not clean and very dusty. I have stayed 15 days and sometimes needed to clean myself.In our room one of the curtain hook was down and no one fixed it.Towels were old and with spots. Same with bed sheets.Some personnel at front desk are not very friendly. They looked as if they were doing this job unwillingly.In check out, they charged my card before even I have checked details from a print out and said yes. I insisted checking and she said it is all done. This is a first in my entire life since I am travelling a lot due to my business.

Great facilities, I wish I had more time to use it. Very polite and smiley staff always willing to help. Location super central and easy to get from and to anywhere. A great restaurant within the hotel with great food.

Got to the hotel prior to check in and the room wasn't ready, but we were able to leave luggage there. 2 people in our room. We both agree the bed was very hard--surpassing the description of firm. I personally like a firm bed, and this bed was past what I find comfortable, but the pillows were great. Plenty of space for 2 people. Bathroom was nice and had very nice amenities. Had a decent view of 4th Ave. Perfect location. Just around the corner from the subway, plenty of shopping and restaurants and, or course, Union Square Park.

Small, unique boutique Hyatt hotel in a great location right off Union Square. All the employees are young, friendly and helpful.The rooms were very small but so are most rooms in New York City. I will be returning again.

The hotel had the feel of a small boutique, rather than a typical Hyatt. Rooms well appointed, but small. Limited closet space and dresser drawers, but fine for one person. Perfect for work/leisure activity in the Union Sq. Area.

We were overall happy with our stay here at the Hyatt Union Square. We enjoyed that it was very central and close to walk to greenwich village for dinner or down to Soho for shopping. The rooms are small but that is to be exoected in NYC. We had a terrace room which was very nice to have a cute little terrace to step out onto.
