I felt the room was also very clean and quiet compared to what I've seen other reviews state- i really didnt hear much city noise at all which is surprising because the terrace rooms are on the 2nd floor. The shower was great and i loved their shampoo and soap products they smelled excellent and worked great. The only negative I would say is there is very little space to unpack your clothes... The closet has a fee hangers and maybe two small drawers.

It's a boutique hotel, so rooms are on the smaller side, but very clean, very well laid out and very well appointed. From check in, to check out, staff were always smiling & helpful. Nice bar and restaurants. Room was well stocked with extra towels, hairdryer & the usual amenities, and was very well lit. My problem with most hotels are the lack of lighting in the rooms, but the Hyatt was well lit & bright. Great room for business person or a couple , I'm guessing they have larger rooms for families, but not sure. Price was a little on the high side, but it is in the East Village, and it was very well run. Would stay again, and I would recommend it.

I stayed overnight at the Hyatt in Union Square the night of my birthday so I wouldn't have to go all the way home to Westchester. The staff was very pleasant, professional and helpful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! I even asked them if they had a curling iron and they did! It was brought up to my room in 10 minutes.

I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for a business meeting as well as long weekend. I liked being away from really busy areas in NYC and this seemed to be centrally located. I was able to walk to Chelsea, subway, Broadway shops.

We are world wide, seasoned travelers and expect a certain level of comfort and service in a hotel. Our daughter was moving into an apartment in NYC, so we chose the Hyatt, Union Square, expecting a stress free stay. Unfortunately there are so many problems with the hotel; I don’t know where to begin.We arrived on Thursday, August 13th. The sink and toilet in our room were both extremely slow.. The toilet had to always be flushed twice. The coffee maker was broken when we tried to use it in the the morning. During the evening, the air conditioner started making all sorts of unusual loud noises and grunts and we were unable to sleep the entire night. The next morning we packed up and asked for a quiet room with a functioning sink, toilet and air conditioner. We were first taken to a room next to the elevator, an absolute no for us. We were then given a second room . As soon as we entered the room and turned on the air we recognized that the air conditioning was completely broken. The front desk absolutely refused to move us again, saying that they would send up an engineer. We were told some sort of story about the temperature in NY. However we ARE intelligent enough to know when some thing is BROKEN….having nothing to do with the temperature in NY. It was beyond humiliating for us not to be believed …..to have to just sit there and endure an un air-conditioned room in the middle of a NY summer waiting to see if it can be fixed. The engineer spent 45 minutes attempting to fix the system before he gave up. We asked to be moved again. The front desk was very slow and it took another 45 minutes of sitting in this non air conditioned room to provide us with, yet, another room. Finally we were given a handicapped room. This entire move to another room took an ENTIRE MORNING, eating up our time needed to help our daughter.  The shower and the toilet were both in the shower. (handicapped room)Any time you showered the entire bathroom floor was wet for an hour. Shoes and pants became wet any time you needed to use the toilet after someone showered Nonetheless we kept that room out of desperation. Our coffee and toiletries were never replaced by the maid even once, though we complained to the front desk. Our key cards was cancelled twice after we extended our2 day stay to a third and then to a fourth. requiring us to go back down to the lobby and wait on line two separate times by the front desk for new cards. The front desk was often busy and we were unable to call for our car when needed. The phone would simply ring with no one answering it. Instead we had to go downstairs and wait 20 minutes instead of pre ordering. Finally, to add insult to injury, at 8:15 in the morning on Monday, August 17, someone used their key and simply WALKED INTO OUR ROOM…..no knocking. I screamed and the person left. We assumed it was a hotel employee. I reported it and barely received an apology. We never did find out who was responsible. This really alarmed us. It was completely unacceptable.It was a busy time moving our daughter into an apartment in NYC. We did not need the added stress of a less than mediocre hotel. The stay was awful and I would have to rate it POOR. The hotel did take off one night from the bill. However, this in no way compensated for the distress we endured.We look forward to your reply.And this was our reply. Please notice the FOUR spelling errors in the reply from the Hyatt. Very unprofessional."Thank you so much for your email message regarding your stay at Hyatt Union Suqare ; it is my pleasure to assist you.I would like ot say I apologize on behalf of Hyatt Hotels and Resorts, for the stay in which you have described. I will be forwarding yoru feedback to the hotel's management for furher assistance regarding this matter.If there is anything else with which I may assist you, please let me know."Best Regards,Sasha NealRES Guest Services SpecialistGlobal Contact Center - Omaha9805 Q StreetOmaha, Nebraska

our second visit to new york and wasnt dissappointed!! fabulous boutique hotel in a prime location, close enough to explore all that manhatten has to offer! can really recommend it! we had a lovely stay here, & the staff couldnt be more helpful!

My daughter and I were so very pleased with the look and feel of this Hyatt location. I felt it has the reliability of a Hyatt, but the ambiance of a small chic boutique. The staff were warm and welcoming, especially Charlie, Melissa and Jennifer. The staff seemed very happy to assist in anyway possible.We felt special. Only a few rooms per floor. Very private feel. Our room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. I dislike street noise, so I was relieved to have a room on the 10th floor facing away from the street. We had a unique view of an old wooden water tower and old fire escapes. Hard wood flooring was fantastic. Lavish linens. We did not feel like we were in a small room. Besides, we spent most of our days wandering about. We were able to get discount Broadway tickets (TKTS) for evening fun.The fitness room was a great way to start the day. So easy to walk or take the subway (train). This was a great location for exploring the city. Check out The Strand Bookstore around the corner. Walk to the Village.Jason (I think I have the name right), did a great job arranging a private car to take us to the airport. It was less than or equal to a cab and far more comfortable. (thank you!)

Hotel was very well maintained. Rooms were very upscale and modern. Very minimal downside was water pressure in faucet, no turndown service was given. Staff was very friendly and cheerful. Would recommended it for anyone who wants a little getaway into the heart of manhattan

I had a excelent stay in this Hotel. The room was clean and beautiful and the staff was very friendly. The location of the Hotel was also really good for me. Sleep quality was only "ok" because of the traffic in the early morning, but I guess thats normal in New York City. All in all I can say that I would book this Hotel again, and I would also recommend it to all my friends.

Great hotel and great people & service. The bar was not open at certain times of the day, but all other services were excellent. The laundry service was especially efficient. Not cheap, but where is in New York?

This hyatt is located at a perfect location just a couple blocks south of Union Square. Convenient to everything such as shopping, parking, dining, night life... We rented two rooms for a night and the hotel was awesome! Very hip and luxurious decor, super-clean, good size for NYC and service was great. The overall vibe is just cool. The hotel was in perfect condition. I was suprised to learn they have been open for 2 years! You would have thought we were the first ones to stay there based on how immaculate everything was! Keepit up Hyatt Union Square!!!

I have stayed here a few times on trips to visit my daughter who goes to school in the city. The location is perfect and Union Square is one of my favorite areas. The restaurant was good too. The rooms are very nice. I have stayed in different types here. They do have some larger than others and are worth the extra cost if you need space.

Best NYC hotel I've been to in some time - staff was exceptional, simply outstanding! Even remembered our names from valet to check in staff! In town for a visit to NYU - great location, rooms, bar for late night cocktails and restaurant next door.

First of all, the service is excellent from reservation, sales to front desk.For those with a sweet tooth, the chocolate thins are cool (milk and dark with special flavors).I stayed in a comfortable sky room facing the 14th street. No view although on the 10th floor. However, I have no complaints on the room. The bathroom area is modern and chic. The location is convenient, walking distance to Metro, Whole Foods market and the Farmer's market at Union square. The Fourth is an excellent restaurant on premise. The Strand bookstore and a famous Max Brennar Chocolate store/cafe is nearby. The Coffee Shop by the Union Square is a great place for brunch. Note that no traffic is allowed on the Saturdays at the front of the hotel. Plan accordingly if you have a Sat flight before 2pm.wifi is good too. Btw, the roof top area is closed at this time. I would come back soon.

Always enjoy staying here when I visit on business! Clean, modern rooms with exceptional front desk service and amenities. It's central in NYC and is a quick subway away from anywhere you need to go. Will stay here every time I visit.

I really enjoyed our room in Union Square. The only complaint I had was no dresser drawers to put our clothes in. We had to keep in the suitcase. I traveled with a teenager and she was sort of messy. The 2nd complaint was that they charge you $100.00 per day for incidentals. They take it out of your credit card the day you arrive. I got most of it back. Paid around $29.00 for the candy my granddaughter ate that was in the room. I had booked this room because there was a picture of an outside bar. When I asked they said they no longer have it. The good thing about this place is the people that work there remember your name. Every time I came in or out of the hotel they acknowledge me by my name. They will get a cab for you and help you with your bags. The dwnstairs bar was cool and so was the bartender even though they were closing when I came in on a Saturday night looking for a drink after the play.

I originally chose the Hyatt Union Square because my daughter lives in the area. Now the staff recognizes me when I arrive for my stay, and couldn't be more welcoming. My husband was with me this trip and was also impressed by the helpful staff. We will definitely return.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Union Square New York. The rooms were a bit small, and Hyatt needs to get over their fascination with the "Barn Door" style door to the bathrooms. That said, the staff consistently greeted me by name and always made me feel welcome. Its a great location for those of you interested in all that there is to offer in Tribecca, SOHO, and the Village.

Hotel, room and bathroom was beautiful. We did not use the restaurant or lounge but they were very nice. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was very convenient to NYU. We would definitely stay there again!

Stayed there for several days for a wedding. Had several rooms - the staff is very pleasant and helpful - great experience! Rooms at corner of 13th and 4th avenue were great. Parking available across the street

Great location with friendly, knowledgeable staff. Close to subway. We slept good on terrific, king size bed. Very effective blackout curtains. The pillows were amazing and I'm picky about my pillows. Lobby had ice water with lime or strawberries available each day. We stayed three nights and enjoyed seeing this area of NYC. The hotel had two complimentary bikes for guests. They adjusted our seats, gave us a bike map and off we rode along the Hudson on the west side. We usually stay in Midtown, but enjoyed this more.

I have stayed at this hotel at least 5 times and it always has been a good experience. The staff is friendly and always help with any requests for upgrades, early check ins and late check outs.The rooms are great and super clean.The gym comes in handy :) I haven't tried the restaurant inside the hotel as the location of the hotel gives access to so many restaurants around. Loads of shopping areas easily accessible as well.This has now become my Goto hotel in New York.

Nice hotel. Great staff. Wonderful location! Elevators are pretty slow and the fridge in the room doesn't keep anything cold. It's crazy!! I heard other people discussing the same issues. That's all!!

Room 209.Stayed over 3 weeks. Best location. Super gym. Private outside terrace option.Untrained staff.Malfunctioning elevators. Midnight construction noise. That hotel didn't want to end. Ants in room.Even after cleaned twice. Nyc style rooms.Small/no storage. In-house/in-room dining inadequate and better outside.Individuals try, but generally faulty and at times bad service. Victor and the other ushers holding the door are the ones saving this place, in fact would give 0 if I could.

Great location, friendly staff. Loved the lemon water!! The area was great by Union Square park where it was easy access to subway and places to eat in walking distance!! I would recommend this location!

Enjoyed going to lunch, theatre and a late bite at the hotel bar. There are many restaurants, bars and stores around Union Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were told you can take the nearby subway to get to see the Mets which we are interested in doing.

This Hyatt is located near Uhall and Palladium, two major dorms for NyU. It is fairly close to NYU, itself. We have stayed here several times. The rooms are spotless and modern. Lots of convenient places to plug in. The courtyard rooms are much quieter-fewer sirens and horns. The restaurant, The Fourth, has excellent food, and is very accommodating to guests.

Stayed here for 1 night for work - this is my second stay at this property, and will definitely be back again. It is truly a boutique hotel feel - nothing like the ginormous hotels in midtown. Rooms are small (this is NYC - what do you expect?) but well appointed and very comfortable - everything you need. Great vibe in the lobby and hotel bar, and nice sized fitness center in the lower level. Key is the LOCATION - right by funky Union Square (GREAT people watching, lots of weird) and tons of good shopping and restaurants within walking distance. 2 blocks away from a Green line subway stop so really easy to get up to midtown or downtown for those wanting to avoid above-ground traffic. Nice perks at the hotel - free loaner bikes to pedal around the city, and a really nice breakfast place attached to the lobby (free if you are Diamond - and it's good to be Hyatt Diamond!!) Wholeheartedly recommend for your next visit to NYC.

Our first visit and I usually avoid chains, but I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was spotless, quiet--completely quiet, well appointed (once we found how cleverly all space was used and found the coffee pot!) Great location just off 14th Street subway station, on the same lines as Grand Central Station, so we never needed a cab. Around the corner from the Strand Bookstore for any serious reader. Wide variety of eats available in easy walking distance, so we never tried the on-site choices.

I got upgraded to a corner room. Really comfortable bed, well designed space and gorgeous bathroom. The staff was seriously outstanding. Sincere and friendly. The only thing I wasn't a super fan about was the limited room service menu. I was hoping for more American/comfort food being that it was a Hyatt but they use their restaurant (Fourth)'s kitchen. Extremely limited items. Not a ton of choices within walking distance if you are traveling solo. I tried the Mexican restaurant across the street - gross! Overall I would return here and probably try the sushi place across the street.

Hotel is well located near Union Square and very convenient to explore entire city.Rooms are small but modern and very well decorated and clean. It is close to shops, nice restaurants. Staff is friendly and helpful. Was a good choice for a few days in NYC.

We had to stay for 6 nights due to a family emergency, and the staff could not have been nicer. The room, while on the smaller side, was nicely decorated and up-to-date. The staff in the bar was fantastic! All of the bartenders/servers were gracious, personable and experienced bartenders. We loved decompressing there after a stress day. (Music was much too loud on some nights---like a bar that's trying too hard.) Only downsides were spotty housekeeping and front desk staff who were either very helpful or provided wrong info. Too bad one has to pay for coffee in the morning. All in all, a very nice property in a bustling area. Fast Wifi too. We'll be back!

The entrance, bar, room are all ok. The staff at the front desk are ok but not so warm. The worse thing about the hotel is room service, i.e. Cleaning, placement of indemnities, towels, etc. We have complained many times and they could not get it right. The room was also left dirty on many occasions.

This is not your typical Hyatt. As you can guess, space on Manhattan is rather limited, and that is reflected in this facility. The lobby, hallways, and rooms are all rather small, and there is insufficient space (drawer and closet) space to store all the clothes you would use on a multi-day stay. But that is the only negative for the property. The hotel appears to have been renovated or redesigned fairly recently, perhaps within the last few years. Everything from the elevators to the rooms seems to reflect a newness that, if not authentic, then has been well maintained. An example of a modern look is apparent in the rooms in the desk / entertainment center. Modern, sleek design, that is reflective of the room size restrictions. Another example is in the shower stall with large tiles and a "rain" type shower head.As mentioned, this is not your typical Hyatt. You might think of this as a Hyatt boutique offering. Very clean and new, modern feel, but limited space. Surrounding neighborhood has several very good restaurants and stores. Easy access to the subway systems. We would certainly be pleased to stay here again.

This is the second time we've stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The lobby and bar area have an active vibe at night, but it doesn't carry over into the rooms. We were on the 2nd floor and it was quiet. While our room was small, it was well-appointed. The staff is very friendly and nice. Our one minor wish is that the lighting in the bathroom was better. It's very low, so if you are a guy who needs to shave, it's a bit of a test.

My overnight stay was comfortable in every way. Loved the stylish and boutique-y feel to the entire hotel. Great place to meet up with friends and relax. Staff was exceptional with big smiles greeting me each time I came thru the door. The room was a bit small but, serene & included plenty of amenities. Bed was quite comfortable. Overall, I felt well taken care of!

I was working in Williamsburg and was looking for a hotel along the L train. The Hyatt was minutes away from the Metro stop and had a great selection of restaurants and shopping near by. I was staying for a few weeks, and the room is not set up for long-term stays, very little storage, but the staff was amazing and the location made up keeping everything piled in my suitcase.

As Diamond member in May 2015 I stayed in 3 Hyatt Hotels in New York: 4 nights at the Hyatt Times Square, 8 nights at Hyatt Union square and 1 night at Grand Hyatt New York. While the Hyatt Times Square fully fulfilled the Hyatt standards I am used outside the US, Grand Hyatt was ok, Hyatt Union square was a disappointment. Below I describe the experience of the Hyatt Union Square#When I arrived at the hotel the first impression was positive the design of the hotel is modern and a bit different in a positive way. Location is great, subway close by. Check in was quick but the room was disappointing. Be aware that what the Hyatt Union square pages calls quiet room (the cheapest room but still about USD 380) means that you room is dark because if you look out of the window you look against an ugly wall which is about 5 meters away from your window. Not much light comes into the room so I wanted to change the room.As Diamond member I get normally an upgrade and I asked for it. They told me I will get the next day. Asking the next day, they told my again nothing is free but the next day. Normally if you stay in a Hyatt the staff is approaching you telling you that now they have a free room. But there nobody approaches you. So I asked again the next night – they said they forgot inform me - finally I got a different room which was then very nice, big windows, nice view therefore positive although indeed not so quiet – but better you hear traffic than you stay in a dark room (furniture are also dark, which looks nice if there is a lot of light in the room, but not nice if not much light comes from the window). True is also what other wrote – you hear almost everything through the doors if sbd is outside. As I had a free weekend I wanted to rent a bike on Saturday as it is promoted on their Homepage. Unfortunately it turned out that they have only two bikes available – first come – first serve. So there was no bike available on Saturday. Therefore on Sunday I went up early – bike was still available and I made a tour. After about 100 meters I realized that the chain protection – was half broken. So I had to improvise but then it worked nice. Coming back I informed the reception, they said they will repair it – so only one bike was available for the others the rest of the day. The next day I saw that they just had taken off the chain protection. I was just wondering whether a 5star hotel where you pay on average 430 USD per night cannot afford a third or fourth bike – taking into account that they promote the bikes actively? But as I found out later there are other ways. The public bikes to rent at the station for some dollars work quite well. The staff at the reception is young and there is quite a big number working there. I saw at least 7 during the week I stayed there. About 50% are friendly – with the other 50% you have the impression that they are more happy if you don´t ask them too much – not Hyatt standard and no comparison with the good and friendly team e.g. at Hyatt Times Square. Also it seems that staff is not interested that Hotel makes business. Before I arrived I asked via email for a special price for a longer stay. Several days no answer and once it came no real use of the answer. When I was there I asked the blond lady at the reception whether I could speak with sbd. from reservation or sales: Answer: No, as they are only hear from 9 a.m. to 5 a.m. (Remark: I arrived on a Friday at 3. p.m. asked already at that day whether I could speak with sbd. form reservations/sales but reception told me that everybody left already!!!). Then the lady asked me what it is about. I told her that I wanted to ask for a rate for November as I will stay here for 14 days. The lady answered: Just look in the internet (….which does not show you special rates).There are also some other small points which is not Hyatt standard: e.g.: I do not want that my room is cleaned every day. In each Hyatt in such a case you get a message through the door that room service could not clean because you had the “do not disturb” sign on. I assume this is done to see whether the customer is doing fine – which is proved when the guest takes the message. Well, this is not done at Hyatt Union Square. That are also a number of small things that normally make the difference of a Hyatt and a Sheraton – but which are not performed in Hyatt Union Square. Finally the absolute highlight of negative experience of my stay: As Diamond member I have breakfast free (in US as there is no buffet but a la carte until a certain amount). The first day I ate eggs sunny side up. It came with potatoes which is unusual for me. So the next day I asked for the eggs sunny side up but instead with potatoes I wanted to have bacon. To my surprise the waiter told me that he has to ask his superior. So he went to a lady, obviously his sperior, and I saw how she made an angry face and she shaked the face right and left. Waiter came back and told me that it is not possible but that I can order the bacon as side dish?! After I had breakfast I went to the superior of the waiter and told her that I never experienced in a five star hotel that I cannot change a side dish (even at Mc Donald’s you can tailor your hamburger if you wish). She told me that that´s the policy here. On my argument that the most policy is to be customer oriented she answered why I complain, I did eat the potatoes anyway. So I had enough went to the reception asked for the manager in charge. He apologized and told me that the Restaurant does not belong to the Hyatt there is only an agreement with them and they work that they come to Hyatt standard. Result: The next 5 days I did not go anymore for breakfast and I did not go to the restaurant anymore for dinner. Ok, here is what normally Hyatt Standard is: I stayed for business in Hyatt Madeleine Paris: I had problems with my stomach and asked the waitress whether I could have sth which is good for my stomach but not on the menu. The waitress told me that this is not problem and the next days I got clear vegetable soup, mashed potatoes etc. – they simply took care of me. That is why I choose Hyatt. When I asked in Paris whether I could talk with sales, reception informed their colleagues, they email and called me and we found a time where we could meet and since then I am always trying to go to this hotel with my team. All this is missing at Hyatt Union Square although it is not really a bargain to stay there. Last remark: I asked today for a rate for my 14 days stay at the hotel and I got an answer the same day. So hopefully things are getting better.

We only stayed overnight, but have absolutely nothing to complain about. We parked our vehicle using their valet service, which was very convenient. The staff was pleasant both at the front desk and in the restaurant when we were there for breakfast. Room was stylishly decorated. We stayed in a studio, and while it was small, it didn't feel cramped with 2 people in it. Would definitely stay here again.

First time at the Hyatt Union Square New York, but certainly not the last. The hotel is in a great spot. Room was spacious for NYC and comfortable. The staff were friendly and super helpful! I highly recommend.

bathroom was on top of the bed, but besides that great location and nice new hotel amenities. Staff was very friendly also and room was very clean. The bed was comfy, just wish I wasnt near the elevator or stairs because I kept hearing it all night.

I really enjoyed staying in this boutique type Hyatt hotel. The rooms were beautifully appointed with modern decor. Once you stepped inside from the chaotic Union Square it was a very calming and serene atmosphere. Since hotel doesn't have a ton of rooms, it never felt jammed with guests at the desk, waiting for elevators or in the halls.

My son was recovery from surgery the 5 nights we stayed at the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located to grocery stores, restaurants and the subway. Everyone at the hotel is very helpful and friendly. It was disappointing that the roof top area wasn't open…we were looking forward to having a place to sit outside. Also, I called several days before our stay to reserve a refrigerator with a freezer compartment. I was told they would reserve one for our room. When I arrived there wasn't a fridge/freezer in our room and the mini bar fridge did not cool at all. The hotel sent up buckets of ice, but we needed a place for ice packs and cold drinks 24/hr a day. On the second day they delivered a working refridgerator. Had the hotel told me ahead of time they don't offer a freezer option, I probably would have looked at other hotel options.

Love this hotel. Have stayed here a few times. It's right in the heart of the Union Square, Village area. Hotel is clean, rooms are spotless and unique. Staff is wonderful. My new favorite hotel in NYC>

Only stayed here for a few days, but the room was very clean, and had a very modern appeal. Comfortable, although a little on the smaller side. Very tall/large people may find the space a bit too tight, but it was great for me. Decent Wi-Fi speeds, although I expected more from buying the higher tier of internet. (Only about 10Mbps down at best) I would still come again because the staff was very nice and accommodating, and it was easy to work and rest in my room.

Hotel was ok! Booked hotel on Tuesday and was told of I called back and prepaid by Thursday, I could get a 40 lower rate. I called back on Wednesday and they would not honor. Manager told me that someone else did their booking and rates changed daily.

The hotel is nice and I have stayed there before. It is close to shops, restaturants and public transportation. The rooms are clean and feel roomy even though they are NewYork size rooms. On my last visit while on business, the wake up call never came and I missed two meetings. This is a basic service that all hotels offer and should be managed with no effort. The manager was very apologetic, but the apology did not cover the lost cost of business. Next time I will set my own alarm.

I could not have asked for nicer and cooperative people as those at the desk at the door where ever they were needed. Helpful friendly very polite making any question I had easy. I also appreciated that the day after the wedding they asked how it went, excellent

Excellent location, excellent service, and great room. Everyone was extremely friendly and ready to assist at a moments notice. Rooms were stylish and most importantly, comfortable. Highly recommended!

This is the perfect medium sized hotel in a great location, close to lots of fabulous restaurants, shopping, and subways. The streamlined rooms offer everything you need in a hotel room, including very nice bathrooms. The friendly staff and on site restaurants and bar are also great additions.

So many good things to say about this hotel! Clean, extremely friendly service, modern, nice! The location is awesome! Very quick walk to Union Square which was a great place to hang out and outdoors restaurant there and a farmers market on Saturday! Not a far walk to the flat iron building and Eatly! Definitely will stay here again its in a less congested more pleasant area of the city!

Stayed here for 3 days for business. Enjoyed the neighborhood location by NYU and the room design was an open loft design which at first had me scratching my head but by the end of my stay I really liked. Maximum use of the room space. Had drinks in the lobby bar and breakfast in the restaurant and both were very good. bar has great wine and top shelf bourbon and scotch selections. Rooms very clean and the showers are AWESOME! I took the longest showers I ever have in a hotel because they are luxurious. Staff was excellent! However they only have two elevators and they are slow. That kept it from 5 stars rating

The lobby is small but cheery modern and the location is ideal for those wanting to explore and take in the east village, greenwich, union square or hop the train up to midtown. We were graciously offered an upgrade to a lower-floor room that happens to have a private patio garden. The rooms are a bit smaller than other Hyatts but.. this is New York. Plus, one should be out and about as much as possible anyway. Friendly staff, helpful with luggage, directions and hailing cabs as needed. Good stuff Hyatt, keep up the good work.

Lovely location with some good restaurants close by. The Union Square market is worth a visit. Friendly service. The elevators are very slow other than that a great place to stay. Room is cleverly fitted to maximise on the space. Powerful shower and quiet rooms.

We stayed at this one and the Hyatt in Washington, D.C. Both locations are absolutely stunning hotels to stay in! Beautiful building, beautiful rooms! Very affordable, without sacrificing any quality!

Lobby lovely and beautiful contemporary, front desk staff amazing. Housekeeping in great need of improvement - items missing, toilet seat with a leftover drink lime in float... Elevator a bit slow as no service elevator - which the cleaning staff bumped me for. The amazing front desk staff deserves backup...

New and stylish, immaculately clean, attentive and helpful staff (from the front desk to the housekeeping staff). That about sums it up. My only suggestion is an upgrade to the amount of lighting in the room. The lighting is a little too dim for my taste. A little more bright lighting would be welcome.

This is our new favorite--modern styling, clearn, efficient, friendly staff, and in the center of everything. Union Square has its own events, music, farmers market, and a Whole Foods for grabbing snacks. The subway at Union Square can get you anywhere. Walkable to Greenwhich Village.

This was a very nice hotel on 4th and 14th streets in Manhattan. The proximity to the subway and walkable neighborhoods was very easy to navigate. The rooms were small but had everything you could need. Everything was well placed and no space was wasted.

We have choosen Hyatt Union Square because it is placed so central (in the meaning of geographically) and not as busy as Time Square area. It takes around 50 min walk to Central Park and the same time to the financial district. And very close to Soho/Chelsea/Meatpacking District, approx. 30 min walk to Whitney Museum/High Lane. The hotel service was very good, helpful and friendly. Only you have to tell them to clean the room as it has been done after the first day, but missed it on the second and would have missed on the third - but as soon as I asked for it, it worked out well again. The price/service for July was good also in comparison to other hotels. They do serve a really nice breakfast (a la carte) in their restaurant, great food quality. Overall, we would come here again, it was just the perfect location for us.

I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for one night on a business trip for an event across the park from the hotel. The location proved to be advantageous for grabbing cabs or walking the neighborhood. The hotel is clean with well-appointed rooms and nice bathroom products. For a business stay when you're less concerned about the views of the city, this is a good choice. But if you're in town to take in the views from your room - which is a big part of a trip to New York City - this may not be your best choice. Many of the rooms face either a wall or an interior courtyard of others buildings. My only complaint is the electric plug in the bathroom didn't work, even after resetting the GFI, leaving me in a lurch while trying to get ready for my work day - no hair dryer or curler in the bathroom and no time to have maintenance come and fiddle with it. On the up side, the hotel was more than accommodating by giving me (or my employer) a break on the room charge for my inconvenience.

Fantastic location. Close to everything - walking & subway. Rooms quiet & well serviced. Staff great. It's not a massive hotel with so many rooms you feel lost. There's a more intimate feel. This is my go-to hotel when I am in New York

Hyatt Union square is a good choice if you like this location. I like this location.Rooms are small but clean.If you are road side it might be noisy.Prices are affordable and staff very kind.Breakfast is ok but avoid the sausage, in fact it is merguez !

Pros: Great location, quiet room, good a/c, nice shower, lighting labeledCons: small room, refrigerator doesnt work, mood lighting in bathroom instead of task lighting. I personally hate the trend of dark poorly lit bathrooms, impossible to see for applying make up and I hope this trend goes away. No comfortable chair. One elevator was out yesterday.

Lovely hotel with excellent staff. Front desk personnel were very helpful and friendly. Bell service was also very helpful and quick to help with taxi service. Rooms were clean and room service was great! Would definitely stay again with family.

Great location, friendly staff, clean cute rooms, lovely atmosphere and delicious food served at the restaurants and bar in the hotel, they even have a gym on site!!!Exceeded our expectations ❤️We stayed for three nights and we ll definitely stay there again.

Clean, contemporary, great location, friendly employees, cool restaurants.We are coming back in August and are staying here again.Love the Union Square area especially with the farmers market on the weekends.

This is one of my favorite parts of the city and I'm so happy there's now a really nice place to stay. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was friendly and helpful. My room was great as were the restaurants. I look forward to staying here again!

I recently had occasion to stay in NYC and decided to go with one of my favorite brands, Hyatt. I've probably stayed in 5 or 6 different Hyatt's around the country and they all have offered a similar high level of service and accommodations. When I arrived early Saturday morning I easily pulled in front of the hotel and was greeted by a very friendly but professional bellman who immediately went to my trunk and removed my luggage then showed me inside and valeted my car. Once inside I had to do a double take to ensure I was in the right hotel. It was not your typical institutional hotel lobby but more of a chic, boutique hotel that NYC is famous for. My room was not available yet (it was only 10:00 am) and they offered to place my bag in the room once it became available. When I returned to the hotel that afternoon and made it to my room my bag was already there and the clothes I brought on a hanger were hung in the armoire. The room was not your typical box and bath style it had lots of modern styling which included a wine rack and glass set up , cut into the wall material. ( I really should have taken a picture) the bathroom was smartly set up with space saving pocket doors and an excellent shower. ( no tub) The room was properly equipped with motion sensors that illuminated the room as necessary. When we needed ice we had to call the front desk (the ice arrived before I finished opening the wine) . Lastly the room (217) I had came with a very spacious (even for NYC) balcony with seating for 4 but room for more. Clearly this is a hotel with a personality equal to its professionalism.

Why I love the Hyatt Union Square:-Boutique feel, but you also get Hyatt points!-Always clean-Updated, modern styling-Great place to meet friends for drinksI would recommend it for personal or business travel!

As always it was a pleasure staying at Hyatt Union Square! The staff, the room, the location and the atmosphere is amazing. After having visited 106 countries and several hundred hotels worldwide, Hyatt Union Square is still my number one choice. The staff always take their time for the guests, they are extremely helpful and mindful. I will recommend this seven days a week!Thanks everyone for a delightful stay.

Stayed with my extended family at the UnSq Hyatt. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms were modern and up to date. Safe, clean, cool lobby. Had a lost baggage situation, and staff was very helpful in receiving and calling to track it down.

I was pleasantly surprised at the experience here. Nothing bad at all to say, the beds were to die for and rooms were super comfortable for a NYC hotel. The only suggestion is that the restaurant and bar downstairs should stay open later than they do.

Top rate hotel in every way. Modern, contemporary in style in the heart of Union Square......shopping and restaurants unmatched. Staff extremely caring and friendly. One of the best bathrooms I've seen in a hotel. Would very highly recommend!

Must have been recently redone as things were very 'cool!' Great colors, bright, lit and a real gym! Being a fitness fanatic this hotel was ideal with clean air, great gym, healthy options and in a great location. Manager Dave M was excellent and the staff was very helpful, but not overbearing. Would highly recommend staying here for business and pleasure.

The Hyatt Union Square is a great location to multiple subway lines and easy to walk to a number of areas and restaurants. The hotel is clean and modern but typical NYC size rooms. Wish the rooftop area was open!

Very attractive accommodations and professional staff. Excellent location near parks and restaurants of every cuisine. The room was spotless and very attractively furnished. All personnel were eager to help and displayed a pleasant attitude. plan to return for future visits.

By far the best Hyatt in NYC, service, restaurant, work out facility and location. Extremely clean and comfortable. Rooms were great, AC was quiet and good for summer.Bar is out standing and great Breakfast

I realize it is hard to be in a really bad location in Manhattan, but this is very central and only a short block from the Union Square subway station. The hotel was clean and modern as were the rooms. We were on the 10th floor so the street level noise was minimal by NYC standards. Our room was spacious and well laid out. I loved the hotel and hope to stay here again soon.

Exceptional service, great location a block from Union Square, stylish and comfortable room, very nice restaurant and bar on site with outdoor patio, and easy valet parking made for a very enjoyable stay.

I knew the property would be nice and thought it might be a little predictable, but I was more than pleasantly surprised with my overall experience at the Hyatt Union Square. It had a casual, hip environment. The room was unique and the right size for a single adult. The showers were refreshing and, most importantly, the bed was perfect!

We stayed for 8 nights, everyone at the hotel and at the fourth room was super nice and made us feel welcome. The room was always spotless. We really enjoyed the stay and we will likely return here on our next trips to NY.

My stay was comfortable and luxurious! It was so nice to come back to a peaceful and relaxing room after being in the constant hustle and bustle of the city. The staff is incredibly friendly and the rooms are just gorgeous!

Despite limited space, the room's layout gave a feeling of spaciousness; convenient location and super friendly, helpful and competent staff made this stay very enjoyable. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Was visiting NYC for two weekend nights to see college age daughter whose dorm was around the corner from the hotel. I would definitely recommend the hotel and its restaurant. Fabulous location, too. Staff was highly accommodating. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was excellent and the wait staff very attentive and personal.

Girls' trip to celebrate my birthday, see sights and visit my son who lives in Brooklyn. Got the type of room requested. Beds and pillows in our room very comfortable! Bathroom had two parts and if I could have taken the glass walk-in shower with the leg shaving bar back home with me I would have! Made two requests and delivery to the room was within minutes. I can't say enough about the friendly desk staff who always spoke to us coming and going. I had the trip planned for months and right before the trip my daughter broke her ankle and brought crutches and a knee scooter. The staff were very helpful and when we asked about directions twice the doorman walked to the corner to make sure we headed in the right direction. We found the Union Square location good for food, items from a Walgreens, getting cabs/Uber, etc. Despite my daughter's challenges, we had a fantastic trip and enjoyed our stay with Hyatt and would return on a subsequent visit.

service was kind, informative, responsive, and personable. room was very chic and stocked with great magazines and toiletries. best part was having so much space while still being in such a central location! thank you!

Great staff, great service and super location to soho and NYU. I would return to this hotel. They were very courteous and helpful at all times. Very cool vibe also. The only criticism was the food in the cafe was over cooked and overpriced even for NYC.

Have stayed at the Union Square Hyatt many times and have always enjoyed my stay. I travel a lot for business and this hotel has become one of my favorites in NYC. Great neighborhood, great staff and service. Rooms are a bit small, but welcome to NY!

I have stayed at many hotels claiming to be 4 and 5 star hotels. This one has definitely earned the 5 star rating. A high level of service starts from the second you arrive and are greeted by the doorman, making it clear that their objective is to make your stay as enjoyable and comfortable as possible. The decor and atmosphere was crisp and inviting. At the upstairs restaurant, the staff and manager Mac continued with a high level of service. If you are traveling for business, the lounge in the lobby was perfect for casual business meetings. The decor in the room was beautiful, and the amenities and comfort of the rooms was unmatched. Great location in the heart of the New York City, close to transportation and Union Square. Will definitely be staying here again.

Good enough rooms. Food excellent. Does the job, Can't be bothered to elaborate. Look out for Mac who'll keep you entertained. I don't have anything more to say - let me out of this bloody website....

My husband and I just recently stayed at the hotel, in one of the suites, with private patio. Layout of room was beautiful and roomy. The location is in the middle of everything and anything you need, restaurants, park and great shopping. I was most impressed with the service we received, extremely professional, friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, the bed very comfortable. We were also impressed with the restaurant in the hotel as well, service and food were great.

Attending a conference, stayed one night. Very welcoming and helpful staff. Room on lower floor with patio, very nice to take in the sounds of New York and relax. Close by Union Square. Room well laid out and set up for working, ie good work space.

We decide to try someplace new on our annual NYC trip. We figured Hyatt would be a special experience, but we were disappointed. The good: rooms are artfully appointed, very clean, and well maintained. Very trendy decor. The bad: NYC tiny, plus the bathroom was literally in the bedroom with only a mirror separating the two. Also, the shower handle came off in my hand when I turned it to set temperature, and the cold faucet turned in the wrong direction over the basin. The good: nice turndown service includes clean towels and fancy chocolate. staff were cheerful and polite and full of offers to help. The bad:they didn't deliver. I'd ordered a refrigerator in advance for medical reasons, and we called that evening from the taxi. The clerk said she would look for one. When we got there, she said she couldn't find one but there would be one around noon the next day. We figured someone would be checking out from another room and we could get that fridge. Fortunately I had ice to get me through the night. But in the morning they confessed that they didn't really have ANY refrigerators and would try to get one from another hotel. I took my medication and ice packs to our hosts' home-a bit inconvenient but safe. The hotel offered to store my medication in their fridge (after the inaccurate communications was hardly going to trust them with expensive medication that I needed to stay alive), but they had no freezer for the ice packs. Finally that afternoon they called to say they had a fridge, and all was well. I appreciate that Someone went out of the way to get that fridge. But this is the first time I've ever had trouble getting a fridge in any hotel at any level--from the lower level chains to the Ritz. And to tell me they could not store the Ice packs--are they saying there is no freezer in their two restaurants and one bar? Scary idea! I love the location, but they have some work to do to bring it to Hyatt quality.

Clean room, quiet, comfortable bed, enough space, great location near 2 NYU dorms. Faucet in bathroom vanity is too close to basin (only about 3 inches or so), a little annoying. No counter on vanity so I used the drawers.

I was extremely pleased with this hotel and would definitely go back. The rooms are delightful and the lobby has a lovely restaurant and bar area. The location is excellent and the service was awesome.

My friends and I had an awesome one night stay here! The atmosphere at hotel is very cool and the staff was great. Dan checked us in and was a pleasure to talk to and then Michael followed up to make sure our stay was a good one. We had fabulous breakfast at fourth. Delicious cappuccinos and fresh squeezed juice. Not a single thing I can think of to complain about!

My friend and I stayed here together, and found the experience to be fantastic. The hotel is small, but the staff are friendly and accommodating (seriously, they had an answer to anything I asked for!) The rooms are also small, but what would you expect for a hotel in the middle of Manhattan? The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was also superb - especially the shower, I felt like I had a spa shower in the room. There are food options within the hotel, but its Union Square location means there are lots of other food options around. Think Coffee and Liquiteria are just across the street, and Union Square is a two minute walk.

I loved the room but was disappointed with the morning service and snippy front desk personnel. There needs to be a food option starting at 6am. I did not enjoying walking 8 blocks (6 down, 2 over) to get breakfast at 6am.

Enjoyed everything about the hotel. The room, staff, location. On Saturday the street was closed to traffic for a huge street market, which was good fun too. Very modern, but with high service standards, I'd happily return at anytime.

I was only in NYC for one night for a business trip. My meeting was down near WTC, so this Hyatt location was better than others in midtown. I was pleasantly surprised at this Hyatt property which was the size of a large boutique hotel. The decor was beautiful with a relaxing, natural feel. Rather than catch a cab to go just a few blocks to dinner, there are two sturdy European bicycles for free check-out in the lobby. It was perfect. The bar and bartender were great, a nice place for a nightcap.

Stayed here for a week with my family as it was a convenient location for us to travel around and check out NYC. Overall the stay was pleasant. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negative points were the two elevators to the rooms and fitness centre was too slow. If you're in a rush for time make sure you leave in advance because the elevators could hold up. The room itself was a nice room. Good layout and we had a view of the main road. Our refrigerator wasn't working and asked for it to be looked at twice - it wasn't. So we didn't make use of the mini bar. Instead just went to the wine and grocery stores over the road to buy drinks. The bed was comfortable but as someone with a lower back problem the bed was too soft for me (my husband liked it). We checked to see whether the firmness of the bed could be changed - it couldn't. Therefore, we took extra bed sheets and made a makeshift bed on the floor for a couple of days.

I had a great 4th of July stay. Everyone was very friendly even though they were missing out on their own fun times with friends and family. That was very much appreciated.The hotel is in a great location one block from a major north/south subway line as well as the L going cross town.The hotel's restaurant and bar are very good and for those seeking other accommodations there's a myriad of choices not far away.Thank you for the nice stay!

Lovely place and the location .All those who have work schedule but want a slice of NY at night time this place will make it possible to have the time for both . Within walking distance from the commuter point of view to have easy access to all .

This Hotel is consistent in its excellent service and hospitality. The rooms are a good size, the bedding is luxurious and and the amenities are top notch. The hotel restaurant is delightful for breakfast and you can sit outside. Great location to be close to the Vilage. I will definitely come back.

We stayed as a family at this hotel for a weekend getaway. It is close to main subway lines and Union Square has its own attractions; Farmers Market, Chanting monks in the Union Square, close by delicious City Bakery, Max Brenner, Joe's Coffee, East & West Village, Gramercy, Eataly..they're all at walking distance. Hotel itself was relatively new property but rooms were very small. It was difficulty even to turn in the bathroom. We had a terrace but no view. We asked for child crib, first two of them were broken, was finally fixed on third try. The restaurant and cafe at the hotel is nice for breakfast or dinner; however , being in the middle of Manhattan you have many more options around. I suggest trying Union Square Cafe. If you want to shop at the Farmer's Market, go early, good stuff usually sells out first. Also the pretzel-croissants at the City Bakery tend to finish early too, enjoy them early in the day; don't forget the chocolate croissant, out of this world.

Arrived late after our wedding ceremony. We had called the hotel ahead about our special night and late arrival. Check-in was very efficient and welcoming. Upon arrival to our room (complimentary upgrade to a King Suite) there was a trail of rose petals to our comfortable king bed.A bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries. We were very impressed with such a wonderful surprise. Would have loved to extend our stay and enjoy the facilities of the hotel but we had other plans. Would definitely recommend. Aces

Twice I've stayed here in the past 2 weeks, and both times I've had to check into multiple rooms to find one below 77 degrees. The first time I had to switch rooms 3 times to find one that was 71 or below, which of course is very annoying when you arrive and just want to go to sleep. I just checked in again today, and once again my room is 77 degrees. I'm too tired too even fight with the people here, this hotel is far too expensive to sweat for a half hour after you check in. I'll never stay here again.

Very clean and neat, convenient to Union Square. Doorman and front desk were very helpful. The restaurant was VERY GOOD! We stayed over on a Sunday night. The Monday morning desk staff were clueless when asked when does the complimentary coffee stop being served. When I went in to get coffee at 7 am...a very irate waiter yelled at me and said no coffee, no coffee...kinda like...no soup for you! Apparently they stop serving then as the restaurant opens up. The wait staff in restaurant were wonderful..both Sunday night and Monday morning. I did email the hotel to tell them of the problems and management was quick to get back to me and said they would check it out. I appreciate the fact that they responded to my note.

Enjoyed long weekend at the Hyatt Union Square....well-priced clean nicely appointed rooms.Very friendly and professional staff. Excellent location convenient to the Village and Soho, great restaurants in area.

Best hotel I've stayed in in nyc. I was upgraded to a corner room and loved it. Hotel is clean with a nice interior design. Room was modern and nicely appointed and spacious for Manhattan. Will stay there again.

Fantastic upscale hotel a block from Union square. Great in-house restaurant, not to mention tons of options right across the street. I stay here for business and pleasure and am never disappointed. I live the big gym, clean rooms, friendly staff... The views swim the street side rooms are great too, and I don't find it to be too noisy.

I love the location of the Hyatt, just four blocks from my office at Astor Place. Very nice service, although they should provide a corkscrew in the room. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants this time, but the food is good, albeit very expensive. The bed was heavenly -- I slept better in it than I have in weeks!

It was our second stay over 9 months apart and the doorman remembered us when the car pulled up. That was the beginning of a great stay . We would go back again. This location is just perfect to enjoy a weekend or bus trip in nyc

Incredible location. Staff is warm, friendly and professional. Comfortable room, but a tad small (hey, it's New York). Modern bathroom. No mini fridge. I would definitely recommend this for business travelers or couples.

Had a great time in NYC and this hotel was located in the heart of a great area. Rooms were clean and comfortable, staff was extremely friendly and the overall experience was great. Walking distance in every direction has a lot to offer.

I really enjoyed my time at the Hyatt Union Square and would definitely stay again. The location was excellent and the staff was exceedingly helpful and accommodating. When I arrived I was informed that I was the "Platinum Member of the Day," which resulted in an upgrade to a 4 p.m. checkout and a free breakfast at The Fourth, these bonuses definitely enhanced the trip and were most appreciated.

Great Location, Great Place For tours through NY, excellent service, very friendly staff, super quiet room where you can relax after coming home from loud and turbulent NY.Small fitness room is included.

A long term work assignment has me living in the Hyatt Union Square for 5 consecutive weeks on 3-5 night stays. This is now week 3...Short review: The hotel is very modern and up to date. Rooms boast comfortable beds, faux hardwood floors, and the bathrooms are bright. With two great restaurants and a nice bar with a dj on site during happy hour, you can't go wrong. Gym is one of the best ones I've seen in a hotel in a long time.Long review: I've stayed in rooms on floors 2, 3, and 4 this far. The layout of my floor 4 room had a proper enclosed bathroom. Floors 2 and 3 have the open concept bathroom. Proper water closet and shower, with an open concept sink. Good TV channel offerings (right now it's Tour de France season, so I'm happy they have NBC Sports channel). The gym is rockin. I wish the scale was in a corner and not smack dab in the middle of the room, but I'll live. Lots of treadmills, ellipticals, free weights, fresh apples, water, chilled and dry towels! Restaurants are good too (will review those in detail on their respective profiles). Stopped by the bar and enjoyed the happy hour special, $7 caipirinhas and $5 apps. Both were tasty. Short walk to Union Square. Youthful and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again!

Boutique hotel with very helpful staff. Room was modern, clean and very comfortable.Union Square has all of the services, restaurants and shopping. Use of bicycles is provided at no charge. Happy hour in bar was fun.

The room was snazzy. The property and the room was very clean and well-kept. I liked the open setup in my room using the bathroom sink/mirror to divide the room. The towels were soft and absorbent and the shower had great water pressure and temperature. I had free Wi-Fi and it the connection was fast and reliable.The bar was set up nicely; staff was attentive and the drink was good.To be honest though, I likely would not book this hotel if I was traveling for pleasure simply due to costs (outside of my budget).

I stayed there for 3 days with my wife. It is very convenient and close to many restaurants. The staff was friendly and always smiling. I would stay there again for sure. Also a nice bar in the lobby and restaurant as well.

The hotel really makes me angry. I spent almost 300 dollars to stay for one night in the HYATT hotel and I even cannot get a cup of free water!!! All the things in the room are not free, they are very expensive and the hotel staffs would never tell you that. If all the items in the room is not free, they shouldn't put them in the room or they should tell the customers that they are not free!!! But they didn't. AND IT IS A LIE. They entice customers to buy all the things.NOBODY TOLD ME THAT THEY ARE SO EXPENSIVE. AND THERE ARE NO SIGN!!! IN THE ROOM TO SHOW I SHOULD PAY FOR IT.IF I KNOW THEY ARE SO EXPENSIVE, I WON'T TOUCH THEM!! It was very happy for me to see all the snacks in the room firstly, but now it is disgusting. Hyatt hotel lies to customers and I won't choose to stay on it anymore. And I would also tell all the people what you do! I WON'T COME AGAIN. The wifi is very very slow and the hotel is not quiet during night. HATE IT !!

The location is perfect-a short subway ride from Grand Central. The staff is exemplary-genuinely friendly but perfectly professional. My room was so clean and attractive and I enjoyed the sensors knowing where I was in the room and then providing lighting. My one wish was for a magnified mirror and better lighting around the vanity-I had to put on make up for an evening wedding and could not see well. I understand there are some rooms with the mirrors provided. The hotel gives you a long list of sundries etc they are happy to bring to your room if you forgot anything. The iron and hair dryer were both much better than the ones I own. The snacks for sale were thoughtfully selected-if I had chosen to pay to eat them I couldn't have come up with a better selection. My view was reminiscent of the set of West Side Story with the concrete wall of fire escapes but on the eleventh floor I had natural light and it was very quiet. I did not eat in the restaurant but would have loved to do so-it is attractive and on Sunday morning there was a trio playing live music during Brunch. I would go back and highly recommend this hotel.

Room facilities were to my taste, similar to Andaz on 5th avenue. Hotel staff were helpful and accommodative. Also liked the restaurant (The Fourth). But one thing, need better coffee - would suggest Think Coffee across the street.

Always been a great hotel and had many pleasant stays in the past...unfortunately credit card was charge $1100+ for something? not returned yet....still waiting for an explanation, did get something about a duplicate booking but now hearing that others have also been accidently charged.

Great cheerful staffClean updated roomPerfect restaurant/bar area  The location was central for our needs and easy to travel around the city from this point ..We would surely stay at the Hyatt union square on our next visit!

The Hyatt is a well located hotel with a young fresh vibe. The check in desk is not your usual hotel experience and the staff are friendly. I've stayed here a number of times and unless you are in a room well away from the elevators and that doesn't have an adjoining room door you will struggle to get any tranquility. The wooden floors combined with poorly sound proofed doors mean corridor noise can be an issue but worse if you are in an adjoining room you may as well make friends with the people in the next room because you will be hearing each other throughout your stay.

Stay was niceservice was excellent --both courteous and attentivemy only concern was the valet parking charge. we learened at checkout that the parking fee is not prorated if you exceed 24 hours. We had to get our car and finding parking elsewhere if we wanted to avoid a $65 additional charge even though we had planned to stay 1 day + 2 hours

Had a two night stay at the Hyatt Union Square, mainly for business but did get a chance to explore the neighborhood. Hotel is really well positioned right off Union Square, and staff were very welcoming.

Great hotel! Awesome location with beautiful, clean, and comfy rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was great with many places within walking distance. We can't wait to go back soon!

Stayed here on a business/pleasure trip to NYC. I LOVE this location - perfect spot to reach some of the best restaurants in town. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, choice of 2 bars in the lobby and the staff is extremely friendly. I will definitely be back.

I stayed at this hotel because my client was having an event there. I arrived in NY by train, and the hotel was easily accessible by subway. The check-in experience was very efficient and friendly. An experienced staffer helped a newcomer who was helping me - the care and attention to detail by both was outstanding. The room was well appointed and immaculate, the common areas were well-lighted and tastefully decorated. Our group had a great meal in the hotel restaurant, too. I live close enough to NY that I rarely stay there overnight at my own expense, but next time I do, I know where I'll be staying. This hotel has earned my business.

Used Hyatt-Points to collect 2 free nights here at the end of weekly long visit to New York (started at James in Soho). Good choice.I've been to New York about 20 times but never stayed in the Union Square area before. And now having stayed here - I should probably stay at this hotel or some other hotel close-by again. Feels kind of close to everything - both the Downtown districts and to Midtown. And lots of stores, restaurants just a few minutes walk from hotel.Hotel has rooms that look nice and new, a good gym, bikes to borrow for free and a nice breakfast restaurant where you could sit outside in the morning.

From the moment I entered the lobby until I left, I had a 5 star experience from the staff to the room. My room was really clean, quiet, very updated and so enjoyable. There was no view (the back of another building), but it was QUIET. (Something to be valued in New York.). The location was perfect ... Walking distance to SoHo, the Village, the Whitney., and just a block off Union Square. The attached restaurant (called The Fourth) was really nice, not pretentious as many are. The goid was really very good for hotel fare. I will go back to this hotel and will recommend it to friends. The front desk staff deserves praise for friendliness and helpfulness.

I stayed here and was pleased how close it was to the subway and how often cabs came by to get me to and from meetings. Rooms have nice hardwood floors. Shower is nice and deep. No tub but that was ok. The bathroom was nice and clean. Great amenities in the room and staff was very accommodating.

Had the opportunity to stay at the new Hyatt in Union Square. Very pleased with all facets of the hotel. Professional staff, well appointed rooms, great restaurant and lounge. We had a room with a patio that was a peaceful respite from the tumult on the streets below. Will definitely return and recommend to anyone.

Great location near, but not "in", Union Square, with easy access to the Village, NYU, Chelsea, etc. New facility with great restaurants and friendly staff. Appropriately sized workout room, and small but clean and stylish rooms

We, hubby and I, visited over Memorial Day weekend for a romantic getaway. We really enjoyed the location; just steps from Union Square central plaza with farmer's markets and street performers, and close walk to the subway, meatpacking, Madison Park, and much more. Great neighborhood and central location. The room was comfortable, hip and intelligently laid out so even though small, did not feel cramped. Staff was friendly. Would stay here again.

The room was small but excellently well set out with a comfortable work desk and all the connections to the TV etc above the desk. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom well appointed and the staff were friendly and helpful. I will definitely choose it again!

This hotel and location is a must! I am a bit of a hotel snob and was do pleasantly surprised by the hyatt Union square, extraordinarily clean, feels brand new, wonderful friendly staff always ready with a greeting and a smile! The location, who could ask for more, right in the middle of Union square area with broad choice of restaurants and bars. One of the most chill areas of New York.My room was a terrace room, which if you've ever staying in ny to have terrace let alone one the size of your room is outstanding! This will be my new favorite when traveling to the city!

We chose this hotel initially for its location and also because it was new. The location proved to be absolutely excellent! Very close to union square station access to all the parts of Manhattan we wanted to get to was easy both via the subway, but also the busses. Within walking distance was NOHO and the Meatpackers districts. With the hotel basically sitting in the Greenwich village area, with great food within a short walk. The rooms and amenities were superb, this was epitomised when after a very hot day a lovely flavoured iced water dispenser was placed in the lobby for the residents - nice touch!Special thanks to Robert at the front desk, he was awesome and helped made our stay that much better - thank you.Just one last point, the Fourth restaurant (attached to the hotel) is excellent, worth a meal or two.

Recently built / renovated, this is a small, very modern hotel in excellent condition. Staff are professional. It is 1 block from Union Square and the subway - making it very convenient to anywhere in the city. Highly recommended - but see notes on room selection.

Fantastic Hyatt property near Union Square. Terrific neighborhood to walk, shop and dine. Stayed with daughter before moving her into NYU housing for summer internship. Staff was very professional and friendly. Adequate fitness center and great bar/restaurant. Although rooms were small, nicely appointed and very comfortable. I would go back in a heartbeat!!

I travel often to NYC and have stayed at great hotels. I must say how impressed I was with this property. It is a beautiful smaller hotel that doesn't have the usual "corporate" feel. Very intimate with a super friendly and helpful staff, a great restaurant (The Fourth) and cool bar area. The room I stayed in was beautiful and quiet - very modern but not "over the top." I will definitely stay here again!

If you'd rather be away from the bustling and over-crowded center of NYC (i.e., avoiding the tourist hordes that crowd the Times Square area), then the Hyatt Union Square is a very good alternative. It's new (or newly a hotel/Hyatt) so the rooms are fresh and surprisingly nicely sized (not the tiny coffin-like spaces that many NYC hotels offer); storage space is a premium but strategically place such that it isn't cramped. The bed and pillows were quite comfortable. The dining options within the hotel are expensive but not "terribly all that" (had dinner at The Fourth but was not very impressed with the cuisine). But within immediate vicinity of the hotel are less expensive, but still healthy options (I liked Fresh Go (?) across the street though their coffee was abysmally lukewarm). The elevators were horribly slow though. The staff were helpful, friendly and quite welcoming. The Union Square area has great atmosphere, and recommends itself. Would probably stay here again.

Love this property ... Great location and amazing staff!!! I will definitely be back for a revisit. I did not use the Restaurant but the decor of the whole lobby and restaurant was just spectacular!! Five stars!!!

I stayed with my wife for three nights at Hyatt Union Square, on a partly business/partly leisure trip to NYC. That was our second stay at this hotel. Modern and comfortable rooms, I like specially the open bathroom layout, receiving direct daylight. I like the size of this hotel as well, medium size hotel, with a warm atmosphere and very nice and helpful staff, not the kind of massive and impersonal hotels in NYC. And wireless internet is now free! Very nice! Lots of good eateries and restaurants at walking distance, and very close to the trendy East Village. We will come again, for sure! Thanks.

I am a platinum member with the Hyatt hotels and am accustomed to much better service fromHyatt properties. During my stay at this hotel for 2 days the garbage in the room was not emptied, the coffee was not replaced after it was used. As a platinum member a newspaper should be delivered to the room every morning but was not delivered to my room. I asked for one wake up call the phone rang every 5 minutes 3 times.But to top it all off, I received a request for feedback by the front office supervisor. I sent my feedback and never heard back from them. I expect more from a Hyatt.

My wife walked in. Looked around and we canceled our reservation and left. She is very particular about where she stays and this is second reservation at a Hyatt where the hotel was definitely not acceptable. Fool me once! Staff very courteous. Location not nearly in center of action as Times Square Hyatt. Guess where we ended up!

THREE key complaints:1. I arrived at 11:15 at night after flying to NYC from San Francisco. Hadn't eaten dinner. Room service and all hotel restaurants were already closed - in NYC!!! Even the front desk worker said the bar was closed but he didn't know why. Front desk worker directed me to a place across the street - walked over and that was also closed. Nothing else was open that I could find so went to bed hungry. Woke up at 5am - room service menu said breakfast didn't start until 6:30am - I waited 90 minutes so I could eat in my room while working. Called at 6:30 and was told the restaurant didn't open until 7:00am!! I could have walked to get breakfast somewhere nearby but waited stupidly believe the menu in the room. When I complained to the front desk, the customer service was horrible. Nothing offered to me for all this inconvenience!! At a minimum they could have offered a comp bfast at 7 for this but, nope - nothing, nada - even when I asked.2. Room was so small - distance from desk to bed was so tight the desk chair was bumping up to the bed. Very uncomfortable.3. What happened to bathtubs? Maybe it's all of NY, but I would expect to be told if my room had a shower only - I wasn't and now don't have any place to soak my muscles. At $450 a night this place is NOT worth the money! WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!!

This place is a GEM. From the location, to the rooms, to the staff, to the everything. I love this Hyatt location. The hotel seemed relatively new and the lobby is amazing. The staff could NOT have been more helpful. I was here on business and every detail was taken care of for me. I arrived late and asked for a good dinner recommendation. The staff was so great and had GREAT advice. Will definitely be BACK!

My friend and I stayed overnight May 16-17. The check-in and check-out process was easy, and the front desk staff was very friendly. Our room, though small, utilized the space perfectly. The bed was also very comfy. My only complaint would be that the toilet area in the bathroom was way too small. I have a medical condition, and I need more room than that to take care of myself. Otherwise it was a great stay.

We recently picked up our son from NYU and this hotel is perfectly located near it. Rooms are nice and very clean. Yes they are small but typical small for a New York room. The staff were very accommodating and very friendly. If you are looking for a close place near NYU this is the place!!

This poor review is only poor because we were relying heavily on some support from staff and we didn't get it. Perhaps it is a bit harsh, but for the money paid, I expect more. Facilities, location, etc were mostly fine / good. I have stayed at some of the "big" times square hotels and had a better experience on most fronts.All staff were polite, courteous, tried to be helpful, etc, but plain old NOT helpful. If I'm laying down 5 star money, I want a full time concierge (hyatt relies on front desk to play this role most of the time) -- assistance with tickets, tourist info, booking restaurants, etc. So, for instance, I asked about tickets for wicked, getting a deal, etc. I mentioned that they seemed to be far from sold out online. They offer me seats for $270 per head through their "ticket service" and weren't really helpful in any other regard. We decide to just show up at the box office instead. We ended up paying roughly $100 per head for better seats. I read online "ask your concierge as they have the know how/connections/etc" -- yeh right.Another example, I saw a $40/hour chinese massage place nearby, but forgot where I saw the sign. I ask the front desk (concierge not working...it's like 2PM). They say they aren't aware of anything except for Chinatown. I walk out the door and literally 1.5 blocks away I see the massage parlour. Come on, you don't have to know all of NYC, but at least know your own 2 block radius.Help planning ahead. We emailed the concierge like 4 weeks in advance of our trip with some basic questions (after calling for him while he was out). Didn't hear back. Called again 1 week before. Didn't hear back. Called again a couple days later, finally heard back. Not on my original questions, but on a question I asked on my third call. Again, I realize they are not my own personal assistant, but come on, replying to an email within one week seems reasonable. I had basic questions (e.g. how to get reservations at XYZ, how to get tickets to the tonight show, how to get last minute broadway ticket deals)......quite "common" questionsRoom was a shoebox, but a quite nice shoebox. It's NYC after all. However, our room was next to some type of utility closet / room, so there was too much noise associated with that room (woke up a couple times, etc).

You will not be disappointed with this hotel. Beautifully appointed, immaculate, and competent, friendly service. Great location. Special mention to the concierge, Robert Brigman, who went out of his way make my stay stress-free. He did not a miss an opportunity to find solutions to unusual check-out requirements, as my husband underwent surgery at a nearby hospital with iffy discharge dates. He takes pride in what he does and was extremely professional, something often lacking today.

All in all, great hotel. About market for Manhattan in terms of rates. Staff is responsive, and room is good size (not large, but not uncomfortably small). Great Union Square location, close to the metro but not noisy.

Trips to nearby Mt. Sinai Hospital have required overnight stays, so my wife and I thought if for no other reason than convenience we would book at this hotel. Now that we have stayed twice, we have many more reasons to make it a favorite for any reason to be in NYC.
