Everything about the hotel from the attentive staff to the fabulous interior design of the public spaces to the well designed and nicely appointed guest rooms presents a very welcoming feeling. We have enjoyed both dinner and breakfast in the hotel dining room and the bar across the lobby offers a truly amazing selection of single malt scotch. While at the hotel don't miss an opportunity to mingle with the locals in Union Sq park; it will be educational to say the least.

This is a very nice hotel, centrally located in NY. I travel to the city often and have stayed at many hotels - this place really stands out from the pack. Why?1. The staff. They're the nicest, most hospitable staff of any NY hotel I've been to. Victor, Victor, Michael, Katelyn, and the entire team go out of their way to make sure you're comfortable. It goes a long way when you arrive tired on a cross-country flight.2. The rooms. It's NY, so they're not big, but they're comfortable and have high quality materials/amenities.3. The facilities. They have an awesome gym that's never too crowded. The Fourth has a killer breakfast. And the wine/whiskey lounge is the perfect place to unwind at the end of the day.

Enjoyed our visit at Hyatt Union Square. Front desk staff worked hard to accommodate our needs. Would definitely return... liked the area very much. Very convenient to the Union Square subway stop (1 block) which will get you anywhere in Manhattan in minutes.

A trip at short notice to NY was made complete with our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The property is new and hip, in arguably one of NY's best neighbourhoods. Room was very small but not surprising in such a big city. Would stay again. Ask for a high rise room.

The service was great, everyone had been to "smile school," clean, new and tidy. Friendly and accommodating staff, but they can't make the rooms any bigger. The rooms are shoe boxes, even by Manhattan standards, and we've been in maybe 10+ Manhattan hotels in this price category and higher. The room was basically a one room affair with an exposed shower and sink area and pocket door toilet area off a bedroom space that was so tightly configured as to make it necessary to actually choreograph one's moves around the bed with your partner/spouse so you don't actually have to climb over the bed to get around each other. We gave it 3 stars only because of the staff. Will NOT stay here again.

We travel to NY frequently. We like to stay near Union Square. We typically stay at the W which is across the square but this time we could not get in. Having had brunch at the Hyatt we thought we would stay there. What a mistake. First of all the rooms are so small only one person can walk in front of the bed at a time. I know hotel space is challenging in NY but the W room is at least twice the size! Then, we did not receive our wake up call on our first morning...so strike relying on the hotel to get us up. When we complained, they offered us breakfast as a comp. The next night we asked if we could have drinks instead of the breakfast and they said yes. Guess what, that comp was $27.00. Try to have breakfast there and it sure isn't $27.00. When we went to check out, I was upset with the $27.00 comp so they bumped it up to the $60.00 drink charge but that was only after the guy on the desk was rude. When I said that the room was small he said that they are a "Boutique Hotel". I told him that "Boutique" does not mean tiny. We have stayed all over the world in Boutique Hotels and this is the tiniest hotel room I have ever stayed in. When I told him we usually stay across the street at the W he said that the rooms there are "tired". I think he needs to stay there....they are NOT tired. We also had an issue with the fact that we had a confirmation of prepayment that they did not show as being prepaid.I have stayed in many Hyatt hotels before. The most recent stay was in September in Vancouver. I am shocked that Hyatt would put their name on this hotel.

Just got back from 2 nights at the Hyatt. Great experience. Rooms are small as others have noted, but well appointed. Bed/pillows are SUPER comfortable and shower is really nice with great water pressure. Our room had no view (looked out on another building) but was very quiet! There are 2 bikes for guests to use for free in the lobby. Location is great, subway 1 block away and Union Square has everything you could need from grocery stores to restaurants and shopping. There is also a great Farmers Market right in the park. The Strand Bookstore is just around the corner and there is also a great small book store called Alabaster just a few doors down from the hotel entrance. Ate breakfast at the Newsbar, a couple of blocks away;excellent coffee and egg sandwiches. Also had breakfast at The Coffee Shop right off Union Square which had a great basic bfast menu. Used reward points for this stay, but prices are reasonable for NY and would definitely stay again.

We were here college touring and were delighted with the location and amenities. Hotel was very close to Union Square-we took the subway or walked everywhere. Lots of shopping and places to eat near by. As noted by other travelers, rooms were compact but very modern. We had breakfast at the hotel on several days and it was quite good. Staff was very attentive. Would definitely recommend.

We arrived here after a red eye flight into New York. Hoping to just have a place to put our luggage until the room was ready we were pleasantly surprised to find it was already available at 8am and we were allowed to check in early. This was the best surprise of our entire trip and made our introduction to New York wonderful. Victor and Victor (yes both guys were named that) were very helpful the entire time we were there. Not only helping us get situated but also providing great restaurant recommendations and anything else you could possibly want. I've stayed at many many places for work over the years and this staff was by far the most efficient and helpful that I've ever experienced.The room was smaller than most but that was expected for New York. The design of the rooms was stellar and took great advantage of the space. Everything was top of the line both in design and functionality. From the motion lights in the closet and wine bar in the room to the buttons just about everywhere to control everything to the high tech TV and video system. I've stayed at 5 star hotels that weren't nearly up to this standard.The location in Union Square was perfect as well. The subway was less than a block away as well as just about every store and restaurant you could need. It was very central to just about everything in New York as well. The restaurant and bar downstairs were also very trendy and fun. I would stay here every single time I come back to New York. The only annoying thing was that the wifi has three levels. The free one had speeds up to 2mbps and if you paid extra you could get up to two levels higher for streaming. It wasn't worth the extra 15 or 35 bucks a day to get the higher speeds to me though. So be prepared if you plan on streaming any video or doing any video chats at the hotel.

My wife and I just completed our second stay at the Hyatt Union Square in New York - and, just like the first time, we were so very impressed. The young, energetic, passionate staff was so friendly, casual and accommodating. The rooms have a cozy, boutique-y feel with nice views of the area and with the feel of apartment living. The area is oh-so-cutting-edge - in Union Square and the East Village at the same time. So many restaurants, coffee bars, cocktail bars and stores within a few blocks - and mere walking distance from the Lower East Side and the West Village. All in all, a fantastic place to spend time in NYC!!!

I liked the Hyatt Union Square. The rooms may be small (this is New York City), but they are stylish and comfortable. The staff are friendly and amenable. The hotel does not feel like a chain at all. I particularly liked the bathroom of our room which was very well equipped with a shower to die for.

I've stayed here several times for work, and it's consistently been great. The hotel is clean, modern, and comfortable. The front desk staff are friendly and will help you immediately with anything you need. It's right by Union Square and super close to any Flatiron business you might need to walk to. I'm also crazy about The Fourth, the restaurant next to the lobby. Their Fennel-Sage Chicken Meatballs & Araucana Poached Egg is my favorite breakfast in town.

We frequently stay at Hyatts and this one was definitely unique! It had a boutique feel about it, from the casually dressed staff to the decor. It was modern and comfortable. The restaurant was, surprisingly, a highlight (usually don't have high expectations for hotel restaurants). The breakfast was fantastic with the best bacon we've ever eaten! The only thing stopping me from giving the hotel a 5 star rating was the room size. We upgraded to an Alcove Loft. It was much smaller than I would've expected from a suite upgrade. Can't imagine what a standard room size would be. But we will definitely stay here again - wonderful location, staff, and overall experience.

This was my first time at the Hyatt Union Square, and I loved this little hotel! I will certainly be back! It's not gigantic, more boutique like, which felt very comfortable and homey. The staff is so friendly and helpful! Robert gave us a free upgrade and we went from an inside room that we knew would be really quiet, to a larger "city view" room. The noise was not bad, and we appreciated the extra space! (Thank you @Robert!) I left something behind, and they were able to located it when I called -- just such a nice feel to this place. The bar/pub is cute and comfortable, with lots of fun and funky seating with comfy pillows. We'd hang there in the morning as we all congregated. The restaurant, "The Fourth" was also comfortable, incredibly attentive wait staff, and totally yummy food! The "Organic Salmon" was the table favorite. I could go on and on, but you can't beat this place and the location! So fun. Highly recommend!

This Hyatt is a nice little hotel with stylish and modern rooms. Staff is very helpful, young and cheerful - definitely one of the best hotel experience in New York City, recommended. Location is awesome.

The rooms were beautifully decorated, and felt modern in the best way. Their concierge, Robert, was a delight. He was understanding, informative, patient, and very helpful. The lobby, and lounge are well-appointed, and lovely. The staff were all friendly. Top drawer experience.

I have stayed in a ton of hotels (and a ton of Hyatts) as I travel for a living. This one is by far one of the best I have stayed at. Everything is just easy. Check-in is easy. Rooms are clean and comfortable - they aren't big, but more than acceptable for New York. Great location. Everyone was friendly. It was just easy - and staying in a hotel should be easy. Well done Hyatt!

We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The staff were exceptionally polite, welcoming and helpful. The location was perfect. Every need we had was met. We chose this property because we were looking for a location near family in the Village, and because it was an anniversary trip we selected The Sanctuary, which was being offered at a pretty reasonable rate. What a spectacular room - the private terrace was an absolute luxury. We've never been as sorry to leave a hotel as we were on this trip!

My husband and I just spent the weekend in New York City, and once again, chose the Hyatt in Union Square. Not only is it a great little hotel, but the location is perfect for our needs. There are a ton of restaurants right around there, and it is only a short walk to SoHo. Highly recommend it.

College hunting for son, staff from top to bottom excellent, great location and nicely appointed hotel. Will be vocal about this place to all, great value as well, would not think about staying somewhere else when we return

Having rented an apartment annually for the past six years, to work at an art fair in Manhattan, I have now found my true "annual"home in New York! From welcome to departure the whole experience of staying alone in Manhattan was made a most pleasurable event. The rooms modern, spotlessly clean and compact, with everything one would need for a most comfortable stay during a hard working week. Due to late hours at work ate in "the Fourth" every evening - delicious. The Reception Staff ably headed by Robert the Concierge were warm, helpful and highly efficient. Victor the doorman was my first welcome smile on arrival and quietly and efficiently organised a car to speed me to JFK on my departure. Thank you to all at Hyatt Union Square for a memorable week!

What a perfect location for an overnight jaunt. This place is only a couple of years old, but nothing is being done for the first time - all service aspects are friendly, experienced and worthy of mention.Our "courtyard" room overlooked the interior rear of the building, but there was plenty of light. The room was nicely appointed - modern and comfortable. Regretably there was the small array of items for sale on the desk, including the $7 Evian water bottle, but hey - who am I to deny them a merchandising opportunity.The draw here is the efficiency and location, with a global brand and standard. Decent value and frankly a no-brainer.

I enjoyed my stay at this Hyatt mostly because of all the friendly staff. The location was great for me and my group. Check in was a breeze and I found the room very clean. I liked the modern decor, great tv, comfortable bed, and nice bathroom amenities. I did not love the lighting though. It is very unflattering. I was with a large group of women and we all said the same thing. It made makeup application difficult. To be fair, a lighted makeup mirror was available , but I didn't realize that til later. So, if you are applying makeup, request the mirror, trust me. While I didn't use them I liked that curling irons and straight irons were also available free of charge. I didn't eat at the hotel so I can not comment on the food. The staff at the bar behind check in was great...very friendly and helpful.Tips: 1) see above re mirror2) request a quite room far away from the elevator if you are a light sleeper. My room sounded like I had the elevator right behind the headboard. I had to change my room due to the noise.

How do I love the Hyatt Union Square? Oh in so many way! The staff is the greatest asset of this hotel - warm, welcoming and always helpful - discreetly so when necessary. They're very unpretentious. The rooms - Ohhh the ROOMS - we stayed in a double queen room. Me, hubby and 2 teen boys. NO CARPET. Beautiful contemporary tile everywhere. The shower is beautiful (no tub) with a rain shower that works great. There's a real glass shower door! The water closet (toilet area) has a barn-type door to give privacy. Even the shampoo et al are Bigelow brand and exceptional. There's a full-size hair dryer. The bathroom also has a barn-style door which is a great space-saver. The room itself is an average size for a NYC hotel (on the smaller side compared to other locations outside of NYC) but the appointments are lovely. Two large closet units are on each side of the bed(s) with a light that comes on when you open the door. The safe is in one closet so the light really comes in handy. There's a small desk area to charge electronics, as well as on the night stand. The room has a nice TV for the few mins you may want to watch it. As for comfort - central A/C and heat. No unit under the window to keep you awake and blow the curtains. And the bed is oh so glorious. I'm usually a poor sleeper in hotels but my family and I slept like the proverbial babies on the heavenly mattresses. Personally I love this location. Its quieter without being sleepy. It's away from the craziness of Times Square but a 20 minute cab ride to that area and the theaters. Union Square is right around the corner for shopping and restaurants and a stroll through the small park. Washington Square is a short walk away where you can hang out and watch singing, dancing, etc. In the distance you can see the 9-11 Memorial. This was our second trip to this Hyatt (NYU area) and we will be back. Shout-out to the staff who make a terrific hotel exceptional!

We stayed at this hotel last year with some business friends and went back this year with the same group.The Front Desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I was given an upgrade since I am a Gold member and loved my room. Being an architect, I care a lot about the interior design of the hotels and I can rate this hotel as one of the best hotels that I stayed at in NYC. We enjoyed the ambiance and the friendly service at the bar. I had a very quick breakfast at the restaurant that had great food and service.The location is great as well.

Extraordinarily friendly staff, comfortable rooms (small, but completely normal size by New York standards) a really nice fitness center, and close to everything I needed and wanted on this trip to NYC, including Strand Books around the corner, and Soba Ya (my favorite Japanese restaurant) just down 4th Ave a couple blocks. Two 24-hour walgreens directly across the street are also super convenient.The hotel staff went out of their way to make me feel welcome, even helping me with a last minute late checkout request and sending an email from the front desk manager during my stay to make sure everything was going well. They also offer complimentary shoe shines - I just dropped mine off in the morning the day I checked out and they were ready to go by noon.My only complaint would be the walls are pretty thin so you can hear your neighbors on either side of you and anyone in the hall pretty easily (and they can hear you). Fortunately everyone near me during my 3-night stay was quiet and considerate. I stayed here for business but would definitely come back and stay here for a short leisure trip as well.

Whoever did the interior decorating did a terrific job. The guest rooms and bathroom are an average size, but the decorators use of tall doors and windows, floor to ceiling cabinets and lovely fixtures with an overall asian look makes it feel larger than the sq. ft. It was very refreshing (and not noisy) to have a wood floor. How nice not to have worn out carpeting that has been cleaned hundreds of times. The decor is fresh and very pleasant. And the window opens slightly, just enough to help with the claustrophobia of most hotel rooms in NYC.Kudos to the concierge Robert Brigman and Victor Marrero for their pleasant helpful service.

My experience at this hotel was great. The service was impeccable - quick, smiling, courteous, and very helpful. The whole place is very attractive, from the lobby to my room. The room itself was the smallest type they offer, and though it was small I had everything I needed and room to move around. Cleverly designed, comfortable, clean, and secure. I was on the third floor, so there was a bit more noise from the street than I am normally accustomed to, but I suppose that's to be expected on a lower floor of a hotel anywhere in NYC. Though I noticed road noise, it did not bother me to the point where it woke me up or served as a distraction. I'd stay here again, and I'd recommend it.

The hotel is new and very well done. The staff is super friendly and very inviting. The rooms are clean and new. The location is very good near the subways and union square park and the village.Enjoyable stay.

We really enjoyed our weekend stay at this hotel. Room was small but well laid out and had everything you need/want. Had breakfast at their restaurant The Fourth, it was good. Gabriel was lovely. Only strange experience was in Singl. Supposed to be a whiskey hot spot, we came in at 10pm, on a Saturday night, they couldn't find the whiskey guy for 15 minutes, just wanted to ask a couple of questions. Found the recommendations once he arrived to be below average. And expensive, and we never complain about prices in nyc. Not a big deal, but not what we expected. We love the location of this hotel and can highly recommend it.

Whoever trains the staff at this property deserves a big bonus. Every single employee at this Hyatt is friendly and helpful from check-in to departure. The rooms are clean and spacious for NYC and priced reasonably. We will definitely return.

I stayed here for 5 nights on business.The room was average sized, clean, and modern. Basic appliances and bathroom supplies. I had to pay for Wifi though, which is just so out of touch for a supposedly modern hotel. And on the first night I was there it wasn't working at all, even after I had paid!Good restaurants and bar downstairs, and of course Union Square is a fantastic location in NYC.

We had a lovely time staying at the Hyatt. Everyone were really friendly and very welcoming.It's a short walk to local attractions and Times Square and shopping areas.Restaurants close by are great and you'll receive a fabulous service. One thing to note to those visiting America is to expect to pay gratitude normally set between 15 - 20% of your final bill.Further more tipping your taxi and hotel staff a couple of dollars between 2-10 USD is expected.

Exceeds expectations. Stay here a lot for business and it's one of my favorites. I'd pick this any day over the very tired W just a block or two away (and I think it's cheaper). I'd stay here if on a personal trip, too. Compared to some of the shoeboxes in NYC, this is a good option.

My wife and I found this hotel to be a "breath of fresh air" as opposed to the usual stuffy hotels in NYC. The regular room we booked was ultra cool with a chic newness feel to it. Though the usual small size, the price wasn't too high. But the amenities in the room are all very new and user friendly. We loved the lighting in the room as well as the shower with its amenities. All in all, I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

This hotel was expensive and not worth it for the view we had staring at another brick wall. But overall the room was clean and pretty nice. Everything was nice but didn't raise the bar for me. The one good thing about the hotel was they had free bike rentals so we rode them around the city one day. The staff were pretty young and "in training" it seemed like but they were friendly.The drinks at the hotel bar were overpriced like every hotel in new york, and the general atmosphere wasnt very inviting in the day time so we left after one drink. It was a pretty good location if you want to be closer to Soho rather than busy Times Square. I don't think I'd stay here again as it didn't do much for me. I've stayed in a lot of places in New York for a lot less and I just didn't get the value I wanted to from the Hyatt.

We couldn't have had a better stay at this Hyatt location. As a frequent traveler I thought the level of service was incredible. Everyone from the bellman to the front desk had a smile on their face - you could tell they enjoyed not only their job, but working together as a team and it came through in their interactions with the guests. Not only did the front desk figure out how to get me checked in early, the recommendations for dinner and next day breakfast hit the mark. They really listened to what we were looking for - off the beaten path, local places and came through with choices that met the experience we were looking for. A stay can really be enhanced when the people you interact with are great at their job and have fun doing it.

Stayed at Hyatt Union Square for the first time for Business Travel. This was my sixth Business trip to NYC, and by far my favorite hotel! Updated modern look throughout the hotel. Extremely clean, everything looked brand new. Room was spacious (for NYC). Front desk customer service was excellent. Every morning as I was leaving, the door man would walk me out to the street and hail a cab, open my door and tell me to have a nice day. Lobby lounge was comfortable well stocked bar and great service. I did not use the restaurant, but observed many locals dinning there. Overall, I will definitely stay at this hotel next time i'm in NYC.

The front desk staff made this experience so very enjoyable. They seem to drop everything when you walk in the door and welcome you with a smile at every opportunity. Very helpful for taxis, directions, etc. Rooms were not huge but this is New York and the price and location were wonderful. Great bathrooms, clean, nice toiletries. Can't recommend this hotel enough. Restaurant on site was very good as well.

I stay here when traveling for business - usually every other month. It is clean and comfortable, with an upscale look and feel to the lobby and rooms. The hotel staff is friendly and courteous; always a smile from the doorman to the front desk. I HIGHLY recommend Hyatt Union Square.

The first time staying at the Hyatt. It will not be the last. Convenient location and the staff was very personable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a comfortable place to stay.

My partner and I stayed in an Urbane Sky room from 26th-31st Jan 2015. I have stayed at many hotels in Manhattan and this has now moved to the top of my list for NYC.The hotel is loctaed in a great location close to the subway with midtown attractions an easy walk away. The Hotel has a real boutique feel to it and has a great chilled vibe without being too wanky.The rooms though small are clean and have everything you need. We stayed on a high floor and it was generally quiet though the garbage trucks and fire engines were noticeable but not menacing. I mean hey you are in New York! If you want complete serentiy perhaps a stay in the country is more your style. The staff here are genuinely friendly and are always happy to assist. We ate at the Fourth for Breakfast and a dinner and the food and service were great. Fortunately our stay was blessed with several days of snow and a snowstorm (Juno) that closed the entire city down. This made for an added bonus as the city was a ghost town! Will definitely be back on a return visit to the city.

Was here on business so looking for quiet, clean, comfortable bed, and lots of plugins. This has it all. Good lighting on the rooms too (I'm all about the ability to dim). Didn't truths restaurant, but the bar is well done and is known for whisky. I tried the pricey wine.

My how this neighborhood has changed over the years. The property is well situated to Union Square and Gramercy Park areas (and the subway stations). Small lobby makes it feel more like an apartment building than a traditional hotel, so there is something more personal and intimate about it. We were here for a business conference and everybody was well cared for. Modern, stylish rooms with city views. A nice Hyatt for a stay in New York.

Great location for a newer property in the Union Square area. Low Key and still one block from the great activity and restaurants. I have stayed here every 3 months for the last year forsaking all of my other frequent hotel plans. Great accommodations for business stays and pleasure. The staff is very professional but will make you feel like family. Rooms are a nice size, hard wood floors are super clean with very comfortable beds. Lastly, the workout room is very good with multiple trend mills, elliptical machines and bikes with plenty of room for 5 machines, a full rack of dumb bell weights. and stretching area, Very good use of space.

I found the hotel very conveniently located. The room was spotless. The check in took less than 3 minutes. The restaurants were clean and appetizing. The prices were fair for New York City. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

We just spent the long President's Day weekend at the Hyatt--what a lovely surprise. Stylish (small but it is NY) room, with great bed, great lighting and chic bath amenities. Terrific staff--room service and newspaper and ice arrived very fast and with great smiles. The fitness center is well equipped. It is one block south of Union Square so a great location for lots to do and transportation, but also quiet. Our room had great black out shades and we slept wonderfully. The bar and the restaurant Fourth are terrific. Would return in a heartbeat.

My spouse and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square on a Saturday evening in mid-January 2015 for one night. We booked our reservation on-line on the Hyatt website using a special rate called “And the Winner Is”, in which each guest is presented with an envelope at check-in that offers a special perk such as a bottle of wine, a late check-out, or a room upgrade. We hoped for the room upgrade, because we had already booked a “better” room category of the Alcove Loft. (Therefore, the only categories to upgrade to are the Emphyreal Suite and The Sanctuary.) Much to our delight, the front-desk agent upgraded us to The Sanctuary (a 1-bedroom suite with a terrace) upon check-in! What an awesome surprise!The Hyatt Union Square is located on Fourth Avenue at 13th Street in the Union Square / Gramercy / Flatiron neighborhood of Manhattan. The property is located one block from Union Square itself, and many shops and restaurants are right outside of its doors. Two drugstores, Walgreens and Duane Reed, border Union Square; in addition to pharmacy items, both stores operate as mini-markets, selling drinks, snacks, reading material, and so on.The Sanctuary Suite is located on the second floor of the hotel, as are all of the Terrace rooms. The room number for The Sanctuary is 211. (We believe that the other rooms ending in “11” are the Alcove Loft rooms, which are all corner suites and offer slightly more room to their occupants.) The best feature of the Sanctuary is the 1,000-square foot L-shaped terrace. Because the living room area is positioned on the corner of the building, the room contains floor-to-ceiling windows, each set of which has automatic blinds and sheer drapes that open and close with the touch of a button. You can access the terrace from both the living room and the bedroom. Unfortunately, we stayed in this room in the winter, so we did not get to fully enjoy the outdoor space, but it contains many different pieces of outdoor furniture, such as a dining table / chairs for six people, two single-person lounge chairs, one double two-person lounge chair, two sofas, two chairs, several outdoor lamps, and potted plants / foliage. The terrace must be an amazing space when the weather is nice! The room itself features wood floors, leather wall panels, and suede ceiling tiles. The oversized suite includes a separate living room with a 2-piece futon-like sofa, dining table / chairs for four people, large free-standing iPod speaker cube, and unique kind of mini-bar. The bedroom features a king-size bed, second flat screen TV (incorporated into the mirror of the dresser unit). The two-part bathroom contains a huge walk-in shower for two people and a large sink vanity. The toilet cubicle is in another area that you can closed off with sliding pocket doors, and it has a second tiny free-standing sink in an area that can also be closed off. (Note that the description of this room online mentions a “separate powder room”, however, this room contains only one toilet. Although this room contains two sinks in different parts of the large bathroom, it does not incorporate what we think of as a “powder room” meaning an additional “half-bathroom”.) Two bathrobes (but no slippers) hung near the shower, and larger-than-normal (perhaps 5-ounce) bottles of CO Bigelow toiletries (including shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and body lotion) were located in a recessed area of the shower. In the living room, The Sanctuary contains a door that permits it to adjoin with a terrace suite, creating a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit when both units are rented.We previously stayed at the Hyatt Union Square in October of 2013 (see our previous review for more information on the hotel features). Our second stay was just as pleasant as our first stop, and we plan to visit this hotel again. Although there are not many hotel options in this neighborhood, this hotel is surely the best!

Great location - walking distance to most areas except it was so cold when we were there we could not take full advantage. Rooms are clean and modern but v small even by NYC standards. Also I am not a fan of the open bathroom concept. Although there are doors for the shower and washroom the whole unit is open so you effectively have no privacy for changing etc should you require it. There is a nice bar on the ground floor, should you need it. We did not eat here given the abundant choices around us. What really makes this hotel is its location. Makes up for some of the things we did not like on room design. That said we had a perfectly comfortable stay - this is just about personal preference.

Stayed here for 4 nights for a business trip. Reserved a room with a terrace, although it was a silly idea since it's in the middle of the winter. But end up to be very quiet and snow covered terrace was nice to look at. Two days before arrival I noticed they lower the rate for the duration of my stay (I booked a fully prepaid rate and the new lower rate was also fully prepaid), however they won't match the lower rate. Somehow I think the way the property yield the rate was very miss leading. How come early birds got worse deal???Really nice bathroom and room size was pretty good consider the location. The bed was super comfortable. Some issues with Engineering during the stay, reading light by the bed/downlight in the bath and the worst was the super NOISY heating unit. Somehow it made the room louder than sleep on a 747. Overall service was good and breakfast in the dining room was great to start the morning.

Location, location, location. You know what they say, it means everything. Well this hotel was in the perfect location for me. It's just off Union Square so there is lots to see and do in the area that's minutes away. Its just around the corner from the Strand Bookstore in the Village, amazingly good restaurants on 2nd Avenue like Veselka or Ippudo on 4th Ave. It's an easy walking distance to Washington Square, Christopher, Bleeker and Spring Streets, The Highline, Meatpacking district, and Houston Street - some of the best neighborhoods in the city. It's also around the corner from Whole Foods Market on Union Square in case you want to pick something up or have a quick bite to eat without the sit-down restaurant prices and/or the choice of bad fast food. Most importantly this hotel is a decent distance from the really commercial touristy areas around Times Square and midtown Manhattan. So if you want to be in the 'thick of things like Times Square' this isn't so close.This Hyatt - Union Square has a small but smart, unimposing entrance and there is a little lobby with a bar to the right and restaurant to the left as you walk in... nothing grand or imposing. Maybe because I was there during New Years Eve, it seems like it was hectic - private parties and dinners on many nights.Staff seemed a bit harried. I thought the service was good to adequate... professional but not overtly friendly. I tried to order room service on New Years Eve - no response, no dice. But then it was New Years Eve. And they misquoted me the price of the taxi to the airport - it was $20.00 more than they quoted. The room was smallish but typical of NYC, I chose a cheaper option. The space was beautifully styled with good little additions like the ipod dock, comfy bathrobe and good quality toiletries. It had a shower no bathtub, but that suited us just fine. There were 2 problems I identified - there was no free wifi in our room, (it's not cheap and adds a bit to your room's bill) and I was on the fourth floor and it was a bit noisy - but not street noise more like mechanical, elevator noise. The hotel asked me for feedback and I told them about the noise and they seemed sincere in wanting to have it fixed. So maybe it's not an issue now.

Loved this hotel! Stylish interiors with nature-inspired sleek design. The overall vibe is relaxed yet service/staff is top notch. I worked at the communial table in the lobby bar one morning and the internet was super fast. Location is PERFECT, just a block off Union Square. I would highly recommend it.

The Hyatt in Union Square never disappoints. I normally choose this Hyatt to stay at for business. This location is clean, the bed is magnificent, located in the best area of Union Square of Manhattan, right across a convenient store Walgreens, a block a way from a movie theatre and many restaurants walking distance from. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling and needing a place to stay in New York City.

The hotel was great. Out room was newly renovated and clean. The best part of our stay was their concierge Robert. He was super grin else and went above and beyond to make our stay relaxing. We had our dog and they were super accommodating. Robert recommended several places for dinner as well as happening place for after dinner. We will defiantly be back for another stay-cation.

Hyatt Union Square is a nice hotel of high standard. Staff is a bit informal but professional. The design is very urban and modern. Our room (City Studio category) was very small, but otherwise adequate and very clean. It was equipped with TV, ipod dock, and a quite large safe that would even hold a laptop. A big plus compared to other NYC hotels I stayed in was the absence of noise: despite facing the street (7th floor), there was barely any road noise - even none of the honking. Being just around the corner from Union Square, the location is amazing. From Union Sq. public transport connects well to midtown and downtown Manhattan, but also to Brooklyn. It is even easy to walk to Eastside, Soho, Nolita etc. Around the hotel you find many coffee shops, bars and restaurants of various categories (we never had breakfast in the hotel since there were so many options around). There are also a number of convenience stores around Union Square. Previously I stayed in Midtown on all my NYC visits, but from now on I prefer to stay around Union Square. Hyatt is an excellent option, but next time I would aim for one of the bigger rooms, if budget allows. Oh and there is free wifi in the lobby, but we were lucky since we still received that in our room.

its hard to find a descent hotel in new york, and hyatt union square lives up to all expectations!location is perfect & the rooms are very new too with updated technology.breakfast selection (though unlike most hotels who have buffets), has a great selection of a la carte dishes. the gym is one of the best you'll find in manhattan too.i'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. its also in walking distance to soho in case you need to shop and away from all the hustle of times square/herald square which tend to be super busy with tourists.

Centrally located, among shopping, great restaurants, unique and boutique stores, I am not surprised this stands out among the best Hyatt Hotels in the world. Let's begin with the outstanding customer service and complimentary tray of cheese and wine sent to my room with a hand penned note. I was floored by the wood floors in the rooms! No carpets? I was so impressed by this, rarely does one find hard wood floors in a chain…I would say this Hyatt far exceeds most boutique hotels I have scrutinized. The prices are fantastic for value. They have room service that is quite eclectic and reasonable. They aim to please. Story told, it used to be a club with a dance bar downstairs. If you see , which you will as I took many pictures, it is divine. The food is outstanding as well as the concierge. Transportation is simple, most everything in walking distance, Penn Station close, and a great Hotel to hold a conference. Parking not an issue if you do desire to drive as there is parking on most streets as apposed to a parking fee that would meet a mortgage payment. Aside from that, I stayed there, as my daughter had several appointments to chose a wedding gown. They are all in walking distance. If you go to Kleinfelds, do not choose the W hotel they suggest, go with the Hyatt Union Square. I also ate at The Fourth restaurant in hotel. I am a chef, designer, and it was to perfection. Pictures are mine, and divine.

I stayed here New Years Eve, the room far exceeded my expectations. Price was very reasonable.Checking to checkout could not have gone smoother.Beautifully done small rooms. Definitely recommend, good area also.. close to a lot...

This is a great hotel in a great location , the staff were excellent and we were made very welcome . This was our first visit to New York and we have already booked our second visit so see you in December .

This hotel is great -- the atmosphere is fun, the rooms are lovely and the location is wonderful. The people are friendly and eager to make your stay perfect! I have stayed here numerous times and every time is perfect!

nice hotel clean with comfy beds ........ and thats always a plus after a hard days sight seeing staff here in general are good ... except the donut who took the payment twice for the room you will like the rooms here ... and close to shops and subway......................................

And across street from firehouse so sirens all night.Staff was great room tiny and bar service mediocre at best rooms small shower only seventy five dollar per night parking and chemicals used for cleaning left room dry and tough to breathe without opening window.left phone charger called housekeeping within hour after leaving they never called back

I really liked staying at this hotel. It had a modern NYC boutique hotel feel. Definitely one of the nicer Hyatt's that I have stayed at. The room is your typical small NYC hotel room but it is manageable. They really space planned well and so I didn't feel too cramped. The bathroom is nice and I liked the shower. The only thing I didn't love is the lack of counter space in the bathroom for your makeup bag, etc. We were on the 7th floor facing 4th Avenue so we had a nice view. The road noise is bad so I would request a higher floor next time. We were given a late check out of 2 pm which was great. The location is great and it is easy to walk to SOHO, the Village and shopping around Union Square. We easily walked to dinner and the Washington Square Arch. The subway is very close and it is easy to get to midtown. The staff are very friendly and attentive. I would definitely stay here again.

I used to live in Gramercy and remember the hotel being built. Very surprisingly this new comer delivers compared to other hotels in the same area. Everything is brand new, well kept, and well serviced. My room was kept top notch all week. Even when I was working out of my hotel room for a day, they managed to find time when I went to dinner to service it. Their walnut bitters old fashioned at the bar downstairs is something you should try during your stay.

Great hotel, great location, excelent service! Definitely would return! It is my third time at this hotel. Shortly it shall offer free wi fi in the rooms, so ir will be perfect! Great bar and restaurant!

Stayed here for a business trip, and was so pleasantly surprised at how warm and welcoming this hotel is! The staff were so pleasant and gracious. The room, though small (expected in NYC) was the coziest I've stayed in - anywhere! I had an amazing night's sleep, and that never happens in a hotel! It was quiet and comfortable - a real delight! Loved the small touches that made the stay that much more enjoyable such as the turn down service with chocolates and the radio turned on when we came back from dinner. Easy to travel in and out of. Wish we had more time here. And it smelled amazing in the lobby and the hallways. We couldn't quite place it - cinnamon and something else. Wonderful!

Leave your shoes at home because there’s nowhere to store them in the miniscule cupboards in these otherwise modern and functional rooms. I left mine on the floor and travelling alone I could barely store the rest of my clothes. If there's more than one of you someone is going to have to live out of their suite case during your stay at the Hyatt Union Square. Apart from this and the open plan bathroom, where you are sleeping in reach of the vanity basin (the toilet and great shower have doors) it brand new, slick with dark wood floors great bed and plenty of good lighting. The rooms are very small, though mine had a courtyard larger than the room, unfortunately I couldn’t use it in winter but still gave the room a larger feel. It's new and is nice and the staf are helpful and it doesn’t feel like a chain hotel more boutique feel than cookie cutter feel. Service was excellent a faulty bedside light was fixed promptly and the location is superb. Forget staying around the touristy Times Square as Union Square is much more interesting with twice a week farmer markets, tons of great restaurants and most subway lines that will get you pretty much anywhere. The hotel has what looks like a great whisky bar and a restaurant, which I didn’t try...there’s too many choices on the streets nearby. The location itself makes this hotel a good choice, if you don’t mind small rooms, its very well run, very clean and practically and tastefully designed.

Spent New Years in NYC and decided to stay here. Great for getting around, with the Union Square subway station a block away. Needed to ship a few packages before my arrival there, and communicated with them through email for this, and they were extremely helpful. The property is in great shape, good rooms (small but as expected). The ONLY reason for which I'm not giving them 5 stars, is because house keeping did leave behind a couple of things that I would expect to be picked up... dirty coffee cups, granola bar wrappers, etc. I was provided with a survey after check out, and contacted directly by the hotel to discuss my comments, which leads me to believe and feel they really care about guest satisfaction. I would definitely stay here again.

We booked on line and visited over the new year period . The hotel is lovely and once you've navigated the subway, a great place to have as a base, within easy reach of all the well known attractions as well as the lesser known ones. The hotel itself has a modern feel . The rooms are well designed with all the mod cons, wide screen tv, coffee making facilities and well equipped with electric iron. ironing board a powerful hair dryer and even an umbrella for guests to use on those rainy days. lovely touch.Staff are pleasant and astute. Any issues were put right immediately so can't fault the service. If there is anything negative to say about our experience , it would be that we would have liked to have had the opportunity for a few New Year's Eve drinks in the bar but sadly this was closed off for a private New Years party. As residents of the hotel, we felt a little rejected. We had never been to New York before, didn't know the area well enough to locate a good bar and the hotel bar seemed ideal. At least in theory anyway. Despite that, We really like the hotel and would recommend it strongly .

Stayed at the Hyatt Union Square in an Alcove Loft for four nights between Christmas and New Year. Although the room overlooked the corner of 13th Street and Fourth Avenue, we had no noise issues. The room itself was quite spacious and well maintained. Turn down service each evening with chocolates, There was a hot water problem on two of the mornings of our stay but this did not detract from our overall experience of the hotel.Friendly staff throughout the hotel including the Singl Lounge. We had breakfast in the Fourth each morning. The menu could probably do with some changes but the food was always good and the breakfast staff outstanding.The location was great for walks into the East and West Villages, as well as to the Highline and Chelsea markets. Would definitely stay here again.

My stay @ the Hyatt Union Square was wonderful. Aside from the hotel being clean and conveniently located, what I really appreciated most was just how friendly each of the front staff professionals were. From the doorman, to the folks at check in, it’s pretty refreshing for me to come across such pleasant folks – especially after a long flight from California.I travel to NYC quite frequently for work, and after a few trial and errors at other hotels, I'm really happy to have found this particular hotel. Fairly priced, modern styling, and close to subways and great food.

Although I have to admit, that in spite of all the small issues we faced, I would most definitely stay here again. Our first night in the tiny but very well appointed room could have been a disaster if we hadn't insisted we be moved. It was very warm in New York and our Airconditioner wasn't working. We called the reception and insisted they move us late at night, for the inconvenience of which they upgraded us to a be it another tiny room, it was a room with a very large and much needed terrace. Then we had an issue with the hot water in the shower, for which they compensated us by taking one night off and a promise of some points added to my Hyatt Gold account which never reached me, oh and a couple of cheese/ fruit and wine platters. The Gym was well equipped, the expensive but fabulous breakfast should not be missed and the service staff was truly infallible.

The hotel is modern and new and clean - plus, plus, plus. The location is one of the best for exploring the city - BIG plus.The only complaint we really had was the noise. We were supposedly upgraded to a city view room over the courtyard room we booked - I wonder if the courtyard would have been quieter. The noise from the street was a bit much, granted it is NYC, it was just a bit too loud for my liking. Perhaps if we were on a higher floor (we were on 4) it would have been better? I did also request a room away from the elevator, but did not receive one - I definitely suggest it. Doors to the room are not well sound-proofed and you could hear everything in the hallway. Overall, good stay for a decent price. Staff was friendly and accommodating.

This location was perfect for a quick one nighter in the area. We wanted to be near webster Hall so 2 out of our party could go to the concert while the other 2 could explore, wine and dine. perfect! the hotel was clean and modern. The desk staff was pleasant and helpful..special mention to Robert who was able to answer ll of your questions. We live fairly close so we do overnights occasionally..normally I am a Marriot lover..but this Hyatt was fine too....Not completely won over . But close. There were restaurants and lounges that seemed pretty inviting. maybe next time since we already had our agenda planned out! The surrounding area was safe and fun to explore! Wifi seemed to only be free in Lobby...if thats important to you . The room was good size for NYC hotel. Upon walking toward the room the hallway smelled just cleaned... inside the room everything was cleaned well as well!

I really enjoyed my stay in the new Hyatt just off Union Square. Fantastic neighbourhood location and small hotel feel from a big hotel brand. Loved the bar and breakfast at The Fourth. Rooms are a little small but ask for a corner room for extra airiness. Only drawback was the heating system...a little loud.

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for the first 10 days of January. What I really want to impress on you all is how fantastic both the hotel itself is and how helpful and efficient the staff were. The rooms, whilst not overly spacious are incredibly well equipped and always cleaned to the highest standards. As for the staff, I really cannot speak highly enough of their friendly and helpful attitudes, as well as their efficient and professional manner. A special shout goes to Robert and JB, both of whom helped my wife and I with anything we could ask of them (I'm disabled and use a mobility scooter) and seemed to always be on duty when we needed something. In short, an amazing hotel in a great location, with fantastic staff and facilities.

Beautiful hotel in a great location with really friendly staff. Only downside was they didn't have the room we booked available when we arrived at 10pm after a long journey from the Channel Islands. We had booked a double queen and they only had a single king so one of our party had to sleep on the floor. Not a great start to the holiday.They offered free breakfast and wifi - neither of which we wanted - also offered to find us another hotel but we were in a group and it was 10pm so the floor was the best bet.All sorted the next day but I'd recommend an early check-in or contacting them before you arrive to confirm your booking.

Although I think they forgot about us while 'preparing our room', they checked our luggage as it was too early to check in, which gave us hours to go explore the city. Our room was quiet and comfortable but the maid did a substandard job cleaning the bathroom before we checked in which made me want to wash everything else first. The prices for add ons were quite over the top ($5 candy bar, $3 chips, $15 glass of wine, and 'Intimacy Package' of 2 condoms for $10 that I've never seen offered at any other property) and the on site restaurants had limited offerings with big price tags. We only heard our neighbors as the doors are literally touching each other- and they slam shut. Nightly turndown service with chocolates, plenty of freebie hygiene items to restock. We're Hyatt loyal- we've stayed at cleaner, quieter, family friendlier locations. However, the front desk staff were friendly and accommodating to all our requests. This was a super convenient location for catching the subway around town. We highly recommend Dos Toros Taqueria down the block as well!

This hotel was amazing. Right from when you walk in the door you can tell it's a bit more modern than most hotels. The staff was friendly and told me his name and how long he was working till. When I walked into my room the radio was playing, and there was a hand written note addressed to me wishing me a good stay in my room. As you can see from the pictures others have uploaded the rooms look very modern, but I really enjoyed the small things. The fact that from the bed, I could turn off all the lights, and I could plug my chargers into an easily accessible plug by the bed without having to go behind furniture as you have to in many hotels. All the connections to the tv are located right by the desk, so if you wanted to play something off your laptop onto the tv, it would be easily accessible. This place really nailed the details, and the decor was beautiful. My room had nice view.

Everything about this hotel was perfect. The hotel was modern and clean. The location was amazing. The price per night was reasonable. And, most of all, the service was outstanding! The staff was incredibly professional, courteous, and accommodating. Of all of our visits to NYC, this is the best stay we have had. Stay at this hotel when visiting NYC.

This hotel is one block from Union Square, which makes it a great base to either explore the region or to visit more distant neighborhoods using the subway. Room was decently sized, and counted on a comfy bed and good shower. Staff was very nice. As this is a smaller Hyatt, it feels more trendy and modern than, for example, the gigantic Hyatt on Grand Central. It became one of my first options to book when going to NYC.

This is an amazing romantic experience. The best hotel we have ever stayed in and will definitely return. We stayed for three days during the Christmas holidays, the staff were attentive to our every need, the room was immaculate and the hotel had great facilities (gym, restaurant and bar). It was worth every penny and more. However, I wouldn't say its for families mainly couples. Great experience! 10/10

I have stayed at this Hyatt for three nights during Christmas time. I booked it directly on the Hyatt website using their sealed envelope giveaway special. Very fortunate, I got the empyreal suite for a very decent price. The room is 1111 which is located on the highest floor of the hotel. It's a corner suite and I believe is the largest room available. We used the web check in at the airport before we departed and already confirmed with a room number. Service was excellent as I was given Internet to use through out my stay for free. Make sure to ask them. The suite was decent size and have a very comfortable bed with a view of the empire state building. The location is prefect just a small block south of union square. Very easy to get to Times Square, fifth avenue thru subway or taxi. I couldn't comment on the hotel restaurants since I have not eat there. But overall I would give a four star to this property.

We have been to New York a lot and stayed in various hotels, but I really liked the Hyatt at Union Square. It has a nice Designer, boutique hotel feel, with a nice restaurant and bar. The room was lovely and even had a terrace, which is rare in NYC and in the summer will be perfect. The staff was really friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay there again.

Stumbled on this chic little hotel while cruising Hotels.com. $299 for the night was totally reasonable for a spot in such a prime location! Upon arrival, we were greeted by the lovely Robert who was behind the desk (hotel manager, I think..?). After a short chat with him about how happy we were to be there, he upgraded us three levels to a room on the PH floor with a great city view. Our room was spotless and, despite its modern aesthetic, felt pretty cozy. It wasn't noisy at all in the hallways either. Overall, great experience there. One minor criticism--no doorman or bellhop either of the two times we came back to the hotel (we only stayed overnight). Maybe it was a coincidence and someone is usually manning the door. But, when we checked in on a Friday, no one was there to open the door and take our luggage. A doorman is a nice touch. Our only wish is that we'd stayed long enough to eat at the restaurant and check out the hotel bar.

My husband & I recently stayed 6 nights at the Hyatt Union Square. Our room was “the urbane studio” Room 613. It was VERY quiet with the most comfortable king size bed & luxurious pillows and sheets. NYC is called "The City That Never Sleeps” but we both got the BEST sleep every night. The beautiful blackout curtains completely block out a ray of light.-I took a picture of the beautiful sheer curtain pattern. One morning we woke at 9am! OMG! If you have to be somewhere, set your alarm or ask for a wakeup call.The room is a small space; about 350 sq. ft. but every bit of space is utilized efficiently. The shower is a good size with great hot water and water pressure. The small vanity area was very efficient for my husband to shave his face & for me to put on the makeup—great lighting.The downstairs lobby is very inviting if you're meeting friends or just want to get out of the room for a bit to read the NY Times. It is a dog friendly hotel too. My daughter-in-law came by with the doggie and we just sat and chatted in the lobby. It is a very soothing and calming atmosphere.One caveat- don't be tempted by the mini bar or snack bar in the room, LOL. The sticker prices are outrageous: Snickers bar $5, beef jerky $7, Dean & Deluca gummy bears $10, 1 liter of Fiji water, $7—ridiculous! Walgreens is across the street on 13th and there are stores all over the square for anything you need.I want to give a shout out to some very special employees that made our 6 day stay very pleasant. The Doormen: Joseph Barnes and Chris Sing both greeted us each time with a wonderful smile & what seemed to be genuine interest in our plans for the day. At the Front Desk Victor Marrero and Sam Gustafsson were very helpful in answering any of our “touristy questions” which I’m sure they have heard numerous times. Also, Valerie in housekeeping, she made our room up quite a number of the days, even working on Christmas Eve Day with no complaint when I’m sure she would have liked being home with her family. I do hope the manager of the hotel will pass these compliments on to these very wonderful men & women. I feel a business is only as good as the people who work there!

Nicely laid out room, very comfortable bed and extremely convenient location. Normal city noises from street but I heard very little from the hallway. Gym was large and clean.Tip: free bottled water in the gym.Tip Part Deux: about the internet. There are TWO networks. If you try the hotel network, it prompts you to pay. Use the HOTEL LOBBY network and it's free.

I had an inside room, looking out on the courtyard. Best of it was the quiet! Never knew I was in the city. And I didn't notice any noise from the corridor outside either. The shower was great, too!Helpful staff, both checking in and out. I booked through booking.com. All went smoothly.

I stayed here with my boyfriend from 11/23-26/2014. My boyfriend booked this hotel after researching numerous locations to stay for a few days in the City. He choose Union Square because of its location to many businesses and restaurants (he could go and grab coffee in the morning when I am dead to the world). Additionally, it is close (a short block) from the nearest subway station. It was nice to be in this location as it was also close to the Union Square Holiday Market. The room itself was not too cramped and could fit both of our bags without trouble. The bathroom was beautiful - large waterfall shower (you can shave your legs without bumping into a wall) and separate water closet. The bed was super comfortable, I didn't want to get out of it in the cold, cold mornings. Plugs to charge all your various electronics were numerous (I hate it when there aren't any plugs by the bed)! The staff was friendly enough, but perhaps a little aloof, I didn't really care though.The only "gripes" I can think of is that there was low pressure for the toilet (which made it not flush very well) and that the room itself has a plank flooring... for some reason I was expecting carpet. I would definitely stay there again though, this is probably the most upscale hotel I've stayed at and glad to have made it a Hyatt. :)

As long as you don't get a room near the elevator, the Hyatt is a great place to stay. Friendly staff, well equipped fitness center, and great restaurants made this an ideal place to stay. They do have free internet but its lousy. Better off paying for the high speed internet although the cost for three days was about half my monthly bill at home.

Staff was exceptionally helpful and in tune with my needs. I asked for a car for a 4 am airport run and the next morning at my wake up call the front desk said "Mrs. Esposito, you car is here when you are ready." Front desk staff is non-intrusive, friendly and welcoming. Room was closer to an international Hyatt than we we usually see state-side.

Location is excellent, union square is around the corner and so many small yet quality bars and restaurants in the surrounding area. My hat goes off to the concierge and other front desk personnel who truly made my stay feel warm and welcome. It is so refreshing to see young people motivated to work hard and put smiles on their customers' faces. Bravo

While gathering all strange happenings during my 3 days of stay at the Hyatt union square I wanted to title my review "a mixed bag" but when I checked out of this hotel and they tried to stuff into my bill some $150 for "package assistance fee" for handling and storing some 5 packages I ordered to the hotel, that was too much. During this stay I as well as my business partners got stuck in the elevators 3 times, hotel alarm was activated by mistake 2 times and when I've asked for late checkout , front desk guy said they are sorry but the hotel is full, but as soon as I offered payment of half rate, they managed to find 3 rooms for late checkout. The rooms are tiny and with 2 suitcases you can barely walk in the room, the sink area in the bathroom is very small with no room to place your stuff. All in all, this is my 1st and last time in this hotel. And if you ask, they cancelled the $150 fee they tried to charge, lucky me that I've checked the invoice.

I was very impressed with the friendliness and professionalism of the staff...the cleanliness of the entire property (I observed staff in brisk winter temperatures meticulously cleaning the sidewalk outside the entrance) and the quality of the amenities. Will add this to my list of favorite hotels.

We booked this for a few days in NYC with our 6 month old son after our NY wedding. Because of him we booked a room on the second floor with a private patio. We could sit outside an enjoy a glass of wine and take-away while he slept inside. The hotel also provided yoga mats for him to crawl on outside and everything else you could need. Union Square is a great place to stay close to shopping, more cosy than further up midtown and easy to get to everywhere with the subway.Stayed at the hotel August 13.

The hotel is extremely well located, with a lovely decor. We were in a small standard room, very nicely decorated with obviously a lot of thought given to maximizing limited space. With two of us in the room, however, it was very tight, with not an inch of extra space -- typical of standard Manhattan hotel rooms. The room was very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful.I would recommend this hotel and would stay there in the future.

I am a platinum member with Hyatt, and think highly of the Hyatt brand. This was my first time staying at Hyatt Union Square Hotel and will not return. This property was very similar to a W hotel. Loud music in the lobby and lobby bar. The rooms were funky and not very practical.The service was very good at checkin, the bar and breakfast but I prefer a more standard Hyatt.

We booked 4 nights at the hyatt union square after trawling through the hundreds of hotels listed on various booking sites and trip advisor. Although it was more than we initially wanted to spend, we liked the reviews and decided to book it. We were not disappointed. The hotel is very well located, close to everything in union square. The hotel provided complimentary wine and snacks as it was my birthday which was a nice touch. The room was perfect and shower was amazing! The front desk was staff were really friendly and welcoming and provided helpful recommendations of places to visit and eat around the hotel. Everything was clean, well maintained and so hyatt! We will definitely stay here again and I would highly recommend this hotel. My only gripe is that you have to pay for internet.. For a hyatt this should be free for all guests.

I stayed at the Hyatt because it is close to our NYC office and happened to have a good rate (for NYC). The hotel is very nice and clean - sleek lines, etc. The sleek lines appear to carry over to the staff as well because they all seemed to have fallen out of Vogue. The staff were also all very nice and accommodating. The room was tiny and the bathroom was tinier. I didn't like the open shower because after I used it the floor of the bathroom was wet - and you couldn't get to the, er, facilities without wading. The sink was outside the bathroom so no problem there. The other issue I had with the room was that there were almost no drawers and no place to put my suitcase. But it would be hard to say that it wasn't a very nice hotel. I would stay there again.

Beautiful hotel, front desk staff very nice, rooms modern and clean, hip crowd. Close to many restaurants and stores. Room was small and internet is not complimentary.We were given a room right next to housekeeping which tended to be loud. I was in bed and I kept hearing a sound like the elevator going up and down. Then, in the middle of the night a man's voice talking in full volume to someone over his 2-way radio for quite a length of time. Surprised by this. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC and and am well traveled. I would consider a return stay to this beautiful property.

Small but very cute rooms. We had a courtyard facing room which made it for very quiet sleep. The hotel restaurant has an amazing All organic and local breakfast. Hotel Location is perfect -a block from Union Square and great bars and restaurants.

We stayed here with a friend. The hotel is clean, modern and low profile. Our room was on the back, so it was very quiet.The location is great, just one block to Union Square. It is super safe, there are plenty of bars, restaurants, bookstores, etc.The front desk staff was friendly and helpful since arrival. I was pick pocketed near the Flatiron building, and my id and credit card were stolen. They were really nice to me when they found out about it and quickly helped me to contact Amex to cancel it, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Lovely new hotel uses technology to make the most of your stay. My room was in the back, as I had requested a quiet room, and it was! Very clean, with wood floors for style and cleanliness. Bedding was very comfy. Room temperature controls were easy to find and operate. I thought the staff was exceptionally polite and personable. Room was arranged in a way to make room seem spacious, especially for NYC! Very close to NYU dorms Palladium and University Hall. 20 minute walk to Washington Square. Lots of good restaurants nearby.

The Hyatt Union Square is one of the sleek, cool hotel experiences in NYC.All the associates are super nice and professional. The ambience is low key and subtle and cool. Rooms luxurious with extra comfy bedding. Highly recommend .

I am a platinum member with Hyatt, so I do value the Hyatt brand. This was our first time staying at the Union Square Hotel and we would not return; mainly because there are other NYC Hyatt properties that are much nicer and typically in the same price range.So the service in the hotel is outstanding. I arrived early and they were able to accommodate with a mid morning check-in; which was much appreciated. The bell staff was so helpful and they always had a smile on their faces.But the main reason for staying in a hotel is the room, and this is where this hotel fell short. First, the room was very small; so small that I actually stubbed my toe a number of time stepping out of bed (hit my rollaway; because there was not other place for it). The bathroom; while very nice, was tiny, And lastly, the hotel was very noisy. Not so much from the street (that is expected in NYC), but from the hallways and most notably some weird sounds coming through the air vents. Could not quite figure out where the noises came from; but it was not pleasant.So if you are looking for Hyatt property in NYC, you should look no further than either of the Andaz properties (5th Ave or Wall Street); and bypass the Union Square property.

We had a very nice stay in this hotel! The staff is very friendly. The room was larger than we expected, and was very clean with a comfortable bed and large shower. Our room faced the back of the hotel, so no view, but it was quiet at night. We did not eat at the restaurant downstairs but did have a drink in the lounge - pricey (but that's NYC). The best thing about the hotel is the location - it's only a block to the Union Square subway station, a great hub with lots of train lines. SoHo, with all its restaurants and shopping is only a few blocks down. I'd stay here again just on location alone!

The Hyatt is fairly new and a great location (close to subway and east to get to Brooklyn, midtown, uptown). The service at the hotel is excellent. We have stayed at the hotel 5 times since opened and see the same staff each trip. We will be back soon.

Good location for those who don't want to be too near the touristy parts of NYC. It is well connected by subways and everything "cool" is in walking distance, apart from Central Park.Rooms well equipped and everything works and heating works. Staff are friendly, as they are with all Hyatt hotels.Cleaners too noisy in the morning and was woken every day at 8am and the elevators are very slow (they all are in NYC).Bar area is really nice and not overly pretentious. I didn't eat in the restaurant but heard it was good.One of the better places to stay in Manhattan.

First time staying around Union Square and this hotel is just perfect location. Just a few minutes from the hustle and bustle of Union Square...2 minutes to Subway and shops. Rooms are freshly decorated with a great shower, I enjoyed a Urban studio with floor to ceiling windows and a great view of Manhattan skyline. Very clean throughout the hotel.Great gym for those inclined to pound the treadmill. If you have forgotten to pack any amenities just dial 0 and they will help you out...with almost anything!Try out the lounge downstairs, complimentary coffee in the morning - great space for relaxing at anytime of the day.

I haven't stayed at a Hyatt for a while so i was looking forward to this experience. The room was small - as expected for NYC. It was very clean, tidy and well laid out. The front desk staff were very helpful in proving directions and options for eating.

My first stay at the Hyatt Union Square was a very nice, it had a small hotel boutique feel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are well laid out and efficient. The breakfast restaurant was excellent and the wait staff very attentive. The hotel is well located near many restaurants and shopping. I travel a lot for business and my stay here was one of the better experiences I’ve had in some time.

I have for years said the Hyatt 48 Lex is my favorite New York City hotel. However, I just stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for the first time. I had a great stay and loved the property. I felt very grateful for peace, quiet & privacy on a lovely garden patio. The staff were great. Everything was first class. Breakfast was superb. The thick cut bacon was perfect. The wait staff was extremely attentive and professional (not always the case at other hotels). The neighborhood is close to NYU where my meetings were held and I have to say it is one of the nicest neighborhoods to stay in. Since NYC can be very chaotic for visitor, I found this part to be tranquil. Also, great burrito shop across the street and a superb wine store as well. Nice!

This hotel is a 10I live in Hawaii where we have the true Aloha spirit and I felt that from the entire staffThe floors are all wood so there is no stained carpet or mold and mildewThe furnishings are sleek and the bathroom is really so well doneYou have a feeling that you have a little oasis in the heart of hectic ManhattanThe lounge is a great place to meet friends and just have a drink and relax after the days endThe manager Tenzing and the general manager Chris Holbrrok are so kind and go out of their way to make your stay a great one

So impressed with the friendly staff this hotel has, really shows that there is a hotel with a good atmosphere.Also have to give credit to Sam the manager, who really helped us out when we ran into some small problems at the beginning of our stay.He really knows how to treat a customer.Good, modern and clean rooms, location is good with a nice lobby and lobby bar.The perfect place to stay in NYC.

A friendly hotel with a great staff. It's in a great location right around the corner from Union Square. Subway stops are close. Comfortable but small room that's up-to-date. I would recommend staying in one of the rooms that faces the courtyard. No view, but very quiet. There must be a fire station around the block because there were a lot of firetrucks going by with their siren's blazing. That would be a noise factor if you are staying in a room facing the street but I didn't hear a thing with a courtyard room. Happy hour at The Fourth was fun but I wish there were more selections to share. Salad and spaghetti are not sharable. :) And the Single Lounge was a nice place to relax with a glass of wine. Thanks Hyatt Union Square for providing a home away from home.

I love the way the staff makes me feel at home. They focus on customer service, and try hard to please. I travel 40 weeks a year, and this is one of my favorite hotels. Rooms are modern, clean and comfortable.

This is a great find in NYC. The location couldnt be better with Union Square, NYU, SoHo and much more all an easy walk. The hotel itself is lovely. Great, well-appointed, modern rooms. Best, though, is the service - EVERY person I came in contact with was amazing! Friendly, helpful and professional. I almost hate to write this as I like it as my little secret.

A talented jazz trio greeted my arrival and check-in was super fast . A smallish room felt much larger by its well-considered design. Clean and stylish bathroom. I had no idea this was such a new hotel but look forward to staying here again.

If you are are travelling to New York City look no further than the Hyatt in Union Square. This is a fantastic home base location while you take in the sights of this amazing city!Located just around the corner from Union Square the hotel is in an excellent location within easy walking distance from Greenwich and East Village, SoHo, NoHo, Gramercy Park and Flatiron. The rooms are not big (but what room is in NYC?!?) however they provide all the modern facilities you will need to be comfortable. The check-in and check-out process is very quick, the staff are very friendly, the room rates are reasonable and the restaurants are excellent... The main restaurant is called "The Forth" and I should really review this place separately as it deserves all the accolades it can get... I would say one of the best Coffee's I have had in the city and definitely one of the best breakfast's... Try the B.E.L.T which is one of the signature dishes! I promise you will not be disappointed.Come now and stay!! What are you waiting for :)

You can't beat the location. It is close to everything. Hotel is nicely decorated, the rooms are a good size. Restaurant looks good and the staff are very friendly and kind. Relaxing atmosphere, recommended!

There's so much great about this place that I'll do the bad part first. The rooms are small. Europe small. That said they are brilliantly laid out and make the absolute best use of the space. Every single detail is thought out, and fits perfectly.Service. There aren't enough adjectives to describe how excellent the service is at every level in this hotel. I travel 10 days a month for work. The staff, from bellmen to front desk, restaurant and housekeeping had an uncanny ability to read my mood and respond wonderfully. I'd almost say psychic. I arrived early and read in the lobby for a bit while I waited for my room. They treated every guest the same way.Restaurant - I didn't expect a lot . Sandwiched between the east and west village walking distance to some of the best food on earth, here was this gem. The food was fantastic, well thought out menu. Better yet and yup I can't say enough about it, the service. If this is your first trip to Manhattan, do not drink or eat here first. The experience will leave you woefully unprepared for dining in other places. They are friendly, they look you in the eye, they'll give you great tips for other places to try.
