In a nut shell they made every person in a fairly packed restaurant feel like they were the only party there. Location- Perfect. Very safe tons to do in walking distance. Subway is right there and not a problem getting a cab. Also way faster from JFK than the regency. Stay here. If you're reading this and still debating, STAY HERE.

There's very little here to suggest you're staying in a Hyatt: instead, it has the look and feel of a luxurious and modern boutique hotel. The place was built from the ground up less than two years ago and still has the crisp, clean feel of a new property. The lobby and rooms are compact but well planned and decorated with neutrals and grays. The bed is divinely comfortable, as is the shower. We had requested a quiet, non-street facing room but there were none available. Luckily, the windows are solid and block the worst of the noise. Every staff member was helpful and happy, especially Victor at the door. We paid just about $350/night; hotel parking is $65 per day while the lot diagonally across the street was ten dollars less. When we tried to log on to Wifi, the message read $9.95 a day although I've read on other reviews that it was free.

I always loved this part of Manhattan. You are close to up and down town and the shopping in this area is perfect and gives you a good selection of the shops you can find elsewhere in Manhattan.The hotel is a well designed boutique hotel. The rooms are better than what you expect in Manhattan at this rate.I was there with my Mother, she is 86, but she ages with love for beautiful modern environment, I guess that is why she keeps so young . The team is a Hyatt team at the level; I don't need to say more, I travel around the world from Moscow to Ho Chi Minh; I'm always impressed by the level of performance the Hyatt team performs in what ever country over the world. The breakfast is whatever you expect from an American breakfast and more. The bar of the hotel is a great hang out either before going out or coming back. This is my second home at of home in New York for sure

My family and I stayed during the last summer in this hotel, during the last world cup. We definitely felt like be at home, Its a very cozy hotel and fresh, despite be part of a big hotel brand, the service is very personalized. The location is great, many restaurants and shops around. Its not so crowed like times square.Rooms are good size, very modern, like brand new and well illuminated. I also recommend the restaurant, lunch or dinner In all our USA trip this place has the value. I definitely recommend. Thank you guys!

I'm on my 11th stay here since April 2014. I've been a Hyatt Diamond for over 10 years now and have been involved in the hotel industry for over 25 years... I'm a picky hotel guest.I absolutely love the location, rooms are on the small side but for the solo traveler they are perfect, nicely designed and wonderful amenities... love the CO Bigelow bath amenities. The hotel also has a great gym, all the equipment you need is there, it's larger than the typical hotel gym. There are 2 dinning establishments and 1 bar and of course room service. Food and beverage is above average for most Hyatt's... but service can be improved. The restaurants are not operated by Hyatt, the are part of One five Hospitably Group.In the beginning I've had some service issues... but I had hopes the hotel would improve. I'm happy to report it has. I can really see the effort from management to staff, it seems their aim is to be one of the best hotels in NYC. The Fourth Restaurant seems to be making an effort as well. I have definitely seen an improvement in service during my past 3 stays. I know some other have said the hotel seems a bit too hip... well this is what Union Square and the Village is all about! Sadly gentrification has changed the character of this colorful part of NYC, but it's still the center of hip-ville, it's diverse, vibrant and artistic...but more in a hipster sort of way (UGH). This hotel is part of this energy, and I love it. In the end the Hyatt Union Square is raising the bar, it's becoming an awesome hotel in one of the most awesome neighborhoods on the planet, in the greatest city in the world. Going to be hard to consider another Hyatt or hotel when in NYC.

Very nice rooms, helpful people, and a little over the top in its hip-ness. If you're under 30, you'll love it. (If you're over 30, you'll find it OK.) But, why, or why, do they charge for high speed wi-fi?

Try this location for a different NYC experience. Just a few blocks from the Village and SOHO we enjoyed our stay in that area so much we only went North of Union Square in order to catch a show. The Hyatt Union Square deserves it's high ranking on Trip Advisor. Squeaky clean with terrific service, an excellent location, comfy bed, a nice sized room (for NYC at least) and great sound proofing. Highly recommend.

Staid there for 4 nights had some troubles while checking in but they upgraded me so it was all good . Very nice and clean hotel the location is good as it is close to the subway and lots of restaurants and shopping to do walking distance from the hotel. Over all it was a very good hotel staff were friendly and always smilling , service is good and also a very modern hotel suits newyork well. I would deffinately comeback. Good experience over all and it is a new hotel.

The Hyatt Union Square is a very well located property at 13th and 4th. You have easy access to a number of key subway lines (notably the 4, 5 and 6 are around the corner on 14th and 4th). There are also tons of restaurants, cool shops (like the Strand Book Store) located within walking distance.The room was very clean and up to date. The only thing which was missing was an in-room safe for valuables. WIFI is free and very good quality.The noise from the street can be LOUD. There is a fire station on 13th and those fellows do like their sirens and air horns.Service was very good. Checkin and check out was seamless. getting cabs etc. was no problem at all.The room had a rate of all in $600 a night...but hey this is New York.

Had the 'Urban Terrace Room'. Very nice room, good size, nice bathroom. The terrace is a real gift. It is enclosed by high (3m) walls, opened to the sky, but still feels good and open. Good quality bed and lining. Super clean and neat. Very friendly staff at both the reception and the bar (been to Fourth bar only, not to the single malt bar - they don't have beer to start with after a long NYC walk before all those fine drinks....). After moving out of a half priced hotel on this same trip after two days because of the unbelievable small room size, I have to say this place delivers for the price... I just wasn't aware before that prices in general went up so steeply all over NYC.

This trip was my second visit to the Hyatt Union Square and it was even better than the first. I went alone for the first trip and used points so had a small but very nice room on the interior of the hotel. No complaints here- there was plenty of space for me, a ton of plugs and tech options and it was quiet. Going back with my husband, though, I wanted a larger room so booked an alcove loft room which are on the corners of the hotel. The room was very spacious and had a sitting area as well as the bed. Again, we had all the plugs we needed and not 1 but 2 huge flat screen TVs. The room had windows overlooking both 4th Ave and 13th street which was awesome. I would recommend you take a sound machine (as I did) or earplugs as there is a fire station about a half block away. Even with the sound machine, we heard the fire truck go out several times during the night. The windows open and although we kept them closed at night, it was very nice to be able to open them during the day and get the nice fall breezes. The showers in this hotel are amazing. They have wide rain fall shower heads with plenty of pressure that makes for a lovely shower. Everything is new and contemporary. The shower had walls made of small oval tiles- a beautiful but expensive effect. The only thing I would change is the closet which is very small and more of an armoire. I like to hang my clothes whenever possible and we filled it up right away. It's not a deal breaker, though. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We were greeted every time we left or returned to the hotel- not the norm for New York. They have clearly assembled a top notch group of employees who genuinely enjoy their jobs. I will most definitely be back.

Great boutique hotel in the middle of everything. Subway station was less than a block away. Check in was easy and Dan at the front desk was incredibly helpful and friendly. Loved the rooms. Super cute boutique hotel. We were even able to crack the window in our room. Perfect for a fall day in NYC! Will definitely visit hyatt union square again!!

Fabulously fun and fashionable hotel....we had a truly wonderful visit. The Hyatt, Union Square is well located and has a great bar area and breakfast/brunch menu. The staff were warm and friendly and couldn't do enough to ensure our stay was comfortable. Our room was beautiful and a good size for NY! We cannot wait to return and enjoy more time there. Would definitely recommend. Thank you to all the staff. CR, London.

Stayed 3 nights in NY this past weekend. 2 of the nights were at the Park Hyatt, and the third night was at Hyatt Union Square. To be honest, I thought Hyatt Union Square was a better experience. Yes, the Park Hyatt had all of the most updated decor and technology, but Hyatt Union Square was hipper, less hassle, just as clean, and had a better location. If you prefer a more authentic NY "neighborhoody" vibe, then this is the place for you. Union Square area is awesome, and is easily walkable to the West Village, Soho, Flatiron, etc. I can only stomach the midtown, time square fakeness for about a day, so this was a breath of fresh air... literally- my room had 3 windows and they all opened. It was 70's in October in manhattan, and the breeze was nice. The staff was great. I won't hesitate to go back.

I stayed for a week last month and had several family members and friends also at the hotel. We are all in agreement that we experienced the best hotel staff of all of our NYC visits. I need send thanks and a shout out to Erin, Halima, Chris, Joseph, Dan Melissa and Robert for their friendly smiles and help managing our stay as it was like juggling jello with the various check-in and departure dates and times as well as the need for cabs throughout the day.The hotel manager needs to be acknowledged for excellent recovery service for an incident of no fault of the hotel.The nicest gesture was the room upgrade to their best suite for a person who was only staying one night due the limited nursing coverage for her adult son. The upgrade made her queen of the day.Loved kicking back in the beautiful lounge off of the lobby. Can't wait to return next year.

This hotel seems to be targeting the 'hip' crowd, which is not us. The lobby is slate and hard surfaces, the male staff are young, unshaven with shirt tails untucked - they are cool, I guess. All staff members are friendly and helpful, some more capable than others.The rooms are small with very little storage. We stayed here a week, so we were not able to unpack and had to live out of our suitcase, we had to consolidate everything into one suitcase so that we had room to walk around the bed. The room was for two adults, but we only received one bathrobe, one pair of slippers and one bottle of water - I guess we were supposed to take turns. We started hiding our bottle of water hoping they would give us another one, it never happened.There was a problem with the wrong name on our registration, we spoke to four different people and tried four different times to get it corrected, that never happened either.The restaurant, more like a bistro, had decent food, but pricy for what it was.The location is fine, if you have business in the Union Square area, but if you're going for sight seeing, it will take you a 30 minute taxi ride to get to any of the major tourist spots because of the traffic.I don't think this hotel lives up to the Hyatt reputation and I wouldn't recommend it.

Considering its nightly price, I seem to have been given a lemon of a room. For a Hyatt, my room made me laugh it had so many issues. The ceiling had a tap as though a flap kept opening and closing all night regardless of aircon switched on or off. The shower taps needed to be shut extremely tight to stop the water from coming out (Im glad I persisted and it eventually stopped), the clock radio wouldnt hold time after several adjustments. Staff was quite friendly and helpful.

I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for four nights last month while visiting my son who lives in the East Village. The hotel is about a year old, and very well designed. A great location, easy access to everything. The staff was helpful and accommodating. All in all, a great hotel for NYC, and I would go back, and plan on it, hopefully sooner than later.

I've stayed at this hotel regularly for business. It's a superb property in a city where you often roll the dice with lodging - even with well respected brands. There are a few things that make this hotel stand out from the rest:1. It's New: Everything is fresh, clean, and stylish without taking itself too seriously. It does modern well. A (big, huge) benefit of being new is that they constructed it well - this is without a doubt the quietest hotel I've stayed at in the city. Contrast with another hotel I've stayed where earplugs are an amenity...2. The Staff: They're well trained, courteous, and demonstrate a high EQ. Most times I'm checking in after a morning of travel and a full day of work - they read this well and make the check-in friendly but efficient. No unnecessary chit-chat, unless of course that's what I'm looking for, then they're skilled at that as well and are always willing to consider (and accommodate, when applicable) a request.3. The rooms: They have a really nice variety of rooms including some with spacious garden patios. Here's the thing I love - If you're in one of their smallest rooms, you don't really know it. The decor is modern but functional, which means the space is well used. The bathroom facilities are well designed and I love the shower - roomy, big shower head, perfect water pressure, and easy water temp adjustment. The products are nice as well.4. The Gym: I hate missing a workout just because of travel. And nothing is more disappointing then then finding out a hotel's gym is nothing more than a 20 year old treadmill and a random dumbbell. No worries here - their gym is TOP NOTCH. Brand new equipment to meet whatever your needs - cardio, free weights, machines, core station, etc. The have a filtered water machine but also provided bottled water, towels, COLD TOWELS, headphones for tvs mounted on cardio machines, and apples for post-workout recovery :) It's spacious so you can do whatever your little (strong) heart desires.Bottom-line: I have a choice of hotels for business travel and this will always be #1, but I wouldn't think twice about staying here for personal travel as well. It is absolutely my favorite in the city, and it's made me a loyal Hyatt customer.

I stayed here last month for work. I only wish that I could have stayed here longer as I was hardly here 24 hours so I could not enjoy all of the ammenties offered. The front desk was very helpful upon check-in and provided a wealth of information about the area. What's very clever and what other hotels should do is that they provided a list of restaurants that are recommended by the staff. This would not work at a larger format hotel but it completely suited the boutique aspect of this even though it was a Hyatt.The room was well appointed and what you would expect in size for a basic room in NYC. Quiet for the area which I really appreciated. My favorite things were the openness of the restaurant and lounges. The weather was wonderful so the floor to ceiling glass doors were open on the street. The location is IDEAL for the area. It is not just on Union Square which could be quite loud, but just a block or two away so everything was in distance.Only drawback was that the service in the restaurant was sometimes a bit slow and the host rather distracted at the beginning. However, this all progressed to a good pace by the end of breakfast. I think just the growing pains of a new venue. I will definitely stay here when I return to NYC and have suggested that others do so too!

Great restaurant for breakfast, sophisticated yet comfortable and welcoming. Just-right minibar (Tate's cookies, Dean & DeLuca nuts). Helpful and friendly staff. Accommodating housekeepers (worked around our schedule). Good front desk staff, able to line up car service on short notice. Nice seating area behind front desk for reading, meetings. Good gym. Sleeping room was small but great bed and efficiently designed with everything we needed and quiet - no small feat in this location. Can move ironing board out of small but well lit closet to create additional hanging space.

I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square in New York for a week and loved it! The hotel is modern and classy and located in a very nice area. It's also close to the subway system which is the best way to get around the city. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to ensure you are looked after. Def worth staying here when in NY.

Great experience from check in to check out. Staff members extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms are small but well appointed and very quiet. Great location for shopping, dining and sightseeing. Would definitely stay again.

Loved my stay here. The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. Every night, when I got back after a long day of work and going out, I was personally greeted in the lobby - I felt like I had arrived home. The hotel seems brand new - everything is clean, spacious, and well-appointed. I stayed in an Urbane Sky Room on the top floor - the room definitely had a lot of space to move about, and the floor-to-ceiling windows let in a *ton* of light. The one con is that Union Square can be really loud during the day - definitely heard a bit of street noise - but at night I had no trouble sleeping. Would definitely stay here again - a great jumping off point to the rest of the city.

Everything about this hotel was absolutely fantastic. The property itself is definitely one of the more unique Hyatt properties out there - all the amenities you'd expect from a high end Hyatt but with the intimate feel of a boutique hotel. Diamond benefits during this stay included breakfast for 2 at the hotel restaurant ($25 per person), and since we were celebrating a special occasion, an upgrade to one of the most incredible suites I've ever stayed in (an outdoor deck large enough for entertaining 20+ guests, a 2-person rainfall shower the size of most bathrooms...) For a NYC hotel, the gym was also much bigger than I expected...was able to get a decent workout in before an evening of gluttony. Service was impeccable, from check in to the speediness of the ice/glasses we requested to be brought to our room. Location also can't be beat...drop a pin in the middle of all the sights you'd want to visit in NY and it'd be in Union Square. Would without a doubt return to this hotel on my next visit to NY.

Hotel is extremely clean and comfortable and is in a fantastic location. Steps from a major subway hub and union square and all of the amenities offered therein. Rooms are small but very cleverly designed to maximize space and utility. Fitness facility is top notch with water and towels and very clean new equipment. Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, with everyone asking your name and remembering it upon return.

We were in NY to visit our son and attend one of his performances. The hotel decor is modern and beautifully done, our room was an urbane studio and we enjoyed our partial view of the Empire State building, fun at night with all the lights. Aside from being beautiful, the room was clean and comfortable. We can't say enough wonderful things about the friendly, helpful staff. We had breakfast in the restaurant which was delicious, our waiter attentive. Easy walk to the subway, and a variety of restaurants, coffee shops and interesting NYC parks. We definitely would return on our next visit to New York.

My husband and I have recently returned from a two week stay at the Hyatt Union Square and I just wanted to say how impressed we were. We have stayed in a few different hotels around Manhattan over the last few years and I must say that the Hyatt rates as one of the best we've visited.The staff were all really friendly, helpful, pleasant, and professional, on checking out Michael and Victor Marrero were super. I must also praise the behind the scenes staff (cleaners, etc for their hard work and professionalism). The hotel itself is very modern, the lobby is beautifully designed with plenty of space to sit and relax. We booked a Urbane Studio room which was fabulous, it was spacious, comfortable with a wonderful bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable as were the pillows. The location is great, I love the Union Square area it has some good bars and restaurants and you are a minute away from the subway. I would like to keep this hotel secret, but that would be doing it a disservice. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay, a welcoming and comfortable one.

I needed to stay near Union Square and was so pleasantly surprised at the quality and relative affordability of this hotel. The modern design is stunning and the rooms are spotless and comfortable. The photos the hotel provides on their website are totally accurate. I did not eat in the restaurant, but I did have room service breakfast, which was as pricey as any other NYC hotel but was fine. The location is perfect for anyone visiting NYU, going to a show at the local clubs, etc. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

From the doorman to the reception staff to the room service team, the staff at Hyatt puts customer service to the forefront.Every interaction was driven by a desire to serve and tend to the satisfaction of the guest.

Stayed for 23 nights in Aug/Sept and had a great experience. Check in was totally smooth. The room I got was just as promised - I requested a higher floor with city view and was very happy with the room. For a long stay, this room was great for a single traveller - and for a normal/short stay would be great for a couple as well. The style is clean and modern. The bed is super comfortable. The staff working the front desk and the door are incredibly helpful and warm. A few glitches during my trip were handled quickly and smoothly. The hotel has a great bistrot that I also frequented a bit. The service there was not consistently great - it depended on the waiter and host - and was often understaffed (which I also found to be true in my previous stay at this hotel) but the food was great, and when the staff was "on" - all was good. I did not let this affect my rating for the hotel as I view the restaurant as separate. The location is fantastic. Not only central but right next to a Subway stop that is Express stop - could not be easier. I stay in many hotels - about 5 months of business or personal travel in a year - and I definitely plan to return to this one again. This will become my NY go-to hotel for sure!

I travel occasionally for my job and I enjoy the experience of staying in different hotels. I'm quite selective when it comes to hotels as well. I'm so lucky to have found this relatively new Hyatt property in a prime location in NYC. It is located right off the Union Square subway stop (the entrance for the train is like a block away). The area is perfect for both business (like myself) and tourist. Every type of restaurant, shopping, and convenient store is around the corner. I love this area of the city because Union Square has an open air market with local vendors who sell fresh flowers, veggies and other items. Plus you can't beat the abundance of street entertainers!Before I entered the hotel, I was warmly greeted by the bellmen who ushered me to the front desk where I was graciously greeted again by the front desk staff. I so wish I could remember names because this would be a great time to mention those who helped me. A gentleman took my bags to my room and also assisted me in hailing a cab once I returned to the lobby (I was headed to an event that evening).Of course NYC doesn't have 'spacious' hotel rooms (as I'm not sure anything is spacious in the city), but the way in which every element of the room was appointed made the room feel larger. The mirrors and lighting gave the room depth. I believe while I was gone, someone came in and closed the drapes and placed chocolates on the pillow! I promise that was not there when I initially entered the room earlier that afternoon. The bed was super comfy and the shower was hot and full pressure. I honestly didn't want to get up in the morning. Another bonus is the hotel uses C.O. Bigelow products (i.e. soap, shampoo, conditioner)...who doesn't like C.O. Bigelow?! Check out the next morning was smooth and like the previous night, the gentleman assisted me in hailing a cab back to Penn Station. I was quite impressed by the Property Manager, Jennifer who personally emailed me to see how my stay was at her hotel...seriously, it was a personal email, no autofil. I greatly appreciated that email and it really speaks to the quality of Hyatt hotels and their customer service, and more specifically this property in NYC. There are hundreds of hotels in NYC, but I will definitely stay at this hotel on future trips.

As the quintessential business traveller, my stay here was the closest to perfection I've had in a long time. I arrived very late and had an efficient check in with no fuss. The room is extremely efficient (I mean that in a good way) and spotless. But above all, all the staff, from FOH to Housekeeping are friendly yet un-intrusive, efficient without being rushed, helpful without being patronizing. Will repeat for sure.

As a frequent traveler, I am rarely wow'd! It was my first stay at the Hyatt Union Square.1) Upon arrival the bellman greeted me at my taxi and offered to bring my bags to reception. I find this to be very helpful as the most difficult step for the traveler with a carry-on and briefcase is navigating out of the back of a cab, a technical challenge, and then across the sidewalk or entryway with his valuables meaning expensive items such as computers and no less valuable items such as socks! It is common today to have a person ask if you need help after you've already arrived at reception which I generally do not take advantage of because I live out rolling bags and can easily find my way to the elevator and room. Not the case at the Hyatt Union Square making a great first impression.2) The lobby is modern and upscale without being over the top. The reception staff was very helpful and efficient. The room smaller than a typical setting (square footage is at a premium in NYC) but very nicely furnished. Reception brought a bottle of Cabernet (my favorite) as a welcome gift. Nice touch. Classy. 3) The bed and linens are superb and the room (on back of the building) is quiet and enjoyable.4) I especially enjoyed my dinner at "The Fourth", a restaurant conveniently located right of the lobby. The atmosphere and music were arty and calming. The food was a delightful surprise! I truly did not expect to experience world-class food. The Rouget appetizer and Sea Bas entree were as good as it gets - and I'l eaten at many of the best restaurants in the world traveling to more than 50 countries. Wow! I think the fish was as good or better than the Metropole in Monaco if that is even possible. My waiter was attentive but not pushy. I eat in restaurants everyday. I enjoy upscale and dives alike. When the food quality and preparation is of such a high caliber one appreciates the service to match - my experience was top notch. Thank you for that - and at a fair price BTW.5) Didn't find the remote for the TV in the room so I left a note for housekeeping - upon returning to the room and still no TV remote, I called and a remote was delivered within ten minutes. I like the multi-mode digital interface so that I can use the TV display with my laptop and iPad. In summary, I am glad to have experienced the property for the first time and ended up on such a lovely upbeat frame of mind. Expectations exceeded Five Stars!

We had a wonderful experience at the Hyatt Union Square staying for three weeks in Manhattan. The location is great, rooms are very good and we found it nice and quiet. this is our third trip to NY and we have stayed at various other hotels but none which have pleased us more than this one! All the staff were helpful, friendly and accommodating which reflects very well on the management team! We would return to the Hyatt Union Square in a heartbeat! Thank you very much to Victor who retrieved our mobile SIM Card we left behind and managed to send it to us at the airport before our departure. Not may other hotels go to hat much trouble!

We stayed here for a week and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. The location is fantastic for visiting Manhattan, the subway is very close and many attractions are within a reasonable walk. There are lots of good places to eat nearby.We found the king room a bit small for two travellers for a week, especially for storage. The soundproofing around the room doors was poor; you could hear everything going on in the corridor. The staff were friendly and helpful and we would stay at this hotel again the next time we are in New York

Our family of four was alwaysgreeted with smiles and great attitudes. For a new "boutique" hotel it was very comfortable. Our room (2 doubles) was not big, but adequate for our needs, to be expected in midtown NYC. Spa like bath, great products. Nicely located for our day trips either north or south. Would not hesitate to return. Within walking distance to many great restaurants, convenient to subway.

My daughter attends NYU, so I recently visited her. Wanted an upscale hotel with a great location, and the Hyatt Union Square did not let me down. The front desk were beyond helpful and friendly, and the room was modern and comfortable. Not too big, but well laid out with fabulous style. The location can not be beat, plenty of great food around and of course, Union Square is in the heart of Manhattan. I will be going there as my regular hotel when I visit NYC now.

The Hyatt is a hotel of two halves.It is in a good location, I really like the Union Square area. The front of house reception staff were great, the room was average size by New York standards but well apointed with a modern bathroom and comfortable bed.The disapointment was the resturant and room service. Breakfast was terrible, lots of staff all trying to avoid customers, the menu was limited and the food was very poor. One evening I was tired and wanted a room service dinner, again very limited choice, particularly for non meat eaters, one option, and very average and over priced.In summary I would probably stay again, but ensure I eat out!

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Union Square and had a wonderful experience! The hotel location was great for me as I was there on business and the hotel was just a few blocks form my office. The hotel itself was great! The rooms were very clean, well sized, and comfortable bedding. The whole hotel seems to smell like a spa, in a good way! The staff was incredibly friendly from the moment I arrived. Everyone went out of their way to greet me, introduce themselves and offer to help make my stay as comfortable as possible. I will definitely stay here again when I'm in the city, for work or vacation. :)

Stayed here for 5 nights for a business trip. Service was good, the beds are very comfy, great showers and generally a nice set up of a hotel. The restaurant was good. If you want a decent coffee, go directly across the road to 'Think Coffee'. Union Square is great for bars and restaurants and you can walk to the High Line. Overall a very comfortable stay and I will stay here again on my next trip to NYC. The only pitful was to get decent wifi in your room, it is fairly expensive. Free wifi in the lobby.

The staff at this hotel could not have been lovelier. I had about 14 rooms booked for my wedding weekend and we could not have been more pleased. Everyone, from the front desk, to the doormen to the restaurant employees were super-helpful and nice. Would definitely recommend.

My family traveled to NYC and stayed at the Hyatt Union Square, which opened pretty recently. This hotel is extraordinarily nice. Staffs are very professional and passionate and the room was very clean and effectively designed. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to find a nice hotel in NYC.

Just spent a wonderful week in NYC with my family.Stayed at the Hyatt Union Square and was just perfect for exploring the city by foot,subway,taxi or bus.We stayed in a Courtyard studio room and it was spot on for us as we did not spend too much time in our rooms,but the bed was heavenly and the shower was a great wake up call in the morning.Staff all very friendly,courteous and helpful.Stay here you will not be disappointed!!!

Traveled with my family to NYC and stayed at the Hyatt in Union Square. With the not-so-hot NYC weather this summer, walking was the norm. Location of this hotel is perfect. The lobby and rooms are tastefully finished...also more boutiquey rather than the hustle & bustle of Grand Hyatt near Grand Central. Although the bathroom is small, it's well laid-out. Service is attentive especially by the front desk team/doormen. Food is also good, but given the choices in NYC, ate out more often.Two negatives:a) Toilet sink in our didn't drain efficiently (picture attached)b) Service of this one waiter at "the fourth" restaurant during breakfast...felt like he didn't want to be there and didn't want to deal with anyone....we felt there was a lag in service consistency.Overall though, would stay here again. The positives outweigh the "hotel-addressable" flaws.

On my recent business trip to NYC I stayed at Hyatt Union Square NYC which is in Midtown. Great restaurants, shopping and certainly easy to get to and from my business meetings. Quiet, very clean, neat and courteous staff. Will stay there again as I travel to NYC frequently.

We chose the Hyatt Union Square based on location - checking in an NYU freshman. Pricey, yes, but what a value! NYC real estate is quite expensive, so we expected the room to be small (it was, but very cleverly designed, with pocket doors and hidden storage, and beautiful decor and oh so chic!) Everything appears to be brand new and is spotless and fashionable and quite comfortable. Not much desk or counter space but we enjoyed the courtyard view - yes, surrounded by other buildings with just a peek out into the city, but very New York. Our room was quiet and cool and extremely comfortable.The staff, EVERY SINGLE SOLITARY ONE OF THEM, went out of their way to accommodate our needs, to give us directions, to recommend restaurants, to help us the morning of dorm check in with our carful of belongings, to make us want to make the Hyatt Union Square our New York home when we come back periodically over the next four years. The hotel is immaculate, the amenities superb, the location great, but it is the staff that make it perfect. Thanks Joseph, both Victors and Tenzing!

The Union Square location is a perfect destination whether you're in New York for business or leisure. The staff at the Hyatt are courteous, professional and willing to go the extra mile to ensure your needs are met. I stay at a ton of Hyatts and this will be my new go to hotel in New York. #iamadiamondmember

The Hyatt Union Square was a lovely hotel. I would recommend this hotel. I will review the pros and cons. Pros- Located near the subway, very close to Union Square Park which my kids enjoyed, Chic urban feel in the lobby and lounge and restaurant, Being downtown is just cool and not stuck in a touristy spot. The staff were responsive to any needs we had such as towels etc. Also, it was surprisingly quiet! I was expecting noise but I didn't hear any hallway or street noise. we were on the 8th floor. Cons- They were about an hour late in checking us in. Also the room is quite small. We did have 2 adults and 2 kids. It was a double room but it was tight and there was very limited drawer space. But it's New York, right?

I have to start by saying that the bar is set high for me for the Hyatt quality expectations. I have been spoiled by the Park Hyatt in DC where I stayed Jan-March this year almost every week while working in DC. They are as close to perfection as can be, and my expectations have been set accordingly. As a platinum member, I try to stay at the Hyatt as much as possible, but not all of them measure up. I am pleased to say that the Union Square Hyatt measured up 100%. From superb functionality of the room, to super friendly staff, everything was excellent during my stay. And when I say room functionality, I mean every little piece of space used and all with the traveler's convenient in mind. Including power outlets by the desk and superb internet. Soundproofing is pretty good too and the AC is whisper quiet. All the supplies which for me constitute hospitality were available and waiting for me in the room. From a complementary bottle of water delivered daily, to a robe and slippers or a coffee maker. The staff was always meeting your eyes with a smile and a friendly remark. Any request was accommodated, including stowing my bag between two stays. That's Hospitality with a capital H for me. I have tried three Hyatts in NY. Grand Central, Andaz5th Ave and now Union Square. Grand Central is lousy on the hospitality score and I am not going back after they made a bad internet in my room, my problem to resolve with their vendor. Plus you need to call to ask for anything you need or you won't get it; things like a robe or coffee maker you call houskeeping and you need to ask for water at the front desk each and every day (which means if there is a long checki/checkout line, you are out of luck). Andaz and Union Square Hyatt are both excellent and on par. Kudos to Union Square for meeting these standards with a lower price point!. If I may suggest one slight area for improvement it woudl be replacing the powdered creamer with the liquid ones. Powdered creamer says Motel6 to me. On the next visit I will probably store some milk in the minibar for my coffee.Internet is free for platinum members, otherwise it costs $10 a day. I stayed in the Sky room on the 11th floor, facing 4th avenue. It costs a bit more but it's totally worth it. The view was pretty nice and light was excellent. There was no noise from the street except perhaps an occasional police siren. Blackout curtains shielded from the street lights very well. The glow from the light switches was a bit too bright, but I slept fine.

Great shopping, fabulous restaurants, music and shows right in the neighborhood. Best location for easy access to many different subway lines.The hotel room was awesome - perfect place to relax after a long day. A little pricey, but totally worth it.

This was the first time my husband and I had been in New York city in 50 years. We were warmly welcomed, and upgraded for our stay. The room was sleek, modern and very well laid out. We did not hear any city noise, and slept well. Everyone was helpful, and efficient. Valet parking was very convenient.

very welcoming and friendly staff upgraded room due to platinum status also free wifi added perk room had nice views and plenty of room for a New York hotel shower was great heaps water pressure I was in love also a very quiet location it was close to every thing and plenty to do local the bar in the hotel seemed very trendy security at night was excellent

Our stay at the hotel was just wonderful. Everyone has been truly helpful and most courteous. This was our first stay at the hotel and we shall certainly return anytime we are in NY. We would certainly recommend this hotel

... caused by the beeping cordless phone. I would've rated this property excellent (great location, well sized rooms for NYC, amazing staff, esp. the service by the two Victor's at the front desk, fitness center, beds, etc.) but just before 2am, the phone started beeping (not ringing, but beeping) and couldn't figure out how to make it stop; and neither did the front desk know how to make it stop... so they sent someone up to get it.Also, here's some advice.. free coffee is available in the lobby, but only until 7am. After that, you have to buy a coffee at the restaurant, even HGP Diamond members (by the way, the property doesn't have a Regency Club).

A perfect hotel to stay if traveling in this part of NY for business. Rooms are in excellent condition, staff is courteous and friendly, and location is in vicinity of many nice restaurants. Excellent hotel that deserves high ratings for being such a great place to stay.

Best location if you want to live East Village ( Union Square, Washington Square ) area.1 block from Union Square with nice coffee shops, farmer market and lots of restaurants.The hotel has a bar with great ambiance and a restaurant with lots of character where you can have great breakfast, brunch on Sunday or dinner every day.The rooms are good but I would recommend if you have a hard time with noise to request a room facing the courtyard ( interior ) and not 4th Avenue .People are very friendly.if you are on business and your office is in Mid Town Manhattan this is a great location.Price is very reasonable.

just got home yesterday from a 5 night stay in the Hyatt Union Square, and could not wait to write about our excellent stay.whoever does the hiring of the front staff must be commended, they are all incredible(thanks to both Victors, and Joseph, you guys are wonderful!!)we had 2 rooms, huge beds, great amount of space for a hotel room in a city such as New York. so modern and comfortablelocation was amazing close to the train, close to the main shopping areas, great restauants and coffee shops.had a incidence with housekeeping and was worried it would not be taken care, but spoke to Richard, housekeeping supervisor, who took care of the problem and resolved it like a magician, honestly Richard, my faith in receiving good customer service is quite low, but you raised it to another level. thanks for going out of your way to solve the problem and making me a customer that is definitely coming back to stay at the Hyatt Union Square again soon!!!

When traveling with the family, I will often call ahead to try and get our room needs met. Even for our one night stay last weekend, Victor M went completely out of his way when I called prior to driving up from south Jersey. He made sure to get the best two rooms he could, and put our two rooms on the same floor. Victor was sharp, professional and caring both on the phone and greeting us upon arrival. The rest of the front desk team (Victor #2 and all the rest) were equally friendly and helpful during our visit, helping with walking maps and local festival information. We definitely felt the "hyatt touch" throughout this all to brief stay.Lobby and rooms were clean and comfortable, and a very 'hip' experience for Hyatt - not far off from their Andaz brand (which I love). We enjoyed our breakfast at Fourth Restaurant, run by a well known local restaurateur. OJ tasted as good as in a Florida grove, oatmeal very freshly done...all great stuff with very personalized service.Thanks for a nice, quick escape weekend!

I've stayed in this hotel several times over the past 12 months and it has been a great experience each time. I am sensitive to noise and I always choose the courtyard room. There is absolutely zero exterior noise whatever the floor which is a real luxury in a place like New York.The room is rather small but perfectly organized and comfy.The staff was great and even walked me two blocks to help me find a taxi because of a farmers market in front of the hotel the day I left.I am going to NYC on a regular basis because of my daughter in NYU and I will return to the hotel any time there will be room available when I go.

I used to live in NYC before and I still travel to NYC every 2-3 months for business trips, and after staying at multiple different hotels in Manhattan, I can confidently say that this is one of the best hotels in New York.The staff is very nice, polite and cordial. Erin at the front desk was very helpful with the smooth check-in process, specially after the long trip that I had.Comparing to other Hyatt locations in Mahattan, it's far better than the Grand Hyatt - which had very small rooms and bathroom, even for a grand king bed; it has been just remodeled and it has a similar touch to the Andaz locations at 5th Ave and Wall Street, although with an incomparable location at only one block from Union Square. Even better than the Waldorf Astoria (clearly overrated, with old and smelly rooms) or the Sofitel (which is nice, but very small rooms). The rooms are quiet, the bed is very comfortable.If you want to enjoy your stay in NYC and you want to walk around / shop in the Union Square, Village, SOHO, area, this is your hotel. True new yorkers will highly recommend this location.

I'm in NY every other week for business, and I stayed here for the first time. It is my new favorite hotel! I usually stay in Mid Town but Union Square got me away from the crowds, the tourists and brought me to the heart of NY. There are fantastic restaurants in the area, and fun vibes.The staff was more than accommodating and couldn't have been any nicer.If you're looking for a top notch hotel, with a boutique feel…this is it!!

Very nice hotel-loft style very modern and clean. Window opens in room, which is a plus in cool weather (if you can tolerate NYC street noise). The restaurant (the Fourth) has a wonderful breakfast menu. Location is good if you need to be close to downtown. My only complaint is the noisy ventilation system (otherwise would be 5 stars). Even turning it off completely didn't stop the noise. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Quick service to get a taxi in the morning.

Stayed here 4 nights . Had come here to drop our son to NYU - v convenient location as it's next to founders hall . Was a good decision as it proved to be much easier to go back and forth to move things ( staff kept helping with the luggage , taking it on their trolley to the dorm ) . Location is really convenient , next to Union Square station. Lots of great eating and shopping places .

We were dropping off my son at NYU, so I booked the Urban Terrace room for 7 nights. I loved this hotel! Location was fantastic - steps from Union Square with a Metro station steps away. Hotel was quaint yet not pretentious. The staff were friendly and quite helpful. I had a small incident with some boxes that were delivered to the hotel for my son's move-in day being somehow misplaced. The hotel corrected the mistake expeditiously, and later that evening a complimentary bottle of champagne was delivered to our room as an apology for the incident. Thank you Tenzing! I really appreciated that you did that. All in all, a great hotel that takes pride in providing its guests with an exceptional service. I'll be staying there again soon...

My daughter and I stayed here in August 2014. The hotel is stunning, beautifully designed and with superbly trained staff who were unfailingly charming, knowledgeable and helpful. I had booked a basic room, but basic here means luxury; fluffy towels, a fridge, coffee maker, everything you could need and above all a magnificently comfortable bed with top-quality linens. The location is terrific, in the middle of the Village with it's vibrant and lively atmosphere. Some gripes though I am afraid! At these prices, it just isn't acceptable to charge for wi-fi, end of story. And when I rang room service to ask for grilled cheeses after our long journey, we were told they weren't on the menu! Any hotel worth it's salt ought to be able to produce a grilled cheese, surely. Food is expensive: a Primavera salad the size of a side-salad $14 for instance, $6 for a glass of milk! So, stay here for a great night's sleep but don't eat or drink here, and factor the wi-fi charges (grrrr) into your budget.

We dropped our son off at NYU and stayed at the Hyatt in Union Square and could not have been more pleased with the experience. The staff were extremely helpful with the large amounts of luggage we had as well as received three big boxes from Bed, Bath and Beyod for storage overnight for us. There is also an excellent gym and the rooms though small were very functional.

What a lovely hotel in a lovely neighborhood! Usually I stay in the typical Times Square kind of location but chose Union Square for this trip, and I'm glad I did. The hotel was excellent in every respect: the service, the rooms, the restaurants, and the amenities were just wonderful. Bed was enormous and the floor to ceiling windows provided a sweeping view of the city around me. The best coffee in the world from the barista who was friendly and engaging and a simply magnificent breakfast in the restaurant: a banana pecan pancake soufflé-wow but too bad there wasn't stomach room for the made on the premises croissants and pastries... The gym was well equipped and spotless. Leaving VERY early in the a.m. for a flight home the front desk Manager actually went out and hailed me a cab! A safe and smaller town neighborhood environment allowed me to walk around to explore without feeling any concern at all. Next time I plan to get a terrace room and if it is as nice as it appears I may not leave the hotel all weekend!!! Kudos to the staff-

Such a delightful hotel, in a great area and the staff goes above and beyond what anyone would expect to make sure that our stay was perfect. The rooms are chic, modern and very comfortable. We have stayed in alot of 5 stars in NYC, but this is where I will be staying from now on. Its has such a good "feel"

What a wonderful hotel-great location, service and rooms! The ends are the terrific Hyatt beds and linens. Everything is crisp and new-a pleasure to stay there. Being in the middle of Union Square is convenient to everything-shopping, subways and many great restaurants. Will not hesitate to book there again in the future.

We used Hyatt Union Square New York as a base for four days of sightseeing in NYC. Overall very happy with our stay. Front desk staff were friendly. It is a trendy hotel and we enjoyed the decor in the public areas as well as the room. We enjoyed the drinks at the bar but cannot comment on food. Gym was well equipped. Disappointing that in room WIFI is not free. We stayed in cheaper places around America and they were able to provide this. Good excuse to use the lobby though. An annoying mosquito problem in the lobby and bar (? why) that was not sufficiently addressed while we were there. Would stay again and recommend to friends.

Great staff, rooms clean and if your lucky to stay on the 11th floor the suites are cool. The bar has a cool vibe for just chilling out. Hotel is just one year and therefore feels like your the first to stay in these rooms.

The staff at this hotel is wonderful & willing to please their guests. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to Union Square with shops, restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Close proximity to Broadway make taxi hailing simple, whenever the hotel doorman is unavailable to do so. Good use made of small room space, however I must say the room was larger than most NYC hotel rooms at this price level. Upscale coffee shop & bar downstairs. Coffee shop espresso & baked items were excellent, even the gluten free muffin! Hotel is new, clean and as a solo female traveler I felt very safe. I look forward to my next stay here and hope that the rooftop area is open soon!

I was impressed by the Hyatt on Union Square. It’s hard to find a good corporate approved hotel for my company that’s nicer and not off Times Square. The rooms are much bigger than I expect in New York and I also thought your front desk people were very good, esp. as I checked in late at night and left early morning.

Just came back home to London from my great stay at the Hyatt Union Square only to find that I had completely forgotten to pack the shoes. I rang the Hyatt straight off the plane and housekeeping were straight on it, they followed up immediately and Drita the Director of Housekeeping personally informed me that the shoes (I love those shoes) were located and arranged to get them back to me. The staff at the hotel throughout my stay were attentive and helpful, and having stayed at many hotels in my working and other life - I could really appreciate it. Highly recommended.

Travelling with my 19 year old daughter and 3 suitcases on a trip back to uni from Australia - we usually stay at Hyatt Grand Central and wanted to experience a different area. Hotel looks quite boutique and traditional from outside but the staff are funkily dressed as is the lobby. Staff were very nice and "upgraded" us. I'm a Hyatt Platinum member. Our upgrade was the same tiny room only looking out to a busy street rather than an internal courtyard. Not really an upgrade! The room on a high floor was absolutely minuscule and the decor and finishes, looked cheapish. Its a newl hotel, and its going to be out of fashion in 5 minutes! I knew from the photos the room would be small, so I hadn't ordered a twin room, but I didn't realise how small! There was a curved desk -gotta love the desk -with no cupboards under that made the tiny space even harder to get around, and an elliptical mini bar/coffee area that again took up valuable floor space. There was no storage in the bedside tables except one drawer on one and magazine space on the other side. The robe was 3feet wide at best and half taken up with 2 shallow drawers and the safe, and the other hanging half included the ironing board! We had to put 2 cases and our cabin bag in storage to avoid a complete obstacle course! Bathroom actually bigger than Grand Central Hyatt, with excellent shower pressure and nice amenities. It just didn't feel 5* at all. Not luxurious or expensive at all - sorry!Dined our second evening at the adjoining restaurant The Fourth which looked pretty cool. The hostess was good but the two male waiters were average to ordinary. We waited 45 minutes for our main course on a fairly quiet night. I was then up all night with food poisoning from around 4am and couldn't go out the last evening to the restaurant we'd been looking forward to as I was still so ill and I'm never sick! The position of the hotel is great, and I much prefer the area downtown as it has a much more local and interesting vibe. Don't think I'd ever stay here again however. I'd only really recommend it to a business person travelling lightly for a couple of days no more. I didn't see the "bigger" rooms but I just feel if you looked around you could get much more space for your $$. Definitely not for a family.

Everyone was attentive and committed to the guests.The facilities were in impeccable conditions, very comfortable and convenient.The restaurant the Fourth, had a great ambience, service and food. Simply delicious.Everything worked like clockwork. Totally satisfied, absolute recommended experience.

We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Union Square Hotel, we were greated as if we were royalty,treated with the up most respect. The staff were all very welcoming, the quality and comfort of the rooms complete top of the line..

More like an Andaz this place is the best hotel I've stayed at in New York and in my list of top 3 in the world. Genuinely friendly and helpful staff, a bed to die for, and the location is fantastic. Just 100m to the metro. I honestly can't think of any suggestions to improve the property so I'll simply say "well done" team. And hyatt should be very proud to have this property in their portfolio. It's well appointed but more importantly extremely well run.

I chose this hotel due to proximity to Union Sq. with its confluence of subway lines. It's a relatively new hotel with typical contemporary style and décor. Rooms are a little small even by New York standards but nicely appointed. Nice big flat screen TV. And very comfortable bed. Shower had good pressure with no big changes in temp while showering. Staff friendly and helpful. One of the big pluses was lack of the wait time at the elevators which seems to be common in NYC hotels. Hotel is one block from Union Sq and easy walk to shopping on Broadway in Soho. I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but it seemed friendly and inviting.

From the minute our group arrived at the Hyatt in Union Square we were made to feel welcome and the service was top notch throughout our entire stay. It was a lovely oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the city and yet it was still a fairly easy walk (in our day kicks) back and forth to the meatpacking district, 5th Avenue shopping and close to the subway as well. I loved everything from the giant ice cube in my last drink to the delicious iced tea they have in the lobby which is a great pick me up after walking around the hot streets.We would absolutely stay here again, and the only change I would make in my trip would have been to extend it for another day. I have been to large chains and boutique hotels in NYC and the service is always good, but the team at the Hyatt Union Square took it to the next level.Much love and thanks to Victor B., JayBee, Daquan, Michael W. Tenzing, Lucinda and the entire team. We will be back!

I really enjoy staying at the Hyatt Union Square. Everyone is always very welcoming, friendly and helpful. I was telling some of my colleagues about my stay here, and we all agreed that it's the best option in the East/West Village area - we love that it's a Hyatt, so you get points, but it also has a boutique feel that other large chains don't have. Everything is always spotless, and cleanliness is big for me, so the housekeeping staff does a great job as well. I've stayed there a few times, and always receive a hand-written note from the staff, putting that personal touch on it that will keep me coming back!

My stay at the Hyatt Union Square was absolutely excellent. When I arrived, Victor greeted me at my taxi, knew my name, and welcomed me into the hotel. At the desk, Dan let me know that I was the "Member of the Day," which was surprising and exciting! The wonderful, amazing perks that I was offered (wine, snacks, an amazing room, free wifi and breakfast, and more) were only second to the fantastic service from the whole Hyatt team. They even knew the work and volunteer activities I've been up to! It was like white-glove treatment. My room was comfortable and spacious, and everything was truly fantastic. I'm appreciative to the team here, and am looking forward to my next visit. This was my first stay at a Hyatt since becoming a Platinum member, and my experience here has completely validated my choice to make Hyatt my preferred hotel when I travel.

The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel with lovely views and is really clean. It has friendly staff and are always willing to help, they also always smile at you when you're walking past. Only 5 minutes away from Times Square. It has a gym and a spa.

We stayed here for two nights over the weekend, and enjoyed it very much. Hotel is one of Hyatt's "boutique" hotel, so it's a little edgier than a typical property. Staff was very friendly, and the room was comfortable and quiet.

This hotel is a really good find. Great location - lots of subway options right down the street. Restaurants everywhere. The staff was extremely friendly, every single person was professional and really nice. The rooms are typically NY, which is to say they are small. But the décor is beautiful, the bathroom is very efficiently designed and the shower is too die for! One really great thing is the outlets next to the bed. I travel quite a bit for business and I use my phone as my alarm clock. In almost every hotel I go to I have to climb under the bed to find an outlet (usually unplugging a lamp or clock to make this work). Someone was really paying attention when they designed this.I'll be back to this hotel on my next trip to NY.

I stayed here on business and the location was perfectly situated right by Union Square. The front desk welcomed us upon arrival and took care of our every need! The rooms were new and updated, as was the hotel itself. You can't go wrong with this hotel!!

You feel like you are staying in a boutique hotel. This is not your typical Hyatt. From the minute you walk in the staff is waiting for you with a smile on their faces. They are very friendly and always ask is there anything they can do for you. The room was a good size for New York and the lobby bar is a nice place to relax after a long day. I would highly recommend staying at the Hyatt Union Square.

Hyatts newest Gem Great location and one of Hyatts newest gem. I highly recommend this property when visiting NYC. The staff were always available to accommodate all of our request. The location is in their heart of Union square accessible to great shopping and restaurants.

I travel 3-4x per month for business and decided to give the Hyatt group a try when this hotel opened. After multiple stays I would not recommend.If you need to stay at a Hyatt property in NY the Andaz is the only way to go.First of all the beds are completely uncomfortable, the rooms are not properly cleaned, the front desk service is atrocious, and no fridge or cold drinks available in the room.If you need to stay in the area I would always choose W, Standard or Ganservoort which are all in the same price range.Also the Hyatt loyalist rewards are worthless. I'm at platinum status and never received an upgrade. At the other hotels I am frequently upgraded and receive complimentary services.I've complained to Hyatt and the hotel and never heard from them.

Since the hotel opened last year I've stayed three times and enjoyed each one. This was a brief one-night visit, and because we were seeing a play in the Village, the hotel was a perfect choice for an evening downtown. We could go wherever we wished to go on foot, but the hotel's location also makes it easy to get on the subway.The hotel is full of cool design features, but at the same time feels welcoming, and the gym in the basement is convenient and the equipment new. We were given an upgraded room with a great rooftop view East, and the Bigelow amenities are a great local touch. The rooms was as usual well-laid out and quiet .The staff are always part of the great experience at Hyatt Union Square, and this time they really outdid themselves. I had accidentally left my wallet at home, and they went out of their way to not only be helpful, but sympathetic. A great stay, and the hotel has become my go-to in downtown New York.

We had a family traveling from multiple locations for an Art event. Upon arrival there was some confusion with the reservations. We had one room showing as reserved and 4 people to accomodate. Without hesitation and with excellent customer service Mr. Tenzing Dupatsang immediatly assured us he would arrange for appropriate accomandations. Within an hour we had adjoining rooms. This was a relief and at no time did we feel like we would not be taken care of. I highly recommend The Hyatt Union Square as an excellent choice for your hotel needs. Cudos to the staff, food and all around custoner service!!!

Seeked spot near our daughter who lives in East Village for 2 day stay...rarely do we opt for the chains, but Hyatt Union Square is game changer! Decent rate for upgraded city view room...immaculate, cozy & new feeling...love that. But BIG difference was truly terrific staff! Warm & welcoming, helpful & accommodating (thank you Victor!!) plus genuine sense of humor...traits must all be job requirements! Planning return trip to NYC with my sister & her girls mid-August...will DEF stay at Hyatt Union Square!

The hotel has more of a feel of a boutique design hotel. Beautifully designed lobby and rooms. Its restaurant The Fourth makes the best cafe lattes and cappuccinos in NYC thanks to the talented barista Kingsley. Great location next to three different subway lines and within walking distance of the restaurants in the east village. There is a nice fitness center and they have Dutch style bikes available too. We would definitely stay here again.

Enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is near NYU, so there are a lot of restaurants and things to do within walking distance. I paid for the room upgrade, don't know if it made a difference, but the room was a good size & had a view of 4th Ave which made for great people watching. Would stay again.

We regularly visit our daughter, her husband, and our grandchild at Stuyvesant Town, and were pleased to find a name brand hotel within reasonable walking distance. Fortunately we were able to get a special rate. The staff could not have been nicer. Everything (the lobby, the elevators, the halls, the room, the fitness center) was in impeccable condition, perhaps because it is apparently newly renovated. The rooms are typical New York size, a bit small, but it was well set up to maximize the space. As is typical in New York, there are no in room refrigerators, no ice machines, and no free Wi-Fi in the room. There is a coffee maker, an iron, and an umbrella. As we were walking out of the hotel one morning, it just started to sprinkle, and the doorman picked up a Hyatt umbrella and offered it to my wife. We have never had that happen at another hotel. The regular rates are on the steep side, but for what we paid we received very good value at a convenient location.

Here is a hotel that just seems to have it going right, from check in to check out. The right amount of attention to detail without being intrusive or overbearing. The staff is friendly and approachable and you get the feeling they genuinely care that the experience is positive. The rooms are small but functional and the location to so many restaurants, stores and parks makes this a highly recommended hotel. The access to bikes provided by the hotel is a nice touch. Enjoy your next stay.

The Hyatt Union Square is my new favorite, NYC hotel! Stayed two weekends in a row because it was that good!Above and beyond, friendly service, clean, well-appointed rooms and modern conveniences make this hotel a joy to stay in! Conveniently located in the hip, neighborly, university area of Union Square, you'll find easy access to all of NYC's best attractions - and feel more like a NYC resident than a tourist.Every request is met with a smile and the goal of exceeding your expectations. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone from business travelers to couples to families! The Hyatt Union Square aims to please and you won't be disappointed!

The Hyatt Union Square is located in a perfect location--close to subways, walking distance to the Village and so many great restaurants and stores. The hotel itself was clean, hip, and comfortable. (Great shower!). The room was a nice size by NYC standards, and very reasonable. The staff was nice, professional, and helpful. I will definitely return.

Hyatt Union Sq. is nicely located at the heart of Union Sq. which is an excellent location. There are plently of eat and drink locations nearby and the area is busy with hustle and bustle. It is close from the Union Sq. subway greenline. Decently priced and good comfort. I'm sure to return again.P.S.: their shower is one of the best I've used.

My fifth hotel experience in NYC, at Hyatt Union Square, was the best. The location, close to Union square, is very convenient for experiencing most of what Manhattan has to offer. Add to this nice and modern rooms and interior, and a young and service minded staff, I know which hotel I will advise for family and friends. Lars, Norway.

Conviently located Midtown but nestled in a quieter area (Union Square) with a lovely, modern interior. Well appointed rooms, fitness center, but most of all, all friendly, serviced oriented staff. This was my second stay and is now officially my go-to in NYC.

I stayed at Hyatt Union Square during three occasions in July.  Being a frequent business traveler having visited 98 countries in all continents across the world, I have stayed in everything from 1-star hotels in the emerging market up to the top-class hotels in Middle East and Asia. However, despite the class of hotel, you are always looking for that extra that will make your stay special. I had all of that from the moment I walked into Hyatt Union Square! It sounds like a cliche, but coming back for the second time really felt like coming home. The staff is extremely professional and always helpful without being insistent and forceful. The check-in process was very smooth and the flexibility at the front desk on early check-in and delayed check-out was amazing. The staff is young, knowledgeable and passionate about their job. They treat the hotel as their home and they will make your stay truly special.  I will definitely recommend Hyatt Union Square to anyone visiting New York. No matter if you are on a business trip or traveling with family and friends, Hyatt Union Square is the perfect option. In addition, you have everything in the home area around Union Square; a wide range of excellent restaurants and bars, shopping, groceries, or just grabbing a coffee at a bench in the park at Union Square. At the same time, you are only a few stations away from Times Square with the subway with the station just around the corner or the Q-line directly to Coney Island.  In closing, I would like to send a special remark and gratitude to Joseph. His professionalism, positive attitude, willingness to help and support as well as giving useful advises was just outstanding. He was the one that gave our total experience that extra part that makes a difference.If you are looking for the perfect hotel in New York, stop looking and book Hyatt Union Square now!SincerelyFred Hultman

I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights for work and was very impressed. I was upgraded to a very nice room with a huge terrace, had excellent service at check-in from Luis, and great communication both before and after my stay from Carlos and Jennifer.The hotel is located about a block from Union Square which is a fun area. I normally stay in midtown, but this is a great break from the more frenetic pace of that area. Still lively, of course, just not quite as crazy.The room itself was beautiful, I was in a suite so had plenty of room, a huge terrace with a table and a couple of lounge chairs, a big tv (that when turned off is actually a large mirror in the bedroom) with a lot of HD channels, and a great 2-person shower. The last time I stayed was in a much smaller room, but that was also nice, albeit quite a bit smaller. The bed was extremely comfortable and didn't hear a lot of outside noise either which made for a good night's sleep.Breakfast was a bit slow in the morning, but the food was good and fresh. Overall, an excellent stay and will definitely stay again the next time I find myself in NYC.

Exemplary service and warm, friendly personnel made this hotel stay experience delightful. Victor M. remembered my name on the 2nd day I was there after only meeting me once. I thought that was awesome! I was always greeted upon leaving and arriving, The staff is young and eager to please. A small repair matter was attended to immediately and a note was left with the name of the person who fixed it.The rooms are very smartly designed for typically small NYC spaces. The beds, bedding, towels and amenities are first class. Noise and light were completely blocked out for a good night's rest. I would definitely go back.

I like this hotel a lot. My room was not (by any stretch) one of their flagship rooms, but it was beautifully designed comfortable and functional. Great modern bathroom, only thing missing was a comfortable chair and ottoman, which would not have fit in this floor plan. The rate plan I was on did not include free wifi, which is a bit of a pain. Free wifi in the very nice lobby area was available. Super friendly young staff with lots of appropriate tips on things to do and how to best navigate NYC. Everything within a block of the hotel (from Whole Foods to nice restaurants to great wine store). Free first-come-first-served bikes to use, which I did not, but one more day and I would have. Same with a new, clean, up-to-date fitness room.

We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. There is a lot happening around Union Square! Not only is this hotel in an excellent location, but it is also super new, clean and the staff is friendly and willing to help. We had no problems with check-in or with other requests being satisfied quickly and correctly - you can request just about anything, to borrow or to purchase (bottle openers to shoe shine, a list is in the room). I'm getting to really like Hyatt.Close by: Walgreens, Whole Foods, Starbucks, theatre, fantastic goth shop, largest costume shop I've seen, Saturday farmers' market (we bought some local art), Barnes & Noble, street meat (Halal Bros., voted best street meat in NYC, store is close by), Artichoke, Basille's Pizza, Best Buy, McD's, Dunkin Donuts... the list goes on. We took the Gray Line Bus tour a couple days, the stop is only a few blocks away (10-15 min walk). Subway - Uptown, Brooklyn, Bronx is all very close. Just about anything in Manhattan is a $5 - $15 cab fare away. The food in the lower and upper east side is excellent - no need to find a chain restaurant. This is a very cool area to make as a base camp for your NYC stay. We loved it. My friend used the fitness centre and said it fit her needs, was good and new.We didn't eat at the hotel, but had drinks prior to heading out at 'The Fourth'. Staff was friendly and service was quick and professional. The mini fridge was full with mini-bar items on pressure sensors - there isn't room for your own stuff. Our friends didn't have or couldn't find their fridge.There is rumor of a roof-top lounge, that sounds like a great place to hang out. Not open yet.We made use of the free iced tea, apples and WiFi in the lobby. Not a bad place to hang out. I thought I could also see an outdoor patio from our room, but I never investigated. Our view from the room was of the between building space (where the patio is) - nothing more authentic NYC, I guess. My wife complained about the lighting when getting ready for our nights out. She couldn't see to put on her make-up. There are only led lights in the ceiling.

Great experience. Staff very friendly, accommodating, and plush facilities. As a boutique hotel, had maximized the space and the little details. Beds very comfy and plush. Shower roomy although the bath is a galley style. Fitness center state of the art and all types of fitness equipment to make a nice workout. Didn't use the restaurant, but had nice selection. Desk and door staff friendly and would try to get anything and more that you might need. Calm, and younger style but seemed just as happy to deal with us "baby boomers" as their age group. would Stay again. Small rooms, but with a king bed very well proportioned. Nice snack bar if you choose and turn down service. Thanks, and GREAT LOCATION at a fair price.

The room is neat and tidy with very convenient to shopping area and museums. Modern decoration with very good restaurant 'The Fourth'. The managers of restaurant are very friendly and helpful. I spent 6 nights which were relaxing and my power recharged.

The team that work there for me show what other hotels need to do. Always smiling, available and helpful. A great stay and I'll be back. Great restaurant and bar choices too. Perfect location to get around too.

Smallest room I have ever stayed in. Sink and bathroom can be reached from the bed.....that being said, biggest terrace in NYC...no view from terrace, as the website has you believe....but service was good and dark room for sleeping.

Enjoy one night here ...pleasant 'alternative' style and atmopshere for the Hyatt brand. Nice appointments in an upgraded room with an 'urban patio' - given the small room size. Turndown service was nice. One downside is the low limited in bathroom. Would come back to this location,

Bringing first-time out-of-town visitors to the City requires a balance between comfort, ease of mobility, and challenge of resting at night amidst noisy streets below. The Hyatt Union Square offers all of these. Union Square itself is a destination, with its lovely and colorful Saturday farmers' market, terrific restaurants, people-watching, and metro lines connecting to sites beyond. The hotel lobby is welcoming without being overwhelming, flanked by a stylish bar whose windowed walls open to the summer streets and the restaurant Four offering amazing breakfast selections like this not-too-sweet banana pecan soufflé (photo attached. Rooms are smallish but intelligently arranged. The in-room wine bar (with Dona Paola, no less), Nspresso coffee maker, complimentary bottled water, and spacious desk area was everything we needed in our corner alcove suite to join our guests in-house before a night out. A special shout-out to the hotel staff, who down to a person was gracious, pleasant, and accommodating without being cloying. One fellow traveler with M.S. had need to freeze his ice-pack during the July weekend. The staff was on-top-of-it without wait or attitude. Would DEFINITELY use this hotel again for the kindness of the staff alone.

Love this hotel. The staff is always there to greet us as we enter or leave. They provide prompt and expert service. While the lobby is small, stylish and well-appointed, it is the rooms that made my stay. They are comfortable and equipped with all the modern conveniences I needed. While slightly quirky due to their odd shapes, the furnishings are of very high quality and helped me relax and enjoy my stay. A great advantage is the location - 2 minute walk to the center of Union Square and several subway lines. It is our go-to hotel when we travel to New York City. By the way, the restaurant is elegant and the food is outstanding.

It was a very nice stay. The workers are all very friendly & helpful. I just wish NYC hotel prices were cheaper so we could go more often! It's a great location for the subway, restaurants, and grocery stores.

The Hyatt Union Square surpassed my expectations - it was a special 'boutique hotel' (even though part of a chain), with terrific attentive, courteous and caring staff. Victor and Qiara (front desk) and Dita (head of housekeeping) were especially awesome. Great fitness facilities, bar and brasserie in house too - it was so easy to have friends come here to meet and relax, stay and dine or have drinks before going out.I'd not stayed in the Union Square area on other trips: easy access to Broadway and downtown, the wonderful Washington Sq park, and Madison Sq park, and all the attractions around these places.
