This is a very modern hotel (built within the last 5 years, I believe). The location is great with access to Union Square and the East Village and very near the subway. Unlike many places I've stayed in NYC the staff was very friendly and helpful.When I have a choice I now always choose the Hyatt Union Square.

My wife & I really enjoyed staying at your hotel. We are very frequent travelers, staying in hotels over 50 nights per year. We were impressed with the lobby and room design, fitness center and quietness of the hotel at night. From a design perspective, our only suggestion is to add better lighting to the vanity area. We were particularly impressed with the quality and attitude of your staff. It seems that everyone working the lobby was happy to be there and eager to help, without being pushy. They were very helpful throughout our stay. At one point 3 gentlemen were all giving my wife tips for finding small, independent boutiques. Thursday night we asked a big guy at reception for a recommendation for a sit down pizza & wine place. He asked a few qualifying questions then sent us to Rubirosa at 235 Spring St. It was exactly what we were looking for and the food was excellent. Keep up the good work. You have a great operation here.

I have stayed at this beautiful Union Square hotel six times since they opened. The staff is superb, always very friendly and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The rooms are very nice and designed extremely well. The bedding is super comfortable! I have family who live close to the hotel and we always meet at the Singl Lounge . They have an extensive wine list and really delicious appetizers. The Union Square Hyatt is in a great location, close to the subway and within walking distance to many great stores and restaurants. I usually travel by myself and I always feel very comfortable. There are so many hotels to choose from, but this one is my favorite by far!

My partner and I enjoyed a very pleasant stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The room was well appointed and clean. We particularly appreciated the fact that the window opened to take in fresh air and that we could control our room temperature. The bed was very comfortable and staff was friendly and helpful. In particular, I wanted to mention Michael, the young man who welcomed us at the front desk. He was so kind and made us feel welcome. I recommend Hyatt Union Square for its cleanliness, location, amenities and friendly staff. High marks in every area!Sue C

Loved my stay at the Hyatt Union Square. Felt very safe in the middle of a busy and beautiful area of the city. Easy access to my favorite restaurant (shout out: Hu Kitchen) and shops. Truly exceptional experience.

This is the second time we've stayed at the Union Square property. The first was last year when I believe the property first opened. I think the property is beautiful. My first stay had a few hiccups but I wanted to try them again since it was new when I first went.This time, I had a wonderful stay. The front manager I believe was there when we came in and when we left. Very gracious and really made me feel like I could go to him for all my needs. Loved the room layout. So well designed. Really efficient use of the space in the room. Granted New York rooms tend to be small but that's expected. The design didn't make me feel cramped like some other hotel rooms I've been to in New York.Loved, loved, loved the list of amenities they have at the location. I was missing a hair brush and that was one of the items they had on the list. It really saved me a great deal of time chasing one down at the Walgreens. I mean honestly do you want to waste your time running errands while your traveling. Also had a nice breakfast in the adjoining restaurant. Excellent food. Needs a little help with their coffee but would enjoy going to the restaurant again.Great job overall.

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt on 42nd street twice and this hotel tops their service, no doubt. The staff is amazing and made me feel really welcome. Their attention to detail and friendly attitude paired with a hip, clean and comfortable room and great location put this hotel at the top of my list. Highly recommended!

This is a brand new and beautifully designed Hyatt. Everyone was very attentive and focused on delivering an exceptional experience. We loved it and the area! A must visit hotel if you are in NYC! A lot of great restaurants and things to see within walking distance.

Service team incredible. We were in NY for a hospitality seminar and this team just reinforced all we learned about making people feel great. Rooms are clean, modern, comfortable and efficient. Not much of a view, but we weren't there to sightsee.

Rooms are a little on the small side, but extremely well aid out with lots of thoughtful touches and conveniences. The fitness center is also quite nice. Staff is up to Hyatt standards. One tip: avoid the in-house restaurants, even for breakfast, and take advantage of all the fine food and better values within a few blocks.

I would have rated this place 5 stars but had a really bad experience at the bar, complained twice to the hotel and never heard from a manager. First the location is great in Union Square but the hotel is bit of a boutique. Really tight halls and small rooms but well appointed. Our problem was that we went the bar to watch the world cup match and sat down to drink and watch the game at 3:30pm on a weekday. After a long wait a bar tender approached us and I started to order a diet coke and he interrupted me and said "we have a 25 minimum today to sit here" my wife started to order a glass of wine and he abruptly turned and walked away, blowing us off really....no coke no wine just attitude, being that we were spending 440/night we thought this was rude. we left and stopped by the front desk and explained our experience, they apologized explaining the bar is outsourced and not their fault...really its attached to hotel with signage in the lobby. the front desk employee told me a manager would be contacting me and took my info...never heard back after staying 2 more days was contacted by email to insure I would rate my stay well before I checked out...again I explained my negative experience and she arranged a time for a manager to contact me the next day before I left the hotel. again no contact or phone call no follow through. we left an hour after we were supposed to hear form the manager.

Although modernist, the Hyatt Union Square feels quaint and historic with a very personal B&B feel. Perfect place to escape from city bustle, but within walking distance to EVERYWHERE.The hotel's restaurateur and executive chef, Brazilian native, Marco Moreira, is on his way to becoming the "Pope of Union Square South" with his exquisite and interesting cuisine at both on-site restaurants, The Fourth and Botequim!

We were in town for the weekend visiting our son and this was close to his place. It was in a great location for walking to some shops and restaurants and the subway was close by. The hotel has a nice bar/restaurant and even outside seating. Small hotel charm with nice amenities. Will definitely use this hotel again, the staff was very pleasant.

I am a heavy traveler and I can honestly say that without a doubt, the Hyatt Union Square is the best boutique chain hotel in the United States - rivaling most independent boutique hotels. Great location, unique design for the public areas and the rooms, high service levels, exceptionally clean, and an excellent independent restaurant (The Fourth) integrated into it so you don't have to leave for a meal - and, room service comes from the same kitchen! The burger is memorable! This is the most "un-chain-like" hotel within a major hotel brand. The Hyatt Union Square is now my default hotel when in mid-town/lower New York.

I travel the world and stay in hotels about 50 days (for the last 25 years) a year and I can say that this is one of my top experiences for a 4 star hotel (better than many 5 star) I have had in a long time. The bed is comfortable, the pillows great, black out curtains work perfectly, room is very quiet, and all the staff was fantastic. You have and excellent facility and staff. I recommend very few if any hotels that I stay in, not because they are bad but typically they are just OK. I will highly recommend this hotel to everyone I know. While I seldom come to NY, when I come back I am absolutely staying here.Nicely done.

The Hyatt is a chain hotel. However, the Hyatt Union Square is like staying at a boutique hotel. Everyone is friendly and helpful. I stayed there in May and June. Already booked for Christmas. Most likely will stay sometime in the fall.

At the recommendation of a co-worker, I decided to stay somewhere new during a recent business trip, and I'm glad I did. The Hyatt Union Square offers guests incredible service, beautiful accommodations and is within walking distance of everything you'd need. The hotel's lounge, restaurant and gym are all top-notch, and I'll definitely be back.

Great little hotel in the heart of the city. Close to shops, food, restaurant etc. We were able to walk almost everywhere from here and everything was at your doorstep. Rooms were cozy and clean and the washroom are great. Service is exceptional and the staff are very friendly. Turn down service, extra late check-out (3pm) we requested and they said no problem for no cost, Ice tea in the lobby, complementary towels, headsets, apples and water at the gym. Valet was 65 dollars a day,there was also parking across the street and the on 12th as well, but it costs 50 dollars for 24hours. I think the cost of 65 was worth it because we stayed longer than 24 hours and there were no extra charges. We had a great time and really liked the service. They really aim to please here.

Fantastic location close to shops, subway and Union Sq. Empyreal Suite was amazing. With separate dining table, lounge, 2 person shower, wc and bedroom. Sleek modern design, usual Hyatt Comfort. Excellent views, was happy to be able to see the Empire State Building. Service from staff was impeccable. I would choose this hotel again without hesitation. 5 star experience.

I stay for 5 nights, it;s a new Hyatt in the nice and most strategic neighborhood in NYC, you are near of everything by walk or by subway (at one block). The hotel is in a nice buildinq and with a modern decoration that looks very good, I stay in a king room that was small but very comfortable, excellent bed and pillows and nice shower. The bar that's located at the corner of 13th st and 4th av and has also an independent street entrance is very trendy and a good place to take a drink before you go out to dinner, don't hesitate to take breakfast at the restaurant, excellent coffee and a good service in a very nice decor. I would give 5 stars to this review but because of an important error of them with my reservation that was partially solved I take off one, in spite of that I will return here.

I was highly disappointed with my experience here.1. The rooms are very small for what you pay ($500 a night) - the closet is a small piece of furniture, and the shower is literally on top of the bed. I'd say 150 square feet at most, including bathroom space.2. They charge you an offensive amount for just about everything. Water, that's $8 extra. Coffee, oh that's $12 (really?). You want to bring some beverages back to the lobby, sorry, that's not permitted under hotel rules (i was actually told this).3. They don't really have a concierge or other value-added services that I am aware of.I think you can stay in much better value around Union Square, or higher end hotels on Central Park, than stay here.

I have traveled extensively all over the world and will tell you our experience at your hotel for my Daughter's wedding was one of the best if not THE best I ever had. The staff was incredibly nice to all of our wedding guests (they all commented on how polite and friendly the staff was) and very helpful to assist in any way. The front desk staff was excellent. EVERY member of the Bellman's staff was superb! We had tons of luggage going in and out...taxi needs, car needs, limos and shuttles picking us up and they managed it all with a smile. And we couldn't have had a successful event without the help of the Marketing/Event Coordinating staff.. The rooms were very nice and the maid service was great. The restaurant and bar...including staff...was very good as well. When I need to stay in Manhattan....I'll be staying at the Hyatt Union Square. My congratulations to you on a splendid operation.

I travel to NYC for business fairly frequently and try to stay at the Hyatt Union Square whenever I'm in town. The rooms are a great size for New York and the quietest that I've stayed in. There is a ton to do nearby and the location is pretty central to get to other spots as well.

We had a two night stay at this new Hyatt--first time for us as we were visiting relatives in NYC. It's a beautiful hotel---the staff was super friendly and attentive to our needs. The rooms are large by NYC standards, and very clean and comfortable. Beautiful tile in the shower, with a separate toilet. It was a great location near Union Square, so we could walk to the farmers' market on Saturday morning--fun. We'll be back.

Stayed 2 nights while in town for a conference. The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square (obviously), but also East Village, West Village, NYU, etc. The hotel itself is very modern and upscale. Reception/check-in area is small with just a couple of counters, but the staff are friendly and efficient. In fact, I was greeted with either a "good morning" or "welcome back" almost every time I saw any staff person.My corner room was perfect. It was L-shaped with a couch, desk, and TV on one side and bed and TV on the other. Didn't really need 2 TVs, but it was convenient. Bed was comfortable and bath was well stocked. Didn't try the restaurants or fitness center in the basement.The hotel is not cheap, but comparable to other options nearby, and well worth the price. Highly recommended.

This newer addition to the Hyatt family gets a top score in my book! Great location, modern and comfortable rooms, excellent and attentive staff ... who could ask for more? I have stayed here several times and appreciate being remembered and welcomed back with genuine warmth.I am almost torn between keeping this as my 'secret' discovery and sharing this precious 'gem' of a hotel with all my friends.

This Hyatt was beyond and way above anything I expected when I arrived with my family! From the new and very clean rooms to the family like greetings and treatment from the workers :) Micheal at the desk was more them welcoming and accomadating and all the other staff was just as amazing!!! I would never stay anywhere else in NYC! I suggest you don't stay anywhere else! Sincerely, Happy family from Detroit :)

I always choose to stay here in NY. Really nice -- has a very "boutique" feel to it. Staff are great -- very friendly and helpful. Rooms are always very clean, overall the hotel is very well kept. Beds are very comfortable, rooms are small (as always in NY) but very well designed. Very modern and new feel to the entire Hotel -- very nicely designed.Fourth Restaurant is excellent.

I am a business traveler and really enjoyed my stay here. The staff is incredibly friendly.. from the doormen to the folks at the front desk. Great hosts all around with a convenient location near Union Sq. Nice bar with an adjoining restaurant. VERY quiet rooms. The hotel has a nice gym with plenty of treadmills, equipment, etc. Loved the apples and bottled water.I will definitely stay there again.

I recently spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Union Square . This was my 6 th trip to NY and I have to say one of the best. The location is fantastic being so close to good shopping and the restaurants of Soho. I liked that it was away from the high rise financial district of midtown and a little closer to the tree lined streets and village atmosphere that this part of town offers. The hotel itself is very clean and modern. The rooms very comfortable and quiet. I had a corner suite on level 5 and enjoyed the modern design and inclusions. The staff are fantastic. Front desk staff very happy to assist and extremely welcoming. I will return!

We stayed here last week and the hotel was amazing. We had a wonderful welcome each time we came into the Reception area where the staff were so friendly and helpful in every way. Both Victors were exceptional. The bed was the most comfortable we have slept in. Fantastic location and modern carefully designed rooms with the shower and toilet separate. Fantastic air-conditioning which we could adjust easily and instantly. Also very quiet at night.We loved it and are planning a return visit. Thank you so much.

My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 5 days. Very nice, modern, chic hotel. The staff is wonderful and available. Lighting controls are very techie, the TV is great (not the usual flat-panel add-on with bad resolution), the bedding is superb. And it's quiet, even facing out on Fourth Avenue. Best of all is the shower -- planning to buy one of the shower heads for use at home! Highly recommend and we'll be back.

Recently stayed at this hotel. It is in a great location near union square. The rooms are new, very comfortable, extremely clean and quiet. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. It's a great location for a stay in NYC. Will return.

The staff are wonderful, the rooms are tasteful and the location is awesome. It felt like a hidden gem in the midst of downtown new york city. Really looking forward to seeing here again next time I pass through

Hotel overbooked for my room classification ,after lengthy process problems worked out.Even though conditions not the best,the management did everything possible to ease my dissatisfaction .My faith in management has been restored.

My family stayed at this hotel during Memorial Weekend and were pleasantly surprised by the new modern interior and courteous service. I got an excellent deal from Costco and the price, quality of the room and the location of hotel would be very difficult to beat. This Hyatt sits between Union Square Park and NYU and everything we needed was within easy walking distance. Taxis were easy to hail and even though we stayed at the lowest floor (3rd) we did not hear any disruptive noises. We would gladly stay here again on our next visit.

Rooms are lovely albeit small. Location is key as it is basically on top of the trains. My picky family was pleased with the service and quality of hotel! Hotel was not over the top or flashy but quality of service was like a high end and over the top hotel.

This fairly new hotel is located in the lively East Village. It is modern and comfortable, and has a friendly and helpful staff. I'll certainly stay there again. My one suggestion to management is to provide better reading lights.

Our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. Especially liked the hardwood floors and the lighting system. Smart shower stall. It's a great location (around the corner from Strand bookstore!) and the staff is helpful and friendly. Attractive hotel restaurant offering healthy breakfast choices. They offer a discount to AAA members. We'll be back!Ken S

We stayed here for 9 nights. We really liked the location of the hotel because it was removed from the main tourist area of Times Square yet not too far from everywhere else. The rooms were pretty small but considering we were out most of the time this wasn't a problem and our bed was extremely comfortable. The staff were all young but always very helpful and enthusiastic. Particular thanks should go to Ephrom on the front desk and Joseph who always had a huge smile as he hailed our taxi. If the staff did not know something straight away they always looked it up for us and nothing was ever too much trouble. The restaurant in the hotel was also very good.

This was our third stay at the Hyatt Union Square NYC . The staff was very welcoming, warm & friendly. The rooms are new, large for a boutique hotel and have everything you need. From a great shower, robes, outlets everywhere , cool lighting to current magazines for all tastes, this hotel has it all. It is centrally located in lower Manhattan , so walking is easy to shops & restaurants. Don't think we'll ever stay anywhere else.

We just spent 4 nights at the Hyatt Union Square and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location with shopping, restaurants and subway stations nearby. Union Square is right around the corner. The staff were very nice and accommodating. The restaurant has a good breakfast and the bar is very nice. We had a room overlooking 4th and yet the windows were soundproofed enough to keep most of the noise out. The bed was sooooo comfortable. The room is modern and clean and nicely decorated. My only complaint is that there are not enough drawers in the bedroom to put away your clothes. A couple design tweaks would have solved that problem. We enjoyed our stay and will go back to this hotel in the future.

The best part about this hotel is the door man. Victor is friendly, courteous and remembers your name. After that it goes downhill. The computer check in process is a mess. The reservations are always messed up. The rooms are usually not ready. The maid service is spotty. If you drive call way in advance to get your car, we waited an hour. The rooms are small but clean and the bed is comfortable. If they get the front desk figured out it is a convenient hotel in the NYU area.

We have stayed at this hotel twice in the past year and love it. The location (just off Union Square) is fantastic (close to subway, etc.) The service is spectacular - everyone was helpful and even made the effort to remember our names. We will be back soon!

This hotel is very nice, nice furniture, good food and the best staff I ever experienced, the guest care is incomparable, which is fundamental, expecially when you travel for business, with lots of stress.Will be my hotel in NY in the next trips, for sure.

New York hotels can be hit and miss. Well this one is a hit. We walked in in a rush to quickly checked in as we were getting late in attending a convocation. They took care of us professionally, checked us in, took our luggage, gave us the key and got us a taxi in a just a few minutes. When we later got back to the hotel, our luggage, etc. was in our room; the room was rather small (this is New York after all) but very well organized, very functional and elegant and with a super walk-in shower (essential for a good stay). Throughout our stay the staff was friendly and most helpful whenever we had a request. We will be back. I recommend this hotel for its location, the fact that it is modern/new and for the fact that staff seems genuinely interested in whether everything is in order.

My husband and I stayed for a week at the beginning of May to celebrate both my birthday and our wedding anniversary. We loved everything about our stay. The hotel is modern, elegant and exceptionally clean. The rooms are spacious compared to many other city hotels and we particularly liked the open plan bathroom as it added to the spacious feel of the room. The Shower was large and powerful and the bed was extremely comfortable. We stayed on the 8th floor and did not hear any noise from the street below at all. The staff were all brilliant; really helpful chatty and friendly. They could not do enough for us and dealt with any requests quickly. We ate in the hotel restaurant one evening and the food was good although more expensive than other restaurants in the area. We chose not to eat breakfast in the hotel and instead opted for bagels and coffee from the coffee shop opposite the hotel, or ate a larger cooked breakfast at a local diner a few blocks away called Joe Junior’s. The Union square area was the perfect place to stay. You are within an easy walking distance of many sites and on the main subway lines if you prefer to take the train. We did a mix of both and easily accessed the whole of Manhattan. We even managed to go to watch the Mets one evening and get the subway home in the early hours with no issues. There were lots of really good restaurants fairly close to the hotel around Union Square and a short walk away in East Village. The staff are happy to give tips if you are looking for a particular type of food.I cannot recommend this hotel enough and will definitely stay here next time I visit New York.

We stayed three nights in Union Square and chose this hotel because it is new. The rooms are comfy and quiet, the desk staff are friendly and helpful and the location couldn't be better. It isn't the same as staying in Midtown which is my usual first choice, but i actually liked it better! It was easy to get anywhere from this location, and I loved spending time in Union Square Park. The rooms are small, but have all the necessary amenities, and the most comfortable beds. I appreciated being off the street as it provided respite from the hustle and bustle, and was quiet at night and early morning so i could sleep.

We were here for four nights. Our surroundings were roomier than many NYC hotels we have stayed in. The decor was contemporary and attractive. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. And the quiet was very much appreciated. The staff was young, charismatic and very willing to help. The location was great. The service was very good. We did miss the presence of an in-house concierge. Although staff was eager to help, they often had to ask among themselves until someone had the answer to our questions.

The Hyatt Union Square is a great place for a get away. Great neighborhood, friendly and welcoming staff. The rooms are modern and comfortable. We have stayed 3 time this year and it continues to be our first choice when staying in NYC.

We recently used the Hyatt Union Square New York for our son's wedding party and the Hotel staff was tremendous. We booked 25 nights of rooms and the staff and hotel were fantastic. From the doormen, reception check-in, food and beverage, sales teams, everyone exceed our expectations. I would highly recommend anyone using this terrific smaller hotel with charm, new amenities, classy and well trained staff, and a great location in New York's Union Square area. Needless to say the Wedding was a huge success made even better due to the wonderful hotel and people. Our family are huge Hyatt Union Square Hotel fans and will use again and again on any NYC trips. We had 7 children and 24 adults in our wedding group. Kid friendly hotel.

This property can't be beat for the area. I greatly enjoy staying here and make it a point to book in advance since it fills up quickly. The staff is incredibly friendly and the accommodations feel spacious for a NY room. They use the room space really well in the studio rooms. Splurge on a terrace room and you can have your own outdoor space for dinner/a glass of wine with friends.

Stayed at this hotel twice in the last 3 months. Very friendly and helpful staff, nicely decorated and very clean rooms, great beds! Lounge is a good place to have a drink at the end of the day. And of course, can't beat the location!

This Hyatt is a wonderful hotel located 1 block south of Union Square on 4th Ave. in New York City. For an inner city hotel, the rooms were a good size and they make good use of the space with enough drawers and other amenities (e.g., coffee maker) to make the stay very comfortable.The front staff are knowledgeable, friendly, and very helpful. There are only 2 elevators for this 10 story hotel but they work quickly and efficiently so the wait time is minimal.The stay was 1 night (May 9, 2014).

First thing,its new. For a downtown NYC hotel,the rooms are a nice size and very comfortable. Beautifully appointed with everything you could want or need. And,if you forgot anything,there is an extensive list of items that you could request from housekeeping. One that I would recommend is the lighted makeup mirror. As beautiful the room is,there isn't enough lighting anywhere to put your makeup on. Awesome shower!!!!! Plan a long one. The hotel staff was very friendly and a shout out to John ( one of the managers) for clearing up a small misu derstanding. THANKS! If you like to walk, you'll love this location. You have the union square market a block away. Don't plan on using the in room fridge for ur perishables though. Its a mini bar. My daughter and i walked from the hotel to the High line park and in another direction to the Duplex and Terra Blues. All fun suggestions btw. We try to stay in a different hotel each time we stay in the city but this one I think we will be back too.

This hotel will soon be one of the greats, a future institution like other hotels in NYC. Great room, great bathroom, great location, great restaurant, close to other affordable dining choices and excellent coffee across the street. The best part- the staff. Everyone is super-friendly, everyone is super professional, everyone understands that they're in the business of HOSPITALITY. Kudos on a job very well done !!!

This is the newest hidden gem in NYC. I've traveled there several times this year and this has felt like my home away from home. The management and staff are amazing-service is excellent. Great atmosphere, the rooms are modern and immaculate. Food is also delicious. Special thanks to Carlos, Evan, Kaitlin, and Daquan for making us feel so comfortable and being so accommodating.

My daughter is attending NYU and the location couldn't be better. I had a lovely view and was within walking distance to just about anything. The food/restaurant choices nearby were tremendous. The staff could not have been more friendly, helpful, and accommodating. I will definitely be returning. Thank you Hyatt, this is a class act.

My daughter celebrated her 21rst birthday with her friends in New York City, and we are so glad they stayed at the very beautiful Union Square Hyatt. Upon entering their rooms, I immediately received a call about how clean and beautiful the hotel is. Before they arrived, I spoke with a very accommodating and kind concierge named Tenzing Dupatsang who coordinated a lovely welcoming snack for the girls. This consisted of cheese, fruit, and other pastries. The girls really enjoyed the tasty snacks. As their mother, I was glad to have snacks for them when they arrived from their long travel time into the city. Tenzing is also aware that I am concerned about their safety and has been communicating their travels to me. They went to a nearby chocolate restaurant and Webster dance hall. After hearing about how wonderful the hotel is, I am anxious to stay there myself one day. I am a dedicated Hyatt customer since Hyatt has never failed me in quality, service, cleanliness, and overall excellence in staff. Thank you to the staff at this hotel for greatly contributing to the enjoyment and happiness of my daughter's special night with her friends.

I had business in NYC so I picked the Hyatt Union Square for logistical purposes and couldn't e happier. Even if it wasn't close to what I was in NYC for, the location is fantastic. We walked down to the Freedom Tower, Soho, Lower East Side, we don't mind walking. The service was amazing, didn't have to ask for anything, it was like management could read our minds! The staff was extremely friendly. The lounge and restaurant were great too. The rooms are great sized for NYC standards. Super clean and very nice. C.O. Bigelow soaps, shampoo and conditioner. All in all, very happy with our stay there, wouldn't hesitate at all to recommend this hotel and without a doubt, I'd stay there again.

A calm, appealing oasis in the cacophony that is New York City. The front desk folks are courteous and ready to help with anything. Also, you should eat at the hotel restaurant (The Fourth) while you're there. I have the memory of a gnat and I remember that delicious breakfast in all its fantastic glory.

Having stayed at many Hyatt properties all over the world, I was surprised and disappointed with the lack of basic amenities provided. Most sorely missed...the in-room coffee maker (one cup limit) had only decaf coffee, no regular. So I called guest services and was told they were out of regular coffee! For the next 3 days!!! Customer service would have dictated a quick run to a local market to pick some up. While down in the lobby bar on day 3 I discovered they had set up a coffee pot (no one had informed me it was there) but, you may have guessed it...OUT OF REGULAR COFFEE!!! At 7:00 AM. The staff is very sweet and apologies abound, but no corrections occur. There was no shower cap or makeup/magnifying mirror provided in the bathroom, usually provided in the least expensive hotels. The front desk offered to send up a make-up mirror "right away", but it arrived after I left the room, over an hour later. The light on the mirror was broken when it finally did arrive. I gave it 3stars because it is the quietest hotel I've ever been in in NYC. We were on the 6th floor and there were no detectable traffic noises. The bed was very comfy, and the location is great. Our room was 232 square feet which is quite small, but similar to other NYC rooms. But the hallways were so narrow that 2 people couldn't pass at many parts without turning sideways. All this for $500 per night(including taxes).

From the minute I booked- to the minutiae I checked out- this hotel was awesome! Staff was super friendly and even brought up a custom dessert for my niece who was on her first NYC trip with me for her 15th birthday! I would highly recommend that of you are visiting NYC STAY HERE!!

This hotel was exactly what I needed on my recent weekend trip to NYC. From the minute I arrived I was pleased with this hotel. The front desk staff were friendly, efficient and personable, even past midnight (I took a late flight in). They asked about my plans for my trip and offered help finding anything I might need. I feel like at a lot of places, they don't actually care, but here, the staff remembered that I was there to see a show at Irving Plaza (which is just 2 blocks away) and asked how it was the next evening when I returned. Those are the kind of details that make me a happy customer.The rooms are fairly small, as expected in NYC, but I was impressed with how spacious it felt. There is great space saving design that's still aesthetically pleasing. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby.

I highly recommend the Hyatt Union Square Hotel. I've stayed in NYC many times and never knew about this hotel before! The room was beautiful, modern, clean and had everything I needed. Check in was quick, easy and accommodating! The restaurants were wonderful! What I loves most was the location; everything was right outside your door. Shopping, markets, restaurants and especially and especially the clean open spaces which in NYC are hard to find! I would rate this hotel Andy experience a 5 star!

I love Hyatt Union Square for the friendly staff, lovely decor, and proximity to everything! I have tried many brands in the city, but always come back to Hyatt. I specifically choose the Union Square location because of it's cozy feel.

Front desk staff is always ready to accommodate you as best they can. On my last trip I received a fabulous upgrade and they corrected a mistake in the reservation that I made. Great service with a smile. Gym is fantastic, one of my favorite hotel gyms in the city. My go to union square hotel.

Nice new lovely hotel. Nice room (cozy, but not small). Funky decor. Staff was very friendly. A very ideal location. Right at Union Square and a quick walk to St. Marks for all your "punk rock" shopping needs! Very easy access to the subway (near Astor Place). Not far from Bowery/SoHo. Lots of restaurant choices around the area. Parking is expensive wherever you park in NYC so you just have to deal with it.

We thought we would try this new property in NYC for our latest trip to the Big Apple. I must preface this stay(service-wise) by saying that this year we have already stayed at Park Hyatt Aviara, Park Hyatt Dubai, Park Hyatt Maldives Hadahaa, Grand Hyatt Dubai and also Park Hyatt Vendome UHH yes we are loyal to the Hyatt Brand. We had amazing service at each of these locations. We don't require a lot of attention per se BUT here ALL we needed were prompt wake up calls. On the first night/morning we had requested a wake up call and received it an hour earlier than our requested time. Not the biggest deal BUT we were not fans. On the second night/morning we had requested a wake up call for an "early" flight. WE RECEIVED NO WAKE UP CALL AT ALL!! This was very frustrating and we ended up missing our scheduled flight. Yes... a big deal!! We had really looked forward to our stay at this new prop.

Very good hotel with new rooms. The service is good and there is a very good bar at The hotel Also.At The top there is a nice viewThe location is very good , very close To subway and good restaurants.

This was my first stay at the Hyatt at Union Square. Good downtown location with lots to offer near by. I was upgraded to a city view room and was still a bit surprised at how small the room was. But everything was new and clean and I appreciate that. A big shout out to Evan at the front desk. When I checked in I asked him for a restaurant within walking distance that would be ok for a single diner. He recommended Il Cantinori, and by the time I was in my room he called to confirm the reservation. Evan was very attentive and friendly, as were all the other folks I interacted with at the hotel. Had breakfast at the hotel both days I was there - delicious.

I've stayed at this location twice. The hotel is spotless. the rooms are great for business travel or a quick city getaway.low key and quiet. Extremely friendly staff. They delivered a newspaper every morning and replenished the water bottle every day.

The hotel is in a perfect spot, just right in the middle of everything but quiet and modern. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. I was surprised how quiet the rooms were in the middle of Manhattan and you can even open a window. Rooms are quite big for NYC, nice and modern with everything you'll need.

This is my first choice hotel for business trips to New York. Great location, great staff, and great ammenities. Convenient to shopping, dining, and transportation. Trendy but peaceful atmosphere. Room size spacious enough to allow me to work comfortably at desk in the evenings when necessary.

The staff are exceptional and the rooms well fitted out. This isnt your classic Hyatt hotel with grand rooms and big social spaces but it makes up for all of that with friendliness and the location is perfect for downtown. In my opinion better than the W on Union Square.

I stayed at this hotel last week on business and enjoyed it very much. The location is fantastic one block from Union Square. I was upgraded to a room with a lovely deck although not able to use it because if was so cold. The size of the room was average NYC hotel room, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was well laid out. The front desk staff was very helpful with sorting out the trains to Wall Street for me and making a reservation of dinner in the East Village. The bistro in the hotel lobby served breakfast and that was very good but the selection was a bit limiting. I will return to this hotel again next time I am in NYC for business.

Great hotel, trendy decor and restaurant area. Great location if you want to be in the east village. A 10 minute walk to the Hi-line, meatpacking market and galleries. Great gym and friendly staff. Cool bar area large which was perfect for meeting up with friends.

Just stayed this past weekend at this Hyatt. The location was perfect, near Union Square and it's metro, several grocery stores nearby, 24 hour Walgreens, 24 hour coffee and dining and within walking distance to everything else we needed. The staff couldn't do enough, sp friendly with an "I can" attitude , everyone from Victor the bell captain to the desk, bar and housekeeping staff. Yes the rooms are small, but the price was an unbelievable bargain for such trendy digs. Folks, it's New York! Rooms are small unless you mortgage your house to pay for them. Single malt scotch bar a great touch. Everything clean and great working order,well maintained fabulous new fitness center. . Will definitely return.

Very Friendly staff. Rooms very small but has everthing you need. Good drycleaning. You need to pay for Wifi. Location is exellent if you like the area. Lots of very good and trendy restaurants. Will definetely come back next time I am in NY.

Hello, We have stayed at many hotels in New York,including the Four Seasons and The Trump,and although they are both lovely,the Hyatt Union Square ranks right up there!! We were there celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. I never expect an up-grade as I feel I am paying for the room I booked. When checking in and having a casual conversation with Amanda,she asked why we were in the city,we told her,and all of the sudden,we were given an upgrade! Nice,especially when not expecting it! Our room had a huge terrace!!Amanda at the front desk was excellent,as was every staff member we encountered-friendly,not stuffy or arrogant! The location:can't be beat!! We love the union Square area. Great restaurants,the market,easy access to Soho,the Village and,midtown.There is a subway stop right there,but it is a great walking location. The lobby and hotel bar are beautiful,nice for cocktails before going out. Check out the flower arrangements in the lobby,they are stunning! Rooms-the rooms are small,even by NY standards,but they are layed out perfect,with every high tech gadget imaginable. We didn't mind the size,because it had good lighting,excellent bedding,the best hair dryer,high end toiletries,excellent shower,and was spotless!! Turn-down was lovely with candy and soft music. If you can,get a terrace room.We had a huge terrace with table and chairs...we could have had a cocktail party out there!!  The gym:this is important to my husband,and the gym is super nice,well equipped,clean,towels,fruit and water bottles all available.My husband usually buys a day pass and hits a nice gym/health-club,but did not need to when we stayed here. Don't be put off by this being a "Hyatt"...as I was a little worried and generally prefer smaller boutique hotels.This Hyatt is not your typical chain hotel. If you have any questions let me know.... My son goes to school in the city and I have stayed at a ton of NY hotels,if you need any comparisons!! Enjoy the city!!Thanks again Amanda,and all the doormen,you were all great,so fun coming back to your friendly smiles after exploring the city all day!!

My husband and I stayed at the hotel over the Christmas period for our honeymoon. We choose the hotel because of it's location and close proximity to Wholefoods, great restaurants and shops. Upon checking in the hotel staff were friendly and helpful but after that completely hopeless. We were offered a morning paper which we only received the first morning and then my husband had to call every day after that to request it. We made other requests throughout our stay with the requests form left by housekeeping in the room which were never ever provided. The rooms were modern and clean but extremely small, particularly the bathroom area. There was limited space to hang and store items.It wasn't exactly honeymoon material and we were left feeling disappointed. When we were last in NYC we stayed at the Bryant Part Hotel and unfortunately it was booked out. When we return we will definitely opt to stay there instead of the Hyatt.

I stayed for 3 nights while visiting my daughter who is a student at NYU. The location was perfect! I really liked the welcoming feel of the lobby, and the front desk staff always greeted me, which made it feel like I was either leaving from or arriving at home. The lobby smells great, too. The bed is so comfortable, and the shower was warm and strong. I liked my floor-to-ceiling windows on the 10th floor. I'll be back!

We stayed here for three nights. The hotel is boutique style and has a lovely restaurant attached and a great bar (minus the horrible music.) John is one of the managers and he is fantastic, as is Romeo at the bar. We were in room 802, no view - but quieter than being on the street. Bed was comfortable, rooms had everything you need or you can ask for it. We had a few hiccups during our stay but once I spoke to John, everything seemed to fall into place. We will defiantly consider staying at this location again.

We had a great time at the Hyatt Union Square during a 5-night break. We chose to upgrade to an 'Urbane Terrace' room which incidentally gave us access to a small private courtyard. However given this was mid-Feb and the outdoor daytime temperature was around -6C with heavy snow on the ground, we opted to remain indoors! However the additional large windows and light were a welcome positive. On the downside, the door to the terrace didn't shut tightly and so there was a cool draft detectable when the curtains weren't closed. I would suggest the Urbane Terrace would be a good option during the Spring/Summer, particularly as the air conditioning was extremely noisy whenever we put it on quickly to get some heat in the room.The room was spotless and remained so throughout our stay. The shower was powerful and hot and the CO Bigelow shower gel, shampoos and soaps were replenished often. There was no bath in our room.We used the gym twice during our stay. It contains a good range of modern Life Fitness cardio machines and is located in the basement level. There are about 4 treadmills and 2 or 3 elliptical machines plus a rower and some resistance machines. There are workout towels and water, plus disposable headphones if you've forgotten yours. However change in your room as there are no changing facilities in the gym.We had after-dinner drinks in the bar "Singl" a couple of times during our stay and it was a pleasant, cool place to return. The bar specialises in single malt whiskeys and also offers a range of bourbons and rye whiskeys. If you want some advice and recommendations on what to drink then I would opt for sitting at the bar so that you can talk to the bartender directly. On our first visit we made the mistake of sitting on one of the sofas and an air-headed girl served us. She was obviously employed to look good, rather than have any knowledge of what she was serving. We asked for a recommendation from the slightly bewildering menu of whiskeys and she just vaguely pointed at something, not good. However the second time we visited we sat at the bar and the bartender was extremely knowledgable and friendly offering lots of advice and suggestions for what we should try.We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, and instead opted for one of the many diners within walking distance. For instance Grey Dog Cafe on University Place or Big Daddy's on Park Avenue.On our last day our return flight home to London wasn't until 2230 and so we asked for a late check-out. As we are Hyatt Platinum members we were able to secure a complimentary late check-out until 1600 which was really helpful on the day.

I stayed here with some coworkers recently and I was blown away! Stylish cool rooms, a great bar with an excellent wine selection, and one of the best dinning experiences at their restaurant I've had in a long time.A must stay in when visiting NY

Trying to enter this hotel was a good sign as to how much this Hyatt values impressive visuals over guests' comfort. I left our car with two heavy suitcases on wheels and arrived at two massive heavy glass doors with no doorman on duty. So I had to fight and push my way in, breaking a suitcase wheel in the process. It had been a long trip and I was looking forward to a hot bath but wasn't permitted to check in because I wasn't my wife, who had made the reservation. She got lost while trying to park, and I sat in the lobby for close to forty-five minutes. I won't spend a lot of time on the godawful aesthetics of the lobby (think of a woodpile on strings, beds chained together with wood and hung from the ceiling, bird and feather decals on the wall), but it will certainly look much less impressive in just a few short years. It's scented with some perfume 24/7. You cannot enter the hotel without having to exchange friendly greetings with the desk staff.The Courtyard Studio rooms are tiny. The peculiar moderne decor contnues into the rooms, of course. No hot bath after all: just a large shower enclosure. No bathroom, in fact: toilet in a tiny closet, sink and mirror in the bedroom. No place for your clothes except a small wardrobe and three shallow drawers perhaps 14" x 14". No folding luggage racks, so living out of your suticase is out: we hid them behind the curtain. No towel racks. No ice machines: it took 45 minutes and two calls to the desk to get ice delivered to our room. Connecting door to the adjacent 'studio' meant very poor soundproofing: we had to knock on the door to get our neighbors to quiet down. The lights are all ganged onto a master switch system which dims up and down when turned on but can't be dimmed in actual use. An open-plan minibar takes up valuable counter space: you don't want to ask what gummi bears cost here.Is this the chain that makes a thing about their mattresses? The bed was mad comfortable. Staff is very friendly if you don't mind the greeting routine on every re-entrance; hotel is neat and new. I just don't like the place.

My stay at the Hyatt Union Square was easy and enjoyable from the beginning. Check in was a breeze and my room felt brand new and well made. The employees all had great attitudes and attentive. My room service breakfast was late one morning but they appeared to have fixed the problem after comping the meal - right on time the next morning. The compact hotel layout made it easy to get around and great location in general.

Recently stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location, good first impression and nice clean room, albeit small!To cut a long story short - we had an incredibly noisy fan in our room that was on constantly and it emitted a rattling sound at regular intervals - thereby making for a disturbed nights sleep! It was the fan in the toilet but shutting the door to both the loo and the bathroom made no difference to the sound levels!!We asked for this to be looked at on 3 seperate occasions over our 3 night stay and each time were told that it would be dealt with - after each time of asking nobody got back to us or really seemed to care - incredibly disappointing!!!Such a shame as hotel is in a great spot and I do visit New York regularly and would probably have stayed there again!!We even spoke to a manager upon check out who apologised and assured us he would look into it and be in touch - needless to say this hasn't happened - not the best customer relations!!

Just a beware; reserved room last week for end of Aug 2014, that's more than 6 months ahead; and tried to change dates; not cancel; just move dates. I would have paid more. They informed me my reservation was not cancelable or changeable. I would have been ok with no cancellation policy but not able to change; and I was out of luck to do anything!I will never do an online reservation with Hyatt again. It is there; my fault not to read the whole thing, but come on, can't even change it and pay more??

My bf and I decided to spend a night in Manhattan and found the Hyatt in Union Square. We arrived a few minutes early and they had our room ready. The hotel is very updated and new. We had a courtyard studio. Not much a a view but then again, we werent staying in the room the entire night. They made the most of the space in the room. Everything was hidden with sliding doors in the bathroom. If one person is in the shower, there is a separate little alcove with a door for the toilet if you are that comfortable with each other. Everyone was extremely accomodating and friendly. The bed was fantastic. One of the best nights sleep in a hotel i've ever had. The restaurant and bar downstairs were great too. A little pricey, but this is the Hyatt in NYC. Highly recommended.

Last Saturday, my wife and I were able to go into the city last minute. We literally booked the room on the drive in. Decent rate. We had a courtyard studio. Not the largest room, but it was extremely clean. Bed is super comfortable. Furniture is interesting. Not a lot of closet space etc. The room definitely served its purpose. Not too expensive, great location, and good service. Good choice for a quick stay. Definitely not extravagant and not sure If its good for a lengthier stay.

Over all good stay...restaurant and bar lounge are fine. Staff good, especially breakfast room Manager and breakfast bar service waiter...two great personalities...door men and ck. in staff we're great....only one knock....even as rooms were well appointed, but just too small....felt like I was constantly banging into things .....

Just spent Super Bowl weekend at the new Union Square Hyatt and liked it very much. I have stayed in many hotels in the city and this is very good if Union Square is where you want to be. Incidentally, Union Square is a great area with easy access to the Village and the East Village. Union Square is a major hub for the subways, including the one straight into the heart of Brooklyn.The lobby is attractive with a good space overlooking the street. Staff was young and very good. They were so helpful! They fixed me up with one of the free bikes (helmet included).The room was average sized with good views. Everything was new and clean.Overall this is a good choice.

We had our film crew stay here for a very grueling shoot in Manhattan. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The rooms were great and the service was excellent. The staff went above and beyond their duties to help us unload equipment and also was accommodating with vehicles. Their energy and positive spirit were greatly appreciated and made our shoot a success. We couldn't have done it without this hotel and staff. The bar and restaurant are also very nice! Please take my advice and stay here! It's worth every penny.

I stayed here for two weeks in January while attending a course at NYU. This is a very relaxed, friendly and understated hotel. The hotel is new. The foyer and common areas are smart. My room was a good size, comfortable, well appointed and was kept spotlessly clean. The staff are young and consistently warm/friendly. This is the type of hotel where you don't see staff that often - other than at reception and the restaurant - but everything seems to run very efficiently. Breakfasts were great and the breakfast staff were very friendly. If you want hotel where staff fawn all over you - this isn't the place for you. If you like friendly, hip and efficient - you will like this place.The location is great. 50 meters from Union Square. The village, NYU etc are within 10 minutes walk. This is a young, smart hotel and reasonably priced. I would happily stay here again.

I would like to first say that the location of this unusual hotel can absolutely not be beat.Union Square has absolutely anything you can want or need. There is a great selection of restaurants.groceries and interesting shops. Transportation is tops.When I arrived at the hotel, I thought it was closed. There were no doormen outside to assist you with your bags and the doors are covered in some sort of white covering. We carried all our bags up to our room upon check-in and upon checkout loaded our car with no offer of assistance. Throughout our stay of three nights, I only saw "doormen" outside twice. I was offered assistance getting a cab, but not once was I offered assistance with my suitcases or packages until I was walking passed the front desk which was a bit too late.The hotel lobby is very dark . The desk staff is friendly enough , although it can be hard to find an "adult in charge". The rooms are spotless although tiny. They are equipped with nice toiletries and thick towels. The decor is a cross between European and Ikea and bright and certainly cheerful. The couch was cute but the shape shouted "do not try to get comfortable on me! ". The bathroom (in alcove loft) was quite cool but appeared like a prefab bathroom tossed into the center of the room. I never heard of a bathroom as a room divider. The room had a refrigerator which is indeed a plus although it froze all of our purchased food. I totally agree with the reviewer who states ...."when the Hyatt tries to be hip, you sort of wish they would knock it off and just be themselves. "Love the area, wish I loved the hotel.....

We chose this hotel for its location while on a family visit to Manhattan and were very pleasantly surprised. Hyatt has done a great job with this property. The rooms are modern, clean and well equipped with good lighting and top-quality soaps and potions. The staff is helpful and cheerful. The bar area is nice for an after-dinner gathering but somewhat pricey, offering very high-end single malt tasting flights and good wines. While we did not have breakfast or dinner at the hotel, we did enjoy great hot breakfast beverages on a Sunday morning and were once again impressed with the level of service. As Manhattan properties go, this is reasonably priced.

Somehow, when the Hyatt tries to be hip, you sort of wish they would knock it off and just be themselves. But, anyway, plusses are prices; Christian at the front door and seemingly everywhere else; location, if, like us, you dig downtown; beds and linens; room service; and the shower. Negatives: the NOISE -- fellow guests are very rude, shouting in the hall all night and into the morning (who are these people?); the rooms really are dinky and, to our taste, poorly decorated, although not cheerless; WIFI charges (who does that anymore?); blatantly forced friendliness at the front desk; and a lot of little things that are out of synch with the context, such as offering Vogue instead of cooler mags in the room. (Don't get me wrong; I love Vogue, but check out the collection you find at The Standard East by contrast.) I guess that epitomizes our take -- they just don't get it.

Even by New York standards our room was cramped. The staff was inattentive, For example, no help with luggage at check in, carried luggage to our room ourselves, kinda like a Hampton Inn. When returning to hotel around midnight no one was staffing the front desk. Asked turndown service person to come back in ten minutes which they never did. Also, if you are over 25 you clearly are too old to work here. Positives are the location near a variety of subways and the room was clean. Overall, below Hyatt Hotel standards

New hotel, nice modern rooms. The rooms were small but adequate. The staff was very nice and helpful. Breakfast prices are very expensive and the food is over the top - really nothing for a child to eat.

The front desk greeted us with genuine interest and warmth, and checked is in swiftly and effortlessly. This was reflected throughout our stay, with all the members of staff we encountered.The room we had wasn't huge (but for Manhattan, it was plenty big enough!) but was modern, clean and well equipped. The TV was unquestionably huge, the room had a safe, free tea/coffee facilities, toilet and an awesome shower that feels like Niagara falls at full-flow (certainly wakes you up in the morning!)The location is great, our room had a great view over the street outside, and could just see the Empire State building, which was a nice treat.) The hotel is one block over from union square itself, union square subway station joins up really easily with most other places, so a great base for site-seeing. There are a couple of good places just across the street for bagels and/or coffee in the morning if you don't fancy the on-site restaurants (Best we found nearby was a slightly longer walk to Big Daddys on Park Avenue.. definitely worth the walk if you want the all-american diner experience!) and union square is surrounded by good restaurants for the evening.

Had a fantastic new year staying at the Hyatt Union Square with my partner visiting friends in NYC. I loved the boutique feel of the hotel and personal service whilst knowing it was part of a group I have stayed with and enjoyed on numerous other occasions. Rooms beautifully designed, the bed & pillows so comfortable - probably the best sleep I have had for a long time in any hotel. Fantastic walk in shower with lovely amenities and although the room was quite compact It was really well designed, with real attention to detail & had everything we needed for our stay. Loved the location - easy to walk everywhere and liked the village feel next to Grenwich village whilst been able to walk up town easily. What set this hotel really apart was the staff: They made us feel so at home throughout our stay, so attentive, friendly and welcoming (a real credit to the Hyatt brand). The only feedback I would give to the hotel would be to get a kettle in the room as well as the small coffee machine, and found the in room dining a bit limited and overpriced (even for NY) so didn't dine in the room this time. Also great gym but needed some better mats and excercise balls.However these are just minor points for feedback and plan to go back very soon as we loved our stay here! If the GM or other member of staff read this could they reach out as I would love some advice re booking the room for my next trip - perhaps would go for city rather than courtyard room & want to book on a high floor!Thanks to all the Hyatt staff for such a memorable New Year!! (also loved the bubbly in reception/bar on New Years eve - much appreciated)

We visit NYC at least once a year and sometimes more often. Union Square is the best neighborhood from our point of view-centrally located and fun. This hotel has a prime location for that neighborhood. Think Coffee is across the street, and both villages, Chelsea, and Union Square are all easy walks. The hotel still has that "brand new" look and is really nice. The rooms are not huge, but they are well-layed out and cram a lot of amenities in a small space. If your up for it, they had a men's bike and a women's bike in the lobby you could use for free, along with helmets.

What a great find. I booked this hotel through a 3rd party and got a really great rate by paying in advance. We’ve stayed at numerous NYC hotels in numerous locations and I was keen to try out Union Sq to explore the area better.Super great location with a stack of subway lines dotted all around union sq, Duane Reade, Walgreens (24 hours) and Wholefoods all within a 5 min walk.The majority of hotel staff were friendly and really accommodating - special note Noel & Christian - these guys really made our 4 day stay feel like our home-away-from-home.All our requests were met with speedily,,,,i.e. when we bought some supplies and wanted to use the bar fridge a staff member came up immediately and removed the contents. Our plumbing issues were dealt with promptly. Our one main wish list was that the bathroom floor tiles were heated….we kind of expected them to be for a brand new hotel.The location was great for shopping - pop across and start walking up 5th avenue….a shoppers paradise even from 14th street, otherwise jump on the subway and go downtown to Soho - just a couple of stops away.Pros:Super comfy bedGreat rain showerGreat bath productsComplimentary waterSuper quiet - even on the 3rd floorGreat front office staff - Noel & ChristianFully working window for fresh airCons:Room a little on the small sidePlumbing issues in our room No vanity space for your toiletriesSkip the in-house restaurant

This hotel was a last minute decision right before Christmas. What a lovely surprise. We stayed in "a loft room" and it was lovely, great views, spacious for a Manhattan hotel room. The staff was both down to earth and attentive. Lobby is modern. And we had a great breakfast at Fourth, strong coffee, fresh pastries, perfectly cooked eggs. Definitely will return.

What a pleasant surprise to find this recently completed hotel in the midst of a neighborhood in transition. Hip, young staff at front desk made checking in and out a breeze. Boutique small rooms, but terrace room creates illusion of larger indoor space with tall windows and glass door leading to an enclosed terrace, sustainable plantings, chocolate wicker furniture - not much use on a snowy December stay, but fun to view with city buildings beyond. Found the bar a great meet up spot with satisfying cheese board and some whopper drinks. Lively, fun, whimsical decor.

We stayed at the Hyatt Union Sq. over Christmas, and it was great! The hotel is very attractive with a good location, very easy to get to when driving. From the valet to the check in, everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. We had requested early check in, and even though they were quite busy, they were able to accommodate us, and in fact, upgraded us to a room with a terrace! Too bad it was so cold, it would have been so nice to have coffee or drinks outside. The room was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated, the bed was very comfortable. There was plenty of storage space and we like having a separate toilet area. The sink is blocked off by a partial wall, lets in plenty of light, so it's great for putting on make up, with counter space and drawers, plus there are plenty of well lit mirrors. There is a nice restaurant, good food, great Bloody's and there is also a cool bar on the other side of the front desk, drinks there are good but very pricey. Bathrooms are located downstairs and are Unisex, very nice and clean. They also have a gym and roof top terrace, neither of which we used. This will become our new favorite NYC hotel, we will definitely stay there on our yearly Christmas trip.

Needed a Hyatt hotel for an overnight trip to Manhattan. The hotel is in a great location, convenient to food, shopping and trains. The staff was very, very nice. It was a pleasant surprise and made our stay even better. Ended up with a corner room facing 4th ave. This is good and bad. The windows made the room feel big but the area is busy and at night, it can be a bit loud. But, it's NYC right? Anyways, the room was clean, well appointed and the showers have excellent water pressure. Connected to the hotel are a cafe and scotch bar.. really nice additions to a boutique hotel. The gym actually has nice equipment and nice amenities.I'd say the overall experience here was equal to my experiences at the Park Hyatt Paris and Buenos Aires (with exception of no turn down service)Oh, park your care somewhere else. $75 overnight... it was my mistake for not checking how much it was going to cost.

Great location so I walked everywhere. Service is excellent from check-in to restaurant to check out. I loved my cozy room with huge, comfortable bed and flat screen tv. Shower was also nice and roomy. Food was quite good for breakfast and dinner. I am going to be a regular customer here!

My spouse and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for 1 night in early October 2013. We remitted Hyatt gift cards for our stay, and we were able to use multiple gift cards to pay the bill, which we turned over at check-in time. (The representative that checked us in said that not all clerks knew how to reconcile the gift cards, so she wanted to speed up our time at check-out by taking them at check-in.) We booked our reservation online a few months prior to our stay, and re-checked the rates every week or so until the day prior to our stay. Our rates dropped two times after we had made our original booking, resulting in a savings of nearly $200 over our original rate. (Each time we rebooked, the rate dropped by about $100; so we recommend checking back your rate if you would like to save some money.)The hotel is somewhat new, having opened in the spring of 2013. It occupies a corner location in the Union Square/Flatiron/Gramercy Park area of the city, and is located just one block from Union Square Park. Several subway lines stop near the hotel, and it is also easy to hail a taxi cab because the hotel is located on busy Fourth Avenue. The hotel does not have a parking lot, although valet parking is available. There are many shops and restaurants in the surrounding blocks, including a wine shop, grocery store (Whole Foods), and two pharmacies (Duane Reed and Walgreens) in the very next block. The Union Square Greenmarket (a must-see on Saturdays) is just a block away. The hotel has 178 room arranged over 12 floors.The front desk is a sort of standing podium/table workstation that contains computer terminals. The staff wears long-sleeved multi-colored checked oxford shirts as sort of a uniform. All employees that we encountered were pleasant and helpful. The hotel offers complimentary bicycles for guests to use - sometimes they were present in the lobby near the elevators, and other times they were borrowed. The bikes are a vintage Schwin style, with a box/basket mounted on the back for bags/backpacks. The fitness center, located on the basement level, has all the necessary equipment (treadmills, bikes, free weights) and also offers regular towels, cool towels (in a little refrigerator), bottled water, fresh fruit, and disposable headphones. One of the few things that we did not like about this hotel was the fragrance that permeated the lobby and elevators – an intensely spicy scent that we found it pervasive and unpleasant.Although we did not dine at the hotel, it has several food and beverage outlets: Singl is the hotel bar and lounge, with bar stool seating and many comfortable and varied social groupings of furniture open from late afternoon through early morning. Botequim is on the basement level and serves dinner only, Latin tapas cuisine in a space with an open kitchen. The Fourth is a large American brasserie located on the street level and serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The Fourth has three dining areas: a café with an espresso and wine bar, a communal dining bar, and a more full-service formal dining space. Room service is also available from early morning until late evening. A rooftop bar/lounge is planned to open in the spring of 2014. We think that the dining options have potential, because they are owned by a restaurant group that also manages Tocqueville Restaurant and 15 East (15 East has one Michelin star).We booked the lowest-level room, the Urbane Studio, although we applied for a (paying) e-upgrade at check-in time (which was not available). Our room faced an interior courtyard and did not have floor-to-ceiling windows, which seemed to be the major difference between the Urbane Studio and the Deluxe Studio (Urbane Sky Room). We would love to have seen one of the Urban Terrace rooms or the suites (Empyreal or The Sanctuary). Our room was compact, but not tiny by New York City standards. The furniture was cleverly designed and used every available space. The bathroom vanity area was a bit compact, but the shower was large. CO Bigelow toiletries are provided (soaps, shampoo, conditioner, lotion). A hair dryer, iron and ironing board, and electronic safe are provided. A minibar and snack tray are available. There is no ice machine for guest use, but you can request a (complimentary) delivery from room service. In our room, one robe (a black jersey material) and one pair of slippers were provided. The hotel provided an evening turndown, although it occurred much too early for us to take advantage of it (around 5:00 pm). Instead of mints on your pillow, the hotel offers fortune cookies, which is a unique touch.We would gladly stay at the Hyatt Union Square again. We loved the area – many good restaurants, and a good general vibe in what seemed like a livable residential area of the city.

I had one day in Manhattan and decided to stay out of midtown. This hotel was nicely situated, has a great feel to it, the service was great, friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small but very nicely done. I would recommended this hotel especially if you want to explore lower Manhattan.

All in all, this was a great choice for us. The location was a bit further downtown than I had hoped (4th & 13th), but it was usually a quick cab or Subway ride (10-20 min) to midtown for shopping, sightseeing, etc. It's a small, tucked away hotel, but I really liked that about it. The lobby and bar are beautifully designed - contemporary and interesting while still feeling cozy. The restaurant (Fourth) is the perfect breakfast spot before heading out. The food is fabulous and they offer a jazz brunch on Sundays. The rooms are small, but that is typical NYC. They were really well appointed, clean and comfortable. And the staff was everything we could have hoped for. Lots of great ideas for us and help when we needed it. It feels so intimate that it is almost like staying at a B&B, but with the niceties of a larger hotel chain. Just avoid the $10 water bottles in the room and restaurant. I understand the typical mark up of water bottles, but $10 for a small bottle of Fiji? Really? I bought one out of desperation once (NY will make you thirsty!), but then walked down the street to Duane Read for $2 bottles the next time. I know, it's a small gripe about what was truly a wonderful experience! I would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Just got back from a 4 day trip to Manhattan and stayed here, it was so warm, smelled like Christmas when you walked in the lobby, all the decor and holiday music playing really put me in the Spirit of the holidays. The people were so nice, from the door man to the front desk, they took care of our needs, got us bus vouchers, broadway musical tickets, restaurant recommendations, anything you need, they are so helpful. The Fourth is the restaurant in the hotel, it was very good and the wine selection was top notch. The rooms were very comfortable, the lighting was nice, you can turn on or shut off all the lights from each control panel. The decor was modern and they even have a turndown service and a bottle of water next to your bed. Nice touch.

We came here for our wedding anniversary and were happy to have stayed here for 8 nights. Everyone was so friendly with us from the moment we walked in to the moment we left they were so nice and happy to chat. The reception smelt fantastic like cinnamon or something. We had a courtyard facing room - which was facing a building it wasn't a great view but it worked out better as it meant we had less noise from the street. The rooms are cleverly laid out as it was compact but we had enough space the bed was a great size and incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was very nice and clean with a fantastic shower. I loved the location as you are very close to a lot of restaurants, stores and the subway was very close.

The Hyatt Union Square is a great hotel - clean, newer, and a location that can't be beat. The rooms are well appointed with very nice bathrooms, comfortable beds, and in my case, a really nice balcony (it's just too bad that it was too cold to use it). The Fourth restaurant next door also serves a great breakfast.It's down the block from Union Square and is near to Whole Foods, several great restaurants, and most importantly the N, Q, R, L, 4, 5, and 6 Subway lines. Definitely a great option for NYC.

I was visiting someone in the city during the Thanksgiving weekend and we decided to stay at the Hyatt in Union Square. We had previously stayed in Hyatt Andez on Wall Street and the Hyatt in Midtown. After staying at all three of these locations, I feel I can accurately give each of these a fair review. I arrived on the Tuesday before Thanksgiving earlier than the normal check in time. Not only was I greeted warmly, but I was given a room right away with no having to wait around. The downside, a heavy odor of vanilla or something that lingers in the main lobby that tends to drift into the restaurant which can interfere with the dining experience. When I got up to the room, the first thing I noticed that for the size of the room it was, the designer made the most of every little inch. It still had a somewhat spacious feeling for a room that would be my bedroom back home. I did not go crazy over the decor, but I know this Hyatt uses the designer of Paul Vega as a huge selling point. After sleeping for the night and hanging out in the room these are the main things I noticed that were uncomfortable/disappointing/a nuisance: We had a connecting door room and our neighbors did not respect that when in hotels you should respect people and keep voices down, so children were yelling and banging around at 6 in the morning. We were also placed directly across from where the staff either loads/unloads carts or has services and was constantly banging around, which leads to my next point The walls are EXTREMELY THIN. It is like when they redid the building they did not add any additional insulation, and this now rounds out the last major point The windows LET IN EVERYTHING. I understand we are in the city. There are going to be noises, but when I am on the 10th floor and I can hear EVERYTHING that is going down on the street and when I get close to the window I can feel the cold leaking in, it's like the windows are only single-paned. I was using the desk by the window, the curtains were drawn shut, the heat was on, and I was wrapped in a blanket because I was freezing. It really seems to me that the designer spent his budget on the design and not the functionality of the architecture or having a balance of both. So, I will make a pros and cons list for you to consider if you decide to stay here. Pros: Clean Great Staff Good location Comfortable bed Cons: Thin walls Thin windows Small rooms Beware of where the associate places are

We stayed for 4 nights in November 2013. The hotel is in a good location for exploring the City on foot and is surrounded by excellent cafes, The Strand Bookshop and Max Brenner's chocolate cafe and shop. There is an excellent pizza restuarant just down the road and the subway station (to get to mid-town or up-town) is a few minutes walk away. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as there wasn't much choice for vegetarians (mainly eggs and toast) so we ate in the coffee shop "Think Coffee" opposite. We did have dinner in the hotel once - the service and food were excellent in the Fourth Restaurant. The hotel rooms are modern and clean and comfortable. We had a courtyard room. After the first night we asked to move rooms as we were on a low floor overlooking the courtyard where there is a noisy air con/generator outside on the courtyard which is on 24/7. We moved to a higher floor and couldn't hear it then. The air con/heating in the rooms is very noisy so you can't sleep with it on. We left the heating on whilst out and switched it off when we were in the room. What really makes this hotel great is the staff who are so helpful and have a great customer service ethic. There is a gym in the basement but we didn't use that. There is a guest computer in reception and free wifi throughout. There are tea/coffeee making facilities in the room and robes and slippers, a safe, iron and ironing board, hairdrier and toiletries. We would stay at this hotel again - it is very good.
