We are wine lovers and this was really a nice touch.The location is excellent. Having gone to NYU I love the neighborhood and it is easy to get to any part of town via the subway at Union Square. Great coffee and breakfast in the adjacent restaurant and/or across the street.What needs a little work: although we had the lovely food & wine amenity, there seemed to be lack of knowledge of Hyatt Gold Passport amenities. My husband is a Diamond member and is entitled to a number of benefits for his 50+ nights a year at Hyatt. A room upgrade, complimentary bottled water in room, complimentary breakfast if there is no club lounge (there isn't), complimentary wifi, guaranteed bed type requested, late checkout.We requested a King bed, but the website is a little slippery on this one claiming you get the "Hyatt Grand Bed" - doesn't say what size, but ours was a queen sized bed. We were not offered an upgrade and I basically had to argue with guest services at the front desk to get one for our last night (we got a lovely patio which was great with our pup and to sit outside and enjoy the wine, but the room was still tiny). I was told they were sold out of upgraded rooms, but when I looked at the online booking system that did not seem to be the case. What really bothered me though because it's an easy way for them to score points with Diamond guests, was not being offered the complimentary breakfast and wifi. I had to ask for the breakfast and assumed the wifi would be removed from the bill when I asked - kudos that I didn't have to ask at checkout. Again compliments to the staff on being proactive after I complained about not having our Diamond benefits offered to us upon check-in.Also the rooms are VERY small although I will say they did their best to maximize the use of the space and the Bigelow toiletries were a nice touch. In the mini-bar is a fridge on one side with drinks and a coffee pot on the other.Sometimes it took several calls to get someone on the phone for requests, the docking station is for iPhone 4 with no adapter for Iphone 5 (again this is where the staff excels - the manager let me borrow his charger). Like I said - the staff is what makes this property worth the stay...that and the location. My husband prefers the Andaz because we get bigger rooms, but one has to remember that this hotel has fewer than 200 rooms to begin with and did the best they could with the space constraints.Overall I agree with other reviewers that it's a nice addition to the Hyatt brand in NYC. If you can deal with the limited space for a few days, go for it. If it were just me and not two people, I would definitely stay again.

This location has just recently opened so we thought on this visit to NYC. Good location near Union Square. Staff still seems relatively new. When we drove up there were no valet attendants or anyone else on staff outside. We ended up going inside and they had to call someone to grab the car. Staff at check-in was very nice. Hotel seems to be trying to be very trendy. We had a room on the second floor with a terrace. The terrace was very nice and larger than the room. It was nice to have coffee and read out on the terrace.Room was nice. Excellent water pressure in shower. Overall nice experience.

I stayed at this Hyatt last week. I was in Manhatten to pick up my daughter from NYU. The location was great for me as it was only one block away from her dorm. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A few kinks still need to be worked out but overall it was a great experience. I was in a Business Plan room which was very comfortable. The bathroom was large enough and had a shelf for any items you wished to store in there. There was a coffee maker in the same cabinet that the minibar was located . A nice touch was the treats left each night on the bed at turndown. My only real complaint was housekeeping knocking on my door at 8:30 am on check out day. I enjoyed this hotel and think it is a nice addition to this part of NYC.

I cant believe I paid more than 400 dollars for a room where the tv doesnt work!I complained about the situation at the front desk and for 2 days no one did anything about it.2 days after my first complain someone came to appologize, offered me free breakfast and changing me to a different roomGiven the hassle that involves changing rooms I declinedIm very dissapointed

I step in the"singl" bar for a drink on may way home from work, and I was greeted by a wonderful, friendly and and attractive staff, from the front desk to the bar smiles all around! I immediately was blown away by the design of the hotel.The art work was amazing and very unique to any other hotel/bar that I have been to in the neighborhood. I sat and ordered a scotch "I'm a scotch man" and the bartender was very knowledgeable about the the single malt scotch that was heavy stocked behind the bar. I loved the ice cube great touch! As I walked around scotch in hand...the very happy and attentive waitresses answered all my questions regarding the art work and knew every answer.I wanted to touch everything from the table to the walls every piece had an amazing story behind it... how many art gallery in NYC allow you to drink/and touch the art.....NONE! I defiantly will be back for more drinks.When my friends and family come to visit this is where they will rest there head!

When i first checked in a very nice guy helped me right out of my cab and got me get checked in and on my way fast! The interior of this hotel was different from any other Hyatt I've seen and I stay in them from time to time. Small elegant and personal- I truly liked the neat touches to the room and had a decent amount of sunlight. I love the Union square area and had immediate access to cabs and food. I will definitely stay here again-

I checked in less than two weeks after the hotel opened, and with the exception of the restaurants not being open, the property operated as smoothly as if it had been open for much longer. I was upgraded to an eighth floor room with a terrific view to the street. The window could be partially opened, a plus, and when closed was soundproof. The room was a spotless as one would excpect in a new hotel, and the positioning of its features, and the contrasts of light and dark materials, made a good-sized room feel larger. The flowing white console surrounding the TV and incorporating the desk was an unusual feature that I felt worked with the generally modern design of the room. Loved the oval free-standing mini bar--visually, best design I've seen in a while, although placement of the coffee maker made filling the water in the machine a slight challenge. The yellow accessories on the white sink in the bath were pleasing to look at, the rainshower had excellent pressure, and the oval tiles in the shower stall were visually attractive. The room's dark wood floors were another attractive feature, and the discretion of a separate water closet is always appreciated.The young, pleasant staff were helpful with various questions and needs. The fitness center in the basement is very well equipped, although the music volume was a little too intrusive into what I was listening to on my headphones. The hotel's location is terrific for anyone wishing to stay downtown, yet with easy access to midtown and beyond. Union Square and all it offers is a block away, and walking into the Village, Noho, Soho and elsewhere couldn't be easier. It's also great to find a hotel with a roof terrace--I took my computer up there one morning to do some work. The only obstacle to a fifth star for this review was the loud air-conditioning unit in the room--this could use some attention.

The hotel had only been open for two weeks when I checked in. First off - this is a terrific location, just a block off of Union Square, and in the midst of Village and away from Tourist New York. The King View Room was small, but well appointed, with a full size shower and great water pressure. The rest of the bath area is tight, but it's hard to get a full size bath into a small room and expect to have anything left for the bed area. The hotel is so new that the towels have not been laundered enough, and still have that new towel feel and inability to absorb water. No much of a closet, but again - hard to do in a small space. Coffee maker and mini bar hidden away in a free standing table/bar. There was a large flat screen TV mounted on an curved acrylic wall unit which seemed out of place for the room. Internet access was free due my Hyatt status, but it's still that annoying business of charging a fee for access when you're paying over $400/night for a room. The air conditioning was very loud, even when on Lo, and the airflow so forceful that the curtains on the other side of the room billowed as if on a clothes line in a stiff breeze. At least one room on my floor had not yet been completed, so some construction noise was noticeable.The restaurant was not yet fully operational, so services and service were a bit disjointed, but in time I'm sure that will work out.Everyone I interacted with was friendly and ready to handle whatever question or request I had. Location's great and provides for a nice home base in NYC, once the kinks are worked out - it will be a great place to stay.

Finally a hotel in the Village has opened and the staff has done a stellar job launching the soft opening. Kudos! Perfect Spring weather and a happy occasion did not hurt either, but this new Hyatt stands for itself as a great place to spend a NYC weekend, to explore downtown or visit the kids at NYU. Front desk manager Cheryl Huse has assembled a fine cast, the rooms are NYC small but very smart, and the restaurant is first rate. The Fourth, which opened to Friends and Family only so far--is excellent: the beet salad and salmon were both delectable at dinner and coffee at breakfast makes my top ten list. Around the corner from the Strand, hovering at Union Square, this new Hyatt is a great lodging choice for NY downtown visits.

I had a very pleasant stay. The staff were very friendly and accommodating throughout my stay. The room had modern decor and was at the same time both warm and inviting. The bedding was pristine and comfortable. The towels were soft. The courtyard view is not ideal for those looking for something memorable, but it is very quiet and serene! The gym was well equipped. I didn't get to try the restaurants, as they were not yet open. I can really say nothing unpleasant about my stay. I had a lovely visit!
